title: Demographics: PATIENT (splits) + race + addresses + extensions
description: Patient identity, addresses, contacts, PCP, race, language, MyChart, aliases, IDs, pharmacies, relationships, goals

IDENTITY_ID._TABLE_: The IDENTITY_ID table contains the system master person index ID numbers for your patients. Each patient may have multiple master person index IDs; therefore, a line number is used to identify each identification number for a patient.
IDENTITY_ID.PAT_ID: The unique ID assigned to the patient record internally and links to the patient table. This ID may be encrypted if you have elected to use enterprise reporting�s encryption utility.
IDENTITY_ID.LINE: The line number of the patient ID within the patient�s record.
IDENTITY_ID.IDENTITY_ID: The identification number associated with the patient. This ID may be encrypted. NOTE: This is the identification number that corresponds to the IDENTITY_TYPE_ID column listed in this same record.
IDENTITY_ID.IDENTITY_TYPE_ID: The system master person index ID type corresponding to this identification number for the patient. Master person index distinguishes ID numbers from different locations and service areas based on their type. Type can also be used to designate non-system IDs to be populated and used to interface with data from other systems.
IDENTITY_ID.IDENTITY_TYPE_ID_ID_TYPE_NAME: The name of the ID Type.

PATIENT._TABLE_: The PATIENT table contains one record for each patient in your system. The data contained in each record consists of demographics, PCP and primary location information, registration information, and other information.
PATIENT.PAT_ID: The unique ID of the patient record for this row. This column is frequently used by other tables to link to PATIENT.
PATIENT.PAT_NAME: The patient�s name in the format Lastname, Firstname MI.
PATIENT.CITY: The city in which the patient lives.
PATIENT.STATE_C_NAME: The category value corresponding to the state in which the patient lives.
PATIENT.COUNTY_C_NAME: The category value corresponding to the county in which the patient lives.
PATIENT.COUNTRY_C_NAME: The category value corresponding to the country in which the patient lives.
PATIENT.ZIP: The ZIP Code area in which the patient lives.
PATIENT.BIRTH_DATE: The date on which the patient was born.
PATIENT.ETHNIC_GROUP_C_NAME: The category value associated with the patient�s ethnic background.
PATIENT.RELIGION_C_NAME: The category value associated with the patient�s religion.
PATIENT.LANGUAGE_C_NAME: The category value associated with the patient�s language.
PATIENT.SSN: The patient�s Social Security Number. This number is formatted as 999-99-9999, and a single trailing alphabetic character is also allowed.
PATIENT.REG_DATE: The date on which the last patient verification occurred.  If a patient was verified and then re-verified at a later date, this column will show the re-verified date.  This column will be null for patients that have never been verified.
PATIENT.REG_STATUS_C_NAME: The category value associated with the patient�s status in terms of the patient registration process as of the enterprise reporting extract. This is a customizable list, examples may include: 1 � New, 2 � Verified, and so on.
PATIENT.MEDICARE_NUM: The patient�s Medicare-assigned identification number, if applicable.
PATIENT.ADV_DIRECTIVE_YN: This column contains the value �Y� if the patient has a signed living will on file with your facility indicating how they want their health chare to be handled in the event of an incapacitating emergency. This information is entered in clinical system. If the patient has no signed living will on file this column contains the value �N�.
PATIENT.ADV_DIRECTIVE_DATE: The date a living will was received from the patient.
PATIENT.CUR_PCP_PROV_ID: The unique ID of the provider record for the patient�s current General Primary Care Provider as of the enterprise reporting extract. This ID may be encrypted.
PATIENT.CUR_PRIM_LOC_ID: The unique ID of the location record for the patient�s Primary Location as of the time of the enterprise reporting extract. This column is retrieved from the item Primary Location.
PATIENT.LEGAL_STATUS_C_NAME: The medical and/or legal status associated with the patient�s death. This item is populated through Admission/Discharge/Transfer (ADT) workflows.
PATIENT.BIRTH_STATUS_C_NAME: The category value associated with the newborn�s status at birth as entered in ADT.
PATIENT.PED_MULT_BIRTH_ORD: For multiple births, the place in the birth order of the current newborn patient.
PATIENT.PED_MULT_BIRTH_TOT: The total number of births during the mother�s labor and delivery of this newborn patient.
PATIENT.CREATE_USER_ID: The unique ID of the system user who entered this patient�s record. This ID may be encrypted.
PATIENT.CREATE_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PATIENT.PAT_MRN_ID: The patient's medical record number (MRN), of the type associated with the patient's current primary location.
PATIENT.DEATH_DATE: The date of death for the patient.
PATIENT.REC_CREATE_PAT_ID: The unique ID of the system user who created this patient�s record. This ID may be encrypted.   NOTE: For historical reasons, the column name ends in PAT_ID and cannot be changed; despite its name, it does not link to patient ID. It instead links to CLARITY_EMP.USER_ID.
PATIENT.REC_CREATE_PAT_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PATIENT.ORGAN_DONOR_YN: Indicates if the patient is an organ donor.
PATIENT.TMP_CITY: Contains the city in which the patient is temporarily residing.
PATIENT.TMP_STATE_C_NAME: Contains the state in which the patient is temporarily residing.
PATIENT.TMP_COUNTRY_C_NAME: Contains the country in which the patient is temporarily residing.
PATIENT.TMP_ZIP: Contains the ZIP Code in which the patient is temporarily residing.
PATIENT.TMP_HOME_PHONE: Contains the temporary phone number where the patient can be reached.
PATIENT.TMP_COUNTY_C_NAME: Contains the county in which the patient is temporarily residing.
PATIENT.TMP_ADDR_START_DT: Contains the starting effective date of the patients temporary address information.
PATIENT.TMP_ADDR_END_DT: Contains the ending effective date of the patients temporary address information.
PATIENT.TMP_CARE_OF_PERSON: Contains the name of the contact person for the patient at the temporary residence.
PATIENT.PAT_LAST_NAME: The last name of the patient.
PATIENT.PAT_FIRST_NAME: The first name of the patient.
PATIENT.PAT_MIDDLE_NAME: The middle name of the patient.
PATIENT.PAT_TITLE_C_NAME: The patient's title, e.g. Mr., Mrs., Miss, Dr., etc.
PATIENT.PAT_NAME_SUFFIX_C_NAME: The suffix to the patient's name, e.g. Jr., Sr., III, etc.
PATIENT.SPECIAL_STATUS_C_NAME: The special status of the patient, such as employee or VIP.
PATIENT.LANG_CARE_C_NAME: The patient's preferred language to receive care.
PATIENT.LANG_WRIT_C_NAME: The patient's preferred language to receive written material.
PATIENT.PROXY_PAT_YN: Indicates if the patient has a proxy already.
PATIENT.PROXY_PACK_YN: Indicates if the proxy packet was given to the patient.
PATIENT.EMPLOYER_ID: This is the unique ID of the patient's employer if the item linking the patient to an employer (I EAF 6410) is set to 1.  This is free text if the item linking the patient to an employer (I EAF 6410) is set to 2.
PATIENT.EMPY_STATUS_C_NAME: The employee's employment status (e.g. Full Time, Part time, Not Employed, etc.)
PATIENT.GUARDIAN_NAME: The name of the patient's legal guardian, if any.
PATIENT.PREF_CLIN_ZIP: The zip code of the patient's preferred clinic.
PATIENT.PREF_PCP_SEX_C_NAME: The category value of the sex of the patient's preferred primary care physician.
PATIENT.PREF_PCP_SPEC_C_NAME: The category value of the specialty of the patient's preferred physician.
PATIENT.PREF_PCP_LANG_C_NAME: The category value of the language of the patient's preferred primary care physician.
PATIENT.COUNTRY_OF_ORIG_C_NAME: Holds data on the country in which a patient was born
PATIENT.PED_CESAREAN_YN: This column contains the value "Y" if the patient was delivered by Cesarean Section. If the patient was not delivered by Cesarean Section, this column contains the value "N".
PATIENT.PED_NOUR_METH_C_NAME: Indicates the patient's pediatric nourishment method.
PATIENT.PED_DELIVR_METH_C_NAME: Indicates the patient's delivery method at birth.
PATIENT.PED_MULTI_BIRTH_YN: This column contains the value "Y" if the patient is one of a multiple birth.  This column contains the value "N" if the patient was a single birth.
PATIENT.EDD_DT: The patient's Expected Date of Delivery.
PATIENT.EDD_ENTERED_DT: Date the Expected Date of Delivery was entered.
PATIENT.INTRPTR_NEEDED_YN: Indicates whether the patient needs an interpreter.
PATIENT.PCP_DON_CHART_YN: Indicates whether the primary care physician has finished moving all the information from the paper chart into the system.
PATIENT.PAT_HAS_IOL_YN: This item is used as a data item to mark those patients having intraocular lenses.
PATIENT.PED_BIRTH_LABOR: Stores the duration of labor related to a patient's birth history.
PATIENT.PED_HOSP_DAYS: Stores the number of days spent in the hospital related to a patient's birth history.
PATIENT.MEDS_LAST_REV_TM: Stores the last time the encounter medications list was reviewed.
PATIENT.MEDS_LST_REV_USR_ID: Stores the last user to review the encounter medications list.
PATIENT.MEDS_LST_REV_USR_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PATIENT.SELF_EC_VERIF_DATE: Most recent date patient marked their emergency contact information as verified.
PATIENT.SELF_EC_VERIF_ST_YN: The status of the patient's last verified emergency contact request (e.g. verified yes or no).
PATIENT.EMPR_ID_CMT: A free text comment that can be entered when the value that is considered to be "Other" is selected as the employer. This option is available only if your organization has chosen to link the patient employer to the Employer (EEP) master file in the Facility Profile.
PATIENT.PAT_STATUS_C_NAME: The category value of the patient status. Possible statuses include alive and deceased.  Note that there are many patient creation workflows that do not populate this item so many alive patients could have blank statuses.   If using this column to report on the Alive or Deceased status of a patient population use PATIENT_4.PAT_LIVING_STAT_C instead.
PATIENT.MEDS_LAST_REV_CSN: Stores the contact serial number of the encounter in which the patient's current medications list was last reviewed.
PATIENT.SEX_C_NAME: The category number corresponding to the patient's sex.

PATIENT_2._TABLE_: This table supplements the PATIENT table. It contains basic information about patients.
PATIENT_2.PAT_ID: The unique ID of the patient record for this row. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.
PATIENT_2.RECORD_TYPE_6_C_NAME: The type of patient (EPT) record that this row relates to.
PATIENT_2.BIRTH_TM: The date and time of the patient's birth in 24 hour format.
PATIENT_2.DEATH_TM: The date and time of the patient's death in 24 hour format.
PATIENT_2.MED_HX_NOTE_ID: This column contains a link to the General Use Notes (HNO) meds history note for this patient.
PATIENT_2.IS_ADOPTED_YN: Capture if patient is adopted or not.
PATIENT_2.BIRTH_HOSPITAL: Capture the name of the hospital where the patient was born or first seen after a non-hospital birth.
PATIENT_2.ALRGY_UPD_INST: The PATIENT table extracts the last date on which the patient's allergy information was verified. For more granularity, this table extracts the instant (date and time) that this information was verified.
PATIENT_2.REFERRAL_SOURCE_ID: The unique ID of the provider or other source that referred the patient to the facility. This is distinct from the encounter-specific referral source in PAT_ENC.
PATIENT_2.REFERRAL_SOURCE_ID_REFERRING_PROV_NAM: The name of the referral source.
PATIENT_2.PAT_NAME_RECORD_ID: The networked item that points to the patient's name record (EAN).
PATIENT_2.COMM_METHOD_C_ZC_COMM_METHOD_NAME: Column to hold the category value of Preferred Communication Method (I EPT 89) for the Patient_2 table.
PATIENT_2.FOSTER_CHILD_YN: Indicates whether the patient is a foster child.
PATIENT_2.CONF_PAT_REAL_NAME: The real name of a confidential patient.
PATIENT_2.PAT_CONF_NM_REC_ID: The networked item pointing to the name record for the patient's confidential name.
PATIENT_2.ACTIVE_IER_ID: Link to active Identity History (IER) record for this patient.
PATIENT_2.OTH_CITY: Contains the city for the patient's prescription address, which can be used by pharmacy to determine where to mail prescriptions.
PATIENT_2.OTH_ZIP: Contains the zip code for the patient's prescription address, which can be used by pharmacy to determine where to mail prescriptions.
PATIENT_2.OTH_PHONE: Contains the phone number for the patient's prescription address, which can be used by pharmacy to determine where to mail prescriptions.
PATIENT_2.OTH_EMAIL: Contains the email for the patient's prescription address, which can be used by pharmacy to determine where to mail prescriptions.
PATIENT_2.OTH_CONTACT_PERSON: Contains the contact person for the patient's prescription address, which can be used by pharmacy to determine where to mail prescriptions.
PATIENT_2.OTH_HOUSE_NUMBER: Contains the house number for the patient's prescription address, which can be used by pharmacy to determine where to mail prescriptions.
PATIENT_2.OTH_DISTRICT_C_NAME: Contains the district for the patient's prescription address, which can be used by pharmacy to determine where to mail prescriptions.
PATIENT_2.OTH_COUNTY_C_NAME: Contains the county for the patient's prescription address, which can be used by pharmacy to determine where to mail prescriptions.
PATIENT_2.OTH_COUNTRY_C_NAME: Contains the country for the patient's prescription address, which can be used by pharmacy to determine where to mail prescriptions.
PATIENT_2.OTH_START_DATE: Contains the start date for the patient's prescription address, which can be used by pharmacy to determine where to mail prescriptions.
PATIENT_2.OTH_END_DATE: Contains the end date for the patient's prescription address, which can be used by pharmacy to determine where to mail prescriptions.
PATIENT_2.DEF_ADDRESS_C_NAME: Stores the address that will be used by default by the pharmacy when determining where to mail prescriptions. This can be home, temporary, or prescription.
PATIENT_2.OTH_STATE_C_NAME: Contains the state for the patient's prescription address, which can be used by pharmacy to determine where to mail prescriptions.
PATIENT_2.EMPR_CITY: The city of the patient's employer.
PATIENT_2.EMPR_STATE_C_NAME: The category number for the state of the patient's employer.
PATIENT_2.EMPR_ZIP: The ZIP code of the patient's employer.
PATIENT_2.EMPR_COUNTRY_C_NAME: The category number for the country of the patient's employer.
PATIENT_2.EMPR_PHONE: The phone number of the patient's employer.
PATIENT_2.BILL_INSTRUCT_C_NAME: The category number for the Billing Instruction Code for the patient.
PATIENT_2.PAT_ASSIST_C_NAME: The category number for the Patient Assistance Code.
PATIENT_2.BILL_COMMENT: General comments regarding patient billing instruction
PATIENT_2.CHART_ABSTD_YN: Indicates whether the chart was abstracted.
PATIENT_2.MOTHER_HEIGHT: Height of the patient's mother.  This is used for calculations in the Growth Charts activity.
PATIENT_2.FATHER_HEIGHT: Height of the patient's father.  This is used for calculations in the Growth Charts activity.
PATIENT_2.ALRGY_REV_STAT_C_NAME: This item stores the status of the review of allergies.
PATIENT_2.ALRGY_REV_CMT: This item stores a comment associated with the review of allergies.
PATIENT_2.REVERSE_NATL_ID: Used to store reverse National Identifier in an indexed item for patient search of partial National Identifier.
PATIENT_2.ADV_DIR_REV_DT: The date on which a user last reviewed the patient's advanced directive.
PATIENT_2.ADV_DIR_REV_USER_ID: The user who last reviewed the patient's advanced directive.
PATIENT_2.ADV_DIR_REV_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.

PATIENT_3._TABLE_: This table supplements the information contained in the PATIENT table. It contains basic information about patients, such as the patient's ID, occupation, English fluency, etc.
PATIENT_3.PAT_ID: The unique ID of the patient record for this row. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.
PATIENT_3.LACT_STAT_CUR_C_NAME: The category number for the patient's current lactation status.
PATIENT_3.LACT_STAT_INST_DTTM: The instant when the patient's lactation status was updated.
PATIENT_3.LACT_STAT_CSN: The contact serial number of the encounter in which the lactation status updated. The contact serial number is the unique identifier for the encounter.
PATIENT_3.LACT_STAT_USER_ID: The unique ID of the user who last updated the patient's lactation status.
PATIENT_3.LACT_STAT_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PATIENT_3.AMBULATORY_STATUS_C_NAME: Information regarding a patient's ambulatory status.
PATIENT_3.ADVANCED_DIR_YN: Indicates whether the patient has any advanced directives.
PATIENT_3.ABST_DT: The date of abstraction of the patient record.
PATIENT_3.ALRGY_REV_REAS_C_NAME: Reason for the review status of allergy assessment.
PATIENT_3.ALLOW_HALF_PILLS_YN: Indicates whether the patient uses half pills
PATIENT_3.L_GROWTH_CHART_USED: Contains the last growth chart accessed by a user for a particular patient.  This allows the activity to display that same growth chart for that patient the next time the activity is accessed.
PATIENT_3.ALRG_LAST_UPDA_DTTM: The latest instant in which allergies were updated.
PATIENT_3.PED_BIRTH_LEN_NUM: Newborn birth length stored in inches.
PATIENT_3.PED_BIRTH_WT_NUM: Newborn birth weight stored in ounces.
PATIENT_3.PED_DISCHRG_WGT_NUM: Newborn discharge weight stored in ounces.
PATIENT_3.UNOS_PRIM_COD_C_NAME: The transplant patient's primary cause of death, as defined by UNOS (United Network for Organ Sharing).
PATIENT_3.UNOS_PRIM_COD_SP: Free text description of the transplant patient's primary cause of death.
PATIENT_3.UNOS_CTRB_COD1_C_NAME: The transplant patient's first contributory cause of death, as defined by UNOS (United Network for Organ Sharing).
PATIENT_3.UNOS_CNTB_COD1_SP: Free text description of the transplant patient's first contributory cause of death.
PATIENT_3.UNOS_CTRB_COD2_C_NAME: The transplant patient's second contributory cause of death, as defined by UNOS (United Network for Organ Sharing).
PATIENT_3.UNOS_CNTB_COD2_SP: Free text description of the transplant patient's second contributory cause of death.
PATIENT_3.PREFERRED_NAME: The preferred name for the patient.
PATIENT_3.LAST_VERIFIED_BY_ID: The last user who verified the patient.
PATIENT_3.LAST_VERIFIED_BY_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PATIENT_3.LEARN_ASSMT_ID: Learning assessment ID. This can be used to check that the learning assessments are being given to the appropriate patients at the appropriate times.
PATIENT_3.CURR_LOC_ID: The unique ID of the most recent confirmed patient location that is associated with the patient.
PATIENT_3.PCOD_CAUSE_DX_ID: Stores the preliminary cause of death for the patient
PATIENT_3.PCOD_REC_USER_ID: Stores the user that filed the preliminary cause of death
PATIENT_3.PCOD_REC_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PATIENT_3.PCOD_INST_REC_DTTM: Stores the instant that the preliminary cause of death was recorded
PATIENT_3.CONTRACT_ID: The unique ID of the pricing contract that is associated with the patient.
PATIENT_3.SPOT_UPD_USER_ID: This item saves the user ID of the person who most recently updated the patient's Spotlight folder in the Synopsis activity by adding a row that previously had not been tracked by any other user.
PATIENT_3.SPOT_UPD_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PATIENT_3.GYN_HX_CMT_NOTE_ID: ID of HNO (note) record for free-text gynecological information
PATIENT_3.GYN_HX_FST_PREG_AGE: The patient's age at first pregnancy
PATIENT_3.GYN_HX_MO_BRSTFDG: The number of months the patient spent breastfeeding
PATIENT_3.FAMILY_GROUPER: A family identifier that may be used to group family members together. Note that this is not guaranteed to be unique across deployments in IntraConnect.
PATIENT_3.FETUS_YN: Indicates whether this row is a fetus record or a patient record. YES indicates that the row is a fetus record. NO indicates that the row is a patient record.
PATIENT_3.DENT_CLASS_C_NAME: This item identifies the dental classification of the patient.
PATIENT_3.DENT_LAST_USER_ID: This item stores the last user who edited the dental classification of the patient.
PATIENT_3.DENT_LAST_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PATIENT_3.DENT_INST_DTTM: This item stores the instant when the dental classification of the patient was last edited.
PATIENT_3.ENGLISH_FLUENCY_C_NAME: Record the patient's fluency in English.
PATIENT_3.FORM_CONFIDENCE_C_NAME: Record the patient's confidence level in filling out medical forms.
PATIENT_3.BRANCH_OF_SERVICE_C_NAME: This column stores the branch of service in which the patient serves.
PATIENT_3.MILITARY_RANK_C_NAME: This column stores the patient's military rank.
PATIENT_3.FMP_C_NAME: This column stores the relationship between the patient and the patient's sponsor.
PATIENT_3.PAT_CAT_C_NAME: This column, patient category, combines the branch of service and eligibility type into a three-character code, such as A14. This code affects billing and other downstream systems.
PATIENT_3.MIL_COMPONENT_C_NAME: This column stores the patient's military component, which is used to distinguish between patients who are on regular active duty and those who are members of one of the augmenting support groups.
PATIENT_3.ASGN_MIL_UNIT_ID: This column stores the military unit ID to which the patient is assigned.
PATIENT_3.ASGN_MIL_UNIT_ID_RECORD_NAME: This column stores the name of the military unit's record.
PATIENT_3.MIL_PAY_GRADE_C_NAME: This column stores the patient's military pay grade.
PATIENT_3.TEMP_MIL_UNIT_ID: This column stores the patient's temporary military unit ID.
PATIENT_3.TEMP_MIL_UNIT_ID_RECORD_NAME: This column stores the name of the military unit's record.
PATIENT_3.PED_GEST_AGE_DAYS: Newborn gestational age at birth in total number of days
PATIENT_3.PED_BIRTH_HD_CIRCUM: Newborn birth head circumference stored in inches.

PATIENT_4._TABLE_: This table supplements the PATIENT table. It contains basic information about patients.
PATIENT_4.PAT_ID: The unique ID of the patient record for this row. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.
PATIENT_4.INTERPRT_NEEDED_CMT: Comments regarding the patient's interpreter needs
PATIENT_4.DENT_COMMENT: This item stores the comment of the current dental classification
PATIENT_4.ESRD_G_START_DT: The first date that the acute comorbidity of gastrointestinal bleeding was present during maintenance dialysis treatments for End Stage Renal Disease (ESRD).
PATIENT_4.ESRD_B_START_DT: The first date that the acute comorbidity of bacterial pneumonia was present during maintenance dialysis treatments for End Stage Renal Disease (ESRD).
PATIENT_4.ESRD_P_START_DT: The first date that the acute comorbidity of pericarditis was present during maintenance dialysis treatments for End Stage Renal Disease (ESRD).
PATIENT_4.CMS_OP_ESRD_TRAIN_H: The number of training session that have been performed for a patient's hemodialysis treatment through his/her life time.
PATIENT_4.CMS_OP_ESRD_TRAIN_P: The number of training session that have been performed for a patient's peritoneal dialysis treatment through his/her life time.
PATIENT_4.FOH_ID: This item stores the filing order history ID for the member.
PATIENT_4.TXP_PAT_YN: Indicates if the patient is a transplant patient.
PATIENT_4.EMPR_COUNTY_C_NAME: The category value corresponding to the county in which the patient's employer is located.
PATIENT_4.ALRGY_REV_EPT_CSN: This column contains the source encounter where allergies were most recently reviewed. If allergies were most recently reviewed outside the context of an encounter, the value is blank.
PATIENT_4.OCCUPATION_C_NAME: Category list for the patient's occupation.
PATIENT_4.INDUSTRY_C_NAME: Category list for the industry in which the patient works.
PATIENT_4.EDUCATION_LEVEL_C_NAME: The patient's highest level of education achieved.
PATIENT_4.LOC_EDUCATION_C_NAME: Location of the patient's highest level of education.
PATIENT_4.PARENT_EDU_LEVEL_C_NAME: Parent/guardian's highest level of education achieved.
PATIENT_4.PARENT_LOC_EDU_C_NAME: Location of parent/guardian's highest level of education.
PATIENT_4.RES_OF_STATE_C_NAME: The state of residence category ID for the patient.
PATIENT_4.US_CITIZEN_YN: Indicates whether the patient is a citizen of the USA.
PATIENT_4.PERMANENT_RESIDENT_YN: Indicates whether the patient is a permanent resident of the USA.
PATIENT_4.CNTRY_SUBDIV_CODE_C_NAME: Capture the patient's country subdivision code.
PATIENT_4.RACE_COLL_MTHD_C_NAME: The race and ethnicity collection method category ID for the patient.
PATIENT_4.PAT_NO_COMM_PREF_C_NAME: This column stores why the patient doesn't have a preference for receiving communication related to reminders and follow-up care.
PATIENT_4.FST_LIVE_BIRTH_AGE: The patient's age at first live birth.
PATIENT_4.RSH_PREF_C_NAME: Indicates the patient's explicit research recruitment preference.
PATIENT_4.RSH_PREF_UTC_DTTM: Indicates the instant that the patient last indicated an explicit research recruitment preference.
PATIENT_4.RSH_PREF_USER_ID: Indicates the user who last recorded the patient's explicit research recruitment preference.
PATIENT_4.RSH_PREF_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PATIENT_4.EXTERNAL_DEATH_DATE: The patient's date of death as reported by an external organization. This column is typically populated by importing data through the Patient Load utility.
PATIENT_4.DEATH_DATA_IMPORT_DATE: The date the Patient Load utility populated EXTERNAL_DEATH_DATE for this patient.
PATIENT_4.DEATH_LOC_C_NAME: Describes the location where the patient died.
PATIENT_4.INDIGENOUS_STAT_C_NAME: Indicates whether a patient is considered indigenous.
PATIENT_4.PAT_LIVING_STAT_C_NAME: This column uses information from the chart to determine if the patient represents a real patient. If considered a patient the column returns whether or not the patient is Alive or Deceased. If the record does not represent a real patient then Not A Patient is returned. Patients with blank and custom statuses in the patient status item EPT 102 are assumed Alive. The logic for Not A Patient is identical to EPT 109 - Valid Patient except that test patients can be considered Alive or Deceased.
PATIENT_4.IS_FETAL_DEMISE_YN: This column is used to indicate the state of patient's chart due to fetal demise.
PATIENT_4.ERROR_NEWBORN_YN: This column is used to indicate that the newborn chart was created in error.
PATIENT_4.MEDSYNC_IS_PARTICIPANT_YN: Indicates whether the patient is a participant in the outpatient pharmacy medication synchronization program.
PATIENT_4.MEDSYNC_RECURRENCE: Stores the number of days that are to be between a patient's medication synchronization refills.
PATIENT_4.MEDSYNC_REFILLDATE_DATE: Stores a medication synchronization dispense date for the patient.
PATIENT_4.REFILLMGMT_NOTE_ID: Stores the ID for a General Use Notes (HNO) record for comments regarding the patient's refill management.
PATIENT_4.IHS_ENROLLMENT_NUM: This is the American Indian tribal enrollment ID number for the patient.
PATIENT_4.IHS_BENEFICIARY_CLASS_C_NAME: Classification of the type of patient, indicating a category under which an individual can become eligible for Indian Health Services (IHS) benefits.
PATIENT_4.IHS_PRIM_TRIBE_BLOOD_QUANTUM_C_NAME: This item designates the blood quantum for the patient's primary tribe.
PATIENT_4.IHS_COMMUNITY_OF_RESIDENCE_C_NAME: The patient's community of residence is a subdivision of the state and county in which the patient resides.
PATIENT_4.IHS_RESIDENCE_SINCE_DATE: Date when the patient first moved to this community of residence (I EPT 4104).
PATIENT_4.IHS_SERVICE_ELIGIBILITY_C_NAME: Specifies the types of services for which this patient is eligible.
PATIENT_4.CURRENT_JOB_START_DATE: The date a patient started in her current job.
PATIENT_4.SEX_ASGN_AT_BIRTH_C_NAME: Stores the patient's sex assigned at birth.
PATIENT_4.PREFERENCES_ID: The ID number of the communication preferences record for the patient.
PATIENT_4.DEATH_INFO_SOURCE_C_NAME: Stores the source that provided the information on the patient's death outside of the organization. This item will allow for more tracking on the patients who died outside of the organization, and allow for more accurate data on deceased patients.
PATIENT_4.BLOOD_REQTS_UTC_DTTM: Instant the blood special requirements were last edited
PATIENT_4.BLOOD_REQTS_USER_ID: Stores the user that set the current special requirements for a patient
PATIENT_4.BLOOD_REQTS_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PATIENT_4.ADDR_CHG_USER_ID: The user who initiated the linked address changes.
PATIENT_4.ADDR_CHG_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PATIENT_4.ADDR_CHG_INSTANT_DTTM: The instant that the linked address changes were initiated.
PATIENT_4.ADDR_CHG_SOURCE: The source record that initiated the linked address changes.
PATIENT_4.EDD_BASIS_OB_DT_EVENT_C_NAME: Basis for the patient's expected date of delivery (EDD). Used to track the dating basis for the patient's EDD when the patient does not have a pregnancy episode.
PATIENT_4.VETERAN_DENTAL_CVG_LEVEL_C_NAME: Each patient can have up to one dental coverage. The dental coverage denotes how much dental services a veteran can receive prior to being billed. This column is frequently used to link to the ZC_VETERAN_DENTAL_CVG table.
PATIENT_4.VETERAN_IS_COMBAT_COVERED_YN: This column stores a Yes/No value that indicates whether or not a patient is covered for their service in combat.
PATIENT_4.VETERAN_COMBAT_EXP_DATE: This column stores the expiration date of a patient's combat-level coverage.
PATIENT_4.VETERAN_PRIORITY_GROUP_C_NAME: Each patient can have up to one priority group. The priority group is a list of veteran coverage priorities that is maintained by the Department of Veteran Affairs. This column is frequently used to link to the ZC_VETERAN_PRIORITY_GROUP table.
PATIENT_4.VETERAN_ENROLLMENT_STATUS_C_NAME: Each patient can have up to one enrollment status. This denotes whether or not a patient's coverage levels are active or otherwise. This column is frequently used to link to the ZC_VETERAN_ENROLL_STATUS table.
PATIENT_4.LEGACY_HICN: Stores the patient's Health Insurance Claim Number (HICN) if one was previously available and we've received their Medicare Beneficiary Number (MBI) (stored in PATIENT.MEDICARE_NUM). This value may be needed to look up members during the transition to MBI.
PATIENT_4.RSH_PREF_MYPT_ID: Indicates the MyChart user who last recorded the patient's explicit research recruitment preference.
PATIENT_4.NEPH_ESRD_START_DT: This item is used to store the date of the patient's first regular chronic dialysis treatment.
PATIENT_4.NEPH_PCRF_LPL_ID: This item is used to store the dialysis patient's primary cause of renal failure.
PATIENT_4.NEPH_2728_VERIFY_YN: This item stores whether the dialysis patient's form-2728 was verified.

PATIENT_5._TABLE_: This table supplements the PATIENT table. It contains basic information about patients.
PATIENT_5.PAT_ID: The unique ID of the patient record for this row. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.
PATIENT_5.PHYSICAL_IMPAIRED_C_NAME: The Physically Impaired? category ID for the patient.
PATIENT_5.MEMORY_IMPAIRED_C_NAME: The Memory Impaired? category ID for the patient.
PATIENT_5.SPEECH_IMPAIRED_C_NAME: The Speech Impaired? category ID for the patient.
PATIENT_5.DISABLED_VETERAN_C_NAME: The Disabled Veteran? category ID for the patient.
PATIENT_5.VA_RECOGNIZED_C_NAME: The VA Recognized? category ID for the patient.
PATIENT_5.HEARING_IMPAIRED_C_NAME: The Hard of Hearing? category ID for the patient.
PATIENT_5.VISUALLY_IMPAIRED_C_NAME: The Low Vision? category ID for the patient.
PATIENT_5.DIFFICULTY_DRESS_BATHE_C_NAME: The Difficulty Dressing or Bathing? category ID for the patient.
PATIENT_5.DIFFICULTY_WITH_ERRAND_C_NAME: The Difficulty with Errands? category ID for the patient.
PATIENT_5.SC_PERM_FORM_OF_RES_C_NAME: The social care client's permanent form of residence.
PATIENT_5.SC_GROUNDS_FOR_RES_PERM_C_NAME: Reason why the social care client is able to hold a residence permit.
PATIENT_5.SC_RES_PERMIT_VALID_TO_DATE: Date the social care client's residence permit is valid to.
PATIENT_5.SC_TYPE_OF_RELATIONSHIP_C_NAME: Further specify marriage details for the social care client.
PATIENT_5.RSH_PREFS_ANSWER_ID: The unique ID of the questionnaire answers of the patient's most recent research preference questionnaire submission.
PATIENT_5.RX_AUTO_REFILL_DELIV_MTHD_C_NAME: The delivery method to use for refills initiated via auto refill. If not set, the default delivery method is used.
PATIENT_5.PAT_PHOTO: This stores the file name of the current patient photo.
PATIENT_5.PEND_PAT_PHOTO: This stores the file name of a photo pending approval to be added to the chart.  It has most likely been submitted by the patient via Welcome or MyChart.
PATIENT_5.TYPE_AND_SCR_ELIG_YN: This stores whether or not the patient is eligible for a type and screen.
PATIENT_5.NEPH_PCRF_DX_ID: Stores a dialysis patient's primary cause of renal failure diagnosis.
PATIENT_5.CONSENT_ABILITY_YN: If the patient is able to consent or not. Leaving this item blank will be treated as an answer of "Unknown."
PATIENT_5.MIGRATION_TYPE_C_NAME: The migrant type: either emigrant or immigrant.
PATIENT_5.MIGRANT_COUNTRY_C_NAME: If the patient is a migrant, this is the country which the patient is immigrating from or emigrating to.
PATIENT_5.CONGREGATE_CARE_RESIDENT_YN: Denotes whether a patient is a resident of a congregate care setting such as a group home, residential treatment facility, or maternity home.
PATIENT_5.SEEN_DOMESTIC_TRAVEL_ALERT_YN: Indicates whether the patient has seen the alert in MyChart or Welcome warning them that they can now enter trips that they've taken inside of the United States.
PATIENT_5.KI_SELF_GUAR_ACCT_VERIF_DATE: This item indicates the most recent date the patient verified whether the self-guarantor billing information is correct in Welcome.
PATIENT_5.KI_SELF_GUAR_ACCT_VERIF_STS_C_NAME: This item indicates the most recent answer a patient selected when prompted to verify whether the self-guarantor billing information is correct in Welcome.
PATIENT_5.PAT_PHONETIC_NAME: Stores the phonetic spelling of the patient's name.
PATIENT_5.PAT_RETIREMENT_DATE: The date of a patient's retirement for MSPQ purposes.
PATIENT_5.SPOUSE_RETIREMENT_DATE: The date of a patient's spouse's retirement for MSPQ purposes.
PATIENT_5.DRIVERS_LICENSE_STATE_C_NAME: The state category ID for the patient's driver's license.
PATIENT_5.EMPLOYMENT_HIRE_DATE: The date that a patient was hired at their employer.
PATIENT_5.EMPLOYER_FAX: the fax number of the patient's employer.
PATIENT_5.H1B_WORK_VISA_YN: Indicates whether the patient has an H1B work visa.
PATIENT_5.STUDENT_VISA_YN: Indicates whether the patient has a student visa.
PATIENT_5.BIRTH_COUNTY_C_NAME: The county category ID for where the patient was born.
PATIENT_5.CORRESP_CONTACT: This name of the contact person associated with a patient's correspondence address.
PATIENT_5.CUR_INP_SUMMARY_BLOCK_ID: The current Inpatient summary block ID.
PATIENT_5.PREFERRED_FORM_ADDRESS: How the patient prefers to be addressed.
PATIENT_5.PAT_ACADEMIC_DEGREE_C_NAME: Stores the academic degree of the patient as it would appear with the patient's name. For example, James Smith, PhD.
PATIENT_5.PREFERRED_NAME_TYPE_C_NAME: Stores the type for the patient's preferred name.

PATIENT_6._TABLE_: This table supplements the PATIENT table. It contains basic information about patients.
PATIENT_6.PAT_ID: The unique ID of the patient record for this row. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.
PATIENT_6.IMAGING_WILL_CALL_YN: Holds a "Will Call" status for the patient. This is a status toggled by a Radiology user (eg. Technologist) to flag the availability of the patient for further processing.
PATIENT_6.SEX_FOR_MELD_C_NAME: The patient's sex for adult Model for End-Stage Liver Disease (MELD) calculation.

PATIENT_ALIAS._TABLE_: The PATIENT_ALIAS table contains the aliases and soundex data for your patients. Each patient may have multiple aliases; therefore, a line number is used to uniquely identify each alias for a patient.
PATIENT_ALIAS.PAT_ID: The unique ID number assigned to the patient record.
PATIENT_ALIAS.LINE: The line number associated with the alias information associated with this row. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this row.
PATIENT_ALIAS.ALIAS: The alias on the patient record.

PATIENT_DOCS._TABLE_: The PATIENT_DOCS table contains information about each document that is attached to a patient record, including scanned and electronically signed documents.
PATIENT_DOCS.PAT_ID: The unique ID of the patient record for this row. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.
PATIENT_DOCS.LINE: The unique ID of the patient with this document.
PATIENT_DOCS.DOC_INFO_ID: The ID of the document for this patient.

PATIENT_GOALS._TABLE_: The list of goals (IGO) record IDs for this patient.
PATIENT_GOALS.PAT_ID: The unique ID of the patient record for this row. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.
PATIENT_GOALS.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
PATIENT_GOALS.GOAL_ID: The unique ID of the Discrete Goal for this patient.

PATIENT_MYC._TABLE_: This table contains web-based chart system-related data items that are stored in the Patient (EPT) master file. These items generally relate to web-based chart system account activation and account status, and also include the last verification date for different types of patient information that can be verified through the web-based chart system.
PATIENT_MYC.PAT_ID: The unique ID of the patient record for this row. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.
PATIENT_MYC.PAT_ACCESS_CODE: The patient's current web-based chart system access code. This value is checked when a patient attempts to log in to the web-based chart system for the first time.
PATIENT_MYC.PAT_ACCESS_CODE_TM: This is a timestamp indicating when the access code in field PAT_ACCESS_CODE was created.
PATIENT_MYC.PAT_ACCESS_STAT_C_NAME: The access code status category number for the patient. 0 corresponds to "Not Used". 1 corresponds to "Used".
PATIENT_MYC.MYCHART_STATUS_C_NAME: The web-based chart system status category number for the patient.
PATIENT_MYC.ACCESSCODE_STAT_C_NAME: The access code generation status category number for the patient.
PATIENT_MYC.DEACT_ACCT_YN: Indicates whether the patient's web-based chart system account is deactivated. Y indicates that the account is deactivated. N or a null value indicates that the account is active.
PATIENT_MYC.CODE_FOR_PROXY_YN: Indicates whether the access code was generated for a proxy to use on behalf of the patient. Y indicates that the access code was generated. N or a null value indicates that the access code was not generated.
PATIENT_MYC.MYCHART_EXP_DATE: The expiration date (if one has been set) of the web-based chart system account. When this date is reached, the web-based chart system user is no longer allowed to login to the system.
PATIENT_MYC.MYPT_ID: The unique ID of the web-based chart system patient account.
PATIENT_MYC.LAST_MERGE_FROM: If this patient record is the destination of a previous merging, and the source record has web-based chart system activity, then this item stores the time instant of the merging.
PATIENT_MYC.ALT_WEBSTE_STAT_C_NAME: The alternate website activation status category number for the patient.
PATIENT_MYC.MYC_PAT_TYPE_C_NAME: The web-based chart system patient type category number for the patient.
PATIENT_MYC.DEM_VERIF_DT: Date of last demographics verification by patient or his/her proxy from MyChart.
PATIENT_MYC.INS_VERIF_DT: Date of last insurance verification by patient or his/her proxy from MyChart
PATIENT_MYC.R_E_L_PAT_VERIF_DT: The date when race, ethnicity, and language information was last verified by the patient online using the patient portal.
PATIENT_MYC.PCP_PAT_VERIF_DT: The date that patients last used Welcome to verify and/or update their primary care provider.
PATIENT_MYC.HCA_PAT_VERIF_DT: The date that the patient last used MyChart or Welcome to verify and/or update their health care agents.
PATIENT_MYC.PAT_MYC3_ENR_STAT_C_NAME: Returns the status of enrollment in MyChart Care Companion.
PATIENT_MYC.LAST_LABS_VIEW_DTTM: The last time when the patient or proxies viewed patient's result list (including IP results) in MyChart.

PATIENT_RACE._TABLE_: This table contains information on a patient's race.
PATIENT_RACE.PAT_ID: The unique ID of the patient record for this row. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.
PATIENT_RACE.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.

PAT_ADDRESS._TABLE_: This table contains each patient's permanent address (I EPT 50). The primary key for this table is the combination of PAT_ID and LINE. Each different PAT_ID value represents a different patient, and each LINE value represents a different line of that patient's address.
PAT_ADDRESS.PAT_ID: The unique ID of the patient record for this row. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.
PAT_ADDRESS.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
PAT_ADDRESS.ADDRESS: This column contains the patient's permanent address. Each PAT_ID value represents a different patient, and each LINE value represents a different line of that patient's address.

PAT_ADDR_CHNG_HX._TABLE_: This table keeps track of changes in the patient's address.
PAT_ADDR_CHNG_HX.PAT_ID: Patient ID for whom address is changed.
PAT_ADDR_CHNG_HX.LINE: Line count in the address change history.
PAT_ADDR_CHNG_HX.ADDR_HX_LINE1: First line of patient's home address, current between dates recorded in columns EFF_START_DATE and EFF_END_DATE.
PAT_ADDR_CHNG_HX.ADDR_HX_LINE2: Second line of patient's home address, current between dates recorded in columns EFF_START_DATE and EFF_END_DATE.
PAT_ADDR_CHNG_HX.ADDR_HX_LN_EXTRA: Additional line of patient's home address, current between dates recorded in columns EFF_START_DATE and EFF_END_DATE.
PAT_ADDR_CHNG_HX.CITY_HX: Patient's home city, current between dates recorded in columns EFF_START_DATE and EFF_END_DATE.
PAT_ADDR_CHNG_HX.COUNTY_HX_C_NAME: Patient's home county, current between dates recorded in columns EFF_START_DATE and EFF_END_DATE.
PAT_ADDR_CHNG_HX.ZIP_HX: Patient's home ZIP, current between dates recorded in columns EFF_START_DATE and EFF_END_DATE.
PAT_ADDR_CHNG_HX.EFF_START_DATE: Effective start date of changed address (date when address was changed).
PAT_ADDR_CHNG_HX.EFF_END_DATE: Effective end date of changed address (date of the next address change or NULL if this is the last address change).
PAT_ADDR_CHNG_HX.PREV_HOUSE_NUM: Audit trail item used to store the previous house number when a new house number is entered or if the current primary address is edited.
PAT_ADDR_CHNG_HX.PREV_DISTRICT_C_NAME: Audit trail item used to store the previous district when a new district is entered or if the current primary address is edited.
PAT_ADDR_CHNG_HX.SIGNIFICANT_CHANGE_YN: Audit trail item used to store whether the address change should be considered significant when a new address is entered or if the current primary address is edited.
PAT_ADDR_CHNG_HX.ADDR_HX_VALID_YN: This columns specifies if the historical address stored on the patient record is invalid or incorrect. A blank value means historical address is a valid older address. Use this item to indicate a patient's address was captured due to error, for example, in the case of a patient overlay.
PAT_ADDR_CHNG_HX.PREV_FLOOR: Audit trail item used to store the previous floor number when a new floor number is entered or if the current primary address is edited.
PAT_ADDR_CHNG_HX.PREV_UNIT: Audit trail item used to store the previous unit number when a new unit number is entered or if the current primary address is edited.
PAT_ADDR_CHNG_HX.PREV_BLDG_NAM: Audit trail item used to store the previous building name when a new building is entered or if the current primary address is edited.
PAT_ADDR_CHNG_HX.COUNTRY_C_NAME: Audit trail item used to store the previous country when a new country is entered or if the current primary address is edited.

PAT_EMAILADDRESS._TABLE_: This table stores the patient's email addresses.
PAT_EMAILADDRESS.PAT_ID: Internal ID of the patient (.1 record ID)
PAT_EMAILADDRESS.LINE: The Line Count.  Each line stores one of the patient's e-mail addresses.

PAT_PCP._TABLE_: This table contains the Primary Care Provider (PCP) information for your patients over time. It can also contain data about providers that are not PCPs but are still on the patients' EpicCare-Ambulatory care teams.
PAT_PCP.PAT_ID: The unique ID of the patient record for this row. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.
PAT_PCP.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
PAT_PCP.PCP_PROV_ID: The unique ID associated with the provider record for this row. This column is frequently used to link to the CLARITY_SER table.
PAT_PCP.EFF_DATE: The date from which the provider is in effect as the member�s PCP.
PAT_PCP.TERM_DATE: The last date for which the provider was the member�s PCP.
PAT_PCP.PCP_TYPE_C_NAME: The category value associated with the type of the PCP. This is only populated when the provider is a patient's PCP and is null otherwise.
PAT_PCP.SPECIALTY_C_NAME: The specialty category ID for the patient care team member.
PAT_PCP.RESULTS_C_NAME: The results to receive category ID for the patient care team member.
PAT_PCP.PCP_MESSAGE_YN: Indicates whether a provider on a patient's care team wishes to be included as a recipient of messages sent to the patient's PCP. A �Y� indicates that the provider wishes to receive messages, a �N� indicates that the provider does not wish to receive the messages.
PAT_PCP.RELATIONSHIP_C_NAME: The relationship to patient category ID for the patient care team member.
PAT_PCP.OTHER_NAME: The name for patient care team members that don't have a provider and resource record.
PAT_PCP.OTHER_ADDRESS: The address for patient care team members that don't have a provider and resource record.  Lines are delimited with character 9s.
PAT_PCP.OTHER_PHONE: The phone number for patient care team members that don't have a provider and resource record.
PAT_PCP.OTHER_PAGER: The pager number for patient care team members that don't have a provider and resource record.
PAT_PCP.OTHER_FAX: The fax number for patient care team members that don't have a provider and resource record.
PAT_PCP.OTHER_EMAIL: The email address for patient care team members that don't have a provider and resource record.
PAT_PCP.PCP_HX_COMMENTS: Free text comments that can be entered for a provider that is part of the care team for this patient.
PAT_PCP.PCP_ADDRESS_ID: The unique ID of the address in the provider record that should be used to contact the patient's PCP. This column is frequently used in conjunction with the PCP_PROV_ID column to link to the CLARITY_SER_ADDR table.

PAT_PREF_PHARMACY._TABLE_: This table contains information on a patient's pharmacy preferences.
PAT_PREF_PHARMACY.PAT_ID: The unique ID of the patient record for this row. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.
PAT_PREF_PHARMACY.LINE: The line number associated with the list of preferred pharmacy selected

PAT_RCNT_USD_PHRMS._TABLE_: This table extracts a patient's most recently selected pharmacies.
PAT_RCNT_USD_PHRMS.PAT_ID: The unique ID of the patient record for this row. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.
PAT_RCNT_USD_PHRMS.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.

PAT_RELATIONSHIPS.PAT_ID: The unique ID of the patient record for this row. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.
PAT_RELATIONSHIPS.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
PAT_RELATIONSHIPS.PAT_REL_NAME: The name of the patient's contact.
PAT_RELATIONSHIPS.PAT_REL_ZIP: The ZIP code of the patient's contact.
PAT_RELATIONSHIPS.PAT_REL_LGL_GUAR_YN: Whether this contact is the patient's legal guardian
PAT_RELATIONSHIPS.PAT_REL_REC_LINK_ID: Links this contact to a patient record
PAT_RELATIONSHIPS.PAT_REL_PRIM_PH_C_NAME: Which of the contact's phone numbers should be considered primary
PAT_RELATIONSHIPS.PAT_REL_DISTRICT_C_NAME: The district category ID for the patient's contact.
PAT_RELATIONSHIPS.PAT_REL_HEARING_YN: Capture if patient's relative has hearing impairment
PAT_RELATIONSHIPS.PAT_REL_VISUALLY_YN: Capture if patient's relative has visual impairment
PAT_RELATIONSHIPS.PAT_REL_IMP_NEEDS_C_NAME: Capture the patient's emergency contact's special needs for hearing and visual impairment.
PAT_RELATIONSHIPS.PAT_REL_SPOKEN_C_NAME: Capture the patient's emergency contact's spoken language.
PAT_RELATIONSHIPS.PAT_REL_WRITTEN_C_NAME: Capture the patient's emergency contact's written language.
PAT_RELATIONSHIPS.PAT_REL_PREF_LANG_C_NAME: Capture the patient's emergency contact's preferred language.
PAT_RELATIONSHIPS.PAT_REL_INTERPRET_YN: Capture if the patient's emergency contact needs an interpreter.
PAT_RELATIONSHIPS.PAT_REL_SPL_NEEDS_C_NAME: Capture the patient's emergency contact's special needs.
PAT_RELATIONSHIPS.PAT_REL_NOTIFY_YN: Capture if the patient's emergency contact should be notified on patient's admission.
PAT_RELATIONSHIPS.PAT_LEGAL_REL_C_NAME: Specifies the category for the legal relationship
PAT_RELATIONSHIPS.PAT_REL_ACT_AGNT_YN: Specifies if the health care agent is active or not
PAT_RELATIONSHIPS.PAT_REL_EMAIL: Primary email address of the patient's emergency contact.
PAT_RELATIONSHIPS.PAT_REL_RLA_ID: Links this patient contact to the associated Patient Relationships (RLA) patient relationship record.

PAT_PREF_PHARMACY.PREF_PHARMACY_ID_PHARMACY_NAME: COSTCO PHARMACY # 1020 - MIDDLETON, WI - 2150 DEMING WAY

PAT_RCNT_USD_PHRMS.RECENT_PHARM_ID_PHARMACY_NAME: COSTCO PHARMACY # 1020 - MIDDLETON, WI - 2150 DEMING WAY

title: Allergies: ALLERGY → Allergy → allergies
description: Allergy records with reactions, severity, status

ALLERGY._TABLE_: The ALLERGY table contains information about the allergies noted in your patients' clinical system records. You would use this table if you wanted to report on the number of patients who are allergic to sulfa drugs, for example. To determine the allergic reaction, link to the ALLERGY_REACTIONS table.
ALLERGY.ALLERGY_ID: The unique ID used to identify the allergy record.
ALLERGY.ALLERGEN_ID: The unique ID assigned to the allergen (Agent) record.
ALLERGY.ALLERGEN_ID_ALLERGEN_NAME: The name of the allergen record.
ALLERGY.REACTION: This column contains the free text reaction comments. The actual reaction category value responses are stored in the ALLERGY_REACTIONS table which is linked via the ALLERGY_ID columns in both tables.
ALLERGY.DATE_NOTED: The date the patient made it known that they had experienced an allergic reaction in calendar format.
ALLERGY.ENTRY_USER_ID: The unique ID of the clinical system user who entered this allergy into the patient�s record. This ID may be encrypted.  NOTE: If an allergy record is edited/updated, this will show the most recent change user ID.
ALLERGY.ENTRY_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ALLERGY.SEVERITY_C_NAME: The allergy type category value, describing the nature or character of the allergy (i.e. systemic, topical, etc.). NOTE: This field refers to the field called "TYPE" in the Allergy module in clinical system.
ALLERGY.ALLERGY_SEVERITY_C_NAME: This item stores the severity of an allergy.
ALLERGY.ALRGY_STATUS_C_NAME: The status category number for this allergy record. The status can be active or deleted.
ALLERGY.ALRGY_DLET_RSN_C_NAME: Stores the reason for deleting an allergy.
ALLERGY.ALRGY_DLT_CMT: This item contains the comment about why an allergy was deleted from a patient's chart.
ALLERGY.CONTRA_EXP_DT: The date that the contraindication will expire.
ALLERGY.ALRGY_ENTERED_DTTM: The date and time the allergy was entered into the patient's record using a calendar format. NOTE: If an allergy record is edited/updated this will show the most recent change.
ALLERGY.ALLERGY_CERTAINTY_C_NAME: The certainty that this allergen is a risk to the patient.
ALLERGY.ALLERGY_SOURCE_C_NAME: The source of information for an allergy.
ALLERGY.ALLERGY_PAT_CSN: The patient contact corresponding to the patient encounter in which this allergy was edited.
ALLERGY.ALLERGY_NOTED_DATE_ACCURACY_C_NAME: The noted date accuracy of an allergy determines the accuracy of the noted date specified in DATE_NOTED.  A value of 1-Year indicates that the specific day in the DATE_NOTED column is accurate to the year and not to the specific day. Similarly a value of 2-Month indicates that it is accurate to the month. A value of 3-Exact Date or an empty value indicates that the corresponding value in DATE_NOTED column is accurate to that day.

ALLERGY_REACTIONS._TABLE_: The ALLERGY_REACTIONS table contains the category values of the reactions associated with a given allergy. There may be multiple reactions associated with a single allergy. In this case, there will be multiple records in this table with the same ALLERGY_ID, but with different LINE values.
ALLERGY_REACTIONS.ALLERGY_ID: The unique ID used to identify the allergy record.
ALLERGY_REACTIONS.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
ALLERGY_REACTIONS.REACTION_C_NAME: The integer category value corresponding to the type of allergy reaction. To display names and/or abbreviations, link to the associated ZC lookup table.

PATIENT_ALG_UPD_HX._TABLE_: The PATIENT_ALG_UPD_HX table contains one record for each update of a patient's allergy information.
PATIENT_ALG_UPD_HX.PAT_ID: The unique ID assigned to the patient record.
PATIENT_ALG_UPD_HX.LINE: The line number of a specific allergy update in the patient's allergy update history. This is the second column in the primary key and, in addition to the patient ID, uniquely identifies a patient allergy update.
PATIENT_ALG_UPD_HX.ALRG_UPDT_DATE: The date on which the patient's allergy history was updated.
PATIENT_ALG_UPD_HX.ALRG_UPDT_USER_ID: The user who last updated the patient's allergy history.
PATIENT_ALG_UPD_HX.ALRG_UPDT_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PATIENT_ALG_UPD_HX.ALRG_UPDT_TIME: The time at which the patient's allergy history was updated.
PATIENT_ALG_UPD_HX.ALRG_HX_REV_STAT_C_NAME: This item stores the history of the status of the review of allergies.
PATIENT_ALG_UPD_HX.ALRG_HX_REV_REAS_C_NAME: This item stores the history of the review reason of allergies.
PATIENT_ALG_UPD_HX.ALRG_UPDT_DTTM: The date and time at which the patient's allergy history was updated.
PATIENT_ALG_UPD_HX.ALRG_HX_REV_EPT_CSN: This column contains historical entries for the source encounter where allergies were reviewed. If allergies were reviewed outside the context of an encounter, the value is null.

PAT_ALLERGIES._TABLE_: The allergies that are associated with a patient are stored on this table. This table also provides a link from the Patient (EPT) based tables to the Problem List (LPL) based tables.
PAT_ALLERGIES.PAT_ID: The unique ID of the patient record for this row. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.
PAT_ALLERGIES.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
PAT_ALLERGIES.ALLERGY_RECORD_ID: This column contains the allergies that are associated with the patient. The allergies are stored as unique identifiers so they can be networked to the problem (LPL) master file.

title: Problems: PROBLEM_LIST → Problem → problems
description: Active/resolved problems with onset, priority, diagnoses

CLARITY_EDG._TABLE_: The CLARITY_EDG table contains basic information about diagnoses.
CLARITY_EDG.DX_ID: The unique ID of the diagnosis record in your system.
CLARITY_EDG.PAT_FRIENDLY_TEXT: A description of the diagnosis that is easy for patients to understand.

PAT_PROBLEM_LIST._TABLE_: This table contains information about the problem list of a patient. It is based off the KB_SQL table PROBLEM_LIST_ID, and its function is to list the Problem List (LPL) IDs of each patient.
PAT_PROBLEM_LIST.PAT_ID: The unique ID of the patient record for this row. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.
PAT_PROBLEM_LIST.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
PAT_PROBLEM_LIST.PROBLEM_LIST_ID: The unique ID of the problem(s) listed for the patient record of this row.

PL_SYSTEMS._TABLE_: The PL_SYSTEMS table contains body system data from patients' problem lists in the clinical system.
PL_SYSTEMS.PROBLEM_LIST_ID: The unique identifier for the problem record.
PL_SYSTEMS.PROB_LIST_SYSTEM_C_NAME: This item is a link to the System category associated with the Problem List System record.

PROBLEM_LIST._TABLE_: The PROBLEM_LIST table contains data from patients' problem lists in the clinical system. The data in this table reflects the current status of all problems on the patient's problem list. In the clinical system, each problem is marked as active until it becomes (and is marked) Resolved or Deleted. At that point, by default, it will not be displayed in the application. However, any problem ever entered on this list is stored in the database and will exist in this table. Deleted and resolved problems can be viewed in the application by simply marking a checkbox to show them. Note that deleted and resolved problems can be restored by undeleting them (an option in the application). When a deleted problem is restored, its status is changed to active and the deleted date is returned to null.
PROBLEM_LIST.PROBLEM_LIST_ID: The unique ID of this Problem List entry.
PROBLEM_LIST.DX_ID: The unique ID of the diagnosis record associated with the entry in the patient�s Problem List. Note: This is NOT the ICD9 diagnosis code. It is an internal identifier that is typically not visible to a user.
PROBLEM_LIST.DESCRIPTION: The display name of the problem. Only contains data if the default display name is changed.
PROBLEM_LIST.NOTED_DATE: Represents the first possible date that a problem could have been noted/onset on. By default, this is the problem's date of entry into the problem list. The intent of this field is to allow users to change this date to the date the problem was first diagnosed if that is different than the entry date.  A problem's noted date is documented as a fuzzy date, meaning that it can capture approximate date data ("2012", "1/2012") or exact data ("3/5/2012"). This column captures the earliest date of the effective range. See NOTED_END_DATE for the latest counterpart. For example, if 2012 is documented in hyperspace, then NOTED_DATE will be 1/1/2012 and NOTED_END_DATE will be 12/31/2012.
PROBLEM_LIST.RESOLVED_DATE: The date the problem was resolved in calendar format.
PROBLEM_LIST.DATE_OF_ENTRY: This is the date the specific problem was last edited (i.e., a change was made, either in status, priority, etc.).
PROBLEM_LIST.ENTRY_USER_ID: The unique ID of the system user who last edited the problem in the patient�s Problem List. This ID may be encrypted.
PROBLEM_LIST.ENTRY_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PROBLEM_LIST.PROBLEM_CMT: The preview text (first characters) of the Overview note entered for a Problem List entry.
PROBLEM_LIST.CHRONIC_YN: This column indicates whether or not this problem is flagged as chronic.
PROBLEM_LIST.SHOW_IN_MYC_YN: Indicates whether this problem will be displayed in Epic's Patient Portal, MyChart.
PROBLEM_LIST.PROBLEM_STATUS_C_NAME: The category value associated with the problem�s current state: Active, Resolved, or Deleted.  NOTE: Historical information regarding status changes can be viewed from within the application.
PROBLEM_LIST.CLASS_OF_PROBLEM_C_NAME: The category value associated with additional information for the problem, such as Acute, chronic, minor, and so on.
PROBLEM_LIST.PRIORITY_C_NAME: The category value associated with the relative severity of the problem. Problems can be given a priority (e.g., high, medium, or low).  This field shows the category value associated with the current priority level assigned to a problem.
PROBLEM_LIST.OVERVIEW_NOTE_ID: This item is a link to the note record that contains the overview note pertaining to this problem record.
PROBLEM_LIST.STAGE_ID: The unique ID of the cancer stage record associated with the entry in the patient�s Problem List.
PROBLEM_LIST.PROBLEM_TYPE_C_NAME: The problem type for this problem.
PROBLEM_LIST.CREATING_ORDER_ID: The order ID of the order that created the problem.
PROBLEM_LIST.NO_STAGE_REASON_C_NAME: For a problem that could be staged, stores the reason why it was not staged.
PROBLEM_LIST.NO_STAGE_COMMENT: For a problem that could be staged, stores a free-text comment explaining why the problem was not staged.
PROBLEM_LIST.NO_STAGE_USER_ID: For a problem that could be staged, stores the user who chose not to stage it.
PROBLEM_LIST.NO_STAGE_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PROBLEM_LIST.NO_STAGE_DTTM: For a problem that could be staged, stores the instant when a user flagged it to not be staged.
PROBLEM_LIST.TREAT_SUMM_STATUS_C_NAME: Stores the treatment summary status for this problem.
PROBLEM_LIST.NOTED_END_DATE: Represents the last possible date that a problem could have been noted/onset on.   A problem's noted date is documented as a fuzzy date, meaning that it can capture approximate date data ("2012", "1/2012") or exact data ("3/5/2012"). This column captures the latest date of the effective range. See NOTED_DATE for the earliest counterpart. For example, if 2012 is documented in hyperspace, then NOTED_DATE will be 1/1/2012 and NOTED_END_DATE will be 12/31/2012.  Note that the value may be empty, even if NOTED_DATE is populated
PROBLEM_LIST.REL_GOALS_PROBLEM_LIST_CSN_ID: Stores the CSN (contact serial number I.E. unique contact identifier) of the last related goals contact that was edited.
PROBLEM_LIST.REL_GOALS_INST_DTTM: Stores the instant of the last related goals contact that was edited.
PROBLEM_LIST.PROB_STAGE_STATUS_C_NAME: Flag to indicate whether this problem has been staged or marked as no stage required.
PROBLEM_LIST.DIAG_START_DATE: Represents the earliest possible date that a problem could have been diagnosed on. The latest possible date is stored in DIAG_END_DATE. If these values are the same, then the date is exact rather than fuzzy. For a problem or condition affecting a patient, the diagnosis date is defined as the date when a qualified professional first recognized the presence of that condition with sufficient certainty, regardless of whether it was fully characterized at that time. For diseases such as cancer, this may be the earliest date of a clinical diagnosis from before it was histologically confirmed, not the date of confirmation if that occurred later.
PROBLEM_LIST.DIAG_END_DATE: Represents the last possible date that a problem could have been diagnosed on. The earliest possible date is stored in DIAG_START_DATE. If these values are the same, then the date is exact rather than fuzzy. For a problem or condition affecting a patient, the diagnosis date is defined as the date when a qualified professional first recognized the presence of that condition with sufficient certainty, regardless of whether it was fully characterized at that time. For diseases such as cancer, this may be the earliest date of a clinical diagnosis from before it was histologically confirmed, not the date of confirmation if that occurred later.

PROBLEM_LIST_ALL._TABLE_: This is a generic table that contains every Problem List (LPL) record regardless of its type. It also contains a link to the patient record that is associated with the LPL record, a column indicating the type of LPL record, and an optional link from a Problem History record (type 7) to the corresponding Problem record (type 1) that it describes.
PROBLEM_LIST_ALL.PROBLEM_LIST_ID: The unique identifier for the problem record.
PROBLEM_LIST_ALL.PAT_ID: The unique ID of the patient record associated with this problem list.
PROBLEM_LIST_ALL.HX_SOURCE_ID: Stores the ID of the problem record that this history record describes.
PROBLEM_LIST_ALL.RECORD_TYPE_C_NAME: Indicates the type of information stored in this record, such as Problem List, Allergy, Immunization, etc.

PROB_LIST_REV_HX._TABLE_: This table contains all the historical entries (dates/times/users/related contacts) for when the patient's problem list was marked as reviewed.
PROB_LIST_REV_HX.PAT_ID: The unique ID assigned to the patient record. This ID may be encrypted if you have elected to use enterprise reporting's encryption utility.
PROB_LIST_REV_HX.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
PROB_LIST_REV_HX.PROB_LIST_REV_HX_DT: All the historical dates the patient's problem list was reviewed
PROB_LIST_REV_HX.PROB_LIST_REV_HX_TM: All the historical times the patient's problem list was reviewed
PROB_LIST_REV_HX.PRBLST_REVUSRHX_ID: All the users that have reviewed the patient's Problem List.
PROB_LIST_REV_HX.PRBLST_REVUSRHX_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PROB_LIST_REV_HX.PROB_LIST_REV_CSNHX: The unique contact serial number for the patient encounter in which the problem list was reviewed within an encounter context. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).

PROB_UPDATES._TABLE_: This table includes over-time single-response items from the Problem List (LPL) master file, such as the contact serial number (CSN), contact time, and contact user.
PROB_UPDATES.PROBLEM_LIST_ID: The unique identifier for the problem record.
PROB_UPDATES.CONTACT_DATE_REAL: A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
PROB_UPDATES.CONTACT_DATE: The date and time of this contact.
PROB_UPDATES.CONTACT_SERIAL_NUM: The contact serial number (CSN) of the contact, which is a unique contact identifier.
PROB_UPDATES.EDIT_USER_ID: The user ID of the user who made the change.
PROB_UPDATES.EDIT_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PROB_UPDATES.CONTACT_STATUS_C_NAME: Stores the status of this contact - used by records of type "Problem History".
PROB_UPDATES.EPT_CSN: Holds the patient CSN (contact serial number I.E. unique contact identifier) corresponding to the patient encounter in which related information was added to or removed from this problem, if the edit was made during a patient encounter.
PROB_UPDATES.RECONCILED_YN: This item contains information about whether a problem has been reconciled in a given encounter.

title: Immunizations: IMMUNE + children → immunizations
description: Immunization records with dates, doses, manufacturers, administration

IMMUNE._TABLE_: The IMMUNE table contains data for immunizations ordered through clinical system. May also contain information on immunizations as reported by patient, but not ordered/administered via clinical system;  Fields in this table are noadd- single items in database. If an immunization record is edited/changed, that record will be re-extracted and reflect the updated values.
IMMUNE.IMMUNE_ID: The unique ID of the immunization record in your system production system.
IMMUNE.IMMUNZATN_ID: The ID of the immunization record that corresponds to the type of immunization given to this patient.
IMMUNE.IMMUNE_DATE: The date the immunization was administered in calendar format.
IMMUNE.ROUTE_C_NAME: The category value associated with the route of the immunization, such as oral, intramuscular, or intradermal.
IMMUNE.SITE_C_NAME: The category value associated with the location of the injection, if appropriate. For example, left gluteus or right deltoid.
IMMUNE.MFG_C_NAME: The category value associated with the manufacturer of this vaccine.
IMMUNE.LOT: The lot number of the vaccine.
IMMUNE.EXP_DATE: The date the immunization is next due, if in a series. This is manually established by the user, and not automatically calculated like an HM or BPA.
IMMUNE.GIVEN_BY_USER_ID: The unique ID of the system user who administered the immunization. This ID may be encrypted.
IMMUNE.GIVEN_BY_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
IMMUNE.ENTRY_USER_ID: The unique ID of the system user who ordered the immunization. This ID may be encrypted.  NOTE: If an immunization record is edited/updated, this will show the most recent change user ID.
IMMUNE.ENTRY_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
IMMUNE.ENTRY_DATE: The date the immunization was recorded in the patient�s chart in calendar format. NOTE: If an immunization record is edited/updated, this will show the most recent change date.
IMMUNE.EXPIRATION_DATE: Date upon which this immunization expires
IMMUNE.EXTERNAL_ADMIN_C_NAME: Category value indicating the source of verification of external administration of immunization, e.g. patient reported, WIR reported, etc.
IMMUNE.VIS_DATE_TEXT: The date on the vaccine information statement. Note that this is a free text field in the application, so data will not be in standard datetime format.
IMMUNE.DEFER_REASON_C_NAME: Category value indicating the reason for deferring the immunization, e.g. patient refused, contraindication, etc.
IMMUNE.MED_ADMIN_COMMENT: Free text comment regarding the administration of this immunization
IMMUNE.PHYSICAL_SITE: Item that stores the physical location where the immunization was administered like some specific hospital
IMMUNE.IMM_PRODUCT: Item which stores the product of the immunization. Products are usually related to the lot number.
IMMUNE.IMMUNIZATION_TIME: Column that stores the time when a given immunization was administered.
IMMUNE.NDC_NUM_ID: Store the NDC number ID associated with the administration
IMMUNE.NDC_NUM_ID_NDC_CODE: The external code for the National Drug Code (NDC). An NDC represents packages of medications.
IMMUNE.DOCUMENT_DCS_ID: Document ID for the immunization. This is the information stored when the e-sign information is selected.
IMMUNE.IMMNZTN_STATUS_C_NAME: The category value associated with "Given" if the immunization has been administered, "Deleted" if the immunization has been deleted from the administration history, "Incomplete" if the item has been ordered but not administered and a status of "Deferred" if the immunization has been deferred.
IMMUNE.IMM_MAR_ADMIN_LINE: The line number in the linked order record's immunization link item (I ORD 11270) which references this immunization record ID.
IMMUNE.IMM_CHARGE_REC_ID: This column contains the UCL (Universal Charge Line) record ID for the immunization charge.
IMMUNE.IMM_CSN: This column contains the CSN (contact serial number) for the immunization.
IMMUNE.EXTERNAL_ID: This column contains the immunization's external ID, which is populated by the interface.  The external ID is the external system's identifier for the immunization.
IMMUNE.EXTERNAL_SYSTEM: This column contains the name or ID of the third party system that the immunization data came from.  This item is only populated by custom import specifications.
IMMUNE.INSTANT_OF_ENT_DTTM: This column contains the last instant of update of the immunization problem list (LPL) record.
IMMUNE.IMM_HISTORIC_ADM_YN: Indicates whether the immunization administration is a historical administration.
IMMUNE.IMMNZTN_DUALSIGN_ID: The user who performed the second user verification on the immunization.
IMMUNE.IMMNZTN_DUALSIGN_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
IMMUNE.IMM_DUALSIGNINSTANT_DTTM: The instant at which this immunization was verified by the second user.
IMMUNE.IMM_DEL_REASON_C_NAME: Category value indicating the reason for deleting or canceling the immunization.
IMMUNE.IMM_SCANNED_BARCODE: The raw data captured during immunization barcode scanning.
IMMUNE.ENTRY_DTTM: Contains the date and time that the immunization administration data was last updated. If the exact time is not known, a date may be contained in ENTRY_DATE instead.
IMMUNE.IMM_PRODUCT_C_NAME: The brand name associated with the vaccination administration, stored as a category value from a defined set of products.
IMMUNE.IMM_DEFER_DUR_C_NAME: Each category value represents a different time scale of deferral for a vaccine administration deferral (e.g. "brief", "permanent", etc...). This item does NOT store the specific length of time the vaccine was deferred.
IMMUNE.IMM_REG_STATUS_C_NAME: The current administration's overall status according to an external Immunization Registry.
IMMUNE.IMM_LST_REGINST_UTC_DTTM: Last instant in which the overall registry status from an Immunization Registry was updated for a vaccine administration problem list  (LPL)record.
IMMUNE.IMM_MAR_ADM_INPATIENT_DATA_ID: Link to the INP record that may hold the administrations data.
IMMUNE.IMM_LOT_NUM_ID: This item stores the record ID of the lot(LOT) used for immunization administration.

IMMUNE_HISTORY._TABLE_: The IMMUNE_HISTORY table contains the history data for immunizations ordered through the clinical system. It may also contain information on immunizations as reported by the patient, but not ordered/administered via clinical system. This table contains the history of changes made to the information that is found in the IMMUNE table. Fields in this table are no-add related group items in the LPL database.
IMMUNE_HISTORY.IMMUNE_ID: The unique ID of the immunization record in your system production system.
IMMUNE_HISTORY.LINE: The Line Count for the line in the table which in combination with the IMMUNE_ID forms the primary key for this table.
IMMUNE_HISTORY.IMM_TYPE_HIST_ID: Stores the unique ID of the immunizations (LIM) master file which is associated with this immunization record.  Corresponds to the type of immunization given to this patient.
IMMUNE_HISTORY.IMM_HX_PRODUCT: Stores the product information associated with this immunization. Products are usually related to the lot number.
IMMUNE_HISTORY.IMM_HX_NDC_NUM_ID: The unique ID of the Medication National Drug Codes (NDC) master file that is associated with this immunization and stores the NDC numbers associated with the administration of this immunization.
IMMUNE_HISTORY.IMM_HX_NDC_NUM_ID_NDC_CODE: The external code for the National Drug Code (NDC). An NDC represents packages of medications.
IMMUNE_HISTORY.IMMNZTN_HX_DATE: The  date when this immunization was administered.
IMMUNE_HISTORY.IMM_HX_TIME: The time when this immunization was administered.
IMMUNE_HISTORY.IMMNZTN_HX_DOSE: The dosage information for this immunization administered.
IMMUNE_HISTORY.IMMNZTN_HX_ROUTE_C_NAME: The category number for the route of the immunization, such as oral, intramuscular, or intradermal.
IMMUNE_HISTORY.IMMNZTN_HX_SITE_C_NAME: The location of the injection, if appropriate.
IMMUNE_HISTORY.IMMNZTN_HX_MFG_C_NAME: The category number for the manufacturer of this vaccine.
IMMUNE_HISTORY.IMMNZTN_HX_LOT: The LOT number for the immunization administered.
IMMUNE_HISTORY.IMM_HX_NEXT_DUE_DT: The date on which the administered immunization is due next.  , if in a series. This is manually established by the user, and not automatically calculated.
IMMUNE_HISTORY.IMM_HX_EXP_DATE: The date on which the immunization administered expires.
IMMUNE_HISTORY.IMMNZTN_HX_GIVEN_ID: The unique ID of the user in the EMP master file that is listed in the clinical system as actually administering the  immunization to the patient.
IMMUNE_HISTORY.IMMNZTN_HX_GIVEN_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
IMMUNE_HISTORY.IMMNZTN_HX_EXT_AD_C_NAME: The category number for the source of verification of external administration of immunization.
IMMUNE_HISTORY.IMM_HX_ANSWER_ID: The unique ID in the questionnaire answers (HQA) master file that is associated with the immunization administered.
IMMUNE_HISTORY.IMMNZTN_HX_VIS_DATE: The free text date field associated with the immunization where VIS (Vaccine Information Statements) date is stored.
IMMUNE_HISTORY.IMMNZTN_HX_DEFER_C_NAME: The category number for the reason for deferring the immunization, e.g. patient refused, contraindication, etc.
IMMUNE_HISTORY.IMMNZTN_HX_COMMENT: The free text comments associated with the immunization administered.
IMMUNE_HISTORY.IMMNZTN_HX_ENTRY_ID: The unique ID of the user  in the EMP masterfile associated with the person who entered the immunization administration information into the clinical system.
IMMUNE_HISTORY.IMMNZTN_HX_ENTRY_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
IMMUNE_HISTORY.PHYSICAL_SITE_HX: The physical site information for the immunization administered such as a specific hospital.
IMMUNE_HISTORY.IMM_HX_HIST_ADMI_YN: Indicates whether or not an immunization is historical or not.
IMMUNE_HISTORY.IMMNZTN_HX_ENT_DATE: The date on which the immunization was entered into the system.
IMMUNE_HISTORY.IMMNZTN_HX_STATUS_C_NAME: The category number for the immunization status. Examples are "Given" if the immunization has been administered, "Deleted" if the immunization has been deleted from the administration history, "Incomplete" if the item has been ordered but not administered and a status of "Deferred" if the immunization has been deferred.
IMMUNE_HISTORY.IMM_HX_MAR_ADMIN_LI: The immunization history MAR administration line.
IMMUNE_HISTORY.IMM_CHRG_REC_HX_ID: The unique ID in the Universal Charge Line (UCL) master file that is associated with the immunization administered.
IMMUNE_HISTORY.IMMNZTN_HX_ENC_CSN: This column stores the history information of immunization CSN whenever an edit was made on the Immunization.
IMMUNE_HISTORY.IMMNZTN_HX_DOSE_AMT: The history of dosage amount for the immunization administered.
IMMUNE_HISTORY.IMMNZTN_HX_DOSE_UNIT_C_NAME: The history of dosage unit for the immunization administered.
IMMUNE_HISTORY.IMM_HX_DUALSIGN_ID: History of the users who performed the second user verification on the immunization
IMMUNE_HISTORY.IMM_HX_DUALSIGN_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
