IMMUNE_HISTORY.IMM_HX_DUALSIGNINST_DTTM: History of instant at which the immunization was verified by the second user.
IMMUNE_HISTORY.IMM_HX_SCAN_BARCODE: The history of raw data captured during immunization barcode scanning.
IMMUNE_HISTORY.IMMZTN_HX_ENTRY_DTTM: Contains the date and time that the data in the row was entered. If the exact time is not known, a date may be contained in IMMNZTN_HX_ENT_DATE instead.
IMMUNE_HISTORY.IMM_HX_PRODUCT_C_NAME: The brand name associated with the vaccination administration in previous edits to the record, stored as a category value from a defined set of products. Historical version of IMM PRODUCT - CATEGORY (I LPL 4007).
IMMUNE_HISTORY.IMM_HX_DEFER_DUR_C_NAME: Each category value represents a different time scale of deferral for a vaccine administration deferral (e.g. "brief", "permanent", etc...) that was associated with the vaccine deferral at the time of a previous edit to the record. This item does NOT store the specific length of time the vaccine was deferred. This is the historical version of IMM DEFERRAL DURATION (I LPL 4077).
IMMUNE_HISTORY.IMM_HX_MAR_AD_LK_ID: Link to the INP record that may hold the administrations data - Historical.
IMMUNE_HISTORY.IMM_HX_LOT_NUM_ID: The history of lot(LOT) record Id for the immunization adminstered.

IMM_ADMIN._TABLE_: The IMM_ADMIN table contains information about the immunization administered. The rows included in this table are items from DXR (Document) masterfile which include information on type of immunization, administration date, administered dose, administration route, administration site, immunization manufacturer, immunization lot number, administered by, visit date, deferral reason, administration notes, administration location, administration status, administered amount, administered unit, contact serial number of the DXR record that owns the immunization instance and a unique reference identifier to identify a specific instance of an immunization.
IMM_ADMIN.DOCUMENT_ID: The unique identifier for the document record.
IMM_ADMIN.CONTACT_DATE_REAL: A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
IMM_ADMIN.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.
IMM_ADMIN.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
IMM_ADMIN.IMM_TYPE_FREE_TEXT: The immunization type information for the administered immunization as free text.
IMM_ADMIN.IMM_ROUTE_C_NAME: The immunization administration route category ID.
IMM_ADMIN.IMM_ROUTE_FREE_TXT: The immunization route information for the administered immunization as free text.
IMM_ADMIN.IMM_SITE_C_NAME: The immunization administration site category ID.
IMM_ADMIN.IMM_SITE_FREE_TXT: The immunization site information for the administered immunization as free text.
IMM_ADMIN.IMM_MANUFACTURER_C_NAME: The immunization administered manufacturer category ID.
IMM_ADMIN.IMM_MANUF_FREE_TEXT: The immunization manufacturer information for the administered immunization as free text.
IMM_ADMIN.IMM_GIVEN_BY_ID: The immunization administering user ID. This column is frequently used to link to the table CLARITY_EMP.
IMM_ADMIN.IMM_GIVEN_BY_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
IMM_ADMIN.IMM_GIVEN_BY_FT: The immunization given by information for the administered immunization as free text.
IMM_ADMIN.IMM_VIS_PUB_DATE: The immunization visit date presented to patient for the administered immunization.
IMM_ADMIN.IMM_VIS_DATE: The immunization visit date for the administered immunization.
IMM_ADMIN.IMM_DEF_RSN_FREE_TX: The immunization administration deferral reason as free text.
IMM_ADMIN.IMM_DEF_REASON_C_NAME: The immunization administration deferral reason category ID.
IMM_ADMIN.IMM_NOTES_RAW_DATA: Free text immunization notes from the immunization administration.
IMM_ADMIN.IMM_SRC_DXR_CSN: The contact serial number of the received document record that owns the instance of this immunization.
IMM_ADMIN.IMM_REFERENCE_ID: This item stores a unique reference identifier to identify a specific instance of an immunization.
IMM_ADMIN.IMM_SCHED_ID_FT: Immunization schedule ID used for the administered vaccination.
IMM_ADMIN.IMM_SCHED_NAME_FT: Immunization schedule name used for the administered vaccination.
IMM_ADMIN.IMM_SCHED_CODING_FT: Immunization schedule coding system used for the administered vaccination.
IMM_ADMIN.IMM_SCHED_VALID_YN: Whether or not the administered dose was valid for the given schedule.
IMM_ADMIN.IMM_VALID_RSN_C_NAME: Description of why the given administration is valid or invalid based on its immunization schedule.
IMM_ADMIN.IMM_VALID_RSN_FT: Description of why the given administration is valid or invalid based on its immunization schedule.
IMM_ADMIN.IMM_LST_UPD_INST_DTTM: Stores the last update instant of the immunization in UTC.
IMM_ADMIN.IMMNZTN_SRC_APPL_C_NAME: If this immunization is patient-entered, this item stores the application the patient used to edit the immunization for the contact (MyChart or Welcome). If this item is blank, it is assumed that the patient edited the immunization in MyChart.
IMM_ADMIN.IMMNZTN_SRC_WPR_ID: Stores the WPR ID of the MyChart user who edited the immunization for the contact.
IMM_ADMIN.IMM_EVENT_IDENT: This item stores the ID of the event that is associated with an immunization. In cases where there are multiple encounters that link to an immunization, the earliest encounter is represented here.
IMM_ADMIN.IMM_FUNDING_SOURCE_C_NAME: The category ID for the funding source of the administered vaccine.
IMM_ADMIN.IMM_VFC_ELIGIBILITY_STATUS_C_NAME: The category ID of the funding program that should pay for an administered vaccine.
IMM_ADMIN.IMM_DEFER_DUR_C_NAME: The vaccine administration deferral duration category ID for the vaccine administration in the received document.
IMM_ADMIN.IMM_PRODUCT_C_NAME: The vaccine administration brand name category ID for the vaccine administration in the received document.
IMM_ADMIN.IMM_PRODUCT_FT: The vaccine administration brand name for the vaccine administration in the received document.
IMM_ADMIN.IMM_EXT_ADMIN_C_NAME: The source of information category ID for the vaccine administration in the received document.
IMM_ADMIN.IMM_FILTER_RSN_C_NAME: Stores the reason why an external immunization should be filtered from the composite record
IMM_ADMIN.IMM_EXTERNAL_IDENTIFIER: External ID of the immunization record.
IMM_ADMIN.IMM_GENERATED_SERIAL_NUM: This item stores the serial number that is generated when receiving the document.

IMM_ADMIN_COMPONENTS._TABLE_: The IMM_ADMIN_COMPONENTS table contains information about the components of the immunization administered. The rows included in this table are items from DXR (Document) masterfile which include information on type of immunization, dose validity, immunization schedule, and a unique reference identifier to identify a specific instance of an immunization.
IMM_ADMIN_COMPONENTS.DOCUMENT_ID: The unique identifier for the document record.
IMM_ADMIN_COMPONENTS.CONTACT_DATE_REAL: A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
IMM_ADMIN_COMPONENTS.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.
IMM_ADMIN_COMPONENTS.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
IMM_ADMIN_COMPONENTS.IMM_COMP_ID: The unique identifier for the immunization component.
IMM_ADMIN_COMPONENTS.IMM_REFERENCE_ID: The unique reference identifier for the specific instance of an immunization that the component is part of.
IMM_ADMIN_COMPONENTS.IMM_COMP_GROUP_ID: The unique ID of the vaccine group for an immunization administration received from an external system. This can be either the component or the family of a vaccine.
IMM_ADMIN_COMPONENTS.IMM_COMP_GROUP_FT: The free text value for a vaccine group for an immunization administration received from an external system. This can be either the component or the family of a vaccine.
IMM_ADMIN_COMPONENTS.IMM_COMP_SCHED_ID_FT: The immunization schedule identifier used for the administered vaccination component.
IMM_ADMIN_COMPONENTS.IMM_COMP_SCHED_NAME_FT: The immunization schedule name used for the administered vaccination component.
IMM_ADMIN_COMPONENTS.IMM_COMP_SCHED_CODING_FT: The immunization schedule coding system used for the administered vaccination component.
IMM_ADMIN_COMPONENTS.IMM_COMP_SCHED_VALID_YN: Whether or not the administered component dose was valid for the given schedule
IMM_ADMIN_COMPONENTS.IMM_COMP_VALID_RSN_C_NAME: The description of why the given administration component is valid or invalid based on its immunization schedule.
IMM_ADMIN_COMPONENTS.IMM_COMP_VALID_RSN_FT: The free text description of why the given administration component is valid or invalid based on its immunization schedule.
IMM_ADMIN_COMPONENTS.IMM_COMP_SCHED_DOSE_NUM: Dose number for this component in the immunization series.

IMM_ADMIN_GROUPS._TABLE_: This table extracts the related multiple response Vaccine Group (I DXR 4220) item.
IMM_ADMIN_GROUPS.DOCUMENT_ID: The unique identifier (.1 item) for the document record.
IMM_ADMIN_GROUPS.CONTACT_DATE_REAL: A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
IMM_ADMIN_GROUPS.GROUP_LINE: The line number for the information associated with this contact.
IMM_ADMIN_GROUPS.VALUE_LINE: The line number of one of the multiple values associated with a specific group of data within this contact.
IMM_ADMIN_GROUPS.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
IMM_ADMIN_GROUPS.IMM_GROUPS_ID: Stores the discrete value for a vaccine group for an immunization administration received from an external system. This can be either the component or the family of a vaccine. The corresponding free-text value received from registry is stored in DXR 4221.

IMM_DUE._TABLE_: The IMM_DUE table contains information about when an immunization is due. The rows included in this table are items from DXR (Document) masterfile which include information on type of immunization, due date, earliest date and next dose number for the due immunization.
IMM_DUE.DOCUMENT_ID: The unique identifier for the document record.
IMM_DUE.CONTACT_DATE_REAL: A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
IMM_DUE.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.
IMM_DUE.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
IMM_DUE.IMM_DUE_TYPE_ID: The type ID of immunization that is due. This column is frequently used to link to the table CLARITY_IMMUNZATN.
IMM_DUE.IMM_DUE_TYPE_FT: The free text description of the type of immunization that is due.
IMM_DUE.IMM_DUE_DUE_DATE: The due date for immunization that is due.
IMM_DUE.IMM_DUE_EARLIEST_DT: The earliest date of immunization that is due.
IMM_DUE.IMM_DUE_NEXT_DOSE: The next dose number of immunization that is due.
IMM_DUE.IMM_DUE_SCHED_ID_FT: Immunization schedule ID used for the recommended vaccination.
IMM_DUE.IMM_DUE_SCHED_NM_FT: Immunization schedule name used for the recommended vaccination.
IMM_DUE.IMM_DUE_SCHED_CD_FT: Immunization schedule coding system used for the recommended vaccination.

PAT_IMMUNIZATIONS._TABLE_: This table stores a list of patients' immunizations that can be linked to the immunizations (LPL) table, IMMUNE.
PAT_IMMUNIZATIONS.PAT_ID: The unique system identifier of the patient record.
PAT_IMMUNIZATIONS.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
PAT_IMMUNIZATIONS.IMMUNE_ID: The unique ID of the immunization record.

IMM_ADMIN_COMPONENTS.IMM_COMP_VALID_RSN_FT: The client's age and vaccination history allowed for certain doses in the series to be skipped.

title: Medications: ORDER_MED (splits) + children → medications
description: Medication orders with sig, dose, route, pharmacy, diagnoses

DUPMED_DISMISS_HH_INFO._TABLE_: This table stores data related to duplicate medications on the Home Health Remote Client.
DUPMED_DISMISS_HH_INFO.ORDER_ID: The unique identifier for the order record.
DUPMED_DISMISS_HH_INFO.DUPMED_DISMISS_EMP_ID: This item stores the user who dismissed the duplicate medication warning that the Remote Client showed after the medication was added.
DUPMED_DISMISS_HH_INFO.DUPMED_DISMISS_EMP_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
DUPMED_DISMISS_HH_INFO.DUPMED_DISMISS_CSN: This item stores the patient contact serial number (CSN) associated with the update which dismissed the duplicate warning for this order on the Remote Client.
DUPMED_DISMISS_HH_INFO.DUPMED_DISMISS_UTC_DTTM: This item stores the instant when the Remote Client was synchronized after the duplicate warning for this order was dismissed.

MEDS_REV_HX._TABLE_:
This table lists all of the times that a user reviewed a patient's medication list. 





The list of medications current at each review instance is in the MEDS_REV_HX_LIST table.





Reviewing user and other information about the most recent review of medications is in the PATIENT table in columns MEDS_LAST_REV_TM, MEDS_LST_REV_USR_ID, and MEDS_LAST_REV_CSN.





The list of medications at the most recent review instance is in the MEDS_REV_LAST_LIST table.
MEDS_REV_HX.PAT_ID: The unique ID of the patient record for this row.
MEDS_REV_HX.LINE_COUNT: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
MEDS_REV_HX.MEDS_HX_REV_INSTANT: The date and time that the patient's medication list was marked as reviewed.
MEDS_REV_HX.MEDS_HX_REV_USER_ID: The unique ID associated with the user that marked the patient's medication list as reviewed.
MEDS_REV_HX.MEDS_HX_REV_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
MEDS_REV_HX.MEDS_HX_REV_CSN: The unique contact serial number of the contact in which the patient's medication list was reviewed. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
MEDS_REV_HX.MEDS_HX_REV_COUNT: Count of how many meds are found in the medication history review list (I EPT 17229).

ORDER_DX_MED._TABLE_: The ORDER_DX_MED table enables you to report on the diagnoses associated with medications ordered in clinical system (prescriptions). Since one medication order may be associated with multiple diagnoses, each row in this table is one medication - diagnosis relation. We have also included patient and contact identification information for each record. Note that system settings may or may not require that medications be associated with diagnoses.  This table contains only information for those medications and diagnoses that have been explicitly associated.  Check with your clinical system Application Administrator to determine how your organization has this set up.
ORDER_DX_MED.ORDER_MED_ID: The unique ID of the medication order (prescription) record.
ORDER_DX_MED.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.
ORDER_DX_MED.PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL: A unique, internal contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of the contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
ORDER_DX_MED.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
ORDER_DX_MED.DX_ID: The unique ID of the diagnosis record associated with the medication order.
ORDER_DX_MED.DX_QUALIFIER_C_NAME: The category ID of the qualifier associated with the diagnosis.
ORDER_DX_MED.DX_CHRONIC_YN: Indicates whether the associated diagnosis is chronic.
ORDER_DX_MED.COMMENTS: Free text comments added when the prescription was ordered or discontinued.

ORDER_MED._TABLE_: The ORDER_MED table enables you to report on medications ordered in EpicCare (prescriptions). We have also included patient and contact identification information for each record.
ORDER_MED.ORDER_MED_ID: The unique ID of the order record associated with this medication order. This is an internal unique identifier for ORD master file records in this table and cannot be used to link to CLARITY_MEDICATION.
ORDER_MED.PAT_ID: The unique ID of the patient record for this line. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.
ORDER_MED.PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL: A unique, internal contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of the contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
ORDER_MED.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number (CSN) for the patient contact associated with this medication order. This number is unique across patients and encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
ORDER_MED.ORDERING_DATE: The date when the medication order was placed.
ORDER_MED.ORDER_CLASS_C_NAME: The category number for the order class. This value is used to define how clinical systems process the order.
ORDER_MED.PHARMACY_ID: The unique ID of the pharmacy record that is associated with this medication order. This column is frequently used to link to the RX_PHR table. This field is only populated if the clinical system user selects a specific pharmacy from the  list, otherwise the field is null. This field is only populated by the ambulatory clinical system, not the pharmacy system.
ORDER_MED.ORD_CREATR_USER_ID: The EMP ID (.1) of the user who signed the order (for a non-signed and held order) or the last person who performed a sign and hold or release action for a signed and held order.
ORDER_MED.ORD_CREATR_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_MED.MEDICATION_ID: The unique ID of the medication record that is associated with this order. In some circumstances, for example when Intelligent Medication Selection selects an IMS mixture, this column may contain template records that do not represent real medications. For this reason, it is recommended to use the Clarity column ORDER_MEDINFO.DISPENSABLE_MED_ID when reporting on medication orders.
ORDER_MED.DESCRIPTION: The description of the order. This information is found in the Order field of clinical system�s Order Detail window.
ORDER_MED.DOSAGE: The dispensation amount for the prescription entered by the user in the orders activity. This amount is stored as a string in the orders database.
ORDER_MED.QUANTITY: The quantity of the prescription being dispensed as entered by the user.
ORDER_MED.REFILLS: The number of refills allowed for this prescription as entered by the user.
ORDER_MED.START_DATE: The date when the medication order started. The date appears in calendar format.
ORDER_MED.END_DATE: The date when the medication order is to end.
ORDER_MED.DISP_AS_WRITTEN_YN: Indicates whether or not the prescription should be dispensed as written for this medication.
ORDER_MED.RSN_FOR_DISCON_C_NAME: The category number for the reason a prescription has been discontinued.  This column contains data only in prescription orders that have been discontinued.
ORDER_MED.MED_PRESC_PROV_ID: The unique ID of the provider who has prescribed or authorized the medication order. The value in this column matches the value in the AUTHRZING_PROV_ID column.
ORDER_MED.NONFRM_XCPT_CD_C_NAME: The category number for medication's exception code.  This code explains the reason a non-formulary medication was ordered.
ORDER_MED.PANEL_MED_ID: The unique ID of the medication panel that is associated with this medication order. This column is only populated if the medication order was originally placed as part of a panel.
ORDER_MED.UPDATE_DATE: The date and time when this row was created or last updated in Clarity.
ORDER_MED.ORDER_INST: The date and time the order was placed. The date appears in calendar format.
ORDER_MED.DISPLAY_NAME: The name of the medication as it appears on the medication record itself.
ORDER_MED.AS_MEDICATION_ID: The unique ID of the brand name medication originally chosen by the ordering user. This column is blank if the user did not chose a brand name record.  It is recommended to use the Clarity column ORDER_MEDINFO.DISPENSABLE_MED_ID when reporting on medication orders. Use AS_MEDICATION_ID if specifically searching for orders that were originally selected from a preference list as a brand name medication.
ORDER_MED.HV_HOSPITALIST_YN: Indicates whether  this is a hospitalist order. A Y indicates a hospitalist order.
ORDER_MED.ORDER_PRIORITY_C_NAME: The category number for the priority assigned to an order.
ORDER_MED.MED_ROUTE_C_NAME: The category number for the route of administration of a medication.
ORDER_MED.DISCON_USER_ID: The unique ID of the user who discontinued the order.
ORDER_MED.DISCON_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_MED.DISCON_TIME: The date and time when the medication order was discontinued. The date appears in calendar format.
ORDER_MED.CHNG_ORDER_MED_ID: The unique ID of the changed or reordered medication order that this order replaced. This column is frequently used to link back to the ORDER_MED table.
ORDER_MED.PEND_APPR_USER_ID: The unique ID of the user who approved a pended order.
ORDER_MED.PEND_APPR_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_MED.PEND_REF_REAS_C_NAME: The category number for the reason a pended medication was refused.
ORDER_MED.HV_DISCR_FREQ_ID: The unique ID of the discrete frequency record associated with this medication order. This column is frequently used to link to the IP_FREQUENCY table.
ORDER_MED.HV_DISCR_FREQ_ID_FREQ_NAME: The name of the frequency record.
ORDER_MED.HV_DISCRETE_DOSE: The discrete dose for a medication as entered by the user in the orders activity.
ORDER_MED.HV_DOSE_UNIT_C_NAME: The category number for the dosage unit of a medication.
ORDER_MED.HV_IS_SELF_ADM_YN: Indicates whether this medication was self-administered. A Y indicates that the order was self-administered.
ORDER_MED.ORDER_START_TIME: The date and time when the medication order is to start. The date appears in calendar format.
ORDER_MED.ORDER_END_TIME: The date and time when the medication order is scheduled to end. The date appears in calendar format.
ORDER_MED.NON_FORMULARY_YN: Indicates whether this medication is not on the formulary. A Y indicates a non-formulary medication.
ORDER_MED.ORDER_STATUS_C_NAME: The category number for the current status of an order.
ORDER_MED.AUTHRZING_PROV_ID: The unique ID of the provider who has prescribed or authorized the medication order. The value in this column matches the value in the MED_PRESC_PROV_ID column.
ORDER_MED.ORD_PROV_ID: The unique ID of the provider listed as the ordering provider.
ORDER_MED.MIN_DISCRETE_DOSE: The minimum ordered dose amount for the medication as specified by the user in the orders activity.
ORDER_MED.MAX_DISCRETE_DOSE: The maximum ordered dose amount for the medication as specified by the user in the orders activity.
ORDER_MED.DOSE_UNIT_C_NAME: The category number for the dose unit of a medication.
ORDER_MED.IS_PENDING_ORD_YN: Indicates whether the order has a pending status. A Y indicates that the order does have a pending status.
ORDER_MED.BULK_DISP_YN: Indicates whether this is a bulk dispense order. A Y indicates this is a bulk dispense order.
ORDER_MED.PROVIDER_TYPE_C_NAME: The medication provider type category number for the order.  This item distinguishes between authorizing and documenting provider types for historical and non-historical medications.  If the medication was ordered as historical, the provider is considered the documenting provider and is reflected as such in this item.  If the medication was not ordered as historical, the provider is considered the authorizing provider is reflected in this item as such.
ORDER_MED.MODIFY_TRACK_C_NAME: The category number for the flag that both indicates and distinguishes whether an order was reordered or modified.
ORDER_MED.SPECIFIED_FIRST_TM: If the order was placed with a Specified frequency (the frequency's Type (I EFQ 50) item has a value of 1) and the user specified a first occurrence time, the time specified is stored in this column.
ORDER_MED.SCHED_START_TM: The date and time at which an order was scheduled to begin. The date appears in calendar format.
ORDER_MED.ACT_ORDER_C_NAME: The category number indicating additional information about an order's status--Active, Completed, Discontinued, or Cancelled. An active order is any order that has not been completed, discontinued, cancelled, pended, or signed and held.
ORDER_MED.EXP_AFT_START_DATE: The number of days after the start date that the medication order will expire based on the setting in the medication record. The date appears in calendar format.
ORDER_MED.EXP_BEF_END_DATE: The number of days before the end date that the medication order will expire based on the setting in the medication record. The date appears in calendar format.
ORDER_MED.MED_COMMENTS: Comments for a medication order, as entered by the ordering user when entering the order.
ORDER_MED.USER_SEL_MED_ID: The unique ID of the orderable medication that is evaluated for Intelligent Medication Selection (IMS). This item is blank if the order is not evaluated for IMS.  It is recommended to use the Clarity column ORDER_MEDINFO.DISPENSABLE_MED_ID when reporting on medication orders. Use USER_SEL_MED_ID if searching for medication orders that were evaluated by IMS.
ORDER_MED.USER_SEL_ERX_DAT: The date that the medication record was actually selected by the user.  This item is populated only if Intelligent Medication Selection (IMS) replaced the original user-selected medication with another medication record.
ORDER_MED.REQ_RNVERIFY_YN: Indicates whether this medication order requires RN verification before it is administered. A Y indicates that it does require RN verification.
ORDER_MED.MDL_ID: The unique ID of the medication problem list record that is associated with this medication order. This column is frequently used to link to the MDL_MD_PRBLM_LIST table.
ORDER_MED.LASTDOSE: Comments for the last administered dose of a medication entered in the medication documentation navigator section.
ORDER_MED.INFORMANT_C_NAME: The category number for the informant of a prior to admission (PTA) medication.  The informant is the person who reports a PTA medication being taken by the patient.
ORDER_MED.AMB_MED_DISP_NAME: The name of the ambulatory medication.
ORDER_MED.WEIGHT_BASED_YN: Indicates whether the dose for this medication order is based on the patient's weight.
ORDER_MED.WEIGHT_REVIEW_YN: Indicates whether or not the patient's weight needs to be reviewed for this medication order due to the patient's weight change.
ORDER_MED.ORD_TM_WEIGHT: The patient's last reviewed weight at the time the medication was ordered.
ORDER_MED.ORDER_TIME_WT_INST: The date and time when a new weight is recorded for a patient for a weight based medication review.
ORDER_MED.REVIEW_WEIGHT: The patient's last non-reviewed weight at the time the medication was ordered.
ORDER_MED.REVIEW_WEIGHT_INST: The instant when the patient's last non-reviewed weight was entered prior to when the medication was ordered.
ORDER_MED.REFILLS_REMAINING: The number of refills remaining in the medication.
ORDER_MED.MED_REFILL_PROV_ID: The unique ID of the provider who authorized the medication refill order.
ORDER_MED.OLD_ORDER_ID: The unique ID of the order record that points to the parent medication for refills.
ORDER_MED.OLD_ORDER_DAT: The internal contact date of the parent medication in integer format.  Used to identify the parent medication and will only be populated for child orders.  This does not link to CONTACT_DATE_REAL.
ORDER_MED.RESUME_STATUS_C_NAME: The category number that indicates an outpatient medication order's status before it was suspended as a result on inpatient admission.
ORDER_MED.USER_ID_OF_PROV: The unique ID of the user record that is linked to the provider ID in the AUTHRZING_PROV_ID column.
ORDER_MED.ORDERING_MODE_C_NAME: The category number for the ordering mode of the order (i.e. Outpatient, Inpatient).  Note that Outpatient orders can be placed from an Inpatient encounter as discharge orders / take-home prescriptions.  This column might be blank for Outpatient orders placed prior to the creation of the IP module.
ORDER_MED.PEND_APPROVE_FLAG_C_NAME: The pending medication approval status category number for the order.
ORDER_MED.NF_POST_VERIF_YN: Indicates whether a medication order has been verified by the pharmacist as non-formulary. A Y indicates that the pharmacist verified the medication order as non-formulary. An administrator can use this column to report on how many orders that were placed as non-formulary were also verified as such. To find which orders were placed as non-formulary, use the NON_FORMULARY_YN column.
ORDER_MED.EXT_COPAY_ID: This column contains the external copay ID for an order.
ORDER_MED.USR_SEL_IMS_YN: This item stores whether the product to use with IMS was selected by the user or chosen automatically.  Yes means the user chose the product, No means the product was selected automatically.
ORDER_MED.INDICATION_COMMENTS: The comment entered for the indications of use for this order.
ORDER_MED.DOSE_ADJ_TYPE_C_NAME: The type of dose adjustment that was triggered by the order (i.e. maximum or minimum dose).
ORDER_MED.DOSE_ADJ_OVERRID_YN: This item indicates whether the dose adjustment (i.e. maximum or minimum dose) was overridden.
ORDER_MED.MAX_DOSE: The maximum allowed dose for this medication order.
ORDER_MED.MAX_DOSE_UNIT_C_NAME: The unit for the maximum allowed dose for this medication order.
ORDER_MED.PRN_COMMENT: The user-entered comments for why the as needed (PRN) medication should be administered.
ORDER_MED.INST_OF_UPDATE_TM: The day and time the order record was last updated.
ORDER_MED.PEND_ACTION_C_NAME: The manner in which the medication was reordered, such as reorder from order review or reorder from the medications activity.
ORDER_MED.MED_DIS_DISP_QTY: This item stores the discrete dispense quantity when discrete dispense is enabled.
ORDER_MED.MED_DIS_DISP_UNIT_C_NAME: This item stores the discrete dispense unit when discrete dispense is enabled.
ORDER_MED.END_BEFORE_CMP_INST: The default end date and time of a completed order.  When an order is completed, we will store the system calculated end date and time (which may differ from the actual completion time) in this column in the event the completion is reversed and the defaults need to be restored.
ORDER_MED.BSA_BASED_YN: Indicates whether the dose for this medication order is based on the patient's body surface area (BSA).
ORDER_MED.BSA_REVIEW_YN: Flags orders that need to be reviewed because of a BSA change.
ORDER_MED.ORD_TM_BSA: The patient's last reviewed BSA at the time this order was placed.
ORDER_MED.REVIEW_BSA: The patient's last non-reviewed body surface areas (BSA) at the time the medication was ordered.
ORDER_MED.LAST_DOSE_TIME: Store the time that a PTA med was last taken.

ORDER_MEDINFO._TABLE_: The ORDER_MEDINFO table is an addendum table for ORDER_MED and enables you to report on detail medication information for each order in clinical system (prescriptions). We have also included patient and contact identification information for each record.
ORDER_MEDINFO.ORDER_MED_ID: The unique ID of the medication order (prescription) record.
ORDER_MEDINFO.MED_LINKED_PROC_ID: The linked procedure ID for the medication.  Depending on pharmacy billing configuration, you may have only one procedure ID (code) for all medications or many.
ORDER_MEDINFO.MED_CNCT_DAT_REAL: The real medication contact date (DAT) used in this order.
ORDER_MEDINFO.LAST_ADMIN_INST: The last instant that the medication order is administrated in the Medication Administration Record (MAR).
ORDER_MEDINFO.NUMBER_OF_DOSES: The total number of doses of the medication order that should be given to the patient.
ORDER_MEDINFO.DOSES_REMAINING: The total number of the medication order which has not been given to patient.
ORDER_MEDINFO.VOLUME_UNIT_C_NAME: The volume unit of measure associated with the order.
ORDER_MEDINFO.CALC_VOLUME_YN: Indicate if the volume is calculated.  "Y" means the volume is calculated. "N" means the volume is not calculated.  Default is "Y".
ORDER_MEDINFO.MEDICATION_ID: The ID of the medication prescribed for the patient.
ORDER_MEDINFO.PAT_SUPP_MED_YN: Indicates if the medication is patient-supplied.  'N' indicates the med is not supplied by the patient. 'Y' indicates the medication is supplied by the patient.
ORDER_MEDINFO.PAT_SUPP_DOSES: Specifies the number of doses the patient supplies if the medication is patient supplied.
ORDER_MEDINFO.CALC_DOSE_UNIT_C_NAME: The dose unit for calculated administer dose.
ORDER_MEDINFO.CALC_DOSE_INFO: The calculation steps to get calculated administer dose from the ordered dose.
ORDER_MEDINFO.ADMIN_DOSE_UNIT_C_NAME: The dose unit for administer dose.
ORDER_MEDINFO.DONOT_DISP_YN: Indicate if the medication is not dispensed.  'N' indicates the medication is dispensed. 'Y' indicates the medication is not dispensed.
ORDER_MEDINFO.DONOT_DISP_DOSE: It is to specify the number of doses which will not be dispensed if the DONOT_DISP_YN column is 'Y' for Yes.
ORDER_MEDINFO.PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL: This is a numeric representation of the date of this encounter in your system. The integer portion of the number specifies the date of the encounter. The digits after the decimal point indicate multiple visits on one day.
ORDER_MEDINFO.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
ORDER_MEDINFO.ORDERING_DATE: The date the order was placed  in calendar format.
ORDER_MEDINFO.ORDER_CLASS_C_NAME: The order class category ID for the prescription, used to determine how the clinical system processes the order.
ORDER_MEDINFO.CONC_NAME_C_NAME: The concentration of this order (used only for fixed ratio mixture orders).
ORDER_MEDINFO.LET_EXPIRE_USER_ID: The ID of the user who marked order as Let Expire.
ORDER_MEDINFO.LET_EXPIRE_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_MEDINFO.TIME_LET_EXPIRE: The time when the physician marked the order as Let Expire.
ORDER_MEDINFO.EXP_AFT_START_TIME: The date and time the order will expire, based on the amount of time a physician entered for the order to expire after the start time.
ORDER_MEDINFO.EXP_BEF_END_TIME: The date and time the order will expire, based on the amount of time a physician entered for the order to expire before the end time.
ORDER_MEDINFO.ORD_COPIED_C_NAME: The order copy status: If the order has been copied to another encounter or not.
ORDER_MEDINFO.ORDER_SOURCE_C_NAME: Where in the system the order was placed from.
ORDER_MEDINFO.DFLT_DISCRETE_FREQ_NAME: A flag to indicate if this order should default discrete ambulatory medication frequency information.
ORDER_MEDINFO.DFLT_DISCRETE_DOSE_NAME: A flag to indicate if this order should default discrete ambulatory medication dose information.
ORDER_MEDINFO.REV_ORD_GRANU_YN: Determines if an order is reviewed by day or by instant
ORDER_MEDINFO.EXP_DAYS_YN: Determines if an expiring order is by days or by instant
ORDER_MEDINFO.MED_CONTACT_DT: This is the order contact date in human readable form.
ORDER_MEDINFO.DOSE_CALC_WARNING: Contains the dose warning generated when the order was entered or verified.
ORDER_MEDINFO.MIXTURE_TYPE_C_NAME: Specifies the mixture type if the medication order is a mixture. This column will be empty if the medication is not a mixture.
ORDER_MEDINFO.TPN_SITE_C_NAME: The total parenteral nutrition (TPN) infusion site.
ORDER_MEDINFO.DISP_INDIV_YN: Indicate if the ingredients are dispensed individually. 'N' indicates the ingredients are dispensed together. 'Y' indicates the ingredients are dispensed individually.
ORDER_MEDINFO.MR_IS_PERSISTENT_YN: Indicates whether this order is set to persist after the encounter is closed. Yes indicates the order will not be discontinued; No or blank indicates it will be discontinued.
ORDER_MEDINFO.MAR_ADMIN_TYPE_C_NAME: Used for performance to determine the administration type of the order.  This gets set once the order has been administered.
ORDER_MEDINFO.ORD_COMP_YN: This item determines whether an order is completed or not.
ORDER_MEDINFO.RATE_CALC_WARNING: Contains the rate warning generated when the order was entered or verified.
ORDER_MEDINFO.DFLT_DISCRETE_C_NAME: A flag to indicate if this order�should default discrete ambulatory medication information.
ORDER_MEDINFO.PT_SIG_SMARTTEXT_ID: The unique identifier of the SmartText record used to generate medication instructions for the patient based on order details. A SmartText record is a text template that can contain text and dynamic data.
ORDER_MEDINFO.PT_SIG_SMARTTEXT_ID_SMARTTEXT_NAME: The name of the SmartText record.
ORDER_MEDINFO.DISPENSABLE_MED_ID: This is the unique ID of the medication that is the order's dispensable product. This column is frequently used to link to the CLARITY_MEDICATION table.  We recommend using this column in place of other similar columns to report on medication orders. Other columns that contain a medication ID in ORDER_MED and its addendum tables can contain orderable records or templates that do not represent real medications.  When Intelligent Medication Selection (IMS) runs for an order, this column will choose the medication record evaluated for IMS rather than the IMS mixture template.
ORDER_MEDINFO.TIMELY_THRESHOLD: Number of minutes between the scheduled time for an administration and the actual time given before the administration is considered Late/Early. This is a calculated value specific to each order, derived from settings in the ordered medication, ordered frequency, and System Definitions.
ORDER_MEDINFO.IS_FAM_YN: Indicates whether this order is ordered as a Facility-Administered Medication (FAM). 1 indicates the order is a FAM and will not be discontinued on closing the encounter; 0 or blank indicates it will be discontinued.
ORDER_MEDINFO.ONE_STEP_MED_YN: Indicates whether the order is a one-step medication, a medication whose administration is documented in one step.
ORDER_MEDINFO.PRIOR_AUTH_STATUS_C_NAME: Contains the authorization status of the order when it is released from a treatment plan.
ORDER_MEDINFO.REFERRAL_AUTH_STATUS_C_NAME: The referral status category ID of the order record when it is activated.
ORDER_MEDINFO.RECIPE_AMOUNT: The recipe quantity amount for a ratio-based mixture medication (a medication which consists of a drug diluted in a base at a fixed concentration).
ORDER_MEDINFO.RECIPE_UNIT_C_NAME: The med & dose unit category ID for the recipe quantity for a ratio-based mixture medication.
ORDER_MEDINFO.ADMIN_INSTRUCTIONS_CHANGE_DTTM: Tracks the instant when the administration instructions were changed from their system default.
ORDER_MEDINFO.ADDL_DUES_REMAINING: The count of due times that need to be accounted for before the order can be considered complete, in addition to those that represent ordered due times.
ORDER_MEDINFO.HAS_COMPONENT_DATA_C_NAME: The category ID for whether this order has any nutritional component data.

ORDER_MED_2._TABLE_:
This table enables you to report on medications ordered in EpicCare or Ambulatory Pharmacy (Prescriptions).





This table should be used with ORDER_MED.
ORDER_MED_2.ORDER_ID: The unique ID of the order record associated with this medication order. This is an internal unique identifier for order records in this table and cannot be used to link to CLARITY_MEDICATION.
ORDER_MED_2.TXT_AUTHPROV_NAME: In ambulatory pharmacy, a prescription order could be authorized by a non-EpicCare provider. There is no provider record for this provider. This is used to store the non-EpicCare provider's name.
ORDER_MED_2.TXT_AUTHPROV_DEA: In ambulatory pharmacy, a prescription order could be authorized by a non-EpicCare provider. There is no provider record for this provider. This is used to store the non-EpicCare provider's Dynamic Epic Advisory Database (DEA) number.
ORDER_MED_2.TXT_AUTHPROV_PHONE: In ambulatory pharmacy, a prescription order could be authorized by a non-EpicCare provider. There is no provider record for this provider. This is used to store the non-EpicCare provider's phone number.
ORDER_MED_2.TXT_AUTHPROV_FAX: In ambulatory pharmacy, a prescription order could be authorized by a non-EpicCare provider. There is no provider record for this provider. This is used to store the non-EpicCare provider's fax number.
ORDER_MED_2.TXT_AUTHPROV_STREET: In ambulatory pharmacy, a prescription order could be authorized by a non-EpicCare provider. There is no provider record for this provider. This is used to store the non-EpicCare provider's street address information.
ORDER_MED_2.TXT_AUTHPROV_CITY: In ambulatory pharmacy, a prescription order could be authorized by a non-EpicCare provider. There is no provider record for this provider. This is used to store the non-EpicCare provider's city.
ORDER_MED_2.TXT_AUTHPROV_ZIP: In ambulatory pharmacy, a prescription order could be authorized by a non-EpicCare provider. There is no provider record for this provider. This is used to store the non-EpicCare provider's zip code.
ORDER_MED_2.RX_NUM_FORMATTED: The formatted prescription number for the order.
ORDER_MED_2.RX_COMMENTS: In an ambulatory pharmacy, the person who enters the prescription into the system can add additional comments to the prescription. The comments are not part of the order and are used for pharmacy internal communication only. The comments do not affect the patient instructions, nor the dispense information.
ORDER_MED_2.RX_WRITTEN_DATE: Store the prescription written date, which is the date the prescription was entered into the system through EpicCare, or the date the prescription was written to the paper prescription.
ORDER_MED_2.MED_DISCONT_ENC: *** Deprecated *** The data in this column does not correctly link to PAT_ENC.PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL. ORDER_MED_5.DISCON_PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL should be used for this link instead. ******
ORDER_MED_2.EFQ_OVRD_DAY_TYPE: Specifies what the numeric values in the frequency override days columns represent. If it is 1 then the listed days are relative days. If it is 2 then the listed days are weekdays. Any other value has no meaning.
ORDER_MED_2.EFQ_OVRD_CYCL_LEN: If there is a frequency override specified, this item will contain the length of a relative specified type cycle. For all other specified types this value will be ignored (and should be empty).
ORDER_MED_2.CHART_CORRECTION_ID: For chart corrections, links the order to a Chart Correction Audit (CCA) record.
ORDER_MED_2.PARENT_CE_ORDER_ID: When a cross-encounter order is released, this item stores the ID of the parent order.
ORDER_MED_2.TPL_WT_SRC_C_NAME: The weight source of the treatment plan for this order, as of the time the order is signed.
ORDER_MED_2.OVERRIDE_LINKED_C_NAME: The linked override resolved category number for the medication order. The category indicates whether the admins in the override pull are all linked to pharmacy orders.
ORDER_MED_2.COND_STATUS_C_NAME: For a conditional order, indicates whether the conditions for the order have been satisfied yet.
ORDER_MED_2.PEND_REF_REAS_COMM: Extracts the comment attached to the pend refusal reason (I ORD 7706)
ORDER_MED_2.PRIORITIZED_INST_TM: The time and date that is used as the prioritized date.
ORDER_MED_2.ORDER_QUESN_LIST: The order specific questions that are listed in the order composer for the order.
ORDER_MED_2.EXT_PHARM_MED_NAME: Medication display name received from an external pharmacy.
ORDER_MED_2.PEND_MED_ACTIVE_YN: A flag to determine if this is an active pending medication or not.
ORDER_MED_2.PEND_PREV_ORD_ID: The previous order ID for the pending medication. This item is NOT networked to orders.
ORDER_MED_2.TXT_AUTHPROV_NPI: If the authorizing provider for a medication is not currently an Epic provider (no SER record for this provider), free text provider items are used to save information about this provider. This item stores the National Provider ID (NPI) of the provider.
ORDER_MED_2.ORD_TRANS_METHOD_C_NAME: This item holds the method of transmission for a given order. It should only be set from within an order transmittal rule using the transmission method property (LRC 161).
ORDER_MED_2.PROFILE_ONLY_RX_YN: This item specifies whether the medication order is intended to be filled by the pharmacy immediately or should be filled later when requested by the patient. This flag can be set in order entry based on the order class or by selecting the 'profile only' checkbox in pharmacy order entry.
ORDER_MED_2.DISP_QTY_REM: Stores the remaining authorized quantity (in Written Dispense Quantity unit) that the pharmacist can dispense. It is used in Ambulatory Pharmacy to calculate the Refills Remaining.
ORDER_MED_2.FREQ_UNSCHEDULED_C_NAME: If the frequency is unscheduled, this column will store a 1. If the frequency is not unscheduled, this column will be blank.
ORDER_MED_2.LAST_SUSPEND_DTTM: Instant this medication was last suspended.
ORDER_MED_2.ORIG_MED_ID: Original prescription column; contains the medication order medication ID.
ORDER_MED_2.ORIG_STRENGTH: Original prescription column; contains the medication order strength.
ORDER_MED_2.ORIG_ROUTE_C_NAME: Original prescription column; contains the medication order route.
ORDER_MED_2.ORIG_MED_SOURCE_C_NAME: Original prescription column; contains the medication order source.
ORDER_MED_2.ORIG_DIS_DISP_QTY: Original prescription column; contains the medication order discrete dispense quantity.
ORDER_MED_2.ORIG_DISP_UNIT_C_NAME: Original prescription column; contains the medication order discrete dispense unit.
ORDER_MED_2.ORIG_START_DATE: Original prescription column; contains the medication order start date.
ORDER_MED_2.ORIG_END_DATE: Original prescription column; contains the medication order end date.
ORDER_MED_2.ORIG_DAW_YN: Original prescription column; contains the medication order 'dispense as written?' flag and is either yes or no.
ORDER_MED_2.PENDDC_STATUS_C_NAME: Status of an order with regard to pending discontinue.
ORDER_MED_2.MED_DISC_REFILLS: Saves the discrete medication refills information for the order.
ORDER_MED_2.BACK_DATED_YN: Indicates whether the order was back-dated at the time the start date was entered
ORDER_MED_2.RX_CLINICALLY_RV_YN: This specifies whether the prescription has been clinically reviewed by a pharmacist. Clinical review can either be required to occur before a prescription is filled or after it is filled during fill verification.
ORDER_MED_2.PRIORITIZED_UTC_DTTM: Stores the prioritized instant for the result in UTC

ORDER_MED_3._TABLE_: This table enables you to report on medications ordered. This table should be used with ORDER_MED.
ORDER_MED_3.ORDER_ID: The unique identifier for the order record.
ORDER_MED_3.ORIG_RX_DOSAGE: Original prescription column; contains the medication order dosage.
ORDER_MED_3.ORIG_RX_QUANTITY: Original prescription column; contains the medication order quantity.
ORDER_MED_3.ORIG_RX_REFILLS: Original prescription column; contains the medication refills.
ORDER_MED_3.ORIG_RX_DIRECTIONS: Original prescription column; contains the medication directions.
ORDER_MED_3.ORIG_RX_PRE_PROV_ID: Original prescription column; contains the medication order prescriber ID.
ORDER_MED_3.ORIG_RX_COMMENTS: Original prescription column; contains the medication comments.
ORDER_MED_3.PRESCRIP_EXP_DATE: Contains the expiration date for the prescription.
ORDER_MED_3.ORD_AUC: Item to store the area under curve value for medications using this value in dose calculation.
ORDER_MED_3.ORD_SEL_TARGETAUC_C_NAME: Selected type of the Target AUC in the order composer.
ORDER_MED_3.ORIG_RX_PHRM_ID: Original prescription column; contains the pharmacy
ORDER_MED_3.ORD_PHASE_OF_CARE_C_NAME: This item will store the phase of care for which this order was created. Example: Pre-Op, Intra-Op, PACU.
ORDER_MED_3.ORIGINAL_MED_ID: The unique ID of the medication that determines the formulary status of the order at order entry. The formulary status of this medication at the time of ordering is found in the column ORDER_MED.NON_FORMULARY_YN. For Intelligent Medication Selection (IMS) cases, it will be the medication picked by the user before IMS changes the medication. This is only set for inpatient medication orders.  It is recommended to use the Clarity column ORDER_MEDINFO.DISPENSABLE_MED_ID when reporting on medication orders. Use ORIGINAL_MED_ID for reporting on the formulary status of medications chosen by ordering users.
ORDER_MED_3.COPY_POINTER_ID: This object tracks order (ORD) record links created when using the inpatient or ambulatory order mover utilities to move an ORD record. This item is populated on the source ORD record and points to the target ORD record(s) created.
ORDER_MED_3.CONDITION_FLAG: This column contains the Condition Flag for an order.
ORDER_MED_3.PRINT_LOCAL_COPY_YN: Indicates whether to print a copy of this order. 'Y' indicates to print a copy of this order.  'N' indicates not to print a copy of this order.
ORDER_MED_3.ORX_ID: This column contains the record ID from the Order Lookup Index (ORX).  The ORX contains records for all active medication records and procedure records. This may be populated if an order originates from an Order Panel.
ORDER_MED_3.ORX_ID_ORDER_LOOKUP_NAME: The name (.2 item) for the order panel record.
ORDER_MED_3.SELECTED_FOR_OPC_YN: Indicates whether the order has been selected for resulting in the Orderable/Performable/Chargeable navigator.
ORDER_MED_3.MEDS_RESYME_REASO_C_NAME: This item stores the reason to resume the medication.
ORDER_MED_3.MEDS_DC_REASON_C_NAME: This item is populated in discharge navigator to save discontinue reason at the time of discharge. The value entered will be copied to I ORD 7074.
ORDER_MED_3.IP_INCLUDE_NOW_C_NAME: This is when to start the medication administration.
ORDER_MED_3.IP_INCL_NOW_SCH_C_NAME: Result of Scheduling Include Now Instant for Order
ORDER_MED_3.LAST_SCHED_DATE: The last scheduled date of the order.
ORDER_MED_3.MEDS_ACTION_VERB_C_NAME: Action verb which is used in patient sig of the order.
ORDER_MED_3.CRCL_FORMULA_ID: The creatinine clearance  CrCl programming point that will be used for AUC calculations for order whose dose calculation programming point does not specify a CrCl programming point.
ORDER_MED_3.AFTER_ORDER_ID: This column contains the After Order ID for an order.
ORDER_MED_3.BEFORE_ORDER_ID: This column contains the Before Order ID for an order.
ORDER_MED_3.DIET_COMMENTS: This column contains the Diet Comments entered for an order.
ORDER_MED_3.END_DT_BEF_FILL_DT: Stores the order's end date before it was changed due to the order being (re)filled. This is needed so that if the fills are ever cancelled, we know what to set the end date back to.
ORDER_MED_3.PREV_POC_C_NAME: This column contains the previous phase of care (I ORD 61040). The phase of care for an order is stored in I ORD 61010.  If the phase of care is not needed when the sign and held order is released, the phase of care stored in I ORD 61010 is moved to I ORD 61040 for tracking purposes. The phase of care stored in I ORD 61040 can still be used in the MAR activity to allow for continued phase of care grouping.  The list of phases of care not needed when sign and held orders are released is stored in I LSD 61050.
ORDER_MED_3.ORDER_TIME: The date and time when the medication order was placed.
ORDER_MED_3.IS_HELD_ORDER_C_NAME: This item stores 1 if the order is signed and held and active
ORDER_MED_3.TXT_ORDPROV_NAME: The name of the ordering provider, for providers that do not yet exist in the Provider (SER) master file.
ORDER_MED_3.TXT_ORDPROV_DEA: The DEA number of the ordering provider, for providers that do not yet exist in the Provider (SER) master file. A DEA number is given to providers by the Drug Enforcement Administration and allows them to prescribe controlled substances.
ORDER_MED_3.TXT_ORDPROV_NPI: The National Provider Identifier (NPI) of the ordering provider, for providers that do not yet exist in the Provider (SER) master file.
ORDER_MED_3.TXT_ORDPROV_PHONE: The phone number of the ordering provider, for providers that do not yet exist in the Provider (SER) master file.
ORDER_MED_3.TXT_ORDPROV_FAX: The fax number of the ordering provider, for providers that do not yet exist in the Provider (SER) master file.
ORDER_MED_3.TXT_ORDPROV_STREET: The street address of the ordering provider, for providers that do not yet exist in the Provider (SER) master file.
ORDER_MED_3.TXT_ORDPROV_CITY: The city of the ordering provider, for providers that do not yet exist in the Provider (SER) master file.
ORDER_MED_3.TXT_ORDPROV_STATE_C_NAME: The state of the ordering provider, for providers that do not yet exist in the Provider (SER) master file.
ORDER_MED_3.TXT_ORDPROV_ZIP: The zip code of the ordering provider, for providers that do not yet exist in the Provider (SER) master file.
ORDER_MED_3.RX_SERIAL_NUMBER: Stores the prescription serial number commonly found on triplicate prescription forms. Triplicate prescription forms are used for controlled substances and require multiple copies of the prescription form.
ORDER_MED_3.NOCHRG_EXT_RSLT_YN: This column returns whether the order is an external result that should not drop charges. A value of 1 returns Y. A value of 0 returns N. A null value will return null but is treated the same as 0 when dropping charges.
ORDER_MED_3.WT_MAX_DOSE: This column returns the saved weight-based or body surface area (BSA)-based maximum dose for the order (ORD).
ORDER_MED_3.WT_MAX_DOSE_UNIT_C_NAME: This column returns the saved unit for the weight-based or body surface area (BSA)-based maximum dose for the order (ORD).
ORDER_MED_3.MAX_DOSE_SOURCE_C_NAME: This column returns the source of max dose information that was used in the order (ORD).
ORDER_MED_3.SRC_RX_MED_ID: The ID of the originally prescribed medication as returned by the pharmacy in a refill request.
ORDER_MED_3.SRC_RX_QUANTITY: The quantity of the originally prescribed medication as returned by the pharmacy in a refill request.
ORDER_MED_3.SRC_RX_DIS_DISP_QTY: The discrete dispense quantity of the originally prescribed medication as returned by the pharmacy in a refill request.
ORDER_MED_3.SRC_RX_DISP_UNIT_C_NAME: The discrete dispense unit of the originally prescribed medication as returned by the pharmacy in a refill request.
ORDER_MED_3.SRC_RX_REFILLS: The number of refills of the originally prescribed medication as returned by the pharmacy in a refill request.
ORDER_MED_3.SRC_RX_DIRECTIONS: The directions (patient sig) of the originally prescribed medication as returned by the pharmacy in a refill request.
ORDER_MED_3.SRC_RX_START_DATE: The start date of the originally prescribed medication as returned by the pharmacy in a refill request.
ORDER_MED_3.SRC_RX_END_DATE: The end date of the originally prescribed medication as returned by the pharmacy in a refill request.
ORDER_MED_3.SRC_RX_DAW_YN: The Dispense as Written (DAW) flag of the originally prescribed medication as returned by the pharmacy in a refill request.
ORDER_MED_3.SRC_RX_PRES_PROV_ID: The ID of the prescribing provider of the originally prescribed medication as returned by the pharmacy in a refill request.
ORDER_MED_3.SRC_RX_COMMENTS: The comments associated with the originally prescribed medication as returned by the pharmacy in a refill request.
ORDER_MED_3.PAT_SIG_REPLY_C_NAME: This column contains the user's response to the sig-related questions for previous sig reorder workflows. The sig is the description of how a medication is supposed to be administered which includes the dose and frequency.
ORDER_MED_3.SIG_REVIEW_USER_ID: Holds the user ID of the user who reviewed the patient sig for accuracy. The sig is the description of how a medication is supposed to be administered which includes the dose and frequency.
ORDER_MED_3.SIG_REVIEW_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_MED_3.SIG_REVIEW_INS_DTTM: Holds the instant that the user took action on the patient sig in previous sig workflows. The sig is the description of how a medication is supposed to be administered which includes the dose and frequency.
ORDER_MED_3.SRC_RX_WRITTEN_DATE: The written date of the originally prescribed medication as returned by the pharmacy in a refill request.
ORDER_MED_3.DOSE_RND_ACK_RSN_C_NAME: The category number for the acknowledgement reason given by the user to override a dose rounding warning on this order.
ORDER_MED_3.SRC_RX_DESC: The description of the originally prescribed medication as returned by the pharmacy in a refill request.
ORDER_MED_3.EPRES_DEST_C_NAME: Indicates the destination of e-prescribing order. It will be set by an interface or the ambulatory pharmacy system. The item may not be populated for the old order records.
ORDER_MED_3.CTRL_MED_YN: Indicates whether the medication was controlled when the order was signed.

ORDER_MED_4._TABLE_: This table enables you to report on medications ordered. This table should be used with ORDER_MED.
ORDER_MED_4.ORDER_ID: The unique identifier for the order record.
ORDER_MED_4.E_PRES_EARLIEST_DAT: This column stores the earliest date on which a prescription can be filled for a Schedule II controlled medication. The date must occur on or before the start date for the prescription. It can't be changed after the order is signed.
ORDER_MED_4.ORDER_CONTEXT_ID: The unique identifier of the order context record associated with the order, which contains additional information about when the order is intended to be used.
ORDER_MED_4.PREV_ORD_CONTEXT_ID: The unique identifier of the order context record associated with the order, which contains additional information about when the order is intended to be used.
ORDER_MED_4.PARENT_ORDER_ID: The unique ID of the parent order record for Home Health (HH) orders.  An HH order is an order which represents documentation by a user whose scope of practice doesn't include editing prescription data.  Furthermore, the child order created will not be an actual prescription, but merely represents new instructions to the patient regarding how to take a medication.
ORDER_MED_4.LINKED_OP_MED_ID: The unique ID of the orders record. When Home Health and Hospice clinicians need to document a medication administration against an inpatient medication, a copy of the medication is created with an order mode of inpatient to document the administration. This column holds a link to the original outpatient medication.
ORDER_MED_4.INTERFACE_STAT_C_NAME: This column stores the ID of the interface status of the order.
ORDER_MED_4.PRESC_ORD_SIG: The originally prescribed medication instructions for an order. This will be null if the original  and current medication instructions are identical or if the order is not for a controlled medication that was electronically prescribed.
ORDER_MED_4.PRESC_ORD_MED_NAME: The originally prescribed medication name for an order. This will be null if the original medication name and current medication name are identical or if the order is not for a controlled medication that was electronically prescribed.
ORDER_MED_4.PRESC_ORD_REFILLS: The originally prescribed refills for an order. This will be null if the original refills and current refills are identical or if the order is not for a controlled medication that was electronically prescribed.
ORDER_MED_4.PRESC_ORD_QUANTITY: The originally prescribed quantity for an order. This will be null if the original quantity and current quantity are identical or if the order is not for a controlled medication that was electronically prescribed.
ORDER_MED_4.TXT_AUTHPROV_EXT_YN: Indicates whether the order's authorizing provider is from an external provider database. 'Y' indicates that the provider does not have a provider record in this EHR system and is from an external provider database. 'N' or NULL indicates that the provider has a provider record in this EHR system.
ORDER_MED_4.TXT_ORDPROV_EXT_YN: Indicates whether the order's ordering provider is from an external provider database. 'Y' indicates that the provider does not have a provider record in this EHR system and is from an external provider database. 'N' or NULL indicates that the provider has a provider record in this EHR system.
ORDER_MED_4.WAS_FMLY_CHECKED_YN: Indicates whether the medication order was compared to a formulary during signing. 'Y' indicates that the medication was compared to a payor-plan formulary, external formulary, or hospital formulary. 'N' or NULL indicates that the medication was not compared to a formulary. This does not indicate that the medication is or is not on any formulary, only that a formulary was checked for the medication.
ORDER_MED_4.SELECTED_CRCL_SRC_C_NAME: The selected CrCl source category ID for the order record, indicating the source of the creatinine clearance (CrCl) value.
ORDER_MED_4.CRCL_ORD_SPEC_VAL: This column stores the creatinine clearance (CrCL) value in the order.
ORDER_MED_4.SELECTED_SCR_SRC_C_NAME: The selected sCr source category ID for the order record, indicating the source of the serum creatinine (sCr) value.
ORDER_MED_4.SCR_ORD_SPEC_VAL: The serum creatinine (sCr) value for the order record.
ORDER_MED_4.TRANSIG_LANGUAGE_ID: The unique identifier of the language record used for translating patient-facing information in this order record.
ORDER_MED_4.TRANSIG_LANGUAGE_ID_LANGUAGE_NAME: The language name. If the language is written and uses more than one script to represent it, the name will contain the script in parentheses after the language name.
ORDER_MED_4.ORIG_DOSE_BEFORE_SWITCH: The original dose of the medication before the dose was adjusted.
ORDER_MED_4.ORIG_DOSE_UNIT_BEFORE_SWITCH_C_NAME: The unit category ID for the order record.
ORDER_MED_4.MAXDOSE_HARDSTOP_YN: Indicate whether the max dose limit is a hard stop for this order. If "Yes", the max dose is a hard stop. Otherwise, the max dose is not a hard stop.
ORDER_MED_4.TXT_AUTHPROV_DIST_C_NAME: The district category ID associated with the authorizing provider for this order record.
ORDER_MED_4.TXT_AUTHPROV_CTY_C_NAME: The county category ID associated with the authorizing provider for this order record.
ORDER_MED_4.TXT_AUTHPROV_CTRY_C_NAME: The country category ID associated with the authorizing provider for this order record.
ORDER_MED_4.TXT_ORDPROV_HOUSE: The house number of the ordering provider for this order record.
ORDER_MED_4.TXT_ORDPROV_DIST_C_NAME: The district category ID associated with the ordering provider for this order record.
ORDER_MED_4.TXT_ORDPROV_CNTY_C_NAME: The county category ID associated with the ordering provider for this order record.
ORDER_MED_4.TXT_ORDPROV_CNTRY_C_NAME: The country category ID associated with the ordering provider for this order record.
ORDER_MED_4.MAX_BSA: The maximum Body Surface Area (BSA) for an order, if the selected BSA is greater than this BSA then the selected BSA will be capped at this value.
ORDER_MED_4.MAX_DAILY_DOSE: Max daily dose value entered by the provider or defaulted as the calculated daily dose
ORDER_MED_4.MAX_DLY_DOSE_UNIT_C_NAME: The unit category ID for the orders record
ORDER_MED_4.TXT_AUTHPROV_HOUSE: The house number of the authorizing provider for this order record.
ORDER_MED_4.UNROUNDED_DOSE_MIN: The unrounded dose of this order. If the dose has a range (e.g. 1-2 mg), this is the lower end of the range. If the dose does not have a range, then this will store the dose.
ORDER_MED_4.UNROUNDED_DOSE_MAX: The unrounded dose of this order. If the dose has a range (e.g. 1-2 mg), this is the upper end of the range. Otherwise, this is null.
ORDER_MED_4.UNROUND_DOSE_UNIT_C_NAME: The med & dose unit category ID for the unrounded dose of this order record.
ORDER_MED_4.ION_SPEC_AC_AMT: This column shows the amount of acetate that a provider entered in this order record. This column will be empty if a chloride:acetate ratio or maximize option was selected.
ORDER_MED_4.ION_SPEC_AC_UNIT_C_NAME: The med & dose unit category ID for the acetate amount that a provider entered in this order record. This column will be empty if a chloride:acetate ratio or maximize option was selected.
ORDER_MED_4.ION_MAXIMIZE_C_NAME: The ion maximize selection category ID for the order record.
ORDER_MED_4.ION_RATIO: This column shows the chloride:acetate ratio option that was selected. This column is empty when a specified acetate amount was entered or when a maximize option was selected.
ORDER_MED_4.ION_BASED_TPN_YN: This column indicates how users specify electrolyte amounts for a total parenteral nutrition (TPN) order. 'Y' indicates that users enter amounts for specific ions to add in the TPN. 'N' indicates that users enter amounts for specific salts to add in the TPN.
ORDER_MED_4.CALC_CL_AC_RATIO: This column stores the calculated chloride:acetate ratio for an ion-based total parenteral nutrition (TPN).
ORDER_MED_4.ION_PRI_CALC_AMT_C_NAME: This column indicates whether the primary calculated amount is a weight-based or non-weight-based value.
ORDER_MED_4.USE_AUC_DOSE_YN: Indicates whether the system should automatically update the dose for the order based on the area under the curve (AUC) calculations. 'Y' indicates that the system updates the dose based on AUC calculations. 'N' or NULL indicates that the system does not update the dose based on AUC calculations.
ORDER_MED_4.EPRES_PHARMACY_ID: This column stores the ID of the pharmacy that accepted the prescription.
ORDER_MED_4.EPRES_PHARMACIST_ID: This column stores the ID of the pharmacist or pharmacy technician who accepted the prescription.
ORDER_MED_4.EPRES_PHARMACIST_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_MED_4.RX_ACCEPT_DTTM: Stores the instant at which the prescription was accepted.
ORDER_MED_4.RPTSIG_EXISTS_YN: Indicates whether the patient has indicated that they are taking this med differently from how it was prescribed to them for this order. If yes, the patient reported that they are taking the med differently. If no or null, the patient did not report that they are taking the med differently.
ORDER_MED_4.HOLD_PENDING_PA_YN: This item indicates whether the order is waiting for a prior authorization request to be completed before being sent to its final destination.
ORDER_MED_4.SEND_PA_REQ_YN: Indicates whether a prior authorization request should be sent for a medication order when it is signed. 'Y' indicates that a prior authorization request should be sent. 'N' indicates that a prior authorization request should not be sent.
ORDER_MED_4.PA_ORG_ID: The unique ID of the data exchange organization associated with the order record, which specifies the payer that a prior authorization request should be sent to when a medication order is signed.
ORDER_MED_4.PA_ORG_ID_EXTERNAL_NAME: Organization's external name used as the display name on forms and user interfaces.
ORDER_MED_4.SCRIPT_SUP_ID: The unique identifier of the provider under whose supervision a prescription was placed.
ORDER_MED_4.ONE_STEP_MEDPROC_ID: The unique ID of the order record. This item points to a procedure order record for the procedure used to administer the medication. The item is populated when administering a medication that is documented as administered in an Ophthalmology or Orthopedic context.
ORDER_MED_4.SPEC_DOSE_LMT_HR: The number of hours the dosing limit represents.
ORDER_MED_4.SPEC_MED_TYPE_C_NAME: The special medication type category ID for this order. This indicates whether the medication uses special dosing parameters, such as for patient-controlled analgesia orders.
ORDER_MED_4.RX_TRANSITION_ID: The unique identifier for the patient follow-up tracking record, which stores information about how a patient is transitioning from one medication to another.
ORDER_MED_4.RX_TRANSITION_STAT_C_NAME: The medication transition status category ID for the order record.
ORDER_MED_4.RX_TRANSITION_STAT_RSN_C_NAME: The medication transition status change reason category ID for the order record.
ORDER_MED_4.RX_TRANSITION_STAT_CMT: This item stores any additional comments about why the medication transition status was changed.
ORDER_MED_4.RX_TRANSITION_STAT_USR_ID: The unique identifier of the user who changed the transition status of the medication.
ORDER_MED_4.RX_TRANSITION_STAT_USR_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_MED_4.RX_TRANSITION_STAT_UTC_DTTM: The date and time the medication transition status of the order was changed.
ORDER_MED_4.DISCON_LOCAL_TIME: This item stores the instant in the patient's local time zone that an order was discontinued.
ORDER_MED_4.RX_REQUEST_TYPE_C_NAME: The prescription request type category ID for the order record
ORDER_MED_4.DISC_WAIT_PA_YN: This column indicates whether an order was discontinued while waiting for prior authorization.
ORDER_MED_4.ERX_ORD_NAME: The name of an order that was electronically prescribed.

ORDER_MED_5._TABLE_: This table enables you to report on medications ordered. This table should be used with ORDER_MED.
ORDER_MED_5.ORDER_ID: The unique identifier for the order record.
ORDER_MED_5.FREE_TXT_SUP_PROV_NAME: This is the name of the supervising provider.
ORDER_MED_5.FREE_TXT_SUP_PROV_IS_EXT_YN: This indicates whether the supervising provider comes from an external provider database.
ORDER_MED_5.FREE_TXT_SUP_PROV_DEA: This is the Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) number of the supervising provider.
ORDER_MED_5.FREE_TXT_SUP_PROV_NPI: This is the National Provider Identifier (NPI) of the supervising provider.
ORDER_MED_5.FREE_TXT_SUP_PROV_PHONE: This is the phone number of the supervising provider.
ORDER_MED_5.FREE_TXT_SUP_PROV_FAX: This is the fax number of the supervising provider.
ORDER_MED_5.FREE_TXT_SUP_PROV_STREET: This is the street address of the supervising provider.
ORDER_MED_5.FREE_TXT_SUP_PROV_CITY: This is the city of the supervising provider.
ORDER_MED_5.FREE_TXT_SUP_PROV_STATE_C_NAME: This is the state of the supervising provider.
ORDER_MED_5.FREE_TXT_SUP_PROV_ZIP: This is the zip code of the supervising provider.
ORDER_MED_5.FREE_TXT_SUP_PROV_HOUSE: This is the house number of the supervising provider for medication instructions.
ORDER_MED_5.FREE_TXT_SUP_PROV_DISTRICT_C_NAME: This is the district of the supervising provider.
ORDER_MED_5.FREE_TXT_SUP_PROV_COUNTY_C_NAME: This is the county of the supervising provider.
ORDER_MED_5.FREE_TXT_SUP_PROV_COUNTRY_C_NAME: This is the country of the supervising provider.
ORDER_MED_5.MLSIG_SIGTYPE_C_NAME: The multiline sig type category ID for the order record, indicating the relationship between multiple sets of medication instructions, each defined for a discrete period of time. '1' or NULL indicates that the order record only has one set of medication instructions.
ORDER_MED_5.HOME_HEALTH_DUE_COMMENT: The comments entered about the home health medication due time or the person responsible for home health medication administration.
ORDER_MED_5.HH_RESP_PERS_C_NAME: The home health responsible person category ID for the order record, indicating the person responsible for administering the medication.
ORDER_MED_5.BASE_MED_ORDER_ID: The unique identifier for the order record representing a multi-product prescription group, containing this order record and others which represent individual product prescriptions within the group.
ORDER_MED_5.MULTI_PROD_IMS_YN: Indicates whether the order uses multi-product prescription ordering, which selects multiple products to reach the total ordered dose. 'Y' indicates that the medication uses multi-product prescription ordering. 'N' or NULL indicates that the medication uses single-product prescription ordering.
ORDER_MED_5.PA_DISP_OVERRIDE_YN: This item indicates if prior authorization should be shown or hidden for this order, regardless of whether other data indicates that PA is needed.
ORDER_MED_5.SELECTED_CRCL_SEX_C_NAME: The sex assigned at birth category ID for the patient sex used in creatinine clearance (CrCl) calculations.
ORDER_MED_5.RX_TYPE_C_NAME: Flag used to determine how this prescription should be sent to the Finland prescription center.
ORDER_MED_5.MED_PROVENANCE: This item stores provenance information about medications from external health record systems.
ORDER_MED_5.PAIN_AGREEMENT_YN: Stores whether or not there is a pain agreement with the patient effective at the time the order was placed.
ORDER_MED_5.HOME_HEALTH_GIVE_PRN_YN: Indicates whether the home health medication should be given on an as-needed basis in addition to or in place of scheduled due times. 'Y' indicates that the medication should be given on an as-needed basis. 'N' or NULL indicates that the medication should only be given at scheduled due times.
ORDER_MED_5.PCA_TOTAL_DOSE_FLO_ID: The unique identifier of the flowsheet row record storing the total dose row of the order's linked PCA assessments. If the order is not for a PCA or it does not have a linked PCA assessment configured, the value will be null. A flowsheet row is a documentation tool used to track a specific piece of information over time.
ORDER_MED_5.PCA_TOTAL_DOSE_FLO_ID_DISP_NAME: The display name given to the flowsheet group/row.
ORDER_MED_5.NO_RENEW_REASON_C_NAME: The do not renew reason category ID for the order record.
ORDER_MED_5.ORIG_RX_ORDER_CLASS_C_NAME: For prescription orders created by the interface, this item holds the order class that was assigned at the time the order was created.
ORDER_MED_5.ORDER_INST_UTC_DTTM: The date and time the order was placed in UTC. This is the same as the data in ORDER_MED.ORDER_INST, but in UTC.
ORDER_MED_5.HH_NOT_DAILY_YN: Indicates whether a home health medication is not taken daily. 'Y' indicates that the home health medication is not taken daily. 'N' or NULL indicates that the home health medication is taken daily.
ORDER_MED_5.CONFIDENTIALITY_FLAG_C_NAME: The hide from proxies flag category ID for the order record, indicating whether the order should be hidden on medication lists shown to a patient's family or proxies.
ORDER_MED_5.ORDERED_DAYS_SUPPLY_PER_FILL: The calculated minimum days supply of the medication ordered. The value for this item is calculated when the order is signed, or when the order is edited by the pharmacy.
ORDER_MED_5.PAUSE_START_DTTM: The start instant for the pause period of a medication order.
ORDER_MED_5.PAUSE_END_DTTM: The end instant for the pause period of a medication order.
ORDER_MED_5.PREVIOUS_INR_DATE: The date of the patient's last INR assessment.
ORDER_MED_5.NEXT_INR_DATE: The next date on which a patient's international normalized ratio (INR) should be assessed.
ORDER_MED_5.USER_SEL_ORDER_TEMPLATE_OTL_ID: The unique ID of the order template record which a user selected to create the order record for this row.
ORDER_MED_5.DISP_RECPNT_NAME: This item holds the recipient name for the dispatch request.
ORDER_MED_5.DISP_RECPNT_CITY: This item holds the city for this dispatch request.
ORDER_MED_5.DISP_RECPNT_STATE_C_NAME: This item holds the state for this dispatch request.
ORDER_MED_5.DISP_RECPNT_ZIP: This item holds the zip code for this dispatch request.
ORDER_MED_5.DISP_RECPNT_COUNTRY_2_C_NAME: This item holds the country for this dispatch request.
ORDER_MED_5.DISP_RECPNT_HOUSE: This item holds the house number for this dispatch request.
ORDER_MED_5.DISP_RECPNT_COUNTY_2_C_NAME: This item holds the county for this dispatch request.
ORDER_MED_5.DISP_RECPNT_DISTRICT_C_NAME: This item holds the district for this dispatch request.
ORDER_MED_5.HH_IN_BAG_YN: Indicates whether a home health medication was marked by a clinician as prepacked in a bag. 'Y' indicates that the medication was prepacked in a bag. 'N' or NULL indicates that the medication was not prepacked in a bag.
ORDER_MED_5.HH_IN_PILL_BOX_YN: Indicates whether a home health medication was marked by a clinician as dispensed in a pill box. 'Y' indicates that the medication was dispensed in a pill box. 'N' or NULL indicates that the medication was not dispensed in a pill box.
ORDER_MED_5.HH_BAG_START_DATE: The start date of a home health medication prepacked in a bag.
ORDER_MED_5.HH_BAG_END_DATE: The end date of a home health medication prepacked in a bag.
ORDER_MED_5.HH_PILL_START_DATE: The start date of a home health medication dispensed in a pill box.
ORDER_MED_5.HH_PILL_END_DATE: The end date of a home health medication dispensed in a pill box.
ORDER_MED_5.BRAND_SEL_RSN_C_NAME: The brand selected reason category ID for the order, indicating why the brand medication was selected. This column is blank if the brand product was selected because a user specified the medication should be dispensed as written.
ORDER_MED_5.DISCON_PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL: The encounter or visit in which the medication was discontinued.
ORDER_MED_5.UNIQUE_ORDER_IDENTIFIER: Order identifier that is unique for all deployments
ORDER_MED_5.REC_W_MAP_ERX_YN: Flag that indicates if an ORD row was created in Reconcile Outside Information by a user manually choosing an ERX to match with an unmapped DXR prescription. 'Y' Indicates that an order was manually mapped by a user. 'N' indicates that the order was not manually mapped by a user. NULL indicates that the order was not created in Reconcile Outside Information or the item is not used in the current locale.

ORDER_MED_6._TABLE_: This table enables you to report on medications ordered. This table should be used with ORDER_MED.
ORDER_MED_6.ORDER_MED_ID: The unique identifier for the medication order record.
ORDER_MED_6.AUTH_SER_ADDRESS_ID: The unique ID for the address of the order's authorizing provider. It is used to identify an address using the address unique ID (I SER 21000) stored in the provider record.
ORDER_MED_6.ORDER_SER_ADDR_ID: The unique ID for the address of the order's ordering provider. It is used to identify an address using the address unique ID (I SER 21000) stored in the provider record.
ORDER_MED_6.SUP_SER_ADDRESS_ID: The unique ID for the address of the order's supervising provider. It is used to identify an address using the address unique ID (I SER 21000) stored in the provider record.
