ORDER_MED_6.TEMP_LONG_TERM_IN_C_NAME: The category number for the temporary long-term indicator for unsigned orders.
ORDER_MED_6.PRIORITIZED_INST_UTC_DTTM: This item stores the prioritized instant (date and time) for an order in UTC time zone. It represents the most relevant date and time an action was taken on an order.
ORDER_MED_6.PRIORITIZED_INST_DTTM: This item stores the prioritized instant (date and time) for an order in local time zone. It represents the most relevant date and time an action was taken on an order.
ORDER_MED_6.NEXT_SCH_INST_AT_DISCON_DTTM: The next scheduled date and time for the order at the time of discontinue.
ORDER_MED_6.NEXT_SCH_AT_DISCON_OFF_SCH_YN: Indicates whether the next scheduled time of the order at the time of discontinue is off-schedule. 'Y' indicates that the next scheduled time was off-schedule. 'N' or NULL indicate that the next scheduled time was not off-schedule.
ORDER_MED_6.ORD_SIG_HAS_IOU_YN: Indicates whether Indications of Use are present in the patient sig. 'Y' indicates Indications of Use are present in the patient sig. 'N' or NULL indicate that Indications of Use are not present in the patient sig.
ORDER_MED_6.MED_DIRECTIONS_LONG: Contains the directions for taking a medication order.
ORDER_MED_6.USER_CHANGED_END_TIME_YN: Indicates whether the end time is entered by a user. This is only populated for unsigned medication orders. 'Y' indicates the end time is entered by a user. 'N' or NULL indicate that the end time is not entered by a user.
ORDER_MED_6.ORIG_MED_DIRECTIONS_LONG: Contains the original directions for taking a medication order.
ORDER_MED_6.NO_REIMBURS_CODESET: Holds the code set of the selected reimbursement code.
ORDER_MED_6.STANDING_COUNT: This item stores a numeric value for the count of the order that goes along with the standing count type, indicating the number of hours, days, weeks, or occurrences for which the order will take place.
ORDER_MED_6.STANDING_COUNT_TP_C_NAME: This count type goes along with the count from ORD-34040 to indicate the number of hours, days, weeks, or occurrences for which the order will take place.

ORDER_MED_7._TABLE_: This table enables you to report on medications ordered. This table should be used with ORDER_MED.
ORDER_MED_7.ORDER_ID: The unique identifier (.1 item) for the order record.
ORDER_MED_7.MED_DOSAGE_END_DATE: Stores the calculated end date of the order when using the wide end date feature
ORDER_MED_7.FIRST_DOSE_EDU_PATIENT_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number of the patient encounter associated with first-dose education.
ORDER_MED_7.PENDED_PREV_SIG: For a pended medication order, this holds the contents (if any) of the "Sig (Previous)" display item from the order composer.  If populated, this is the sig (ORD 7055) of the source order at the time the reorder was created.
ORDER_MED_7.DOSE_ADJ_ACCEPTED_YN: Stores whether the dose adjustment is accepted.
ORDER_MED_7.MED_DOSE_CALCULATION_DESC: Stores medication dose override dose programming point calculation.
ORDER_MED_7.NUM_DOSES_TO_SCHED: Stores the number of doses that should actually be scheduled after reconciling a pre-existing OP order into an encounter which schedules OP meds
ORDER_MED_7.DO_NOT_SCHED_PAST_DATE: Stores the last date on which it is OK to schedule an OP order that has been reconciled into an encounter that schedules OP meds
ORDER_MED_7.SCHED_FROM_PERIOD: Stores the period to start scheduling from for an OP order that has been reconciled into an encounter that schedules OP meds
ORDER_MED_7.SCHED_FROM_PERIOD_DURATION: Stores the remaning number of days in the period to start scheduling from for an OP order that has been reconciled into an encounter that schedules OP meds
ORDER_MED_7.SEND_TO_PHARM_REASON_C_NAME: Reasons for sending a prescription directly to a pharmacy. For Australia e-prescribing.
ORDER_MED_7.RX_MOBILE_NUM: Patient's mobile phone number. For Australia e-prescribing.
ORDER_MED_7.MED_PROV_ORDER_ID: Links to the shadow order containing provisional verify data
ORDER_MED_7.TAPER_TRIMMING_INCOMPLETE_C_NAME: Set to Yes if the taper trimming UI's decision hasn't been made yet
ORDER_MED_7.STARTED_TAKING_DATE: The date the patient reports they started taking a medication
ORDER_MED_7.RX_REQ_SUBTYPE_C_NAME: This item specifies the subtype of the external change request this order represents. It is only set on orders created by external pharmacies, and is used in conjunction with ORD 7499.
ORDER_MED_7.RESCARE_REORDER_C_NAME: Response to a question that a user is shown when reordering or modifying an outpatient order while the patient is admitted to a residential care facility.
ORDER_MED_7.DISCRETE_SIG_SOURCE_C_NAME: The discrete sig source category ID for the order.
ORDER_MED_7.MED_ORIG_DOSAGE_END_DATE: Stores the original dosage end date for a medication order when using the wide end date feature if it was changed after the order was signed
ORDER_MED_7.SCHED_FIRST_DOSE_DTTM: Stores the date and time that the first dose in an admission should be scheduled
ORDER_MED_7.LAST_REFILL_REQUEST_UTC_DTTM: The datetime of when the patient last requested a refill for this medication order through MyChart. Used to determine when another refill can be requested for medications filled through non-integrated pharmacies.
ORDER_MED_7.SCHEDULE_PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number of the Patient contact for when Low Acuity scheduling information is saved to an order (SI 34570).
ORDER_MED_7.SOURCE_SCHED_IN_PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for the low-acuity admission contact if the source order is schedulable in that admission when the current order is signed or released. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
ORDER_MED_7.SCHEDULE_USING_METHOD_C_NAME: The schedule using method category ID for the order. This determines how the medication should schedule administration due times in an encounter that supports scheduling outpatient medications on the MAR.
ORDER_MED_7.NEED_INTAKE_SCHED_YN: Stores whether the medication needs intake to be scheduled, even if it was ordered directly on the low acuity encounter.
ORDER_MED_7.RX_WRITTEN_UTC_DTTM: The UTC instant of when the prescription was written
ORDER_MED_7.REMAINING_DOSES_BEFORE_INTAKE: The system will track the number of doses remaining for the order prior to the most recent intake into a low acuity medication management encounter.
ORDER_MED_7.MED_CHG_REPLACE_YN_NAME: Flag to determine if I ORD 7088 - Med change reorder ID is actually a replacement ID.

ORDER_MED_MORPHINE_EQUIV._TABLE_: This table stores virtual morphine equivalence items in ORD.
ORDER_MED_MORPHINE_EQUIV.ORDER_ID: The unique identifier (.1 item) for the order record.
ORDER_MED_MORPHINE_EQUIV.PCA_MORPHINE_EQUIV_CONV_FACTOR: This column stores the calculated morphine equivalent conversion factor of a patient-controlled analgesia (PCA) order. If the order is not for a PCA or it does not have a linked PCA assessment configured, the value will be null. The conversion factor is calculated as the equivalent amount of mg of morphine based on a 1-unit dose of the order. If the medication doesn't contain an opioid, the value will be zero. If there is an error calculating the morphine equivalency, the value will be 999999.

ORDER_MED_SIG._TABLE_: The ORDER_MED_SIG table stores the patient instructions for a prescription as entered by the user. The table should be used in conjunction with the ORDER_MED table which contains related medication, patient, and contact identification information you can report on.
ORDER_MED_SIG.ORDER_ID: The unique ID of the order record associated with this medication order. This is an internal unique identifier for ORD master file records in this table and cannot be used to link to CLARITY_MEDICATION.
ORDER_MED_SIG.SIG_TEXT: Patient instructions for the prescription as entered by the user.

ORDER_MED_VITALS._TABLE_: This table stores historical patient vitals information for each medication order at the time the order was released. It should only be used for reporting on whether or not vitals information had been entered at that point in time.
ORDER_MED_VITALS.ORDER_ID: The unique identifier for the order record.
ORDER_MED_VITALS.WEIGHT_AT_RELEASE: The patient's recorded weight in kilograms at the time the order was released.
ORDER_MED_VITALS.WEIGHT_REL_SOURCE_C_NAME: The source category ID for the patient's recorded weight at the time the order was released.
ORDER_MED_VITALS.HEIGHT_AT_RELEASE: The patient's recorded height in centimeters at the time the order was released.
ORDER_MED_VITALS.HEIGHT_REL_SOURCE_C_NAME: The source category ID for the patient's recorded height at the time the order was released.
ORDER_MED_VITALS.BSA_AT_RELEASE: The patient's calculated body surface area (BSA) in meters squared at the time the order was released.
ORDER_MED_VITALS.BSA_REL_SOURCE_C_NAME: The source category ID for the patient's recorded body surface area (BSA) at the time the order was released.

ORDER_RPTD_SIG_HX._TABLE_: This table contains a history of sig-related data for prescriptions, both what the provider initially prescribed and what the patient later reported taking. Most commonly, the first row for any prescription represents the sig as the prescription was written, and subsequent rows will represent changes in what the patient reports taking.
ORDER_RPTD_SIG_HX.ORDER_ID: The unique identifier for the order record.
ORDER_RPTD_SIG_HX.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
ORDER_RPTD_SIG_HX.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
ORDER_RPTD_SIG_HX.ENTRY_USER_ID: The unique identifier of the user who entered the medication instructions.
ORDER_RPTD_SIG_HX.ENTRY_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_RPTD_SIG_HX.ENTRY_DTTM: The date and time when these medication instructions were entered.
ORDER_RPTD_SIG_HX.ACTION_C_NAME: The action represented by this sig - e.g. the initial prescription; the pharmacist has edited the sig; or the patient reports taking this medication differently from how it was prescribed.
ORDER_RPTD_SIG_HX.SOURCE_C_NAME: The location from which this sig was entered.
ORDER_RPTD_SIG_HX.INFORMANT_C_NAME: The relationship to patient category ID for the person (as related to the patient) who reported the medication instructions for this medication.
ORDER_RPTD_SIG_HX.REASON_C_NAME: The reason given for why the patient is not taking the medication as prescribed.
ORDER_RPTD_SIG_HX.REASON_COMMENT: Additional comments on the reason why the patient is not taking the medication as prescribed.
ORDER_RPTD_SIG_HX.DOSE_MIN: The lower bound of the ranged dose for this medication's instructions.
ORDER_RPTD_SIG_HX.DOSE_UNIT_C_NAME: The med & dose unit category ID for the dose of this medication's instructions.
ORDER_RPTD_SIG_HX.FREQUENCY_ID: The unique identifier of the frequency record used in the medication instructions.
ORDER_RPTD_SIG_HX.FREQUENCY_ID_FREQ_NAME: The name of the frequency record.
ORDER_RPTD_SIG_HX.PRN_COMMENT: The as-needed comment for the medication instructions.
ORDER_RPTD_SIG_HX.ROUTE_C_NAME: The route for this medication instructions.
ORDER_RPTD_SIG_HX.INDICATIONS_COMMENT: Comments about the indications of use for the medication instructions.
ORDER_RPTD_SIG_HX.DOSE_MAX: The upper bound of the ranged dose for this medication's instructions.
ORDER_RPTD_SIG_HX.BRUKSOMRADE: Stores the patient-reported Bruksom�de in Norway
ORDER_RPTD_SIG_HX.BRUKSOMRADE_MEDICAL_COND_ID: Stores the patient-reported Bruksom�de (Discrete) in Norway
ORDER_RPTD_SIG_HX.BRUKSOMRADE_MEDICAL_COND_ID_MEDICAL_COND: This contains the name of the medical condition.

ORDER_RPTD_SIG_TEXT._TABLE_: For each row in ORDER_RPTD_SIG_HX, this table contains the complete sig for the data represented by that row. Depending on whether your organization uses discrete sigs or not, this text may be generated from the various discrete fields or entered directly.
ORDER_RPTD_SIG_TEXT.ORDER_ID: The unique identifier for the order record.
ORDER_RPTD_SIG_TEXT.GROUP_LINE: The line number for the information associated with the text of the sig of this medication.
ORDER_RPTD_SIG_TEXT.VALUE_LINE: The line number of one of the multiple values associated with a specific group of text of a sig within this record.
ORDER_RPTD_SIG_TEXT.SIG_TEXT: The text of the medication instructions for the order record.

ORD_DOSING_PARAMS.ORDER_ID: The unique identifier for the order record.
ORD_DOSING_PARAMS.ORD_DOSING_WEIGHT: Weight used for dosing. Always stored in kilograms.
ORD_DOSING_PARAMS.ORD_DW_REC_DTTM: The instant at which the weight was recorded.
ORD_DOSING_PARAMS.ORD_WT_SOURCE_C_NAME: This column contains the source of the patient weight used for dosing patient-controlled analgesia (PCA) medication.
ORD_DOSING_PARAMS.ORD_DOSING_HEIGHT: This column contains the patient height used for dosing PCA medication. The value stored is in inches for all orders after weight-based dosing was turned on, or starting in Spring 2008, whichever came first. Values are stored in centimeters for treatment plan orders made prior to that.
ORD_DOSING_PARAMS.ORD_HT_REC_DTTM: The instant at which the height was recorded.
ORD_DOSING_PARAMS.ORD_HT_SOURCE_C_NAME: This column contains the source of the patient height used for dosing patient-controlled analgesia (PCA) medication.
ORD_DOSING_PARAMS.ORD_DOSING_BSA: The body surface area used for dosing.
ORD_DOSING_PARAMS.ORD_BSA_SRC_C_NAME: This column contains the source of the body surface area used for dosing patient-controlled analgesia (PCA) medication.
ORD_DOSING_PARAMS.ORD_BSA_CALC_DTL: The dosing body surface area calculation details with weight, height and recorded instants.
ORD_DOSING_PARAMS.ORD_BSA_COMMENTS: Generated comment for dosing body surface area.

ORD_DOSING_PARAMS_2.ORDER_ID: The unique identifier for the order record.
ORD_DOSING_PARAMS_2.ORD_DOSING_BSA_ORIG: The original (uncapped) BSA of an order

ORD_MED_USER_ADMIN._TABLE_: This table contains user-entered administration instructions. This information is already contained as a part of the table ORD_MED_ADMININSTR so this table does not have to be extracted.
ORD_MED_USER_ADMIN.ORDER_ID: The unique ID of the medication order (prescription) record. NOTE: This is an internal unique identifier for order (ORD) master file records in this table and cannot be used to link to CLARITY_MEDICATION.rd.
ORD_MED_USER_ADMIN.LINE: The line number for each user-entered administration instruction line.
ORD_MED_USER_ADMIN.MED_USER_ADMN_INSTR: User-entered admin instructions converted to plain text. This item (I ORD 7226) replaces the functionality of I ORD 7220 for entering/changing admin instructions. I ORD 7220 is still used for displaying the admin instructions and is updated automatically from this item.
ORD_MED_USER_ADMIN.ORDERING_DATE: The date the order was placed in calendar format.

PRESC_ID._TABLE_: This table contains the prescription ID of an order that is populated by an interface.
PRESC_ID.ORDER_ID: The unique ID for the Order record for the prescription.
PRESC_ID.LINE: The line number for the prescription ID. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.
PRESC_ID.PRESC_ID: The prescription ID of the order populated by an interface.

ORDER_MED.PHARMACY_ID_PHARMACY_NAME: WALGREENS DRUG STORE #06130 - MADISON, WI - 3700 UNIVERSITY AVE AT NEC OF MIDVALE & UNIVERSITY

title: Orders & Labs: ORDER_PROC + children → ORDER_RESULTS → labResults
description: Order procedures, results, parent→child chain for lab panels

ADT_ORDER_INFORMATION._TABLE_: This table contains information about ADT Orders.
ADT_ORDER_INFORMATION.ORDER_ID: The unique identifier for the order record.
ADT_ORDER_INFORMATION.ADT_EXPECT_ADMSN_DATE: Stores the date the patient is expected to be admitted.
ADT_ORDER_INFORMATION.ADT_EXPECT_DISCHRG_DATE: Stores the date the patient is expected to be discharged.
ADT_ORDER_INFORMATION.ADT_EXPECT_STAY_LEN: Stores the number of days the patient is expected to stay.
ADT_ORDER_INFORMATION.PAS_HAR_CHNG_RSN_C_NAME: Stores the reason why the patient's current hospital account is ending, and a new hospital account is beginning.
ADT_ORDER_INFORMATION.REASON_C_NAME: Stores the reason for inserting a patient update event.

CLARITY_EAP._TABLE_: The CLARITY_EAP table contains basic information about the procedure records in your system. This does include both A/R and clinical procedures.
CLARITY_EAP.PROC_ID: The unique ID of each procedure record in your system. This is not the CPT� code or other procedure code.

CLARITY_EAP_3._TABLE_: The CLARITY_EAP_3 table contains basic information about the procedure records in your system. This includes both A/R and clinical procedures. This is a continuation of Clarity table CLARITY_EAP.
CLARITY_EAP_3.PROC_ID: The unique ID number for a procedure record.
CLARITY_EAP_3.PT_FRIENDLY_NAME: The patient friendly procedure name for use in MyChart.

CLARITY_EAP_5._TABLE_: The CLARITY_EAP_5 table contains basic information about the procedure records in your system. This includes both A/R and clinical procedures. This is a continuation of Clarity table CLARITY_EAP.
CLARITY_EAP_5.PROC_ID: The unique identifier (.1 item) for the procedure record.
CLARITY_EAP_5.MYC_TKT_OVR_RULE_ID: Specify a rule to determine when to allow manually sending appointment requests to the patient for scheduling.

CL_ORD_FST_LST_SCH._TABLE_: This table stores an order's first and last scheduled date and time, along with the type of review notice for the expire items (i.e. let expire or review).
CL_ORD_FST_LST_SCH.ORDER_ID: The unique ID of the order record associated with this order.
CL_ORD_FST_LST_SCH.LET_EXPIRE_TYPE_C_NAME: Determines the type of review notice for the former "let expire" items

EXTERNAL_ORDER_INFO._TABLE_: This table contains data about medication orders in external encounters that was received but could not be stored discretely.
EXTERNAL_ORDER_INFO.ORDER_ID: The unique identifier (.1 item) for the order record for this row.
EXTERNAL_ORDER_INFO.DISPLAY_NAME: The display name for the external order.
EXTERNAL_ORDER_INFO.FREQUENCY: A description of the external order's frequency.
EXTERNAL_ORDER_INFO.LINK_GROUP_IDENTIFIER: If the external order was part of a linked group, this contains a unique identifier for that group. This is not the ID of any other record in the system.
EXTERNAL_ORDER_INFO.LINK_TYPE_C_NAME: If the external order was part of a linked group, this contains the link type of that group.

HV_ORDER_PROC._TABLE_: This table contains data on order procedures related to a hospital visit.
HV_ORDER_PROC.ORDER_PROC_ID: The unique ID of the procedure order record.
HV_ORDER_PROC.PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL: This is a numeric representation of the date of this encounter in your system. The integer portion of the number specifies the date of the encounter. The digits after the decimal point indicate multiple visits on one day.
HV_ORDER_PROC.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: A unique serial number for this encounter. This number is unique across all patients and encounters in the system.
HV_ORDER_PROC.DISCR_FREQ_ID: The discrete frequency associated with the order.
HV_ORDER_PROC.DISCR_FREQ_ID_FREQ_NAME: The name of the frequency record.
HV_ORDER_PROC.TRANSPORT_C_NAME: Determines how the patient associated with this order is to be transported.
HV_ORDER_PROC.ORD_PROV_ID: The provider ID of the ordering provider.
HV_ORDER_PROC.STAND_CNT: The standing count for the order.
HV_ORDER_PROC.STND_TP_C_NAME: The standing count type for the order (i.e. days, weeks, etc.)
HV_ORDER_PROC.ADM_DEPARTMENT_ID: The admission department associated with the order.
HV_ORDER_PROC.ADMIT_SERVICE_C_NAME: The admission service associated with the order.
HV_ORDER_PROC.ADM_LVL_OF_CARE_C_NAME: The admission level of care associated with the order.
HV_ORDER_PROC.ADMIT_DX_ID: The admission diagnosis associated with the order.
HV_ORDER_PROC.ADM_COND_C_NAME: The admission condition associated with the order.
HV_ORDER_PROC.ADMIT_LEN_STAY: The admission expected length of stay.
HV_ORDER_PROC.ADMIT_DISCHG_DATE: The admission expected date of discharge.
HV_ORDER_PROC.ADMIT_RES_PROV_ID: The provider ID of the senior admitting resident.
HV_ORDER_PROC.ADM_INTRN_PROV_ID: The provider ID of the admitting intern.
HV_ORDER_PROC.TF_DEPARTMENT_ID: The transfer department associated with the order.
HV_ORDER_PROC.TRANFER_SVC_C_NAME: The service associated with the transfer department.
HV_ORDER_PROC.TF_LVL_OF_CARE_C_NAME: The transfer level of care associated with the order.
HV_ORDER_PROC.TRANFER_DX_ID: The diagnosis ID associated with the transfer order.
HV_ORDER_PROC.TRANFER_COND_C_NAME: The condition specified with the transfer order.
HV_ORDER_PROC.TRANFER_LEN_STAY: The expected length of stay associated with the transfer order.
HV_ORDER_PROC.TRANFER_DISCHR_DT: The expected discharge date associated with the transfer order.
HV_ORDER_PROC.TRANFER_PROV_ID: The provider ID of the admitting provider.
HV_ORDER_PROC.DCHRG_EXP_TIME: The expected discharge date and time associated with the discharge order.
HV_ORDER_PROC.DISCH_DISP_C_NAME: The discharge disposition associated with the discharge order.
HV_ORDER_PROC.DISCH_DEST_C_NAME: The discharge destination associated with the discharge order.
HV_ORDER_PROC.ISOLATION_C_NAME: The isolation status of the patient associated with the order.
HV_ORDER_PROC.CODESTATUS_C_NAME: The code status of the patient associated with the order.
HV_ORDER_PROC.DIET_C_NAME: The diet status of the patient associated with the order.
HV_ORDER_PROC.INST_OF_UPDATE_TM: The day and time the order record was last updated.
HV_ORDER_PROC.PAT_UPD_DTTM: The effective date and time of the patient update that should be generated from this order.
HV_ORDER_PROC.PAT_UPD_PAT_CLS_C_NAME: The patient class of the patient update that should be generated from this order.
HV_ORDER_PROC.PAT_UPD_SVC_C_NAME: The service of the patient update that should be generated from this order.
HV_ORDER_PROC.PAT_UPD_ACCOM_CD_C_NAME: The accommodation code of the patient update that should be generated from this order.
HV_ORDER_PROC.PAT_UPD_ACCOM_RSN_C_NAME: The accommodation reason of the patient update that should be generated from this order.
HV_ORDER_PROC.PAT_UPD_LOC_C_NAME: The level of care of the patient update that should be generated from this order.
HV_ORDER_PROC.PAT_UPD_RSN_C_NAME: The reason for change of the patient update that should be generated from this order.
HV_ORDER_PROC.CONSULTANT_ID: Stores the Lead Consultant entered by the user during order entry for transfer and patient update orders.
HV_ORDER_PROC.LEAVE_OF_ABSENCE_REASON_C_NAME: The category ID for the reason that the patient is to go on leave from the current admission. This column is only likely to be populated for Leave of Absence orders.
HV_ORDER_PROC.LEAVE_OF_ABSENCE_LEAVE_DTTM: The date and time that the patient is expected to go out on leave. This column is only likely to be populated for Leave of Absence orders.
HV_ORDER_PROC.LEAVE_OF_ABSENCE_RETURN_DTTM: The date and time that the patient is expected to return from leave. This column is only likely to be populated for Leave of Absence orders.
HV_ORDER_PROC.LEAVE_OF_ABSENCE_HOLD_BED_YN: Whether or not the patient's current bed should be held during the upcoming leave. This column is only likely to be populated for Leave of Absence orders.
HV_ORDER_PROC.DCHRG_EXP_DATE: The expected discharge date associated with the discharge order.
HV_ORDER_PROC.TRANSFER_REQUEST_TYPE_C_NAME: The type of transfer request being ordered.
HV_ORDER_PROC.ADT_PATIENT_CLASS_C_NAME: Patient class used for transfer request orders.
HV_ORDER_PROC.HOSP_AREA_ID: Hospital area to request a patient transfer.
HV_ORDER_PROC.TRANSFER_CENTER_REGION_ID_RECORD_NAME: The name of this cleaning sector.
HV_ORDER_PROC.CODE_STATUS_COMMENTS: The code status comments associated with the order.
HV_ORDER_PROC.EXP_DIS_APPROX_TM_C_NAME: The approximate expected discharge time category ID for the order.

OBS_MTHD_ID._TABLE_: Methods used to perform component test in lab.
OBS_MTHD_ID.ORDER_ID: The unique identifier for the order record.
OBS_MTHD_ID.CONTACT_DATE_REAL: A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
OBS_MTHD_ID.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.
OBS_MTHD_ID.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.

ORDER_ANATOMICAL_REGION._TABLE_: This table stores the anatomical regions of this order.
ORDER_ANATOMICAL_REGION.ORDER_ID: The unique identifier (.1 item) for the order record.
ORDER_ANATOMICAL_REGION.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
ORDER_ANATOMICAL_REGION.ANATOMICAL_REGION_C_NAME: Stores the Anatomical Region category IDs associated to this procedure.

ORDER_AUTH_INFO._TABLE_: This table holds information about prior authorization for medications in certain workflows. It is currently only used when communicating with eClaimLink for authorizations.
ORDER_AUTH_INFO.ORDER_ID: The unique identifier for the order record.
ORDER_AUTH_INFO.MED_AUTH_NUM: Holds the authorization ID returned by the payer.
ORDER_AUTH_INFO.AUTH_DENY_RSN_ID_EXT_CODE_LST_NAME: The name of the list value.
ORDER_AUTH_INFO.AUTH_START_UTC_DTTM: This item holds the instant the authorization is valid from.
ORDER_AUTH_INFO.AUTH_END_UTC_DTTM: This item holds the instant the authorization is valid to.

ORDER_COMMENT._TABLE_: The ORDER_COMMENT table allows you to report on comments for non-medication orders.
ORDER_COMMENT.ORDER_ID: The unique identifier for the non-medication order.
ORDER_COMMENT.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.
ORDER_COMMENT.ORDERING_COMMENT: Free text comment for non-medication orders.

ORDER_DOCUMENTS._TABLE_: This table contains the DCS records attached to an order on a contact level such as scanned hard copy prescriptions, Lab Scans and Lab Reports.
ORDER_DOCUMENTS.ORDER_ID: The unique identifier (.1 item) for the order record.
ORDER_DOCUMENTS.CONTACT_DATE_REAL: A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
ORDER_DOCUMENTS.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.
ORDER_DOCUMENTS.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.

ORDER_DX_PROC._TABLE_: The ORDER_DX_PROC table enables you to report on the diagnoses associated with procedures ordered in clinical system. Since one procedure order may be associated with multiple diagnoses, each row in this table is one procedure - diagnosis relation. We have also included patient and contact identification information for each record. Note that system settings may or may not require that procedures be associated with diagnoses.  This table contains only information for those procedures and diagnoses that have been explicitly associated. Check with your clinical system Application Administrator to determine how your organization has this set up.
ORDER_DX_PROC.ORDER_PROC_ID: The unique ID of the procedure order record.
ORDER_DX_PROC.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this procedure record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
ORDER_DX_PROC.PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL: A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
ORDER_DX_PROC.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
ORDER_DX_PROC.DX_ID: The unique ID of the diagnosis record associated with the procedure order.
ORDER_DX_PROC.DX_QUALIFIER_C_NAME: The diagnosis qualifier category ID, which indicates modifier information for the diagnosis associated with the order record.
ORDER_DX_PROC.COMMENTS: Comments added when the procedure was ordered
ORDER_DX_PROC.DX_CHRONIC_YN: Indicates whether the diagnosis associated with this order record was marked as chronic during the ordering process. 'Y' indicates that a the diagnosis was marked as chronic. 'N' or NULL indicate that a the diagnosis was not marked as chronic.
ORDER_DX_PROC.ASSOC_DX_DESC: This column stores a free text diagnosis description entered by the end user.  Also referred to as the "display as" field.
ORDER_DX_PROC.ASSOC_REQ_DX_ID: The unique ID of the original requisition diagnosis associated with the order. Diagnoses stored by this item might be entered for either clinical or billing purposes.

ORDER_IMAGE_AVAIL_INFO._TABLE_: This table has, for this imaging order, the image availability information for each of the image archives from which you receive Image Availability Notifications.
ORDER_IMAGE_AVAIL_INFO.ORDER_ID: The unique identifier (.1 item) for the order record.
ORDER_IMAGE_AVAIL_INFO.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
ORDER_IMAGE_AVAIL_INFO.IMAGE_LOCATION_C_NAME: The server name category ID that store images for the imaging order.
ORDER_IMAGE_AVAIL_INFO.IMG_AVAIL_YN: Indicates whether images are available at this location. 'Y' indicates that images are available. 'N' or NULL indicates that images are not available.
ORDER_IMAGE_AVAIL_INFO.IMG_AVAIL_DTTM: The updated date and time of the image availability information for the related image storage location.

ORDER_IMPRESSION._TABLE_: This table stores impression information for a procedure.
ORDER_IMPRESSION.ORDER_PROC_ID: The unique ID of the procedure order record.
ORDER_IMPRESSION.LINE: The line count for the reading physician's impression.
ORDER_IMPRESSION.IMPRESSION: The reading physician's impression for this procedure.
ORDER_IMPRESSION.ORD_DATE_REAL: This is a numeric representation of the date each order was placed in your system. The integer portion of the number specifies the date the order was placed. The digits after the decimal point indicate multiple orders on one day.
ORDER_IMPRESSION.CONTACT_DATE: The calendar date that the order was placed.

ORDER_INSTANTIATED._TABLE_: This table contains a list of orders that have been instantiated.
ORDER_INSTANTIATED.ORDER_ID: The unique ID of the order record.
ORDER_INSTANTIATED.LINE: The line count for this table as determined by the number of instantiated orders.
ORDER_INSTANTIATED.INSTNTD_ORDER_ID: The ID for the instantiated order, the child.  Note: For the case of the grandparent/parent/child scenario (Outpatient Standing order released into an Inpatient/HOV setting), this column will store the child (i.e. �grandchild�) order and the ORDER_ID column will store the parent order.  For the grandparent/parent order relationship, refer to STAND_HOV_INST_ORD.ORDER_ID (�grandparent�) and STAND_HOV_INST_ORD.STAND_INS_IP_ORD_ID (�parent�).

ORDER_MYC_INFO._TABLE_: When sharing a lab result with a web-based chart system patient, the clinician may choose to attach a Result Comment. Data for the Result Comment patient note is stored in this table.
ORDER_MYC_INFO.ORDER_PROC_ID: The unique ID of the procedure order record that is being released/unreleased.
ORDER_MYC_INFO.RELEASED_YN: Whether a result is released to a patient on MyChart.

ORDER_MYC_RELEASE._TABLE_: When a clinician (or interface) releases/unreleases a lab result to/from a web based chart system patient, tracking data for that action is stored in this table.
ORDER_MYC_RELEASE.ORDER_PROC_ID: The unique ID of the procedure order record that is released/unreleased.
ORDER_MYC_RELEASE.LINE: Since an order can be released/unreleased multiple times, the line number identifies a particular release instance.
ORDER_MYC_RELEASE.RELEASE_USER_ID: The ID of the Hyperspace user who released/unreleased the lab result to the web based chart system patient.
ORDER_MYC_RELEASE.RELEASE_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_MYC_RELEASE.RELEASE_ACTION_C_NAME: This item indicates the action taken on the lab result. The data stored is a category value. 1 corresponds to Released. 2 corresponds to Unreleased.   A null value also corresponds to Unreleased.
ORDER_MYC_RELEASE.MYC_REL_UTC_DTTM: Contains the instant when a result was released to MyChart in UTC.

ORDER_NARRATIVE._TABLE_: This table stores the narrative information resulting from a procedure.
ORDER_NARRATIVE.ORDER_PROC_ID: The unique ID of the procedure order record.
ORDER_NARRATIVE.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record
ORDER_NARRATIVE.NARRATIVE: Stores the narrative information for this order.
ORDER_NARRATIVE.ORD_DATE_REAL: This is a numeric representation of the date each order was placed in your system. The integer portion of the number specifies the date the order was placed. The digits after the decimal point indicate multiple orders on one day.
ORDER_NARRATIVE.CONTACT_DATE: The calendar date that the order was placed.
ORDER_NARRATIVE.IS_ARCHIVED_YN: Indicates whether the order narrative is archived. Y� indicates that the order narrative is archived. N� or NULL indicate that the order narrative is not archived.

ORDER_PENDING._TABLE_: This table contains information on pending orders.
ORDER_PENDING.ORDER_ID: The unique identifier for the pended order record.
ORDER_PENDING.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record
ORDER_PENDING.USER_ID: The unique ID of the user pending the order.
ORDER_PENDING.USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_PENDING.PENDED_TIME: The time an order was pended.
ORDER_PENDING.PENDED_FOR: The reason an order was pended.
ORDER_PENDING.RELEASED_USER_ID: The unique ID of the user releasing a pended medication.
ORDER_PENDING.RELEASED_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_PENDING.SH_ORDR_PROV_ID: The unique identifier of the ordering provider for a signed and held order.
ORDER_PENDING.SH_AUTH_PROV_ID: The unique identifier of the authorizing provider for this signed and held order record. A signed and held order is an order record that has been authorized but is intended for future use and is not yet active.
ORDER_PENDING.SH_ORDER_MODE_C_NAME: The verbal order mode category ID for the signed and held order, indicating the way the order was placed, e.g. telephone with readback.
ORDER_PENDING.SH_VERB_ORD_COMMENT: The comment entered by a user when creating a signed and held order.
ORDER_PENDING.SH_VRB_COMM_PROV_ID: The unique identifier of the provider who verbally received the order and entered the order record in the system.
ORDER_PENDING.SH_COSIGN_USER_ID: The unique identifier of the user responsible for providing a cosignature for the order.
ORDER_PENDING.SH_COSIGN_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_PENDING.SH_COSIGN_REQ_YN: Indicates whether this order required a cosignature. 'Y' indicates that the order required a cosignature. 'N' or NULL indicates that the order did not require a cosignature.
ORDER_PENDING.SH_VBL_CSN_NO_REQ_N: Indicates whether a rule was used to prevent generating a verbal signature requirement for the order record.
ORDER_PENDING.SH_COS_REQ_RSN_C_NAME: The signature requirement creation source category ID for the order, indicating the reason a cosignature is required for this signed and held order.

ORDER_PROC._TABLE_: The ORDER_PROC table enables you to report on the procedures ordered in the clinical system. We have also included patient and contact identification information for each record.
ORDER_PROC.ORDER_PROC_ID: The unique ID of the order record associated with this procedure order.
ORDER_PROC.PAT_ID: The unique ID of the patient record for this order. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.
ORDER_PROC.PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL: A unique, internal contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of the contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
ORDER_PROC.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across patients and encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
ORDER_PROC.RESULT_LAB_ID: The unique ID of the lab or other resulting agency, such as radiology, that provided the order results.
ORDER_PROC.ORDERING_DATE: The date when the procedure order was placed.
ORDER_PROC.ORDER_TYPE_C_NAME: The order type category number for the procedure order.
ORDER_PROC.PROC_ID: The unique ID of the  procedure record corresponding to this order. This can be used to link to CLARITY_EAP.
ORDER_PROC.DESCRIPTION: A brief summary of the procedure order.
ORDER_PROC.ORDER_CLASS_C_NAME: The order class category number of the procedure order.
ORDER_PROC.AUTHRZING_PROV_ID: The unique ID of the provider prescribing or authorizing the order.
ORDER_PROC.ABNORMAL_YN: Indicates whether or not this order contains abnormal results. This column will contain a Y if there are abnormal results and an N or null if it does not. For orders with lab component results, if any one component of this order has an abnormal result value then this will hold a Y.
ORDER_PROC.BILLING_PROV_ID: The unique ID of the provider under whose name this order should be billed. This might be the same ID as the AUTHRZING_PROV_ID.
ORDER_PROC.ORD_CREATR_USER_ID: The unique identifier of the user who signed the order, or the last person who performed a sign and hold or release action for a signed and held order.
ORDER_PROC.ORD_CREATR_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_PROC.LAB_STATUS_C_NAME: The category number for the status of results for an order, as of the date and time the record was extracted.
ORDER_PROC.ORDER_STATUS_C_NAME: The order status category number of the procedure order.
ORDER_PROC.MODIFIER1_ID: The unique ID of the modifier record.  This is the first modifier entered for the procedure and affects how the procedure is billed.
ORDER_PROC.MODIFIER1_ID_MODIFIER_NAME: The name of the modifier record.
ORDER_PROC.MODIFIER2_ID: The unique ID of the modifier record.  This is the second modifier entered for the procedure and affects how the procedure is billed.
ORDER_PROC.MODIFIER2_ID_MODIFIER_NAME: The name of the modifier record.
ORDER_PROC.MODIFIER3_ID: The unique ID of the modifier record.  This is the third modifier entered for the procedure and affects how the procedure is billed.
ORDER_PROC.MODIFIER3_ID_MODIFIER_NAME: The name of the modifier record.
ORDER_PROC.MODIFIER4_ID: The unique ID of the modifier record.  This is the fourth modifier entered for the procedure and affects how the procedure is billed.
ORDER_PROC.MODIFIER4_ID_MODIFIER_NAME: The name of the modifier record.
ORDER_PROC.QUANTITY: The number of procedures authorized for this order.
ORDER_PROC.REASON_FOR_CANC_C_NAME: The reason for cancellation category number for the procedure order.
ORDER_PROC.FUTURE_OR_STAND: This column indicates whether an order is a future (F) or standing (S) order.
ORDER_PROC.STANDING_EXP_DATE: The date when a recurring procedure order expires.
ORDER_PROC.FUT_EXPECT_COMP_DT: The date by which each future procedure order should be completed. Displayed in calendar format.
ORDER_PROC.STANDING_OCCURS: The number of individual occurrences remaining for this procedure order.
ORDER_PROC.STAND_ORIG_OCCUR: The total number of occurrences that a recurring order was authorized for.
ORDER_PROC.REFERRING_PROV_ID: The unique ID of the provider who has referred this order, i.e. the referring provider.
ORDER_PROC.REFERRING_PROV_ID_REFERRING_PROV_NAM: The name of the referral source.
ORDER_PROC.REFD_TO_LOC_ID: The unique ID of the location record to which this patient was referred.
ORDER_PROC.REFD_TO_SPECLTY_C_NAME: The category value for the medical specialty of the provider to which the patient is referred.  This field does not contain data for referral orders created within Epic.
ORDER_PROC.REQUESTED_SPEC_C_NAME: The medical specialty category number of the provider to which the patient was referred for the procedure order.
ORDER_PROC.RFL_CLASS_C_NAME: The referral class category number for the procedure order.
ORDER_PROC.RFL_TYPE_C_NAME: The referral type category number for the procedure order.
ORDER_PROC.RSN_FOR_RFL_C_NAME: The reason for referral category number for the procedure order.
ORDER_PROC.RFL_NUM_VIS: The number of visits this referral order is authorized for.
ORDER_PROC.RFL_EXPIRE_DT: The expiration date for this referral order.
ORDER_PROC.ABN_NOTE_ID: The unique ID of the notes record representing the Advanced Beneficiary Notice form associated with this order.
ORDER_PROC.RADIOLOGY_STATUS_C_NAME: The category ID for the imaging study status (e.g. technician ended the exam, reading physician finalized the exam) of the procedure order.
ORDER_PROC.INT_STUDY_C_NAME: The category ID for denoting the reason a study is worth being marked for later review, as in for an educational case or for group reading physician review.
ORDER_PROC.INT_STUDY_USER_ID: The unique ID of the employee record who denoted a study as worth being marked for later review, as in for an educational case or for group reading physician review.
ORDER_PROC.INT_STUDY_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_PROC.TECHNOLOGIST_ID: The unique ID of the employee record of the technologist who performed this procedure.
ORDER_PROC.TECHNOLOGIST_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_PROC.PROC_BGN_TIME: The date and time when the procedure order (exam) is to begin.
ORDER_PROC.RIS_TRANS_ID: The unique ID of the user record of the transcriptionist for this order.
ORDER_PROC.RIS_TRANS_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_PROC.ORDER_INST: The instant when the order was created.
ORDER_PROC.DISPLAY_NAME: The name of the order as it appears in the patient's record.
ORDER_PROC.HV_HOSPITALIST_YN: Indicates whether or not this order was placed by a hospitalist. �Y�  indicates that this order was placed by a hospitalist. �N� or NULL indicate that this order was not placed by a hospitalist.
ORDER_PROC.ORDER_PRIORITY_C_NAME: The overall priority category number for the procedure order.
ORDER_PROC.CHRG_DROPPED_TIME: The date and time when the charge was generated for the procedure order.
ORDER_PROC.PANEL_PROC_ID: The unique ID of the panel procedure record associated with this order.
ORDER_PROC.STAND_INTERVAL: The time interval set for a recurring order, indicating the time between one instance of the order and the next instance.
ORDER_PROC.DISCRETE_INTERVAL_NAME: The discrete interval for the order.  This is extracted as the category title.
ORDER_PROC.INSTANTIATED_TIME: The date and time of instantiation when a child order is generated from a standing or future order.
ORDER_PROC.INSTNTOR_USER_ID: The unique ID of the user who instantiated the order.
ORDER_PROC.INSTNTOR_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_PROC.DEPT_REF_PROV_ID: The unique ID of the department to which this order is referred.
ORDER_PROC.SPECIALTY_DEP_C_NAME: The category value for the requested medical specialty of the department to which the patient is referred.
ORDER_PROC.SPECIMEN_TYPE_C_NAME: The specimen type category number for the procedure order.
ORDER_PROC.SPECIMEN_SOURCE_C_NAME: The source category number for the procedure order.
ORDER_PROC.ORDER_TIME: The date and time when the procedure order was placed.
ORDER_PROC.RESULT_TIME: The most recent date and time when the procedure order was resulted.
ORDER_PROC.IS_PENDING_ORD_YN: Indicates whether or not the order has a pending status. 'Y' indicates that the order has a pending status. 'N' or NULL indicates that the order does not have a pending status.
ORDER_PROC.PROC_START_TIME: The date and time when the procedure order is to start.
ORDER_PROC.PROBLEM_LIST_ID: The unique ID of the problem list record that is associated with this order. This column is mainly used for immunization orders.
ORDER_PROC.RSLTS_INTERPRETER: The name of the principal results interpreter, the person who reviewed and interpreted the results.
ORDER_PROC.PROC_ENDING_TIME: The date and time when the procedure order is to end.
ORDER_PROC.SPECIFIED_FIRST_TM: The first occurrence time specified by a user, if the order was signed with a frequency record containing a schedule of specified dates and times.
ORDER_PROC.SCHED_START_TM: This column stores the scheduling start instant used when the order was last scheduled.
ORDER_PROC.SESSION_KEY: The unique key associated with the order at the time of signing.  Other orders will share this key if they were signed at the same time.
ORDER_PROC.LABCORP_BILL_TYPE_C_NAME: The reference lab bill type category ID for the order record, indicating how reference labs should bill for services performed.
ORDER_PROC.LABCORP_CLIENT_ID: The client ID or account ID assigned by the reference lab.
ORDER_PROC.LABCORP_CONTROL_NUM: Required information for LabCorp requisition and order messages.
ORDER_PROC.CHNG_ORDER_PROC_ID: The unique ID of the changed or reordered procedure order that this procedure replaced. This column is frequently used to link back to ORDER_PROC table.

ORDER_PROC_2._TABLE_: The ORDER_PROC_2 table enables you to report on the procedures ordered in the clinical system. This procedure table has the same basic structure as ORDER_PROC, but was created as a second table to prevent ORDER_PROC from getting any larger.
ORDER_PROC_2.ORDER_PROC_ID: The unique ID of the procedure order record.
ORDER_PROC_2.PROV_ID: The unique ID of the reading physician of the exam.
ORDER_PROC_2.MOD_BEGIN_TM: For procedures performed on modalities using Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine (DICOM), this stores the start date & time of the performed procedure sent from the modality to system.
ORDER_PROC_2.MOD_END_TM: For procedures performed on modalities using Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine (DICOM), this stores the end date & time of the performed procedure sent from the modality to system.
ORDER_PROC_2.OVERRIDE_TM: Stores the most recent time a hard stop was overridden at begin or end exam in radiology
ORDER_PROC_2.RVSN_RSN_C_NAME: The revision reason category number for the order. This depicts the reason that a radiology transcriptionist marked a study as needing revision.
ORDER_PROC_2.CHANGE_REASON_C_NAME: The change status reason category ID for the order, which indicates the reason given for reverting an order to a previous radiology status.
ORDER_PROC_2.CHANGE_CMT: Stores the comment given for reverting an order to a previous radiology status.
ORDER_PROC_2.STUDY_INSTANCE: This column stores the unique identifier for an instance of a DICOM imaging study.
ORDER_PROC_2.CHARGE_TM: The date and time a charge was generated by ending a radiology exam.
ORDER_PROC_2.GRP_ORDER_PROC_ID: The unique identifier of the master procedure record used for grouped imaging orders.
ORDER_PROC_2.BALANCE_ADJ_YN: Stores whether the balance for supplies/drugs is already adjusted.
ORDER_PROC_2.IMAGE_LOCATION_C_NAME: Stores the category ID of the PACS (picture archiving and communication) system has the images for a radiology order.
ORDER_PROC_2.IMAGES_AVAIL_YN: Stores whether images are available via PACS (picture archiving and communication system) for a radiology order. 'Y' indicates that the images are available, 'N' and NULL indicate that the images are not available.
ORDER_PROC_2.PAT_LOC_ID: The unique identifier of the department where the patient is located at the time this order was signed,
ORDER_PROC_2.ACT_ORDER_C_NAME: The active order category ID, which indicates information about the order status.
ORDER_PROC_2.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
ORDER_PROC_2.LET_EOD_PRNT_DATE: The date a letter will be created and printed for this order. This is cleared after the letter has been created and printed.
ORDER_PROC_2.ORDER_SOURCE_C_NAME: The order source category ID of the order, indicating where in the EHR the order was entered.
ORDER_PROC_2.SPECIMN_TAKEN_DATE: The date the specimen was taken.
ORDER_PROC_2.SPECIMN_TAKEN_TIME: The time the specimen was taken.
ORDER_PROC_2.LET_EXPIRE_USER_ID: The ID of the user who marked order as Let Expire.
ORDER_PROC_2.LET_EXPIRE_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_PROC_2.TIME_LET_EXPIRE: The time when the physician marked the order as Let Expire.
ORDER_PROC_2.EXP_AFT_START_TIME: The date and time an order will be marked as needing review by a physician, based on a defined period of time after the order starts.
ORDER_PROC_2.EXP_BEF_END_TIME: The date and time an order will be labeled as expiring, based on a defined period of time before the order's end time.
ORDER_PROC_2.ORD_COPIED_C_NAME: The order copy status category ID, indicating whether the order was copied to another visit.
ORDER_PROC_2.REV_ORD_GRANU_YN: Determines if an order is reviewed by day or by instant.
ORDER_PROC_2.EXP_DAYS_YN: Indicates whether the amount of time determining when an order will expire is in measured in days or instants. '0' indicates that the expiration time is in a number of hours. '1' indicates the expiration time is in a number of days or weeks.
ORDER_PROC_2.CHRG_METHOD_ID: The unique identifier of the charge trigger method associated with the order.
ORDER_PROC_2.CHRG_METHOD_ID_CHRG_METHOD_NAME: The name of the charge trigger method.
ORDER_PROC_2.SPECIMEN_COMMENTS: This free text item is used to store comments about the specimen source.
ORDER_PROC_2.SPECIMEN_RECV_DATE: This item stores the date that the specimen was received. It is in the same logical group as the SPECIMEN_RECV_TIME column.
ORDER_PROC_2.SPECIMEN_RECV_TIME: This item stores the time the specimen was received. It is in the same logical group as the SPECIMEN_RECV_DATE column.
ORDER_PROC_2.COLLECTOR_IDN: The name of the user who collected the specimen for the order.
ORDER_PROC_2.COLLECTOR_USER_ID: The unique identifier of the user who collected the specimen for the order.
ORDER_PROC_2.COLLECTOR_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_PROC_2.FUTURE_APPROX_DT_YN: Indicates whether there is an approximate future expected date for this order. 'Y' indicates there is an approximate future expected date. 'N' or NULL indicates that there is not an approximate future expected date.
ORDER_PROC_2.LAST_STAND_PERF_DT: The date on which a standing order was last performed.
ORDER_PROC_2.LAST_STAND_PERF_TM: The time at which a standing order was last performed.
ORDER_PROC_2.PERFORMING_DEPT_ID: The unique identifier of the department where the order was performed.
ORDER_PROC_2.ORIGINAL_ORD_ID: When an order record is created as the result of a procedure change workflow, it stores a pointer to the previous order. To reliably find the original order record, refer to ORDER_PROC_5.ORIGINATING_ORD_ID
ORDER_PROC_2.EXTERNAL_ORD_ID: Stores the external order ID for the order.
ORDER_PROC_2.REMARKS_HNO_ID: Stores the link to the general notes record containing the result remarks. It is networked to General Use Notes record.
ORDER_PROC_2.SER_ADDRESSID: Stores the referring provider address ID for referral orders. The format is provider external ID - Address line number. For example, if provider external ID = 123 and Address line = 4, the value would be 123-4. If the referring provider has no address, this will store the provider external ID only.  Other columns in the same logical group are: REFG_FACILITY_ID (ORD 3010), REFD_TO_PROV_ID(ORD 3100) and REFERRAL_ID (ORD 3300)
ORDER_PROC_2.REFG_FACILITY_ID: Stores the referring facility for referral orders. This is networked to the facility record. Other columns in the same logical group are: SER_ADDRESSID (ORD 3001), REFD_TO_PROV_ID(ORD 3100) and REFERRAL_ID (ORD 3300)
ORDER_PROC_2.REFD_TO_PROV_ID: The unique ID of the provider referred to for a referral order. Other columns in the same logical group are: SER_ADDRESSID (ORD 3001), REFG_FACILITY_ID (ORD 3010) and REFERRAL_ID (ORD 3300)
ORDER_PROC_2.REFERRAL_ID: Stores the associated referral ID for referral orders. Other columns in the same logical group are: SER_ADDRESSID (ORD 3001), REFG_FACILITY_ID (ORD 3010) and REFD_TO_PROV_ID(ORD 3100)
ORDER_PROC_2.LAST_RESULT_UPD_TM: The date and time of the last result date. This item is set based on a time stamp received in the interface. It is also set when results are manually entered or when an order is cancelled.
ORDER_PROC_2.COLLECTION_DEPT_ID: The unique identifier of the department where the specimen was collected.
ORDER_PROC_2.USER_ID_OF_PROV: The unique identifier for the authorizing provider of the order record.
ORDER_PROC_2.LOGIN_DEP_ID: The unique identifier for the login department used by the user signing the order.
ORDER_PROC_2.PERFS_FILED_INST: The date and time the order was performed.
ORDER_PROC_2.CHGS_FILED_INST: The date and time that charges were filed.
ORDER_PROC_2.NOCHG_REASON_C_NAME: Contains the reason that no charges were linked to the order.
ORDER_PROC_2.ORD_PRV_ROUT_MTHD_C_NAME: This item stores the routing method for the ordering provider
ORDER_PROC_2.ORD_PRV_ROUT_ADDR: The address of the ordering provider which will be used to receive the results of this order.
ORDER_PROC_2.RIS_SIGN_AGAIN_R_YN: Indicates whether multi-discipline studies will be sent back to previous signers for review if the result text has been changed for this order. Yes indicates that studies will be sent back. No or Null will indicate that studies will not be sent back. The data is automatically populated when an imaging study reaches Exam Ended or Exam Begun from the value in field "Sign Again if Result Text Changed" in the Radiology/Cardiology Options 3 screen of the linked procedure. If that is null then we look at the same field in the procedure category or the Study review node of the Imaging System Definitions. Users can change the original value by changing the same field in the advanced mode of the Assign Activity.
ORDER_PROC_2.ABN_WAIVER_SIGN_YN: Indicates whether an Advanced Beneficiary Notice waiver form was signed by the patient in the event that the service to be performed was denied by Medicare.
ORDER_PROC_2.CHECK_OUT_COMMENT: The check-out comments entered on the order.
ORDER_PROC_2.RQG_ID: The unique ID of patient and coverage information for non-participatory lab referrals attached to this order.  If this is filled in, then PAT_ID and related columns in the ORDER_PROC table will not be filled in for this order.  This column is frequently used to link to the RQG_DB_MAIN table.
ORDER_PROC_2.SITE_OF_COLLECT_C_NAME: The site of collection category number for the location on patient in which the specimen was drawn.
ORDER_PROC_2.LAB_CANCEL_REQ_ID: The unique ID of the user who requested to cancel the order.
ORDER_PROC_2.LAB_CANCEL_REQ_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_PROC_2.PROTCL_STAT_DT: The date an unscheduled order was placed, or the appointment date for a scheduled order which requires a protocol.
ORDER_PROC_2.PROTCL_STATE_C_NAME: The scheduling status for an order which requires a protocol.  This column links to the ZC_PROTCL_STATE table.
ORDER_PROC_2.LAB_CHG_TRG_YN: Indicates whether a charge was triggered in lab.
ORDER_PROC_2.LAB_ACCOUNT_ID: The unique ID of the order level account record override associated with this order.
ORDER_PROC_2.LAB_COVERAGE_ID: The unique ID of the order level coverage record associated with this order.
ORDER_PROC_2.LAB_DONT_BIL_INS_YN: Indicates whether insurance should be billed for this order. 'Y' indicates that insurance should not be billed. 'N' or NULL indicates that insurance should be billed.
ORDER_PROC_2.USER_CONTEXT_C_NAME: Assigns an order a category ID with a user's context. The order can be used for or created for procedure orders.
ORDER_PROC_2.EFQ_OVRD_DAY_TYPE: The items indicate the override values for cycle length and day type (relative vs weekdays). Specifies what the numeric values in the frequency override days columns represent. If it is 1 then the listed days are relative days. If it is 2 then the listed days are weekdays. Any other value has no meaning.
ORDER_PROC_2.EFQ_OVRD_CYCL_LEN: If there is a frequency override specified, this item will contain the length of the relative specified frequency cycle (e.g. hours, days)
ORDER_PROC_2.CHART_CORRECTION_ID: The unique identifier of the chart correction audit record for the order.
ORDER_PROC_2.PARENT_CE_ORDER_ID: When a cross-encounter order is released, this item stores the ID of the parent order.
ORDER_PROC_2.CONDITIONAL_C_NAME: The inpatient conditional order category ID for the order, indicating whether this order should be conditionally initiated.
ORDER_PROC_2.COND_STATUS_C_NAME: The inpatient conditional status category ID for the order, indicating whether the conditions for the order to be initiated have been satisfied yet.
ORDER_PROC_2.INTERFACE_YN: Indicates whether this order was resulted through an interface or not. Y indicates that the result came through an interface, N indicates it was not resulted through an interface but rather some other result mechanism or not resulted at all.
ORDER_PROC_2.CASE_PANEL_NUM: The surgical panel that this order is associated with.
ORDER_PROC_2.IS_SAVED_ORDER_YN: Indicates whether an order has a status of saved. A "Yes" value indicates that the order is in a status of saved. A null value indicates that the order is not in a status of saved. A "No" value will not be populated for this column.
ORDER_PROC_2.OVRD_TASK_TEMP_ID: Contains the override task template ID for overriddem anchored orders, orders attached to a time (for example, a pregnant woman's delivery date).
ORDER_PROC_2.OVRD_TASK_TEMP_ID_RECORD_NAME: This column displays the name of the task template record.
ORDER_PROC_2.SOURCE_OF_PRI_INS_C_NAME: The source of prioritized date category ID for the order record. Prioritized date is determined by the following hierarchy: collection date and time, result date and time, release date and time (for future and standing orders), order date and time, and encounter date.
ORDER_PROC_2.PRIORITIZED_INST_TM: The time and date that is used as the prioritized date.
ORDER_PROC_2.ORDER_QUESN_LIST: The list of question records associated with this order.
ORDER_PROC_2.HOME_CARE_TYPE_C_NAME: This item stores the type of home care episode the order should create if it is a home care referral order.
ORDER_PROC_2.SPECIMEN_BARCODE: Stores the barcode data scanned during specimen collection.

ORDER_PROC_3._TABLE_: The ORDER_PROC_3 table enables you to report on the procedures ordered in the clinical system. This procedure table has the same basic structure as ORDER_PROC, but was created as a third table to prevent ORDER_PROC_2 from getting any larger.
ORDER_PROC_3.ORDER_ID: The unique identifier for the order record.
ORDER_PROC_3.MAMMO_OUTCOME_C_NAME: This column stores the outcome (e.g. FP/FN/TP/FN/etc) for a mammography study. This column is used to link to the ZC_MAMMO_OUTCOME table.
ORDER_PROC_3.OLD_RAD_STAT_C_NAME: This stores the category ID for the imaging study status (e.g. technician ended the exam, reading physician finalized the exam) before the order was canceled. This will only be populated for canceled imaging orders. This column is used to link to the ZC_RADIOLOGY_STS table.
ORDER_PROC_3.TRANSCRIPTIONIST: The transcriptionist of an external order result coming through the transcription interface.
ORDER_PROC_3.ORDERING_MODE_C_NAME: This indicates whether an order is an inpatient or outpatient order. Note that Outpatient orders can be placed from an Inpatient encounter as discharge orders. This column might be blank for Outpatient orders placed prior to the creation of the IP module. This column is used to link to the ZC_ORDERING_MODE table.
ORDER_PROC_3.PROV_STATUS_C_NAME: The provider status category number for the order at the time of the extract. This item reflects the providers' viewed status of the order result message.  The amount, frequency and type of data stored in this item depends on the programming point records entered into the results message type definition in use at each facility. This column is used to link to the ZC_PROV_STATUS table.
ORDER_PROC_3.RESULT_TYPE_C_NAME: The result type category number for the order, if noted. A null value indicates that it is normal order results. This column is used to link to the ZC_ORD_RESULT_TYPE table.
ORDER_PROC_3.RFL_PRIORITY_C_NAME: The priority level category number of a referral order, which is used to specify whether a referral order is routine, urgent, emergency or elective. This column is used to link to the ZC_RFL_PRIORITY table.
ORDER_PROC_3.REFLEX_ORDER_ID: The order ID from which this reflex order was created.
ORDER_PROC_3.ORD_TRANS_METHOD_C_NAME: This item holds the method of transmission for a given order.  It should only be set from a property within an order transmittal rule.
ORDER_PROC_3.NUM_SIG_REQ: The number of physician signatures required to move the study status to final within the procedural applications.
ORDER_PROC_3.STAT_COMP_USER_ID: The ID of the user who marked an inpatient procedure as 'Complete'
ORDER_PROC_3.STAT_COMP_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_PROC_3.STAT_COMP_DTTM: The time and date that an inpatient procedure was marked as 'Complete'
ORDER_PROC_3.IS_EXT_READ_YN: This item indicates whether this order is for an external read of an imaging study. A null value should be assumed to be No.
ORDER_PROC_3.PENDDC_STATUS_C_NAME: Status of an order if the order is pending discontinue.
ORDER_PROC_3.AUTOINTK_COMPL_YN: This item contains whether an auto-intake has been completed for the order.
ORDER_PROC_3.RESULT_LOCATION_C_NAME: This item indicates which order item the result is stored.
ORDER_PROC_3.STAND_EOW_ID: Holds the ID number of the Standing Status In Basket message associated with this Order.  The In Basket message informs the user that a standing order exists.
ORDER_PROC_3.INPAT_DISC_INTER_ID: This item stores the interval at which a standing order should be released for inpatient orders.
ORDER_PROC_3.INPAT_DISC_INTER_ID_FREQ_NAME: The name of the frequency record.
ORDER_PROC_3.INPAT_AUTO_RLSE_YN: This item indicates whether child instances of a standing order should be automatically released for inpatient orders.
ORDER_PROC_3.LAB_CRT_CNCT_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for the contact that was created from this order. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
ORDER_PROC_3.LAST_OVERALL_ASMT_C_NAME: The most recent overall mammography assessment for the order. This should be the same as the most recent value for ORDER_RAD_ASMT.ASSESSMENT_C. This column is used to link to the ZC_ASSESSMENT table.
ORDER_PROC_3.REVENUE_CODE_ID: The revenue code associated with the service.
ORDER_PROC_3.REVENUE_CODE_ID_REVENUE_CODE_NAME: The name of the revenue code.
ORDER_PROC_3.UNITS_REQUESTED: The number of units requested for the service.
ORDER_PROC_3.UNITS_APPROVED: The number of units approved for the service.
ORDER_PROC_3.TOTAL_PRICE: The total price of the service.
ORDER_PROC_3.PATIENT_PORTION: The amount or portion the patient will have to pay for the service they are being referred for.
ORDER_PROC_3.AUTH_REQUIRED: This column stores whether or not authorization is required for the service.
ORDER_PROC_3.NET_PAYABLE: The net payable of the service.
ORDER_PROC_3.NOT_COVERED: This item indicates whether or not the service is covered.
ORDER_PROC_3.COMMENT_WITH_CANCEL: Comment entered while cancelling an order.
ORDER_PROC_3.SOFT_DEL_FLAG: Soft deletion flag for order records associated with order-based transcriptions, which were deleted by the transcription soft-deletion utility.
ORDER_PROC_3.RESULT_TRACK_STS_C_NAME: This stores whether follow-up with recipients is required, in progress, or completed. This status is the per-order, see RESULT_TRACK_RECIP for individual recipient result tracking statuses.
ORDER_PROC_3.ORD_PHASE_OF_CARE_C_NAME: This item will store the phase of care for which this order was created. Example: Pre-Op, Intra-Op, PACU.
ORDER_PROC_3.REQUESTED_DATETIME: The requested date and time. The items extracted to this column are populated by the Cadence Orders Interface.
ORDER_PROC_3.ORX_ID: Contains an ID from Order Lookup Index. This may be populated if an order originates from an Order Panel.
ORDER_PROC_3.ORX_ID_ORDER_LOOKUP_NAME: The name (.2 item) for the order panel record.
ORDER_PROC_3.RELEASED_INSTA_DTTM: Stores the scheduled instant of the child order.
ORDER_PROC_3.LAST_SCHE_INST_DTTM: This item stores the inpatient order's last scheduled instant.
ORDER_PROC_3.COPY_POINTER_ID: This object tracks order record links created when using the inpatient or ambulatory order mover utilities to move an order record. This item is populated on the source order record and points to the target order record(s) created.
ORDER_PROC_3.AFTER_ORDER_ID: This column contains the After Order ID for an order after Order Transmittal.
ORDER_PROC_3.BEFORE_ORDER_ID: This column contains the Before Order ID for an order before Order Transmittal.
ORDER_PROC_3.DIET_COMMENTS: This column contains the Diet Comments entered for an order.
ORDER_PROC_3.ORD_CONDITION_FLAG: This column contains the a Condition Flag if this is an order created from certain condition.
ORDER_PROC_3.COR_AFTR_FINAL_DTTM: The date and time when the study was corrected and finalized.
ORDER_PROC_3.IS_HELD_ORDER_C_NAME: This item stores 1 if the order is signed and held and active
ORDER_PROC_3.NOCHRG_EXT_RSLT_YN: This column returns whether the order is an external result that should not drop charges. A value of 1 returns Y. A value of 0 returns N. A null value will return null but is treated the same as 0 when dropping charges.
ORDER_PROC_3.PROTOCOL_STATUS_C_NAME: Contains the current status of the order's protocols. Will be used to determine how to populate the protocol work list.
ORDER_PROC_3.PROTCL_ASGN_POOL_ID: If an order's protocol has been assigned to a pool, this item contains the pool ID of the assigned pool.
ORDER_PROC_3.PROTCL_ASGN_POOL_ID_POOL_NAME: The name of the scheduling pool used when searching for available providers for an appointment.
ORDER_PROC_3.PROTCL_ASGN_PROV_ID: If an order's protocol has been assigned to a provider, this item contains the provider ID of the assigned provider.

ORDER_PROC_4._TABLE_: The ORDER_PROC_4 table enables you to report on the procedures ordered in the clinical system. This procedure table has the same basic structure as ORDER_PROC, but was created as a fourth table to prevent ORDER_PROC_3 from getting any larger.
ORDER_PROC_4.ORDER_ID: The unique ID of the order record for this row.
ORDER_PROC_4.LAST_MAMMO_ORD_ID: The last breast procedure that was performed on this patient prior to this order.
ORDER_PROC_4.LAST_MAMMO_LOC_ID: Where the last breast procedure was performed. If it was performed by the current organization, this field will be empty
ORDER_PROC_4.LAST_MAMMO_PROC_NAM: The last breast procedure that was performed. This field allows you to freely specify a procedure name in case it was performed outside the organization.
ORDER_PROC_4.LAST_MAMMO_DATE: The date when the last breast procedure was performed.
ORDER_PROC_4.LAST_MAMMO_WEIGHT: The patient's weight (oz.) at the last breast procedure.
ORDER_PROC_4.EXAM_MAMMO_WEIGHT: The patient's weight (oz.) at the time of this procedure.
ORDER_PROC_4.LAST_MAM_WT_RECD_DT: The date when the weight at last breast procedure was recorded.
ORDER_PROC_4.EXAM_MAM_WT_RECD_DT: The date when patient's current weight was recorded.
ORDER_PROC_4.MAM_HX_REVD_USER_ID: The last person to review the last breast procedure information.
ORDER_PROC_4.MAM_HX_REVD_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_PROC_4.MAMMO_BASELINE_YN: Whether or not this is the patient's first breast procedure.
ORDER_PROC_4.LAST_MAMMO_EXT_YN: Whether the last breast procedure was done externally.
ORDER_PROC_4.MAM_WT_CHNG_RECD_DT: The date the patient's weight change was recorded.
ORDER_PROC_4.MAM_HORMONE_NONE_YN: Whether the patient has no mammography-relevant hormone history, documented by the tech in the visit navigator.
ORDER_PROC_4.MAMMO_HX_REVD_DTTM: The instant the last breast procedure information was reviewed.
ORDER_PROC_4.MAM_HORMNE_REV_U_ID: The last user to review the hormone history.
ORDER_PROC_4.MAM_HORMNE_REV_U_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_PROC_4.MAM_HORMNE_REV_DTTM: The instant the hormone history was last reviewed.
ORDER_PROC_4.BREAST_SELF_EXAM_C_NAME: The category ID that indicates whether or not a patient performs breast self-exams, which map to Yes, No, or N/A.
ORDER_PROC_4.RIS_LTR_NOT_NEED_YN: Indicates whether a study is marked as not needing a mammography result letter. 'Y' indicates a study has been marked as not needing a result letter.
ORDER_PROC_4.REQ_PER_PERIOD: Requested units/visits per period.  This along with the Requested periods (REQ_PERIODS) determines the total 'requested units'.
ORDER_PROC_4.REQ_FREQ_C_NAME: The category ID for the frequency of visits/units requested for the procedure (e.g. day, week, month, year).
ORDER_PROC_4.REQ_PERIODS: Requested periods. Requested units per period (REQ_PER_PERIOD) along with the requested periods determines the total 'requested units'.
ORDER_PROC_4.APPR_PER_PERIOD: Approved units/visits per period. This along with the approved periods (APPR_PERIODS) determines the total 'approved units'.
ORDER_PROC_4.APPR_FREQ_C_NAME: The category ID for the frequency of visits/units approved for the procedure (e.g. day, week, month, year).
ORDER_PROC_4.APPR_PERIODS: Approved periods.  Also known as duration. Approved units per period (APPR_PER_PERIOD) along with the approved periods determines the total 'approved units'.
ORDER_PROC_4.PROC_LNC_ID: LOINC ID associated with the procedure.
ORDER_PROC_4.ABNORMAL_NOADD_YN: Indicates whether the most recent result is abnormal. 'Y' indicates that the most recent update of the result was marked abnormal. 'N' indicates that the abnormal flag is not set, or marked as normal. This is set to 'N' when a result is in progress, and will be updated as result updates are filed.
ORDER_PROC_4.NUM_IMGS_PERFORMED: The number of images performed by a tech during the imaging exam linked to this order. This number is a total for the exam and includes images done on other procedures linked to the same appointment.
ORDER_PROC_4.IPROC_STATUS_C_NAME: The imaging and procedure status category ID of an order.
ORDER_PROC_4.SPEC_DRAW_TYPE_C_NAME: The specimen draw type category ID for the order.
ORDER_PROC_4.ANTICOAG_INR_GOAL_C_NAME: The International Normalized Ratio (INR) goal category ID for a patient on anticoagulation therapy.
ORDER_PROC_4.ANTICOAG_RESP_POOL_ID: Pool of providers responsible for a patient on anticoagulation therapy.
ORDER_PROC_4.ANTICOAG_RESP_POOL_ID_REGISTRY_NAME: The name of the In Basket registry in the HIP master file.
ORDER_PROC_4.ANTICOAG_NEXT_INR_DT: The date of the next International Normalized Ratio (INR) check for a patient on anticoagulation therapy.
ORDER_PROC_4.ANTICOAG_WEEKLY_MAX_DOSE: Weekly maximum dose of anticoagulant for a patient on anticoagulation therapy.
ORDER_PROC_4.ANTICOAG_TARGET_END_DT: Targeted end date for the patient's anticoagulation therapy.
ORDER_PROC_4.ANTICOAG_INDEFINITE_YN: Indicates whether a patient is indefinitely on anticoagulation. 'Y' indicates anticoagulation is indefinite (no end date set for anticoagulation).
ORDER_PROC_4.IPROC_STATUS_INST_DTTM: The instant of the last Imaging and Procedure (IProc) status update of an order.
ORDER_PROC_4.SCREENING_FORM_ID: The unique ID of the screening form linked to the order.
ORDER_PROC_4.SUBMITTER_ID: The unique ID of the external site (submitter) associated with the order. The submitter will typically be copied on results, and could also be billed (depending on configuration).
ORDER_PROC_4.SUBMITTER_ID_RECORD_NAME: The name of the submitter record.
ORDER_PROC_4.INDICATION_COMMENTS: The comment entered for the indications of use for this order.
ORDER_PROC_4.COLL_END_DT: This is the end date for an observation. This typically equates to the end date of a specimen collection or the end date of a procedure.
ORDER_PROC_4.COLL_END_TM: This is the end time for an observation. This typically equates to the end time of a specimen collection or the end time of a procedure.
ORDER_PROC_4.COLL_AMT: The amount of specimen that was collected. The identifier for the units for this amount are in COLL_AMT_UNIT_ID.
ORDER_PROC_4.COLL_AMT_UNIT_ID: The unique identifier for unit of the specimen collection amount (COLL_AMT) for this order.
ORDER_PROC_4.DEST_ANCILLARY_C_NAME: The ancillary category ID for the destination ancillary that is responsible for this order.
ORDER_PROC_4.REF_TO_PROV_ADDR_ID: Address selected for the referred-to provider. Format: {External provider ID}-{Address Line #}
ORDER_PROC_4.REFLEX_SOURCE_C_NAME: The reflex source category ID for the order.
ORDER_PROC_4.BREAST_IMG_TYPE_C_NAME: The imaging type category ID used to indicate whether standard imaging only, or standard plus additional imaging, was performed. Category values used for the NMD 3.0 extract.
ORDER_PROC_4.SCHED_DUR: The amount of time (in minutes) the order will contribute to an appointment
ORDER_PROC_4.SCHED_DUR_IS_CALC_YN: Indicates whether the scheduling duration was calculated by the system. 'Y' indicates it was calculated by the system. 'N' or NULL indicate it was not.
ORDER_PROC_4.SCHED_DUR_BUFFER: The amount of time (in minutes) that should be added to system calculated scheduling duration as a buffer.
ORDER_PROC_4.SCHED_TOL_BEF: How far before the expected date for the order the appointment can still be safely made.
ORDER_PROC_4.SCHED_TOL_AFTR: How long after the expected date for the order the appointment can still be safely made.
ORDER_PROC_4.SCHED_TOL_NO_RESTR_BEF_YN: Indicates if the No restriction checkbox is checked for scheduling tolerance before the expected treatment date for a schedulable procedure. 'Y' indicates there are no restrictions.
ORDER_PROC_4.SCHED_TOL_NO_RESTR_AFTR_YN: Indicates if the No restriction checkbox is checked for scheduling tolerance after the expected treatment date for a schedulable procedure. 'Y' indicates there are no restrictions.
ORDER_PROC_4.PROTOCOLLED_ORD_ID: For an order that was placed from an imaging protocol, this item contains the protocolled imaging procedure order from which the order was placed. This item can be used to help associate contrast, medication, and point-of-care lab test orders with the protocolled procedure orders for which they were placed.
ORDER_PROC_4.PROTOCOL_SOURCE_ID: This item stores a pointer to the last order record that had its protocol edited by a user. When a protocol is edited this item should be populated on the order record that was edited. When a protocol is copied forward to another order record, this item should be populated on the destination order.
ORDER_PROC_4.FINAL_APPROVAL_YN: Whether final approval has been received for a procedure. If Yes, more approval does not need to be obtained. This item is used primarily for reporting purposes.

ORDER_PROC_5._TABLE_: The ORDER_PROC_5 table enables you to report on the procedures ordered in the clinical system. This procedure table has the same basic structure as ORDER_PROC, but was created as a fifth table to prevent ORDER_PROC_4 from getting any larger.
ORDER_PROC_5.ORDER_ID: The unique identifier for the order record.
ORDER_PROC_5.FUTURE_RELATIVE_EXPECTED_DT_C_NAME: Holds a category value for the expected completion date. This may be subtly different from the expected date (ORDER_PROC.FUT_EXPECT_COMP_DT) for things like "in 3 months", which could be Start Date+90 days (S+90), Start date+91 days (S+91), or Start date + 92 days (S+92) depending on the current date.
ORDER_PROC_5.FUTURE_EXPECTED_DATE_COMMENT_C_NAME: Holds a category value for the comment part of expected date. This will include categories based on scheduling comments like "Before Surgery", "After Consult", etc.
ORDER_PROC_5.FUTURE_EXPECTED_DATE_DETAILS: This item holds the free-text details entered if the future expected date comment (FUTURE_EXPECTED_DATE_COMMENT_C) is "Other (Specify)".
ORDER_PROC_5.MODIFY_TRACK_C_NAME: Flag used to denote if the order was modified or reordered.
ORDER_PROC_5.INCOMPLETE_CHILD_ORDERS: Store the number of child orders which have not yet reached completed/canceled status. meaning they are either not yet released or are currently active.
ORDER_PROC_5.ORDER_INST_UTC_DTTM: The instant when the order was created in UTC.
ORDER_PROC_5.MINUTES_BTWN_SCHED_AND_COLL: The number of minutes between the scheduled and collected instants for a lab. Negative values indicate early collection.
ORDER_PROC_5.APPT_WINDOW_START_TIME: This is the start of the appointment window for the preferred appointment window.
ORDER_PROC_5.OVERREAD_SRC_ORD_ID: Stores the order record ID that is marked for imaging overread.
ORDER_PROC_5.APPT_WINDOW_END_TIME: This is the end of the appointment window for the preferred appointment window.
ORDER_PROC_5.PROC_ESTIMATE_ID: A link to a patient estimate record that contains patient cost estimate information for procedure orders.
ORDER_PROC_5.SHOULD_GENERATE_PAT_EST_YN: A flag used for pended orders that indicates that the order should generate a patient estimate record when it is fully signed.
ORDER_PROC_5.FINANCIAL_CLEARANCE_STATUS_C_NAME: Records the financial clearance status of an order
ORDER_PROC_5.FINANCIAL_CLEARANCE_UTC_DTTM: Records the UTC instant an order was financially cleared
ORDER_PROC_5.FNDAVTR_DOC_INFO_ID: Stores the Document ID of the image for the findings avatar
ORDER_PROC_5.IMG_PUBLIC_RSLT_DTTM: The instant in local time at which the imaging result was made public, as defined by the order's study status (e.g. physician finalized the exam) as configured by the imaging analyst team (I RDF 192).
ORDER_PROC_5.ORDER_RECEIVED_DTTM: The date and time the order was received.
