ORDER_PROC_5.ACTV_EXCLUDE_FROM_CDS_REASON_C_NAME: The Exclude From Decision Support reason for the order. It will be either 1 - Unsuccessful Attempt represents an order that was not successfully completed. or 2 - Documented on Wrong Patient represents the order's result information was documented on the incorrect patient.
ORDER_PROC_5.ACTV_EXCLUDE_FROM_CDS_UTC_DTTM: The instance in UTC when the "Exclude From Decision Support" was updated on the order record.
ORDER_PROC_5.ACTV_EXCLUDE_FROM_CDS_DTTM: The instance when the "Exclude From Decision Support" was updated on the order record.
ORDER_PROC_5.LEAVE_TYPE_C_NAME: The type of medical leave being ordered.
ORDER_PROC_5.LEAVE_START_DATE: Start date of the medical leave.
ORDER_PROC_5.LEAVE_END_DATE: End date of the medical leave.
ORDER_PROC_5.LEAVE_DURATION: Duration of the medical leave in days.
ORDER_PROC_5.LEAVE_LIGHTDUTY_YN: Whether the medical leave also has a light duty period.
ORDER_PROC_5.LEAVE_LIGHTDUTY_START_DATE: Start date of the light duty period.
ORDER_PROC_5.LEAVE_LIGHTDUTY_END_DATE: End date of the light duty period.
ORDER_PROC_5.LEAVE_LIGHTDUTY_DURATION: Duration of the light duty period in days.
ORDER_PROC_5.LEAVE_EXCUSED_ACTIVITIES_YN: Whether the patient should be excused from doing specific activities during the leave.
ORDER_PROC_5.LEAVE_EXCUSED_START_DATE: Start date of the excused activities period.
ORDER_PROC_5.LEAVE_EXCUSED_END_DATE: End date of the excuse period.
ORDER_PROC_5.LEAVE_EXCUSED_DURATION: Duration of the excuse period in days.
ORDER_PROC_5.LEAVE_EXCUSED_COMMENTS: Comments about the excused activities for the excuse period.
ORDER_PROC_5.DELIVERY_REQUEST_ORDER_ID: The order ID of the blood component order this order record is requesting a delivery from.
ORDER_PROC_5.DELIVERY_REQUEST_AMOUNT: The number of units being requested from the blood component order record.
ORDER_PROC_5.ORIGINATING_ORD_ID: This column contains the originating order ID. It is related conceptually to ORDER_PROC_2.ORIGINAL_ORDER_ID, but rather than pointing back to the previous order ID at the same level in the order tree hierarchy, this column will point back to the initial order created by the ordering end user. Use this column to find out information about the initial order, or to determine if an order went through a change procedure workflow which generated new order records.
ORDER_PROC_5.PROC_CHANGED_YN: This column determines whether the orderable procedure was changed as part of a change procedure workflow that generated new order records. The column will be set to 1 - Yes if a new procedure was selected during the change procedure workflow step. If the procedure was kept and other details were changed, this column will be populated with 0 - No. If the order did not go through a change procedure workflow which generated new order records, this column will be null.
ORDER_PROC_5.ACTIVE_PROC_TYPE_C_NAME: This item holds the category type of the active procedure order. Only active procedure type orders will be contained in this item. Medications are excluded. The categories separate order type in parent/child/normal and IP/OP order type.
ORDER_PROC_5.DELIVERY_REQUEST_UNIT_C_NAME: The unit category of the blood component order record being requested.
ORDER_PROC_5.BILL_AREA_ID: The bill area this order is associated with.
ORDER_PROC_5.BILL_AREA_ID_BILL_AREA_NAME: The record name of this bill area, financial subdivision, or financial division.
ORDER_PROC_5.ADT_ORDER_TYPE_C_NAME: The ADT (admission, discharge, transfer) order type category ID for the order, indicating what type of patient movement this order is intended for.
ORDER_PROC_5.BI_PRELIM_OUTCOME_C_NAME: Stores preliminary FP/FN/TP/FN/etc info for a breast imaging study. May not contain the most current data until the MQSA report has been run.
ORDER_PROC_5.RAD_EXAM_END_UTC_DTTM: The date and time an order's exam is ended in the Universal Time Coordinated (UTC) format.
ORDER_PROC_5.LUNG_CANCER_HX_YN: Returns whether the patient had a history of lung cancer at the time of the order.
ORDER_PROC_5.PAT_AGE_AT_EXAM: The age of the patient (in years) as of the date of the exam. If the exam has ended, this will be the age as of end exam. If not, this will be the age as of the scheduled appointment date. If an appointment has not been scheduled for this exam, this value will be null.
ORDER_PROC_5.PRIORITIZED_UTC_DTTM: Stores the prioritized instant for the result in UTC
ORDER_PROC_5.RESULT_UPDATE_UTC_DTTM: Stores the last update instant for a result in UTC
ORDER_PROC_5.PROC_SVC_TYPE_CODE_C_NAME: This item contains a procedure service type (surgery, imaging, dental, etc.) that overrides the service type from a referral or coverage source.
ORDER_PROC_5.PERFORMED_IN_ISO_YN: Stores whether the imaging exam was performed in isolation.
ORDER_PROC_5.RFL_FIRST_APPOINTMENT_BY_DATE: The date that the first appointment for the referral should occur by.
ORDER_PROC_5.RFL_LIVING_SITUATION_C_NAME: Describes who the patient or child lives with for this psychology referral order.
ORDER_PROC_5.RFL_CHILD_SERVICE_C_NAME: Indicates the child welfare service role in connection with child psychology services for the psychology referral order.
ORDER_PROC_5.RFL_PARENTAL_RESP_C_NAME: Indicates which entity has parental responsibility for the patient for the psychology referral order.
ORDER_PROC_5.RFL_CONSENT_TO_TREAT_STAT_C_NAME: Indicates the status of obtaining the patient's consent in connection with the referral's transfer of medical record information for the psychology referral order.
ORDER_PROC_5.RFL_CASE_WORKER_NAME: The case manager of the child psychology case for this psychology referral order.
ORDER_PROC_5.LUNG_OUTCOME_C_NAME: The positive/negative outcome for a lung imaging study.
ORDER_PROC_5.MAM_INDICATION_C_NAME: Indication for mammography exam specific to NMD version 2. Category values that can be mapped to BI-RADS indication for exam.
ORDER_PROC_5.HAS_LAB_SPEC_YN: Indicates whether the order or any of the linked performable orders have a lab specimen. 'Y' indicates that the order or one of the linked performable orders has a lab specimen. 'N' indicates that the order does not have a linked lab specimen and no linked performable order has a lab specimen.
ORDER_PROC_5.HAS_RSLT_CNCT_YN: Indicates whether the order has a resulted contact.  'Y' indicates that the order has at least one contact of type 2-Resulted.  'N' indicates that the order does not have any contacts of type 2-Resulted.
ORDER_PROC_5.HAS_CORR_YN: Indicates whether the order has a correction. 'Y' indicates that the order has at least one contact with procedure result status equal to 4-Edited or 5-Edited Result - FINAL.  'N' indicates that the order does not have any contacts with procedure result status equal to 4-Edited or 5-Edited Result - FINAL.
ORDER_PROC_5.LAB_REDRAW_REASON_C_NAME: The last redraw reason category ID for the order.
ORDER_PROC_5.PANEL_RELEASE_DTTM: If this order is a performable order on a test panel, this item stores the local date and time when the associated orderable was released. This column will only be populated for performable orders on test panels. It will not be populated for the orderable order on test panels.
ORDER_PROC_5.PANEL_RELEASE_UTC_DTTM: If this order is a performable order on a test panel, this item contains the UTC date and time when the associated orderable was released. This column will only be populated for performable orders on test panels. It will not be populated for the orderable order on test panels.
ORDER_PROC_5.LAST_RSLT_LAB_ID: The unique ID of the resulting lab from the last contact where the procedure result status is not null.
ORDER_PROC_5.MAM_TECH_IMG_DOC_REV_DTTM: Stores the instant when the last technologist image documentation was reviewed.
ORDER_PROC_5.MAM_TECH_IMG_DOC_REV_USER_ID: Stores the user ID of the last person to review the technologist imaging documentation.
ORDER_PROC_5.MAM_TECH_IMG_DOC_REV_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_PROC_5.NMD_3_MAM_INDICATION_C_NAME: Indication for mammography exam specific to NMD version 3. Category values that can be mapped to BI-RADS indication for exam. .

ORDER_PROC_6._TABLE_: The ORDER_PROC_6 table enables you to report on the procedures ordered in the clinical system. This procedure table has the same basic structure as ORDER_PROC, but was created as a sixth table to prevent ORDER_PROC_5 from getting any larger.
ORDER_PROC_6.ORDER_ID: The unique identifier for the order record.
ORDER_PROC_6.FIRST_CHART_USER_ID: The unique ID of the user who first made results available on the chart.
ORDER_PROC_6.FIRST_CHART_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_PROC_6.FIRST_CHART_UTC_DTTM: The date and time results were first made available on the chart.
ORDER_PROC_6.LAST_CHART_USER_ID: The unique ID of the user who last made results available on the chart.
ORDER_PROC_6.LAST_CHART_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_PROC_6.LAST_CHART_UTC_DTTM: The date and time results were last made available on the chart.
ORDER_PROC_6.FIRST_FINAL_USER_ID: The unique ID of the user who first made final results available on the chart.
ORDER_PROC_6.FIRST_FINAL_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_PROC_6.FIRST_FINAL_UTC_DTTM: The date and time final results were first made available on the chart.
ORDER_PROC_6.LAST_FINAL_USER_ID: The unique ID of the user who last made final results available on the chart.
ORDER_PROC_6.LAST_FINAL_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_PROC_6.LAST_FINAL_UTC_DTTM: The date and time final results were last made available on the chart.
ORDER_PROC_6.FIRST_CORR_USER_ID: The unique ID of the user who first authorized a correction to the result on this order.
ORDER_PROC_6.FIRST_CORR_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_PROC_6.FIRST_CORR_UTC_DTTM: The date and time the results of this order were first corrected.
ORDER_PROC_6.LAST_CORR_USER_ID: The unique ID of the user who last authorized a correction to the results of this order.
ORDER_PROC_6.LAST_CORR_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_PROC_6.LAST_CORR_UTC_DTTM: The date and time the results of this order were last corrected.
ORDER_PROC_6.IMG_EXAM_PAT_WT: Most recent patient weight (grams) preceding the end exam instant, within the system's age-based weight lookback range. Exams missing an end exam instant, as well as exams taking place too long after the last recorded patient weight, will not populate this item.
ORDER_PROC_6.IMG_EXAM_PAT_HT: Most recent patient height (centimeters) preceding the end exam instant, within the system's age-based height lookback range. Exams missing an end exam instant, as well as exams taking place too long after the last recorded patient height, will not populate this item.
ORDER_PROC_6.IMG_EXAM_PAT_BMI: Most recent patient BMI preceding the end exam instant, within the system's�age-based height and weight lookback ranges. Exams missing an end exam instant, as well as exams taking place too long after the last recorded patient height or weight, will not populate this item.
ORDER_PROC_6.FOLLICLE_STDY_MIN_THRSHLD_NUM: The minimum threshold from I LSD 53002 at the time of the study. This value is stored in millimeters.
ORDER_PROC_6.UNIQUE_IDENT: The unique ID generated by the organization that originally created this order.
ORDER_PROC_6.ACCT_SERIAL_NUM: The account serial number associated with the order.
ORDER_PROC_6.RSLT_TRANSMTL_DTTM: The date and time the order was placed on the result transmittal queue.
ORDER_PROC_6.RSLT_TRANSMTL_ENTRY_IDENT: The unique ID used for the result transmittal queue entry associated with the order.
ORDER_PROC_6.ADD_ON_SPECIMEN_ID: The unique ID of the specimen that the order was added onto.
ORDER_PROC_6.NO_PAT_CLASS_REASON_C_NAME: This holds a reason that the patient class was stripped from the order. If this value is blank, it can mean either that the procedure didn't have a patient class or that the reason the patient class was stripped isn't a reason that's audited.
ORDER_PROC_6.PRIORITIZED_INST_DTTM: This item stores the prioritized instant (date and time) for an order in local time zone. It represents the most relevant date and time an action was taken on an order.
ORDER_PROC_6.INTENDED_SMOKE_QUIT_DATE: The date a patient plans to quit smoking. This value is populated by filing an order-specific question.
ORDER_PROC_6.PRIORITIZED_INST_UTC_DTTM: This item stores the prioritized instant (date and time) for an order in UTC time zone. It represents the most relevant date and time an action was taken on an order.
ORDER_PROC_6.RSLT_UPD_UTC_DTTM: Stores the last update instant for a result in UTC
ORDER_PROC_6.RECEIVED_EXT_AUTH_PROV: This item holds the free-text for the received authorizing provider's name. It is free text and not linked to a provider record because we do not want to generate provider records for all received external result orders.
ORDER_PROC_6.DICOM_LAST_UPD_DTTM: The instant of the last time the UIDs were updated.
ORDER_PROC_6.STUDY_LAST_OPENED_DTTM: The column contains the time the study was last opened in edit mode.
ORDER_PROC_6.PATH_NARRATIVE_NOTE_ID: This column contains the pathology result narrative ID and only supports historical data.
ORDER_PROC_6.IMG_CHGEAP_LOADED_YN: Indicates whether default chargeable Associated Procedures have been added to the Imaging Charge Capture Navigator. 'Y' indicates that default chargeable Associated Procedures have been added, 'N' or NULL indicate they have not.
ORDER_PROC_6.DEF_BNDL_CODE_YN: Indicates historical data about whether the default bundle codes are used for charges. 'Y' indicates that default bundle codes were used for charges, 'N' or NULL indicate that default bundle codes were not used.
ORDER_PROC_6.REF_PRV_ROUT_MTHD_C_NAME: The 'Encounter Communication Sent - Method' category ID for the routing method that will be used for automated results routing. The method is determined when placing an order in Ancillary Order Entry.
ORDER_PROC_6.BATCH_PRINTED_UTC_DTTM: This column holds the instant the results report was printed through batch printing routine RISBSREP or through results routing.
ORDER_PROC_6.STUDY_READ_DATE: Stores the last time an imaging order had a status change of "SAVED" or higher.
ORDER_PROC_6.IMG_ADDEND_IN_EPIC_DATE: This column stores when the addendum is updated in Epic (addendum sign date if using an Epic workflow, otherwise whenever received over the interface)
ORDER_PROC_6.IMG_LAST_UPDATE_IN_EPIC_DATE: This column stores when the result is updated in Epic (sign date if using an Epic workflow, otherwise whenever received over the interface)
ORDER_PROC_6.REI_FOLLICLE_ROUNDING_C_NAME: The measurement rounding method for ovarian follicle averages. This indicates whether follicle measurement averages are rounded to the nearest whole-millimeter or half-millimeter. This is only set for studies that contain ovarian follicle measurements. Also only used for averages, not follicle diameters which always round to the nearest tenth.
ORDER_PROC_6.MYC_BATCH_RELEASE_DTTM: Server time instant after which a result will be released to MyChart by the batch job
ORDER_PROC_6.ORDER_DOMAIN_C_NAME: Used to semantically group types of procedure orders
ORDER_PROC_6.PERFORM_BY_DATE: Unbuffered perform-by date used in automatic order cancellation batch job.
ORDER_PROC_6.SEQ_DOC_LAST_UPD_UTC_DTTM: The instant when the linked sequencing documents were last updated, represented in UTC.
ORDER_PROC_6.SEQ_DOC_LAST_UPD_DTTM: The instant when the linked sequencing documents were last updated, represented in the local time of the system that made the change.
ORDER_PROC_6.DISCON_LOC_DTTM: The instant the order was discontinued or canceled in the local timezone.
ORDER_PROC_6.FIRST_FINAL_LOC_DTTM: The instant final results were first made available on the chart. This is the result contact instant (ORD-1970) from the first contact where the procedure result status (ORD-115) is 3-Final result.
ORDER_PROC_6.SND_ORG_PAT_MRN: This item stores the patient's MRN ID from the organization that sent this order.
ORDER_PROC_6.REFD_TO_PROV_CARE_TEAM_ID: This item tracks the IP provider team associated with a consult/referral order.
ORDER_PROC_6.ORD_GRP_RULE_ID: The unique identifier (.1 item) for the rule that identifies this order group
ORDER_PROC_6.ORD_GRP_SESS_UTC_DTTM: The date and time that identifies this order group, in UTC.
ORDER_PROC_6.RFL_PRIM_CONDITION_GROUPER_ID: Primary condition for which the patient is being referred as a Search Condition MAG record.
ORDER_PROC_6.RFL_PRIM_TREATMENT_GROUPER_ID: Primary treatment for which the patient is being referred as a Search Treatment MAG record.
ORDER_PROC_6.RFL_PRIM_SPECIALTY_GROUPER_ID: Primary specialty to which the patient is being referred as a Search Specialty MAG record.
ORDER_PROC_6.RFL_PRIM_SUBSPEC_GROUPER_ID: Primary subspecialty to which the patient is being referred as a Search Subspecialty MAG record.
ORDER_PROC_6.INFUSION_DURATION_AT_SCHED: This item stores the calculated infusion duration in minutes for infusion visit orders at the time of scheduling.
ORDER_PROC_6.UPD_ASMT_RECOM_TIME: Stores the total number of seconds spent by clinicians updating discrete data in the Update Assessment/Recommendations activity.
ORDER_PROC_6.NO_RFL_PROV_TEAM_YN: This item stores whether the "No Group" checkbox to allow placing a referral without an associated provider team has been checked.
ORDER_PROC_6.NLP_AFM_LINK_OUTCOME_C_NAME: The outcome of links between AFM findings and AFM recommendations created using NLP. This is only calculated when both the AFM Findings Model and the AFM Recommendations Model reach a verified status and is blank otherwise. This can be used to measure the accuracy of NLP links.

ORDER_RAD_ACC_NUM._TABLE_: This stores the accession numbers associated with the order.
ORDER_RAD_ACC_NUM.ORDER_PROC_ID: The unique ID of the procedure order record.
ORDER_RAD_ACC_NUM.LINE: The line count for this table as determined by the number of accession numbers associated with an order.
ORDER_RAD_ACC_NUM.ACC_NUM: The accession number associated with an order.
ORDER_RAD_ACC_NUM.SPECIMEN_APP_IDN: The specimen application ID number associated with an order.

ORDER_RAD_READING._TABLE_: This table stores reading physician information for imaging procedures.
ORDER_RAD_READING.ORDER_PROC_ID: The unique ID of the procedure order record.
ORDER_RAD_READING.LINE: The line count for this table as determined by the number of reading radiologists for an order.
ORDER_RAD_READING.PROV_ID: The reading radiologist for the order.
ORDER_RAD_READING.READING_DT: The date that the study was read by the reading radiologist (PROV_ID) -- i.e., the date that the radiologist performed any action on the study.
ORDER_RAD_READING.READ_PHYS_SPEC_C_NAME: The reading physician roles category ID for the order.
ORDER_RAD_READING.READING_RESIDENT_ID: The unique ID of the resident being supervised by the reading radiologist, if one exists.
ORDER_RAD_READING.READ_UTC_DTTM: The date and time in UTC format when the reading physician made a change to the study.

ORDER_READ_ACK._TABLE_: This table is used to store information from the overtime-related Orders items used for the result read/acknowledgment tracking feature. Namely, this is the Read or Acknowledge by User (I ORD 1910) and Read or Acknowledged On (I ORD 1915) items.
ORDER_READ_ACK.ORDER_ID: The unique identifier for the order record.
ORDER_READ_ACK.CONTACT_DATE_REAL: A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
ORDER_READ_ACK.LINE: The line number for when and who viewed the results associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.
ORDER_READ_ACK.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
ORDER_READ_ACK.READ_ACK_ACTUAL_UTC_DTTM: This item stores when the result was actually viewed by an end user.
ORDER_READ_ACK.WHO_READ_ACK_EMP_ID: This item stores which user viewed this result.
ORDER_READ_ACK.WHO_READ_ACK_EMP_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.

ORDER_RESULTS._TABLE_: This table contains information on results from clinical system orders. This table extracts only the last Orders (ORD) contact for each ORD record.
ORDER_RESULTS.ORDER_PROC_ID: The unique ID of the procedure order record.
ORDER_RESULTS.LINE: The line number of each result component within each ordered procedure.
ORDER_RESULTS.ORD_DATE_REAL: This is a numeric representation of the date each order was placed in your system. The integer portion of the number specifies the date the order was placed. The digits after the decimal point indicate multiple orders on one day.
ORDER_RESULTS.ORD_END_DATE_REAL: This is a numeric representation of the end date for each order in your system. The integer portion of the number specifies the date the order was placed. The digits after the decimal point indicate multiple orders on one day.
ORDER_RESULTS.RESULT_DATE: The date the technician ran the tests for each order in calendar format.
ORDER_RESULTS.COMPONENT_ID: The unique ID of each result component for each result.
ORDER_RESULTS.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: A unique serial number for the associated patient encounter. This number is unique across all patients and encounters in the system.
ORDER_RESULTS.ORD_VALUE: The value returned for each result component, in short free text format. NOTE:  This is how the data is stored in the database; as string format. Interface data may come in with alpha characters and this field is designed to store exactly what is stored in the database. This field stores numeric and structured numeric values in M internal format, using a period as the decimal separator irrespective of locale.
ORDER_RESULTS.ORD_NUM_VALUE: A numeric representation of the value returned for each component where applicable. If the value contains any non-numeric characters, the value will display as 9999999.
ORDER_RESULTS.RESULT_FLAG_C_NAME: The category value associated with a standard HL7 flag code to mark each component result as abnormal. Any value in this field not equal to 1 is considered abnormal.
ORDER_RESULTS.REFERENCE_LOW: The lowest acceptable value for each result component. If the value in this column is a number or structured numeric, the numbers will be stored in M internal format, using a period as the decimal separator.
ORDER_RESULTS.REFERENCE_HIGH: The highest acceptable value for each result component. If the value in this column is a number or structured numeric, the numbers will be stored in M internal format, using a period as the decimal separator.
ORDER_RESULTS.REFERENCE_UNIT: The units for each result component value.
ORDER_RESULTS.RESULT_STATUS_C_NAME: The category value corresponding to the status of each result record, such as 2-Preliminary, 3-Final, 4-Corrected, 5-Incomplete.
ORDER_RESULTS.RESULT_SUB_IDN: This item is populated with the unique organism identifier (OVR 700 or interface) when the component of an order result is an organism and can be joined to ORDER_SENSITIVITY.SENS_ORGANISM_SID to identify details about this organism.
ORDER_RESULTS.LAB_STATUS_C_NAME: The category value associated with the status of each result, such as 1-In Progress, 2-Preliminary, 3-Final, 4-Edited.
ORDER_RESULTS.INTERFACE_YN: This Yes/No flag identifies whether each order was resulted through an interface. The field will display "Y" if the result came through an interface, otherwise the field will display "N".
ORDER_RESULTS.RESULTING_LAB_ID: The Unique ID of the Lab running the test.
ORDER_RESULTS.COMPONENT_COMMENT: Contains the comments associated with a order COMPONENT_ID, i.e. this is the comments associated with a specific order component's results. If comment data is too long to fit in this item, then the comments will be found in the ORDER_RES_COMMENT table.
ORDER_RESULTS.RESULT_IN_RANGE_YN: A Yes/No category value to indicate whether a result has been verified to be within its reference range.  This item is set by the interface when the result is sent. A null value is equivalent to a "no"  value.
ORDER_RESULTS.REF_NORMAL_VALS: This is a free-text item which allows you to enter a reference range without tying it to a "low" or "high" value. For example, it could be a string ("negative"), a list of choices ("Yellow, orange"), or a descriptive range ("Less than 20"). The values entered in this range should always represent the "normal" values. This item will be displayed in Results Review as the reference range, superseding any values in the low or high items. It may also be displayed in reports, if the print groups are configured to use it. Multiple responses are permitted (one per line). If the value in this column is a number or structured numeric, the numbers will be stored in M internal format using a period as the decimal separator.
ORDER_RESULTS.LRR_BASED_ORGAN_ID: Used for storing discrete organisms. This item is used for storing isolated organisms at the component level. There may be cases where an isolated organism does not undergo sensitivity tests and therefore is only stored at the component level. Organisms with sensitivities are also stored in addition to this item.
ORDER_RESULTS.COMP_RES_TECHNICIA: ID of the Resulting Lab Technician.
ORDER_RESULTS.VALUE_NORMALIZED: Will contain the structured numeric result value in a delimited structured numeric format. Numbers will be in M internal format. The delimited structured numeric value is the user entered structured numeric value converted to a delimited format. Valid structured numeric formats are range, operator followed by number, and number followed by operator the value stored in this item is of the format:    operator1_$c(16)_number1_$c(16)_operator2_$c(16)_number2.
ORDER_RESULTS.NUMERIC_PRECISION: The number of decimal digits to the right of the decimal point.
ORDER_RESULTS.COMP_OBS_INST_TM: Timestamp to track per non-micro result component when it was collected/observed.
ORDER_RESULTS.COMP_ANL_INST_TM: Timestamp to track per non-micro result component when it was analyzed in lab.
ORDER_RESULTS.RESULT_VAL_START_LN: For multi-line results holds the starting line number of RESULTS_CMT column from ORDER_RES_COMMENT table, where the result values begin.  This column is simply an indicator of the line number(s) where a result is stored.
ORDER_RESULTS.RESULT_VAL_END_LN: For multi-line results holds the ending line number of RESULTS_CMT column from ORDER_RES_COMMENT table, where the result values begin.  This column is simply an indicator of the line number(s) where a result is stored.
ORDER_RESULTS.RESULT_CMT_START_LN: For multi-line results holds the starting line number of RESULTS_CMT column from ORDER_RES_COMMENT table, where the result values begin.  This column is simply an indicator of the line number(s) where a result is stored.
ORDER_RESULTS.RESULT_CMT_END_LN: For multi-line results holds the ending line number of RESULTS_CMT column from ORDER_RES_COMMENT table, where the result values begin.  This column is simply an indicator of the line number(s) where a result is stored.
ORDER_RESULTS.ORD_RAW_VALUE: Stores the raw value of a numeric result as entered by the user. The value stored here and in column ORD_VALUE will be different in international locales for numeric data if the decimal separator used in that locale is a comma instead of a period. This is because ORD_VALUE will store numeric values in the M internal format.
ORDER_RESULTS.RAW_LOW: Stores raw value of the minimum value of the result component mentioned in column REFERENCE_LOW. The value stored here and in REFERENCE_LOW will be different in international locales for numeric data if the decimal separator used in that locale is a comma instead of a period. This is because REFERENCE_LOW will store numeric data in M internal format.
ORDER_RESULTS.RAW_HIGH: Stores raw value of the maximum value of the result component mentioned in column REFERENCE_HIGH. The value stored here and in REFERENCE_HIGH will be different in international locales for numeric data if the decimal separator used in that locale is a comma instead of a period. This is because REFERENCE_HIGH will store numeric data in M internal format.
ORDER_RESULTS.RAW_REF_VALS: This column stores the raw value of REF_NORMAL_VALS (i.e. the reference normal values of the result component). Since REF_NORMAL_VALS will store numeric data in M internal format, the value stored here and in REF_NORMAL_VALS will be different in international locales if the decimal separator used in that locale is a comma instead of a period.
ORDER_RESULTS.ORGANISM_QUANTITY: This item is used for storing isolated organisms at the component level. It contains the numeric or qualitative quantity of the organism that was observed.
ORDER_RESULTS.ORGANISM_QUANTITY_UNIT: This item is used for storing isolated organisms at the component level. It contains the unit associated with the quantity of the organism that was observed.
ORDER_RESULTS.COMPON_LNC_ID: Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes (LOINC) ID of the component.
ORDER_RESULTS.COMPON_LNC_SRC_C_NAME: Source of the component Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes (LOINC) ID.
ORDER_RESULTS.COMP_SNOMED_SRC_C_NAME: Source of the Systemized Nomenclature of Medicine � Clinical Terms (SNOMED) code (reported vs inferred).
ORDER_RESULTS.REF_UNIT_UOM_ID: Pointer to the record that represents the component's units of measure.
ORDER_RESULTS.REF_RANGE_TYPE: Displays the type of the reference range.
ORDER_RESULTS.ORGANISM_SNOMED_CT: The Systemized Nomenclature of Medicine � Clinical Terms (SNOMED) code for the component's organism.
ORDER_RESULTS.ORGANISM_QUANTITY_SNOMED_CT: The Systemized Nomenclature of Medicine � Clinical Terms (SNOMED) code for the component's organism quantity.
ORDER_RESULTS.PERFORMING_ORG_INFO_LINE: This is used to indicate the performing organization information for the component. This item stores the line number of the ORD related group which is used to save the performing organization information.
ORDER_RESULTS.COMPON_EXCL_CDS_YN: To cache if the component has a value or comment that matches a value in Excluded result text (I LSD 768).
ORDER_RESULTS.RTF_VAL_START_LINE: If the component result value is rich text, this column gives the first line of ORD_RTF_VAL_CMT that the value is stored in.
ORDER_RESULTS.RTF_VAL_END_LINE: If the component result value is rich text, this column gives the last line of ORD_RTF_VAL_CMT that the value is stored in.
ORDER_RESULTS.RTF_CMT_START_LINE: If the component comment is rich text, this column gives the first line of ORD_RTF_VAL_CMT that the component comment is stored in.
ORDER_RESULTS.RTF_CMT_END_LINE: If the component comment is rich text, this column gives the last line of ORD_RTF_VAL_CMT that the component comment is stored in.
ORDER_RESULTS.RSLT_ACCR_FLAG_YN: This item determines the accreditation status of the corresponding component. If set to Y-Yes, the corresponding component is accredited. If set to N-No, the corresponding component is not accredited. If null, no evaluation was performed on the component to determine if it is accredited or not.

ORDER_RES_COMMENT._TABLE_: This table contains result component comments for orders that are populated by the Incoming Results Interface. These result component comments are not populated through Enter/Edit Results. The data in this table is populated only if the result component comments normally stored in the Component Comment (I ORD 2070) field is too long to be stored in that field.
ORDER_RES_COMMENT.ORDER_ID: The internal order ID for this procedure.
ORDER_RES_COMMENT.CONTACT_DATE_REAL: This is a numeric representation of the date of this encounter in your system. The integer portion of the number specifies the date of the encounter. The digits after the decimal point indicate multiple visits on one day.
ORDER_RES_COMMENT.LINE: The line count associated with the result component. This line number will match with the LINE column in the ORDER_RESULTS table. It is probable that this table will not have all the lines from the ORDER_RESULTS table since this table only contains data for the components that do not have data in the Component Comment item in the Order record (ORDER_RESULTS.COMPONENT_COMMENT).
ORDER_RES_COMMENT.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
ORDER_RES_COMMENT.CM_CT_OWNER_ID: ID of the deployment owner for this contact. This relates to record sharing and who owns the deployment of the record.
ORDER_RES_COMMENT.RESULTS_CMT: The result component comments for this order record which are populated by the Incoming Results Interface.  These result comments are not populated by Enter/Edit Results. This column is populated when the result component comments that are normally stored in the Component Comment item in the Order record (ORDER_RESULTS.COMPONENT_COMMENT) are too long to be stored in the Component Comment item in the Order record.
ORDER_RES_COMMENT.COMPONENT_ID: The unique ID of each result component for each result.  Additional data about result components can be found in the CLARITY_COMPONENT table.
ORDER_RES_COMMENT.LINE_COMMENT: The line count associated with each line of the result component comments. There can be multiple lines of comments, therefore each line has a line number.

ORDER_REVIEW._TABLE_: This table contains a list of all the users that have reviewed the order and whether that review was accepted or not.
ORDER_REVIEW.ORDER_ID: The unique identifier for the order record.
ORDER_REVIEW.LINE: The line count for this table is determined by the number of users who reviewed this order.
ORDER_REVIEW.REVIEW_USER_ID: The user that reviewed the order.
ORDER_REVIEW.REVIEW_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_REVIEW.REVIEWED_TIME: The date and time when the order was reviewed.
ORDER_REVIEW.REVIEW_ACCEPTED_YN: This column contains Y/N to determine if the reviewer accepted the order.

ORDER_SIGNED_PROC._TABLE_: This table contains the users, providers, and messages related to procedure verbal orders and cosign orders.
ORDER_SIGNED_PROC.ORDER_PROC_ID: The unique ID for the procedure order record.
ORDER_SIGNED_PROC.LINE: The line count for the table.
ORDER_SIGNED_PROC.SIGNED_TYPE_C_NAME: Indicates the type of order signing the row represents. Note: Any type can have cosigner data.
ORDER_SIGNED_PROC.VERB_COMM_PROV_ID: The unique provider record ID for the provider communicating the verbal order.
ORDER_SIGNED_PROC.VERB_SGNER_USER_ID: The unique user record ID for the user signing the verbal order.
ORDER_SIGNED_PROC.VERB_SGNER_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_SIGNED_PROC.VERB_MSGRC_USER_ID: The unique user record ID for the recipient of the In Basket message for the verbal order.
ORDER_SIGNED_PROC.VERB_MSGRC_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_SIGNED_PROC.VERB_MSG_ID: The unique In Basket message record ID of the In Basket message created by the verbal order.
ORDER_SIGNED_PROC.VERB_SIGNED_TIME: The date and time the verbal order was signed.
ORDER_SIGNED_PROC.VERBAL_MODE_C_NAME: The mode associated with the verbal order.
ORDER_SIGNED_PROC.ORDER_PROV_ID: The unique provider record ID for the ordering provider.
ORDER_SIGNED_PROC.AUTH_PROV_ID: The unique provider record ID for the authorizing provider.
ORDER_SIGNED_PROC.CSGN_MSGRC_USER_ID: The unique user record ID for the recipient of the cosigned In Basket message.
ORDER_SIGNED_PROC.CSGN_MSGRC_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_SIGNED_PROC.CSGN_MSG_ID: The unique In Basket message record ID of the cosigned In Basket message.
ORDER_SIGNED_PROC.CSGN_SIGNED_TIME: The date and time the order was cosigned.
ORDER_SIGNED_PROC.COSIGNER_ID: The unique user record ID for the order cosigner.
ORDER_SIGNED_PROC.COSIGNER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_SIGNED_PROC.IS_HOSPITALIST_YN: Indicates if the order was by a hospitalist.
ORDER_SIGNED_PROC.CSGN_CREATE_DTTM: When the cosign requirement was created (UTC Time).
ORDER_SIGNED_PROC.CSGN_RQRD_C_NAME: This item stores whether or not an order requires a cosign based on when a new line is added to the verbal order category type (I ORD 34800).
ORDER_SIGNED_PROC.SIG_REQ_CRT_USER_ID: If the order signature requirement was manually created, this item stores the ID of the user who created the requirement.
ORDER_SIGNED_PROC.SIG_REQ_CRT_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_SIGNED_PROC.SIG_REQ_CRT_SRC_C_NAME: This column is the creation source for order signature requirements.

ORDER_STATUS._TABLE_: The ORDER_STATUS table contains overtime single response orders information.
ORDER_STATUS.ORDER_ID: Unique ID for this order record
ORDER_STATUS.ORD_DATE_REAL: This is a numeric representation of the date of this encounter in your system. The integer portion of the number specifies the date of the encounter. The digits after the decimal point indicate multiple visits on one day.
ORDER_STATUS.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
ORDER_STATUS.CONTACT_NUMBER: The contact number of the orders record.
ORDER_STATUS.CONTACT_TYPE_C_NAME: The category value for the contact type, such as "1" for "Ordered" or "2" for "Resulted"
ORDER_STATUS.ABNORMAL_YN: This Y/N flag reports Y if a result component in the order is reported as abnormal or N if the order is normal.
ORDER_STATUS.ORDER_CREATOR_ID: The unique ID of the person creating the order.
ORDER_STATUS.ORDER_CREATOR_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_STATUS.RESULTING_PROV: The name of the provider signing off on the results.
ORDER_STATUS.LAB_TECHNICIAN: The technician responsible for the order tests.
ORDER_STATUS.RESULTING_LAB_ID: The unique ID of the lab running the test.
ORDER_STATUS.INSTANT_OF_ENTRY: The instant the record was last entered.
ORDER_STATUS.INSTANT_OF_EDIT: The instant the record was last edited.
ORDER_STATUS.RX_DISPENSE_CODE_C_NAME: The pharmacy dispense code used for this order.
ORDER_STATUS.RX_PAR_DOSES: PRN par level number of doses
ORDER_STATUS.CSN_FOR_ADD_REFILL: This item only applies to refill orders. It stores the contact serial numbers of the patient visits where the refill order was modified.
ORDER_STATUS.SCHEDULED_DATE: The date a standard ambulatory order is scheduled for.
ORDER_STATUS.SCHEDULED_TIME: The time a standard ambulatory order is scheduled for.
ORDER_STATUS.PROCEDURE_NOTE_ID: This column contains the unique notes record identifier of the note that resulted the narrative for the order.
ORDER_STATUS.PROCEDURE_NOTE_DT: This is the date for the procedure note that resulted the order.
ORDER_STATUS.ERFLL_REQ_RFL_PRN_C_NAME: This item stores the time period for refills requested in the erefill.
ORDER_STATUS.ERFLL_APP_RFL_PRN_C_NAME: This item stores the time period for refills approved in the erefill.
ORDER_STATUS.EREFILL_TO_PHM_ID: Stores the link to the general use notes record containing the action message to the pharmacy.
ORDER_STATUS.WET_READS_C_NAME: Indicates whether this contact is created by Wet Reads. Used in ED Wet Reads pop-up form.
ORDER_STATUS.ROUTING_OUTCOME_C_NAME: The category value of the outcome of results routing for each resulting contact of order associated with this row.
ORDER_STATUS.ROUTING_RULE_LEVEL: The level at which the results routing rule used to determine recipients was specified. The possible levels are: Auth Prov, Auth Prov Primary Dept, Enc Dept, or System
ORDER_STATUS.ROUTING_SCHEME_LINE: The line of the results routing scheme that was executed to determine recipients for this result. If no line was executed, the value of the column will be the string "DEFAULT".
ORDER_STATUS.ROUTING_INST_TM: The date and time the order was resulted and routed.
ORDER_STATUS.ROUTING_USER_ID: The unique ID of the user the result was routed to for this row.
ORDER_STATUS.ROUTING_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_STATUS.RIS_LET_TEMPLT_ID: The unique ID of the SmartText record for a mammography result letter associated with this order.
ORDER_STATUS.RIS_LET_TEMPLT_ID_SMARTTEXT_NAME: The name of the SmartText record.
ORDER_STATUS.ROUTING_CURSTATUS_C_NAME: This item stores the current routing status for a resulting contact.
ORDER_STATUS.MAM_LIFETIME_RISK: Patient's probability of getting breast cancer in a lifetime. Calculated using external formula.
ORDER_STATUS.LAB_STATUS_C_NAME: Indicates the lab status value associated with each order contact.
ORDER_STATUS.OVRL_BREAST_DENS_C_NAME: Overall breast density. Entered when reading a mammography study.
ORDER_STATUS.RIGHT_BREAST_DENS_C_NAME: Right breast density. Entered when reading a mammography study.
ORDER_STATUS.LEFT_BREAST_DENS_C_NAME: Left breast density. Entered when reading a mammography study.
ORDER_STATUS.MOST_SIG_MAM_FIND_C_NAME: This stores the most significant mammography finding as documented by a radiologist.
ORDER_STATUS.IMG_DOUBLE_READ_C_NAME: This tracks if a double read was performed while resulting an imaging study, and if so, what type of double read was it.
ORDER_STATUS.CAD_USAGE_C_NAME: This stores whether CAD (Computer Aided Detection) was used while interpreting an imaging study.
ORDER_STATUS.LAB_PATHOLOGIST_ID: The unique user ID of the pathologist that has responsibility for the current Anatomic Pathology order.
ORDER_STATUS.LAB_PATHOLOGIST_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_STATUS.RSLT_CNCT_INSTANT_DTTM: The instant in which a result contact is modified/filed to the system. Not to be confused with Result Date/Time, which is when the result was actually generated.
ORDER_STATUS.RSLT_CNCT_USER_ID: The user filing the result contact. For interfaces or Beaker Result Filing background job, this might be a generic user.
ORDER_STATUS.RSLT_CNCT_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_STATUS.RSLT_CNCT_SOURCE_C_NAME: Stores which entry point modified the result contact.
ORDER_STATUS.IPROC_NOTE_ID: Stores the ID to the general use notes record of the Imaging and Procedures Resulting Note.
ORDER_STATUS.IPROC_NOTE_CSN: Stores the contact serial number to the general use notes record of the Imaging and Procedures Resulting Note.
ORDER_STATUS.RES_INTERPRETER_ID: The unique ID of the user who is the interpreter of the results for this order.
ORDER_STATUS.RES_INTERPRETER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_STATUS.RESPONS_AP_USER_ID: The unique ID of the lab user that has responsibility for the current anatomic pathology order.
ORDER_STATUS.RESPONS_AP_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORDER_STATUS.OVRL_TISSUE_COMP_C_NAME: Patient level tissue composition. Entered when reading a breast US.
ORDER_STATUS.RIGHT_TISSUE_COMP_C_NAME: Right breast tissue composition. Entered when reading a breast US.
ORDER_STATUS.LEFT_TISSUE_COMP_C_NAME: Left breast tissue composition. Entered when reading a breast US.
ORDER_STATUS.OVRL_FGT_C_NAME: Patient level amount of fibroglandular tissue. Entered when reading a breast MR.
ORDER_STATUS.RIGHT_FGT_C_NAME: Right breast amount of fibroglandular tissue. Entered when reading a breast MR.
ORDER_STATUS.LEFT_FGT_C_NAME: Left breast amount of fibroglandular tissue. Entered when reading a breast MR.
ORDER_STATUS.OVRL_BPE_C_NAME: Patient level background parenchymal enhancement. Entered when reading a breast MR.
ORDER_STATUS.RIGHT_BPE_C_NAME: Right breast background parenchymal enhancement. Entered when reading a breast MR.
ORDER_STATUS.LEFT_BPE_C_NAME: Left breast background parenchymal enhancement. Entered when reading a breast MR.
ORDER_STATUS.SYMMETRIC_BPE_C_NAME: Symmetric flag for background parenchymal enhancement. Entered when reading a bilateral breast magnetic resonance (MR).
ORDER_STATUS.LAB_CORR_TYPE_C_NAME: Stores the type of correction that was made to an anatomic pathology report.
ORDER_STATUS.RESULT_DTTM: The date and time the technician ran the tests for each order in calendar format. NOTE: Concatenates the result date (ORD 26) and result time (ORD 28) into a datetime format. If the time value is null, the query will return 12:00 AM for a time.
ORDER_STATUS.LEFT_OVARY_SMALL_FOLLICLE_CNT: The number of follicles in the left ovary at or below the minimum threshold as defined in system definitions (I LSD 53002).
ORDER_STATUS.RIGHT_OVARY_SMALL_FOLLICLE_CNT: The number of follicles in the right ovary at or below the minimum threshold as defined in system definitions (I LSD 53002).
ORDER_STATUS.ENDOMETRIAL_STRIPE: The measurement of the endometrial stripe.
ORDER_STATUS.OV_CYST_PRESENCE_C_NAME: Whether ovarian cysts are present in this ultrasound study.
ORDER_STATUS.UTERINE_FIBROID_PRESENCE_C_NAME: Whether uterine fibroids are present in this ultrasound study.
ORDER_STATUS.UTERINE_POLYP_PRESENCE_C_NAME: Whether uterine polyps are present in this ultrasound study.
ORDER_STATUS.NARRATIVE_PERF_ORG_INFO: This item stores the line number of the performing organization related group (ORD 1220) and acts as a pointer to the performing organization information of narrative of the result.
ORDER_STATUS.IMPRESSION_PERF_ORG_INFO: This item stores the line number of the preforming organization related group (ORD 1220) and acts as a pointer to the performing organization information of impression of the result.
ORDER_STATUS.EXT_DISP_FILL_IDENT: Holds the unique identifier for a given fill used to identify the external dispense
ORDER_STATUS.SR_VALID_STATUS_C_NAME: Indicates whether the study has been properly updated and validated for a particular order, and is ready for enhanced validation from outside of Study Review. Validated [1] means that the study is ready for enhanced validation. Not Validated [0] or blank means that it is not ready, usually because the study was modified from outside of Study Review, or has never been opened in Study Review.
ORDER_STATUS.RESULT_PERF_ORG: This item stores the line number of related group 1220 and acts as a pointer to the performing organization information of the result.
ORDER_STATUS.LAB_RESULTING_METHOD: The main resulting method (either manual or a specific interface) that was used to result the order
ORDER_STATUS.NLP_RESULT_ACTION_C_NAME: Flags which result contact was used to send the impression to Nebula for natural language processing. Used to determine if the impression changed since natural language processing ran.
ORDER_STATUS.ROUTING_MOPS_ORDER_ID: The ID of the MOPS grouper order this order was routed with.
ORDER_STATUS.ROUTING_MOPS_ORDER_DAT: The DAT of the MOPS grouper order this order was routed with.
ORDER_STATUS.NLP_UNVERIFIED_IB_ONLY_YN: Flag to restrict sending unverified NLP data to only In Basket.

ORDER_SUMMARY._TABLE_: Contains the summary for an order that has been signed.
ORDER_SUMMARY.ORDER_ID: The unique identifier for the order record.
ORDER_SUMMARY.LINE: Line number of each line in multiple responses in a signed order summary.
ORDER_SUMMARY.ORD_SUMMARY: The summary sentence for the order.

ORD_CLIN_IND._TABLE_: The Clinical Indications (reason for exam) and associated comments.
ORD_CLIN_IND.ORDER_ID: The unique ID of the order record.
ORD_CLIN_IND.LINE: The line count for this table as determined by the number of users who reviewed this order.
ORD_CLIN_IND.CLIN_IND_TEXT: Clinical indications (reason for exam) free text answer to an order-specific question for this order.
ORD_CLIN_IND.CLIN_IND_CMT_TEXT: Clinical indications (reason for exam) free text comment to an order-specific question for this order.

ORD_INDICATIONS._TABLE_: This table stores the indications of use selected for a medication record.
ORD_INDICATIONS.ORDER_ID: The unique ID of the order record.
ORD_INDICATIONS.LINE: The line count of associated changes in Indication(s) of Use for the order record.
ORD_INDICATIONS.INDICATIONS_ID: The indications of use selected for a medication order.
ORD_INDICATIONS.INDICATIONS_ID_MEDICAL_COND_NAME: This contains the name of the medical condition.

ORD_PRFLST_TRK._TABLE_: Tracking info for orders coming from a preference list or order template.  For Beacon, the column ORDER_TEMPLATE_ID is used, which is the unique ID of the order template in the patient's treatment plan used to create the order.
ORD_PRFLST_TRK.ORDER_ID: The unique identifier for the order record.
ORD_PRFLST_TRK.ORDER_TEMPLATE_ID: The unique ID of the order template (OTP) in the patient's treatment plan that was used to create the order.
ORD_PRFLST_TRK.MOD_FROM_OTL_YN: Flag whether this order is modified from its order template.

ORD_PROC_INSTR._TABLE_: This table contains information about order-specific procedure process instructions clinicians see in Order Composer when they sign the order. This item is essentially a SmartText block, which might contain SmartLinks, that is pulled in from the networked Proces Info (I EAP 10650) item at signing.
ORD_PROC_INSTR.ORDER_ID: The unique identifier for the order record.
ORD_PROC_INSTR.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
ORD_PROC_INSTR.ORDER_PROC_INSTR: Process Instructions displayed to end user in the order editing window when signing the order.

ORD_SECOND_SIGN._TABLE_: This table stores the information about second sign for orders.
ORD_SECOND_SIGN.ORDER_ID: The unique identifier for the order record.
ORD_SECOND_SIGN.SEC_SIGN_STATUS_C_NAME: This item stores the status of the second sign.
ORD_SECOND_SIGN.SEC_SIGN_FIRS_DTTM: This column contains the instant at which the first sign occurred.
ORD_SECOND_SIGN.SEC_SIGN_MESSAGE: This is the message shown to the user.
ORD_SECOND_SIGN.SEC_SIGN_REQUIRE_C_NAME: This is the second sign requirement that this order was signed with.
ORD_SECOND_SIGN.SEC_SIGN_SIGNER_ID: The ID of the secondary signing user.
ORD_SECOND_SIGN.SEC_SIGN_SIGNER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ORD_SECOND_SIGN.SEC_SIGN_SEC_DTTM: This column contains the instant at which the second sign occurred.
ORD_SECOND_SIGN.SEC_SIGN_REJECT_C_NAME: The reason that this order was rejected.
ORD_SECOND_SIGN.SEC_SIGN_COMMENT: This stores the comment for the rejection.
ORD_SECOND_SIGN.SEC_SIGN_REJECT_ID: This is the ID of the rejection message that is sent.
ORD_SECOND_SIGN.SEC_SIGN_INDIV_YN: Whether individual review was required for this order when second signing the order.

ORD_SPEC_QUEST._TABLE_: This table contains order specific questions and their responses.
ORD_SPEC_QUEST.ORDER_ID: The unique identifier for the order record.
ORD_SPEC_QUEST.LINE: The line item for this record determined by the order specific question ID
ORD_SPEC_QUEST.ORD_QUEST_ID: The identification number of the question for this order.
ORD_SPEC_QUEST.ORD_QUEST_DATE: The date of the question for this order.
ORD_SPEC_QUEST.IS_ANSWR_BYPROC_YN: Indicates whether or not this question was answered by the procedure. 'Y' indicates that the question was answered. 'N' indicates that the question was not answered.
ORD_SPEC_QUEST.ORD_QUEST_COMP: The line number of the medication in the mixture that triggers this specific question for an IV or total parenteral nutrition (TPN) order.
ORD_SPEC_QUEST.ORD_QUEST_RESP: The response to the question for this order.
ORD_SPEC_QUEST.ORD_QUEST_CMT: The comments on the question of the order.

PERFORMING_ORG_INFO.ORDER_ID: The unique identifier for the order record.
PERFORMING_ORG_INFO.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
PERFORMING_ORG_INFO.PERFORMING_ORG_NAME: The name of the performing organization. The phone number might be a part of the organizations name as labs might send it as a part of the name.
PERFORMING_ORG_INFO.PERFORMING_ORG_DIRECTOR: The name of the medical director of the performing organization.
PERFORMING_ORG_INFO.PERFORMING_ORG_CITY: The city where the performing organization is located.
PERFORMING_ORG_INFO.PERFORMING_ORG_STATE_C_NAME: The state where the performing organization is located.
PERFORMING_ORG_INFO.PERFORMING_ORG_ZIP_CODE: The zip code of the performing organization.
PERFORMING_ORG_INFO.PERFORMING_ORG_PHONE_NUM: Phone number of the performing organization.
PERFORMING_ORG_INFO.PERFORMING_ORG_CLIA_NUM: The Clinical Laboratory Improvement Amendment (CLIA) number of the performing organization. Any laboratory that is included in the CLIA legislation must obtain a CLIA certificate from the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services. The certificate will include a 10-digit number which is the CLIA number of that laboratory.
PERFORMING_ORG_INFO.PERFORMING_ORG_FORMAT_C_NAME: This item represents the format in which the performing organization medical director name is stored.
PERFORMING_ORG_INFO.PERFORMING_ORG_HOUSE_NUM: The housing number of the performing organization address.

RAD_THERAPY_ASSOC_COURSE._TABLE_: Lists external radiation courses linked to orders.
RAD_THERAPY_ASSOC_COURSE.ORDER_ID: The unique identifier for the order record.
RAD_THERAPY_ASSOC_COURSE.RAD_THERAPY_COURSE_SRC_SYS_C_NAME: This item is for orders representing treatments from courses of radiation documented in third-party software systems. The source system is specified in this item, and the ID of the course is specified in the counterpart Radiation Therapy Course ID (I ORD 77805).
RAD_THERAPY_ASSOC_COURSE.RAD_THERAPY_COURSE_IDENT: This item is for orders representing treatments from courses of radiation documented in third-party software systems. The ID of the course is specified in this item, and the source system is specified in counterpart Radiation Therapy Course Source System (I ORD 77800).

SPEC_TYPE_SNOMED._TABLE_: This table contains the SNOMED codes for the specimen type.
SPEC_TYPE_SNOMED.ORDER_ID: The unique identifier for the order record.
SPEC_TYPE_SNOMED.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
SPEC_TYPE_SNOMED.TYPE_SNOMED_CT: SNOMED code associated w/ the specimen type

projectionCode:
function projectOrder(oid: unknown): EpicRow {
  const rows = mergeQuery("ORDER_PROC", `b."ORDER_PROC_ID" = ?`, [oid]);
  const order = rows[0] ?? { ORDER_PROC_ID: oid };

  attachChildren(order, oid, orderChildren);

  // Resolve procedure name
  order._procedure_name = lookupName("CLARITY_EAP", "PROC_ID", "PROC_NAME", order.PROC_ID);

  return order;
}

const orderChildren: ChildSpec[] = [
  { table: "ORDER_RESULTS", fkCol: "ORDER_PROC_ID", key: "results" },
  { table: "ORDER_DX_PROC", fkCol: "ORDER_PROC_ID", key: "diagnoses" },
  { table: "ORDER_COMMENT", fkCol: "ORDER_PROC_ID", key: "comments" },
  { table: "ORDER_NARRATIVE", fkCol: "ORDER_PROC_ID", key: "narrative" },
  { table: "ORDER_IMPRESSION", fkCol: "ORDER_PROC_ID", key: "impression" },
  { table: "ORDER_SIGNED_PROC", fkCol: "ORDER_PROC_ID", key: "signed_info" },
  { table: "ORDER_RAD_ACC_NUM", fkCol: "ORDER_PROC_ID", key: "accession_numbers" },
  { table: "ORDER_RAD_READING", fkCol: "ORDER_PROC_ID", key: "rad_readings" },
  { table: "ORDER_MYC_INFO", fkCol: "ORDER_PROC_ID", key: "mychart_info" },
  { table: "ORDER_MYC_RELEASE", fkCol: "ORDER_PROC_ID", key: "mychart_release" },
  { table: "HV_ORDER_PROC", fkCol: "ORDER_PROC_ID", key: "hv_order_info" },
  // ORDER_ID-keyed children (ORDER_ID = ORDER_PROC_ID in most cases)
  { table: "ORDER_STATUS", fkCol: "ORDER_ID", key: "status_history" },
  { table: "ORDER_AUTH_INFO", fkCol: "ORDER_ID", key: "auth_info" },
  { table: "ORDER_PENDING", fkCol: "ORDER_ID", key: "pending_info" },
  { table: "ORDER_REVIEW", fkCol: "ORDER_ID", key: "review_history" },
  { table: "ORDER_READ_ACK", fkCol: "ORDER_ID", key: "read_acknowledgments" },
  { table: "ORD_SPEC_QUEST", fkCol: "ORDER_ID", key: "specimen_questions" },
  { table: "ORD_PROC_INSTR", fkCol: "ORDER_ID", key: "instructions" },
  { table: "ORD_CLIN_IND", fkCol: "ORDER_ID", key: "clinical_indications" },
  { table: "ORD_INDICATIONS", fkCol: "ORDER_ID", key: "indications" },
  { table: "EXTERNAL_ORDER_INFO", fkCol: "ORDER_ID", key: "external_info" },
  { table: "CL_ORD_FST_LST_SCH", fkCol: "ORDER_ID", key: "schedule_history" },
  { table: "OBS_MTHD_ID", fkCol: "ORDER_ID", key: "observation_methods" },
  { table: "SPEC_TYPE_SNOMED", fkCol: "ORDER_ID", key: "specimen_snomed" },
  { table: "ORDER_INSTANTIATED", fkCol: "ORDER_ID", key: "instantiated_orders" },
  { table: "ORDER_SUMMARY", fkCol: "ORDER_ID", key: "summary" },
  { table: "ORDER_ANATOMICAL_REGION", fkCol: "ORDER_ID", key: "anatomical_regions" },
  { table: "ORDER_IMAGE_AVAIL_INFO", fkCol: "ORDER_ID", key: "image_availability" },
  { table: "ORDER_DOCUMENTS", fkCol: "ORDER_ID", key: "documents" },
  { table: "ORD_PRFLST_TRK", fkCol: "ORDER_ID", key: "preference_list" },
  { table: "ORD_SECOND_SIGN", fkCol: "ORDER_ID", key: "second_signature" },
  { table: "RAD_THERAPY_ASSOC_COURSE", fkCol: "ORDER_ID", key: "rad_therapy_course" },
  { table: "ADT_ORDER_INFORMATION", fkCol: "ORDER_ID", key: "adt_info" },
  { table: "ORDER_RES_COMMENT", fkCol: "ORDER_ID", key: "result_comments" },
  { table: "PERFORMING_ORG_INFO", fkCol: "ORDER_ID", key: "performing_org" },
]

title: Encounters: PAT_ENC (splits) + children → visits
description: Clinical encounters with DX, appointments, disposition, vitals, flowsheets

ADDITIONAL_EM_CODE._TABLE_: This table holds all information related to additional evaluation and management (E/M) codes.
ADDITIONAL_EM_CODE.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: A unique serial number for this encounter. This number is unique across all patients and encounters in the system.
ADDITIONAL_EM_CODE.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.
ADDITIONAL_EM_CODE.EM_CODE_ADDL_ID: Procedure codes used in addition to the Level of Service (LOS).
ADDITIONAL_EM_CODE.EM_CODE_MOD_ID: Modifiers associated with the additional E/M code. Stored in comma-delimited format with up to four modifiers.
ADDITIONAL_EM_CODE.EM_CODE_BILPROV_ID: The billing provider for the additional Evaluation and Management (E/M) codes.
ADDITIONAL_EM_CODE.EM_CODE_UNIQUE_NUM: Unique number associated with each additional E/M code. The number is only unique within the contact.
ADDITIONAL_EM_CODE.EM_NO_CHG_REASON_C_NAME: The reason that a charge was not triggered for an E/M code. This item being populated does not imply any issues with system integrity or system build; it will be set both for legitimate reasons that a charge was not triggered as well as non-legitimate reasons.
ADDITIONAL_EM_CODE.AR_EM_CODE_DX: The associated diagnosis information for additional E/M code data generated by an AR interface.

AN_RELINK_INFO.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number (CSN) for this contact. The number is unique across all patient encounters in any given system. If the system uses IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
AN_RELINK_INFO.PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL: A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
AN_RELINK_INFO.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
AN_RELINK_INFO.CM_CT_OWNER_ID: The Community ID (CID) of the instance that owns this contact. This is only populated if you use IntraConnect.
AN_RELINK_INFO.AN_RELINKRESCHED_ID: When this appointment is rescheduled, the anesthesia record listed here will automatically be relinked to the new appointment.
AN_RELINK_INFO.AN_RELINK_TYPE_C_NAME: Type of relinking to perform when the appointment is rescheduled.

APPT_LETTER_RECIPIENTS._TABLE_: Information about the patient and their contacts selected to receive appointment letters.
APPT_LETTER_RECIPIENTS.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
APPT_LETTER_RECIPIENTS.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.
APPT_LETTER_RECIPIENTS.PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL: A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
APPT_LETTER_RECIPIENTS.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
APPT_LETTER_RECIPIENTS.CM_CT_OWNER_ID: The Community ID (CID) of the instance that owns this contact. This is only populated if you use IntraConnect.
APPT_LETTER_RECIPIENTS.PAT_RELATIONSHIP_ID: A unique ID of the patient contact to indicate if the patient contact should receive appointment letters for a given visit.
APPT_LETTER_RECIPIENTS.SHOULD_RECEIVE_LETTERS_YN: Indicates whether a patient or a patient's contact should receive appointment letters for this visit. 'N' indicates they should not receive appointment letters.
APPT_LETTER_RECIPIENTS.SHOULD_ATTEND_VISIT_YN: Indicates whether a patient or a patient's contact should attend this visit. 'N' indicates they should not attend this visit.
APPT_LETTER_RECIPIENTS.DID_ATTEND_VISIT_YN: Indicates whether a patient or a patient's contact attended this visit. 'N' indicates they did not attend this visit.

ASSOCIATED_REFERRALS._TABLE_: This table contains information about referrals linked to an appointment.
ASSOCIATED_REFERRALS.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
ASSOCIATED_REFERRALS.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.
ASSOCIATED_REFERRALS.PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL: A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
ASSOCIATED_REFERRALS.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
ASSOCIATED_REFERRALS.ASSOCIATED_REFERRAL_ID: Stores the IDs of referrals associated with a visit.
ASSOCIATED_REFERRALS.ASSOC_LNK_SRC_C_NAME: The method used to link this appointment to the referral in the corresponding line of EPT-23025.
ASSOCIATED_REFERRALS.ASSOC_LNK_UTC_DTTM: The instant (UTC) the appointment was linked to the referral in the corresponding line of EPT-23025.

CLARITY_DEP._TABLE_: The CLARITY_DEP table contains high-level information about departments.
CLARITY_DEP.DEPARTMENT_ID: The unique ID number assigned to the department record.
CLARITY_DEP.EXTERNAL_NAME: The external name of the department record. This is often used in patient correspondence such as reminder letters.

CLARITY_DEP_4._TABLE_: This table extends CLARITY_DEP, which contains high-level information about departments from the Department master file.
CLARITY_DEP_4.DEPARTMENT_ID: The unique ID of the Department record.
CLARITY_DEP_4.MED_REC_STYLE_C_NAME: The medication reconciliation style category ID for the department.

CLARITY_EDG._TABLE_: The CLARITY_EDG table contains basic information about diagnoses.
CLARITY_EDG.DX_ID: The unique ID of the diagnosis record in your system.
CLARITY_EDG.PAT_FRIENDLY_TEXT: A description of the diagnosis that is easy for patients to understand.

CLARITY_SER._TABLE_: The CLARITY_SER table contains high-level information about your provider records. These records may be caregivers, resources, classes, devices, and modalities.
CLARITY_SER.PROV_ID: The unique ID assigned to the provider record. This ID can be encrypted.
CLARITY_SER.PROV_NAME: The name of the service provider. This item may be hidden in a public view of the CLARITY_SER table.
CLARITY_SER.EXTERNAL_NAME: The external name of the provider record.

DISCONTINUED_MEDS._TABLE_: This table contains a list of medications that have been discontinued for a patient during an encounter.
DISCONTINUED_MEDS.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique identifier of the patient encounter. Contact serial number is unique across all patients and all contacts.
DISCONTINUED_MEDS.PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL: This is a numeric representation of the date of this encounter in your system. The integer portion of the number specifies the date of the encounter. The digits after the decimal point indicate multiple visits on one day.
DISCONTINUED_MEDS.CONTACT_DATE: The date on which the patient encounter occurred.
DISCONTINUED_MEDS.MEDS_DISCONTINUED: This column contains medications that were discontinued for the patient during the associated patient encounter.

ECHKIN_STEP_INFO._TABLE_: This table contains eCheck-In information for a specific appointment.
ECHKIN_STEP_INFO.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
ECHKIN_STEP_INFO.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.
ECHKIN_STEP_INFO.PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL: A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
ECHKIN_STEP_INFO.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
ECHKIN_STEP_INFO.CM_CT_OWNER_ID: The Community ID (CID) of the instance that owns this contact. This is only populated if you use IntraConnect.
ECHKIN_STEP_INFO.INCLUDED_STEP_C_NAME: The step of the eCheck-In workflow.
ECHKIN_STEP_INFO.ECHKIN_STEP_STAT_C_NAME: The status of the specific step mentioned in the eCheck-In workflow.
ECHKIN_STEP_INFO.STEP_COMPLETED_UTC_DTTM: Stores the instant (in UTC) the step was completed in the eCheck-In workflow
ECHKIN_STEP_INFO.MYPT_ID: Stores the MyChart user ID that did the eCheck-In step.
ECHKIN_STEP_INFO.STEP_ACTION_C_NAME: The category ID for the action taken on an eCheck-In step.

ED_PAT_STATUS._TABLE_: The ED_PAT_STATUS table contains information about ED patients' "patient" status. One row in this table corresponds to one ED "patient" status change. If a patient's ED "patient" status is changed five times in a single encounter, this table will contain five rows for that encounter.
ED_PAT_STATUS.INPATIENT_DATA_ID: The unique ID associated with the Inpatient Data Store record for this row. This column is frequently used to link to PAT_ENC_HSP.INPATIENT_DATA_ID.
ED_PAT_STATUS.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this patient status. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
ED_PAT_STATUS.ED_PAT_STATUS_C_NAME: The category number of the ED patient status for the ED encounter.
ED_PAT_STATUS.PAT_STATUS_TIME: The date and time when the ED patient status was set.
ED_PAT_STATUS.PAT_STATUS_USER_ID: The unique ID of the user who is associated with this status change. This column is frequently used to link to the CLARITY_EMP table.
ED_PAT_STATUS.PAT_STATUS_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ED_PAT_STATUS.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI). This column is frequently used to link to PAT_ENC_HSP.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID.

EXT_PHARM_TYPE_COVERED._TABLE_: The pharmacy coverage type returned from Surescripts eligibility response.
EXT_PHARM_TYPE_COVERED.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
EXT_PHARM_TYPE_COVERED.GROUP_LINE: The line number for the information associated with this contact.
EXT_PHARM_TYPE_COVERED.VALUE_LINE: The line number of one of the multiple values associated with a specific group of data within this contact.
EXT_PHARM_TYPE_COVERED.COVERED_EXTERNAL_PHARM_TYPE_C_NAME: Stores pharmacy coverage type for SureScripts 5010

FAMILY_HX._TABLE_: The FAMILY_HX table contains data recorded in the family history contacts entered in the patient's chart during a clinical system encounter. Note: This table is designed to hold a patient's history over time; however, it is most typically implemented to only extract the latest patient history contact.
FAMILY_HX.LINE: The line number to identify the family history contact within the patient�s record.  NOTE: Each line of history is stored in enterprise reporting as its own record; a given patient may have multiple records (identified by line number) that reflect multiple lines of history.
FAMILY_HX.MEDICAL_HX_C_NAME: The category value associated with the Problem documented in the patient�s family history.
FAMILY_HX.MEDICAL_OTHER: The custom reason for visit or problem entered when the clinical system user chooses "Other" as a family history problem. NOTE: The comment is stored in the same item as MEDICAL_HX_C but is delimited from the response "Other" by the comment character, "[". The EPIC_GET_COMMENT function returns everything after the comment character.
FAMILY_HX.COMMENTS: Free-text comments entered with this problem. This column may be hidden in a public enterprise reporting view.
FAMILY_HX.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: A unique serial number for this encounter. This number is unique across all patients and encounters in the system.
FAMILY_HX.FAM_HX_SRC_C_NAME: This item contains the source of information for a patient's family medical history.
FAMILY_HX.RELATION_C_NAME: This is the category value associated with the family member who has or had this problem. An example might be sister, brother, or mother.
FAMILY_HX.FAM_RELATION_NAME: This is the first and/or last name of the patient's family member. This column is free-text and is meant to be used together with the RELATION_C category to form a unique key for the family member. If no name is entered this column will display an abbreviation of the family relation type beginning with ##.
FAMILY_HX.AGE_OF_ONSET: This item contains the age of onset of the patient's family member that is documented with a history of a problem.
FAMILY_HX.FAM_MED_REL_ID: This item contains the unique ID of the patient's family member relationship for medical history.
FAMILY_HX.FAM_MEDICAL_DX_ID: The unique ID of the diagnosis associated with the family member condition.
FAMILY_HX.AGE_OF_ONSET_END: When the age of onset for a family member's history of a problem is documented as an age range, this item contains the age at the end of the range.

FAM_HX_PAT_ONLY._TABLE_: This table represents all family history specific patient information.
FAM_HX_PAT_ONLY.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
FAM_HX_PAT_ONLY.PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL: A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
FAM_HX_PAT_ONLY.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
FAM_HX_PAT_ONLY.FAM_HX_FERT_STAT_C_NAME: Category for documenting the patient's fertility status.
FAM_HX_PAT_ONLY.FAM_HX_FERT_STAT_NOTES: This item contains additional notes about the patient's fertility status.

FRONT_END_PMT_COLL_HX._TABLE_: This table stores information about front-end collection actions taken through point of sale (POS) payment posting or refund workflows.
FRONT_END_PMT_COLL_HX.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
FRONT_END_PMT_COLL_HX.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.
FRONT_END_PMT_COLL_HX.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
FRONT_END_PMT_COLL_HX.COLL_INSTANT_UTC_DTTM: The instant that this event occurred.
FRONT_END_PMT_COLL_HX.COLL_WORKFLOW_TYPE_C_NAME: The workflow in which this event took place.
FRONT_END_PMT_COLL_HX.LOGIN_DEPARTMENT_ID: The unique ID of the department which a user was logged into at the time of this event.
FRONT_END_PMT_COLL_HX.ENC_DEPARTMENT_ID: The unique ID of the encounter department associated with this event.
FRONT_END_PMT_COLL_HX.RSN_NON_COLL_AMT_C_NAME: The non-collection reason category ID for this event.
FRONT_END_PMT_COLL_HX.RSN_NON_COLL_AMT_COMMENT: The free text non-collection comment explaining why some portion of a due amount was not collected.
FRONT_END_PMT_COLL_HX.GUARANTOR_ACCOUNT_ID: The unique ID of the guarantor who is associated with this event.
FRONT_END_PMT_COLL_HX.EVENT_TYPE_C_NAME: The event type category ID that defines the type of payment event data that is stored in this row.
FRONT_END_PMT_COLL_HX.PB_COPAY_COLL: The amount of professional billing copay that a user collected during this event.
FRONT_END_PMT_COLL_HX.PB_COPAY_PAID: The amount of professional billing copay that had already been paid towards an encounter at the time of this event.
FRONT_END_PMT_COLL_HX.PB_COPAY_DUE: The total amount of professional billing copay that is required for this visit at the time of this event.
FRONT_END_PMT_COLL_HX.HB_COPAY_COLL: The amount of hospital billing copay that a user collected during this event.
FRONT_END_PMT_COLL_HX.HB_COPAY_PAID: The amount of hospital billing copay that had already been paid towards an encounter at the time of this event.
FRONT_END_PMT_COLL_HX.HB_COPAY_DUE: The total amount of hospital billing copay that is required for this visit at the time of this event.
FRONT_END_PMT_COLL_HX.PB_PREPAY_COLL: The amount of professional billing prepayment that a user collected.
FRONT_END_PMT_COLL_HX.PB_PREPAY_PAID: The amount of professional billing prepayment that had already been paid towards an encounter at the time of this event.
FRONT_END_PMT_COLL_HX.PB_PREPAY_DUE: The total amount of professional billing prepayment that is required for this visit at the time of this event.
FRONT_END_PMT_COLL_HX.HB_PREPAY_COLL: The amount of hospital billing prepayment that a user collected during this event.
FRONT_END_PMT_COLL_HX.HB_PREPAY_PAID: The amount of hospital billing prepayment that had already been paid towards an encounter at the time of this event.
FRONT_END_PMT_COLL_HX.HB_PREPAY_DUE: The total amount of hospital billing prepayment that is required for this visit at the time of this event.
FRONT_END_PMT_COLL_HX.PB_PREV_BAL_COLL: The amount of professional billing previous balance that a user collected during this event.
FRONT_END_PMT_COLL_HX.PB_PREV_BAL_PAID: The amount of professional billing previous balance that had already been paid towards this guarantor's outstanding balance during the day of this event.
FRONT_END_PMT_COLL_HX.PB_PREV_BAL_DUE: The amount of self-pay professional billing outstanding balance that a guarantor owed at the time of this event.
FRONT_END_PMT_COLL_HX.HB_PREV_BAL_COLL: The amount of hospital billing previous balance that a user collected during this event.
FRONT_END_PMT_COLL_HX.HB_PREV_BAL_PAID: The amount of hospital billing previous balance that had already been paid towards this guarantor's outstanding balance during the day of this event.
FRONT_END_PMT_COLL_HX.HB_PREV_BAL_DUE: The amount of self-pay hospital billing outstanding balance that a guarantor owed at the time of this event.
FRONT_END_PMT_COLL_HX.PREPAY_DISCOUNT_OFFERED: The total amount of the prepay discount that was offered for this visit at the time of this event.
FRONT_END_PMT_COLL_HX.VIS_BAL_COLL: The amount of visit balance that a user collected during this event.
FRONT_END_PMT_COLL_HX.VIS_BAL_PAID: The amount of the visit balance that had already been paid towards an encounter at the time of this event.
FRONT_END_PMT_COLL_HX.VIS_BAL_DUE: The total amount of the visit balance that is required for this visit at the time of this event.

HNO_INFO._TABLE_: This table contains common information from General Use Notes items. This table focuses on time-insensitive, once-per-record data while other HNO tables (e.g., NOTES_ACCT, CODING_CLA_NOTES) contain the data for different note types.
HNO_INFO.NOTE_ID: The unique ID of the note record.
HNO_INFO.NOTE_TYPE_NOADD_C_NAME: This virtual item is populated with a category value from Note - Type No-Add (I HNO 51) according to the following logic: * if Note - Type No-Add (I HNO 51) is populated, use the value directly * if Note - Type No-Add (I HNO 51) is null and the note is not ambulatory, return null * if Note - Type No-Add (I HNO 51) is null and the note has an ambulatory encounter context, obtain a category from the UCN note type (I HNO 34033) and map that value to an equivalent category from Note - Type No Add (I HNO 51), if possible
HNO_INFO.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for the patient encounter to which the note is attached. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
HNO_INFO.ENTRY_USER_ID: The unique ID of the user who created this note. This column is frequently used to link to the CLARITY_EMP table.
HNO_INFO.ENTRY_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
HNO_INFO.NOTE_DESC: This is a free text description of the note.
HNO_INFO.IP_NOTE_TYPE_C_NAME: The note type associated with this note.
HNO_INFO.ORIGINAL_HP_ID: For View-Only H&P notes only - original note record identifier
HNO_INFO.ORIG_HP_DATE_REAL: For View-Only H&P notes only - original note record contact
HNO_INFO.SOURCE_HP_ID: For Interval H&P only - ID of H&P Note being modified by interval note
HNO_INFO.SOURCE_HP_DATE_REAL: For Interval H&P only - contact of H&P Note being modified by interval note
HNO_INFO.ADDENDUM_PARENT_CSN: Contains the contact serial number (CSN) of the parent document.
HNO_INFO.PAT_LINK_ID: Virtual item that will check all HNO items linked to EPT and return the first EPT ID it finds. The items are checked in the following order: 505, 38970, 21001, 600 (which gives us an order, then we look at ord 210), 1605, 1643, 1640.
HNO_INFO.TX_IB_FOLDER_C_NAME: Stores the Type of Message (I EOW 30) In Basket folder to be used by the Transcription interface to generate In Basket messages
HNO_INFO.UNSIGNED_YN: A flag for if the note record is considered an unsigned note.
HNO_INFO.DELETE_INSTANT_DTTM: The instant when the note is deleted.
HNO_INFO.DELETE_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
