PAT_ENC_DISP.PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL: A unique, internal contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of the contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
PAT_ENC_DISP.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
PAT_ENC_DISP.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
PAT_ENC_DISP.DX_FOLLOWUP_C_NAME: This column typically stores special instructions that the lab should follow when processing this patient's lab orders. However, some organizations choose to store other information in this column.
PAT_ENC_DISP.ORDER_INSTR_C_NAME: This column typically stores the method of follow-up used to communicate order results with the patient. However, some organizations choose to store other information in this column.
PAT_ENC_DISP.LOS_DROPPED_C_NAME: The category number that indicates whether the Level of Service was dropped for this encounter. The category value will be equal to "pending" only while it is in the orders queue.
PAT_ENC_DISP.LOS_AUTH_PROV_ID: The authorizing provider as entered from the Level of Service option in the Visit Navigator
PAT_ENC_DISP.LOS_TRIG_ERR_YN: Whether or not there was an LOS trigger error when dropping the charge.
PAT_ENC_DISP.LOS_NEW_OR_EST_C_NAME: The category number that indicates whether the patient is a new (first time being seen) or established patient.
PAT_ENC_DISP.LOS_HX_LEVEL_C_NAME: The category number for how extensively the patient's history was discussed as entered in the Level of Service calculator.
PAT_ENC_DISP.LOS_EXAM_LEVEL_C_NAME: The category number for the extent of the exam as entered in the Level of Service calculator.
PAT_ENC_DISP.LOS_MDM_LEVEL_C_NAME: The category number for the complexity of the medical decision-making in this encounter as entered in the Level of Service calculator.
PAT_ENC_DISP.LOS_NO_CHG_RSN_C_NAME: The reason that a charge was not triggered for a level of service. This item being populated does not imply any issues with system integrity or system build; it will be set both for legitimate reasons that a charge was not triggered as well as non-legitimate reasons.
PAT_ENC_DISP.LOS_SERV_PROV_ID: Servicing Provider for Physician LOS Charge

PAT_ENC_DOCS._TABLE_: The PAT_ENC_DOCS table contains information about each document that is attached to a patient encounter, including scanned and electronically signed documents.
PAT_ENC_DOCS.PAT_ID: The unique ID of the patient record for this row. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.
PAT_ENC_DOCS.PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL: A unique, internal contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of the contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
PAT_ENC_DOCS.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.
PAT_ENC_DOCS.DOC_INFO_ID: The ID of the document for this patient encounter.
PAT_ENC_DOCS.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
PAT_ENC_DOCS.ADT_CONTACT_YN: States whether or not the document is attached to an Admission, Discharge, Transfer, or Leave of Absence (ADT) Contact.

PAT_ENC_DX._TABLE_: The patient encounter diagnosis table contains one record for each diagnosis associated with each encounter level of service. This table will contain all diagnoses specified on the Order Summary screen.
PAT_ENC_DX.PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL: This is a numeric representation of the date of this encounter in your system. The integer portion of the number specifies the date of the encounter. The digits after the decimal point indicate multiple visits on one day.
PAT_ENC_DX.LINE: The line number of the diagnosis within the encounter. This is the second column in the primary key and uniquely identifies this diagnosis on the encounter.
PAT_ENC_DX.CONTACT_DATE: The contact date of the encounter associated with this diagnosis. Note: There may be multiple encounters on the same calendar date.
PAT_ENC_DX.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: A unique serial number for this encounter. This number is unique across all patients and encounters in the system.
PAT_ENC_DX.DX_ID: The unique ID of the diagnosis record associated with the patient encounter. Note: This is NOT the ICD9 diagnosis code. It is an internal identifier that is typically not visible to a user.
PAT_ENC_DX.ANNOTATION: The annotation (description) text entered for this diagnosis by the clinical system user. This field is NULL if no annotation was entered during the encounter.  Order entry in clinical system limits this field to 160 characters.
PAT_ENC_DX.DX_QUALIFIER_C_NAME: The category value for the diagnosis qualifier. This field is null if no qualifier was entered.
PAT_ENC_DX.PRIMARY_DX_YN: This is a one character field that indicates whether this diagnosis was the primary diagnosis for the encounter. If the diagnosis was the primary this field will have a value of 'Y' otherwise it will have a value of 'N'.
PAT_ENC_DX.COMMENTS: Any text comment associated with the encounter diagnosis. This field is NULL if no comment was provided.
PAT_ENC_DX.DX_CHRONIC_YN: Stores the chronic flag for a diagnosis.
PAT_ENC_DX.DX_UNIQUE: Unique identifier given when a diagnosis is added to the encounter diagnosis list.
PAT_ENC_DX.DX_ED_YN: Definitively identifies an encounter diagnosis (I EDG 18400) as being an ED clinical impression. This is important to differentiate ED diagnoses from diagnoses filed to the same item as in the IP setting.
PAT_ENC_DX.DX_LINK_PROB_ID: Stores the problem ID of the linked problem.

PAT_ENC_ELIG_HISTORY._TABLE_: This table holds information about actions taken on a patient's pharmacy benefit eligibility information.
PAT_ENC_ELIG_HISTORY.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
PAT_ENC_ELIG_HISTORY.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.
PAT_ENC_ELIG_HISTORY.PAT_ID: The unique ID of the patient record for this row. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.
PAT_ENC_ELIG_HISTORY.PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL: A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
PAT_ENC_ELIG_HISTORY.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
PAT_ENC_ELIG_HISTORY.CM_CT_OWNER_ID: The Community ID (CID) of the instance that owns this contact. This is only populated if you use IntraConnect.
PAT_ENC_ELIG_HISTORY.ELIG_ACTION_C_NAME: This item holds the action performed on the patient's eligibility.
PAT_ENC_ELIG_HISTORY.ELIG_PLAN_INDEX: This item indicates which eligibility plan the action was taken on. It is an index into the patient (EPT) 42010 group.
PAT_ENC_ELIG_HISTORY.ELIG_HX_USER_ID: This item holds the user who performed the action on the patient's eligibility information.
PAT_ENC_ELIG_HISTORY.ELIG_HX_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PAT_ENC_ELIG_HISTORY.ELIG_HX_INST_UTC_DTTM: This item holds the instant that the eligibility action was performed.

PAT_ENC_HSP._TABLE_: This table is the primary table for hospital encounter information. A hospital encounter is a contact in the patient record created through an ADT workflow such as preadmission, admission, ED Arrival, discharge, and hospital outpatient visit (HOV) contacts. These contact types have the ADT flag (I EPT 10101) set to 1. This table excludes all other contacts.
PAT_ENC_HSP.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
PAT_ENC_HSP.ADT_PAT_CLASS_C_NAME: The category value corresponding to the patient classification for this patient contact.
PAT_ENC_HSP.ADT_PATIENT_STAT_C_NAME: The category value corresponding to the patient status for this patient contact.
PAT_ENC_HSP.LEVEL_OF_CARE_C_NAME: The category value corresponding to the level of care for this patient contact.
PAT_ENC_HSP.PENDING_DISCH_TIME: The date and time of the pending discharge for this patient contact.
PAT_ENC_HSP.DISCH_CODE_C_NAME: The category value corresponding to the discharge code for this patient contact.
PAT_ENC_HSP.ADT_ATHCRT_STAT_C_NAME: The category value corresponding to the authorization/certification status for this patient contact.
PAT_ENC_HSP.PREADM_UNDO_RSN_C_NAME: The category value corresponding to the preadmission undo reason for this patient contact.
PAT_ENC_HSP.EXP_ADMISSION_TIME: The date and time of the expected admission for this patient contact.
PAT_ENC_HSP.EXP_LEN_OF_STAY: The expected length of stay in days of the admission for this patient contact.
PAT_ENC_HSP.EXP_DISCHARGE_DATE: The date of expected discharge of the admission for this patient contact.
PAT_ENC_HSP.ADMIT_CATEGORY_C_NAME: The category value corresponding to the admission category for this patient contact.
PAT_ENC_HSP.ADMIT_SOURCE_C_NAME: The category value corresponding to the admission source for this patient contact.
PAT_ENC_HSP.TYPE_OF_ROOM_C_NAME: The category value corresponding to the type of room requested for this patient contact.
PAT_ENC_HSP.TYPE_OF_BED_C_NAME: The category value corresponding to the type of bed requested for this patient contact.
PAT_ENC_HSP.RSN_FOR_BED_C_NAME: The category value corresponding to the reason for the type of bed requested for this patient contact.
PAT_ENC_HSP.DELIVERY_TYPE_C_NAME: The category value corresponding to the delivery type of the child for this patient contact.
PAT_ENC_HSP.LABOR_STATUS_C_NAME: The category value corresponding to the labor status for this patient contact.
PAT_ENC_HSP.ER_INJURY: Free text description of injury for this patient contact.
PAT_ENC_HSP.ADT_ARRIVAL_TIME: The date and time of arrival for this patient contact.
PAT_ENC_HSP.ADT_ARRIVAL_STS_C_NAME: The category value corresponding to the arrival status for this patient contact.
PAT_ENC_HSP.HOSP_ADMSN_TIME: The date and time that the patient was first admitted to the facility, bedded in the ED, or confirmed for an HOV for this contact, regardless of patient's base patient class.
PAT_ENC_HSP.ADMIT_CONF_STAT_C_NAME: The category value corresponding to the (admission) confirmation status for this patient contact.
PAT_ENC_HSP.HOSP_DISCH_TIME: The hospital discharge date and time for this patient contact.
PAT_ENC_HSP.HOSP_ADMSN_TYPE_C_NAME: The category value corresponding to the admission type for the patient contact.
PAT_ENC_HSP.ROOM_ID: The ID number of the room for the most recent location of the patient for this patient contact.
PAT_ENC_HSP.HOSP_SERV_C_NAME: The category value corresponding to the hospital service for this patient contact.
PAT_ENC_HSP.MEANS_OF_DEPART_C_NAME: The category value corresponding to the means of departure of the patient for this patient contact.
PAT_ENC_HSP.DISCH_DISP_C_NAME: The category value corresponding to the discharge disposition for this patient contact.
PAT_ENC_HSP.DISCH_DEST_C_NAME: The category value corresponding to the discharge destination for this patient contact.
PAT_ENC_HSP.TRANSFER_FROM_C_NAME: The category value corresponding to the transfer from location for this patient contact.
PAT_ENC_HSP.MEANS_OF_ARRV_C_NAME: The category value corresponding to the means of arrival of the patient for this patient contact.
PAT_ENC_HSP.ACUITY_LEVEL_C_NAME: The category value corresponding to the acuity level for this patient contact.
PAT_ENC_HSP.HOSPIST_NEEDED_YN: Indicates whether a hospitalist needs to be assigned to the patient for this contact.
PAT_ENC_HSP.ACCOMMODATION_C_NAME: The category value corresponding to the room accommodation for this patient contact.
PAT_ENC_HSP.ACCOM_REASON_C_NAME: The category value corresponding to the reason for the room accommodation for this patient contact.
PAT_ENC_HSP.INPATIENT_DATA_ID: The unique ID of the Inpatient Data Store record.
PAT_ENC_HSP.PVT_HSP_ENC_C_NAME: The category value corresponding to private encounter setting for this patient contact.
PAT_ENC_HSP.ED_EPISODE_ID: The unique ID of the Inpatient episode record for the ED visit.
PAT_ENC_HSP.ED_DISPOSITION_C_NAME: The disposition of the patient when discharged from the ED.
PAT_ENC_HSP.ED_DISP_TIME: The date and time that the disposition was entered.
PAT_ENC_HSP.FOLLOWUP_PROV_ID: The follow-up provider for the patient.
PAT_ENC_HSP.PROV_CONT_INFO: The contact information for the patient's follow-up provider.
PAT_ENC_HSP.OSHPD_ADMSN_SRC_C_NAME: Office of Statewide Health Planning and Development (OSHPD) Source of Admission
PAT_ENC_HSP.OSHPD_LICENSURE_C_NAME: Office of Statewide Health Planning and Development (OSHPD) Licensure of Site
PAT_ENC_HSP.OSHPD_ROUTE_C_NAME: Office of Statewide Health Planning and Development (OSHPD) Route of Admission
PAT_ENC_HSP.INP_ADM_DATE: Date-time of the inpatient admission. This is the date/time during the hospital encounter when the patient first received a base patient class of inpatient. This can be different than the value for the admission date if the patient was assigned an emergency or outpatient base patient class.
PAT_ENC_HSP.COPY_TO_PCP_YN: This item will indicate whether the PCP effective for the patient should be notified upon a pre-determined system event.
PAT_ENC_HSP.ADOPTION_CASE_YN: Item to store whether the current contact is related to an adoption case.
PAT_ENC_HSP.PREOP_TEACHING_C_NAME: This item describes whether a patient has been offered or given any pre-operative teaching.
PAT_ENC_HSP.PREOP_PRN_EVAL_C_NAME: This is a category item that describes whether a patient has been offered or given a pre-operative nurse practitioner evaluation.
PAT_ENC_HSP.PREOP_PH_SCREEN_C_NAME: This is a category list that describes whether a patient has been offered or given a pre-operative phone screening.
PAT_ENC_HSP.LABOR_ACT_BIRTH_C_NAME: The category value corresponding to the actual birth status of the delivery.
PAT_ENC_HSP.LABOR_FEED_TYPE_C_NAME: The category value corresponding to the infant feeding type during the delivery process
PAT_ENC_HSP.ED_DEPARTURE_TIME: Date and time the patient left the ED.
PAT_ENC_HSP.TRIAGE_DATETIME: The date and the time the patient was triaged.
PAT_ENC_HSP.INP_ADM_EVENT_ID: The event record for the hospital encounter where the patient first received a base patient class of inpatient, making them an inpatient.
PAT_ENC_HSP.INP_ADM_EVENT_DATE: Instant of the event creation of the event which caused a patient to become an inpatient patient class.
PAT_ENC_HSP.INP_DWNGRD_EVNT_ID: Column to return the event ID of the event that last downgrades the patient from an inpatient patient class to a non-inpatient patient class.
PAT_ENC_HSP.INP_DWNGRD_DATE: Column that returns the effective date and time of a patients latest downgrade from an inpatient patient class.
PAT_ENC_HSP.INP_DWNGRD_EVNT_DT: Column to return the event date and time of the last event that downgrades a patient from an inpatient patient class to a non-inpatient patient class.
PAT_ENC_HSP.OP_ADM_DATE: The date and time during the hospital encounter when the patient first received a base patient class of outpatient.
PAT_ENC_HSP.EMER_ADM_DATE: The date and time during the hospital encounter when the patient first received a base patient class of emergency.
PAT_ENC_HSP.OP_ADM_EVENT_ID: The event record for the hospital encounter where the patient first received a base patient class of outpatient.
PAT_ENC_HSP.EMER_ADM_EVENT_ID: The event record for the hospital encounter where the patient first received a base patient class of emergency.
PAT_ENC_HSP.HOV_CONF_STATUS_C_NAME: This item stores a flag to prevent HOVs from being closed by the end of day batch.
PAT_ENC_HSP.RELIG_NEEDS_VISIT_C_NAME: Used to track a patient's visit-specific religious needs.
PAT_ENC_HSP.EXP_DISCHARGE_TIME: The time of expected discharge of the admission for this patient contact.
PAT_ENC_HSP.BILL_ATTEND_PROV_ID: Billing Attending Provider - The attending provider that is or will be specified on the hospital account and claim when billed.
PAT_ENC_HSP.OB_LD_LABORING_YN: Indicates whether the patient was in labor upon arrival at the hospital.
PAT_ENC_HSP.OB_LD_LABOR_TM: The date and time at which labor began.
PAT_ENC_HSP.TRIAGE_ID_TAG: The trauma identifier assigned to patient. This number is frequently associated with a pre-printed trauma packet that is used when an accident or other incident results in many patients arriving at the hospital in a short time period.
PAT_ENC_HSP.TRIAGE_ID_TAG_CMT: A free-text comment that can be entered along with the trauma identifier or triage ID assigned to the patient.
PAT_ENC_HSP.TPLNT_BILL_STAT_C_NAME: The category number for the Transplant Billing Status for a visit.
PAT_ENC_HSP.ACTL_DELIVRY_METH_C_NAME: Indicates the delivery method of the last baby delivered on this encounter by this patient. For example, Spontaneous Vaginal Delivery, C-Section - Unspecified, etc.
PAT_ENC_HSP.PRENATAL_CARE_C_NAME: Item used to indicate what type of prenatal care the patient has received.
PAT_ENC_HSP.AMBULANCE_CODE_C_NAME: The category number for the ambulance code.
PAT_ENC_HSP.MSE_DATE: Indicates the date and time of the patient's medical screening exam (MSE).
PAT_ENC_HSP.ADMIT_PROV_TEXT: The free text admitting provider for the encounter.
PAT_ENC_HSP.ATTEND_PROV_TEXT: The free text attending provider for the encounter.
PAT_ENC_HSP.PROV_PRIM_TEXT: The free text primary care provider for the encounter
PAT_ENC_HSP.PROV_PRIM_TEXT_PHON: The free text phone number for the primary care provider.
PAT_ENC_HSP.HOSPITAL_AREA_ID: This field identifies the hospital area associated with the hospital unit in this patient contact.
PAT_ENC_HSP.CHIEF_COMPLAINT_C_NAME: This holds the category number for the chief complaint if the free text chief complaint item is not being used.

PAT_ENC_HSP_2._TABLE_: The PAT_ENC_HSP_2 table is the subsequent table for the PAT_ENC_HSP table, which is the primary table for hospital encounter information. Each record in this table is based on a patient contact serial number.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL: A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.EX_DIS_DT_ENTR_DTTM: The instant of entry of expected discharge date.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.EX_DIS_TM_ENTR_DTTM: The instant of entry of expected discharge time.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.CONTRACT_REG_FLAG: Indicates whether an HOV contact was registered using the Contract Registration workflow. If this workflow was not used, this column is null.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.CONTRACT_CODE_C_NAME: The contract code category for the encounter.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.ACCEPTS_BLOOD_C_NAME: The category ID that indicates whether this patient accepts blood.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.ED_ARRIVAL_DETAILS: Free text information holding any details regarding the ED Arrival.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.CONS_SEDATION_C_NAME: The category ID of the conscious sedation status for the patient encounter.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.RESTRAINT_SECLUS_C_NAME: The restraint or seclusion status category ID for this patient encounter.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.MULTI_PREG_YN: Indicates whether the mother has a multiple pregnancy for this L&D encounter.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.DISASTER_NUM: This column stores the disaster number, which is a number given by the ambulance company to patients during catastrophes that cause massive patient influxes to the hospital.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.SRC_PATTERN_CSN_ID: The Contact Serial Number (CSN) of the Admission Pattern record associated with the projected bed usage for this patient encounter. If this projection is manually modified an end user, the column stores null.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.ENC_CLOSED_OR_COMPLETED_DATE: The date that the encounter was closed or completed.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.ED_DISPO_PAT_COND_C_NAME: The category ID of the patient condition at time of disposition in the ED.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.ADOPTION_TYPE_C_NAME: Item to store what type of adoption is related to the current L&D contact.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.PRI_PROBLEM_ID: The unique ID of the principal problem for a patient's hospitalization.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.EXPECTED_DISCHRG_APPROX_TIME_C_NAME: Current approximate expected discharge time.  Each value represents a time range (e.g. Morning, Midday, Afternoon, Evening).
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.DISCH_MILEST_KICKOFF_UTC_DTTM: Displays the date and time that discharge milestones were initiated.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.DISCH_MILEST_AUTO_MANAGED_YN: Determines if discharge milestones have had any manual intervention.  Discharge Milestones are considered auto-managed if the discharge order is the sole driver for kicking off and discontinuing milestones.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.PREDICTED_LOS: The Length of Stay value determined by the Predictive Model run.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.EXP_LOS_UPD_SRC_C_NAME: The source (e.g. Predictive Model, User Entered) from which the Expected Length of Stay was updated.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.ED_ENC_SRC_C_NAME: This column stores how an ED encounter was created (e.g. via interface, user workflows)
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.ED_DEPART_UTC_DTTM: The ED Departure date and time in UTC.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.ADT_ARRIVAL_UTC_DTTM: The arrival date and time in UTC.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.HOSP_DISCH_UTC_DTTM: The hospital discharge date and time in UTC.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.HOSP_ADMSN_UTC_DTTM: The hospital admission date and time in UTC.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.INP_ADMSN_UTC_DTTM: The date and time that the patient first reached a patient class of Inpatient in UTC.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.ED_HISTORICAL_YN: ED Historical Encounter is set by cutover and historical encounter interfaces when patient encounters are created for emergency patients.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.PATIENT_TASK_COMPLETION_RATE: Aggregated task progression rates across all active tasks currently assigned to the patient.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.START_MED_REM_DISCHG_YN: If set to 1-Yes, medication reminders will start automatically after discharge. If set to 0-No or empty, medication reminders will not start automatically after discharge.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.EXPECTED_DISCHARGE_UNKNOWN_YN: Indicates whether the expected discharge date is unknown for this patient. 'Y' indicates that the expected discharge date is unknown and documented. 'N' indicates that the expected discharge date is known and documented. NULL indicates that no expected discharge info has been saved for this contact.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.DUAL_ADMISSION_CSN: In a dual admission scenario this will point from the encounter on leave to the admitted encounter.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.LOA_PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: This column is only populated when the encounter for this row is admitted and the patient currently has an encounter on a leave of absence. This column displays the unique contact serial number of the patient encounter that is on a leave of absence.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.INITIAL_ADT_PAT_STAT_C_NAME: The ADT type of encounter category ID initially assigned for the encounter.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.NOTIFICATION_SENT_FIRST_IP_YN: Indicates whether the Event Notification message was sent when the patient was upgraded to an IP class. 'Y' indicates that the message was sent. 'N' or NULL indicate that the message was not sent. Note that this message is only sent once, even though the date and time the patient became IP can be changed.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.NOTIFICATION_SENT_OBS_ADMSN_YN: Indicates whether the Event Notification message was sent when the patient was upgraded to an observation patient class. 'Y' indicates that the message was sent. 'N' or NULL indicate that the message was not sent. Note that this message is only sent once, even though the date and time the patient became observation can be changed.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.IB_ALERT_LENGTH_OF_STAY_MSG_ID: The unique ID of the In Basket Message that was sent to alert that a patient has gone past the approved length of stay.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.INITIAL_ADMIT_CONF_STAT_C_NAME: The encounter status category ID initially assigned to this encounter.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.TRANSFER_COMMENTS: The transfer comments entered by the user during the most recent transfer.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.MED_READINESS_DTTM: The medical readiness date and time for this patient encounter. This date and time may be expected or confirmed, depending on whether the patient is medically ready or not.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.MED_READINESS_TIMEFRAM_C_NAME: The medical readiness timeframe category ID for the patient encounter
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.MED_READINESS_YN: Indicates whether this patient encounter is medically ready for discharge. 'Y' indicates that this encounter has been marked medically ready for discharge. 'N' or NULL indicates that it has not been marked medically ready for discharge.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.MED_READINESS_INST_ENTRY_DTTM: The instant at which this patient's medical readiness information was last updated
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.MED_READINESS_USER_ID: The unique ID of the user who last updated medical readiness information for this patient encounter
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.MED_READINESS_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.MED_READINESS_SOURCE_C_NAME: The medical readiness source category ID for this patient encounter
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.EXP_DISCH_DISP_USER_ID: This item logs the last user that changed the expected discharge disposition.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.EXP_DISCH_DISP_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PAT_ENC_HSP_2.EXP_DISCH_DISP_ENTRY_UTC_DTTM: The instant of entry of expected discharge disposition.

PAT_ENC_LETTERS._TABLE_: The patient encounter letters table contains information about letters associated with encounters.
PAT_ENC_LETTERS.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
PAT_ENC_LETTERS.LINE: The line count used to identify different letters associated with an encounter.
PAT_ENC_LETTERS.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
PAT_ENC_LETTERS.LTR_STATUS_C_NAME: The category value associated with the status of each letter,  such as 1- Open, 2- Deleted, 3- Sent, 4- Voided, 5-Sent by batch.
PAT_ENC_LETTERS.LETTER_CREAT_DT: The date that the letter was created.
PAT_ENC_LETTERS.LETTER_HNO_ID: The note (HNO) record that hold the letter text.
PAT_ENC_LETTERS.LETTER_FROM_ID: The user ID of the user entered as the "from" user in the letter activity.
PAT_ENC_LETTERS.LETTER_FROM_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PAT_ENC_LETTERS.LETTER_ROUT_CMT_ID: The note (HNO) ID that holds the letter routing comments.
PAT_ENC_LETTERS.LETTER_REASON_C_NAME: The category value associated with the reason for the letter.
PAT_ENC_LETTERS.LETTER_REASON_CMT: The comment for the letter reason.
PAT_ENC_LETTERS.LTR_STATUS_CHG_TM: The instant (date and time) the status of the letter was created or changed.
PAT_ENC_LETTERS.LTR_STAT_CH_USR_ID: The user that changed or created the letter status.
PAT_ENC_LETTERS.LTR_STAT_CH_USR_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PAT_ENC_LETTERS.LETTER_DELVRY_ADDR: The address the letter was sent to.
PAT_ENC_LETTERS.LETTER_RETURN_ADDR: The return address for the letter
PAT_ENC_LETTERS.LETTER_WORKINGDAYS: The number of work days (excluding weekends and holidays) from the date of the letter's encounter to the date the letter was sent.

PAT_ENC_LOS_DX._TABLE_: The PAT_ENC_LOS_DX table enables you to report on the diagnoses associated with the level of service (LOS) entered for a patient encounter. This table contains only information for those diagnoses that have been explicitly associated with the LOS.
PAT_ENC_LOS_DX.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
PAT_ENC_LOS_DX.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.
PAT_ENC_LOS_DX.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
PAT_ENC_LOS_DX.DX_UNIQUE: The unique identifier of the diagnosis associated with the Level of Service (LOS). This value corresponds to the DX_UNIQUE column in the PAT_ENC_DX table. Together with PAT_ENC_CSN_ID, this forms the foreign key to the PAT_ENC_DX table.

PAT_ENC_PAS._TABLE_: PAS items for a patient encounter.
PAT_ENC_PAS.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
PAT_ENC_PAS.AMBULANCE_INCIDENT_NUM: The unique identifier of a patient's journey, via ambulance, to a place where the patient received care.
PAT_ENC_PAS.AMBULANCE_ORG_POS_ID: The unique identifier of the place of service that provided ambulance service for the patient.

PAT_ENC_QNRS_ANS._TABLE_: The PAT_ENC_QNRS_ANS table contains the Answer ID numbers for the Answers to all Appointment Questionnaires. An Appointment can have multiple Questionnaires that are used in conjunction with it, and each Questionnaire will have one Answer record associated with it.
PAT_ENC_QNRS_ANS.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: This is the Contact Serial Number. It uniquely identifies this contact across all patients and all contacts.
PAT_ENC_QNRS_ANS.LINE: This item stores the line number of each Questionnaire Answer record that exists for this record.
PAT_ENC_QNRS_ANS.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.

PAT_ENC_RSN_VISIT._TABLE_: The PAT_ENC_RSN_VISIT contains the data entered as the Reason for Visit for a clinical system encounter. Each row in this table is one reason for visit associated with a patient encounter. One patient encounter may have multiple reasons for visit; therefore, the item LINE is used to identify each reason for visit within an encounter.
PAT_ENC_RSN_VISIT.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: A unique serial number for this encounter. This number is unique across all patients and encounters in the system.
PAT_ENC_RSN_VISIT.LINE: The line number of the reason for visit within the encounter.
PAT_ENC_RSN_VISIT.ENC_REASON_ID: The ID of the record associated with the Reason for Visit entered in an encounter.
PAT_ENC_RSN_VISIT.COMMENTS: The comments associated with the reason for visit entered in a clinical system exam encounter.
PAT_ENC_RSN_VISIT.RFV_ONSET_DT: The onset date for reason for call/visit stored on this line.  Typically this value will only be collected during call workflows such as a telephone encounter.
PAT_ENC_RSN_VISIT.BODY_LOC_ID: The body location associated with the reason for visit for this patient encounter. This column is frequently used to link to the VESSEL_DOC table.

PAT_ENC_SEL_PHARMACIES._TABLE_: Contains the list of selected pharmacies for an encounter.
PAT_ENC_SEL_PHARMACIES.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number (CSN) for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
PAT_ENC_SEL_PHARMACIES.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.
PAT_ENC_SEL_PHARMACIES.PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL: A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
PAT_ENC_SEL_PHARMACIES.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
PAT_ENC_SEL_PHARMACIES.CM_CT_OWNER_ID: The Community ID (CID) of the instance that owns this contact. This is only populated if you use IntraConnect.
PAT_ENC_SEL_PHARMACIES.PAT_ENC_PHARM_ID: Contains the pharmacies that have been selected for the encounter. The pharmacies will display in the pharmacy association grid for the encounter.
PAT_ENC_SEL_PHARMACIES.PAT_ENC_PHR_DEST_ID: Contains the list of destinations for each selected pharmacy listed in PAT_ENC_PHARM_ID.

PAT_ENC_THREADS._TABLE_: This table contains information regarding a telephone encounter and any related messages.
PAT_ENC_THREADS.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
PAT_ENC_THREADS.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
PAT_ENC_THREADS.THREAD_ID: The unique ID of the thread for a telephone encounter that was sent to another user.

PAT_HM_LETTER._TABLE_: List of Health Maintenance letters with corresponding topic, type and due date.
PAT_HM_LETTER.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
PAT_HM_LETTER.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.
PAT_HM_LETTER.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
PAT_HM_LETTER.HM_LET_TOPIC_LST_ID: The Health Maintenance Topic corresponding with the letter.
PAT_HM_LETTER.HM_LET_TOPIC_LST_ID_NAME: The name of the health maintenance topic.

PAT_HX_REVIEW._TABLE_:
This table contains information about when a patient's history was reviewed and by whom.





More detailed information on what kinds of history were reviewed is in the PAT_HX_REV_TYPE and PAT_HX_REV_TOPIC tables.
PAT_HX_REVIEW.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
PAT_HX_REVIEW.LINE_COUNT: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
PAT_HX_REVIEW.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
PAT_HX_REVIEW.HX_REVIEWED_USER_ID: The unique ID of the user who reviewed history for the patient.
PAT_HX_REVIEW.HX_REVIEWED_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PAT_HX_REVIEW.HX_REVIEWED_DATE: The date history was reviewed for this patient.
PAT_HX_REVIEW.HX_REVIEWED_INSTANT: The date and time history was reviewed for this patient.

PAT_HX_REV_TOPIC._TABLE_:
This table contains information about where in the application the history was reviewed for a patient.





The history types (the kind of history reviewed) associated with a header (where the history was reviewed) are in PAT_HX_REV_TYPE.





Additional information about when a patient's history was reviewed and by whom is found in the PAT_HX_REVIEW table.
PAT_HX_REV_TOPIC.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
PAT_HX_REV_TOPIC.GROUP_LINE: The line number of the associated instance of history review in this encounter. Together with PAT_ENC_CSN_ID, this forms the foreign key to the PAT_HX_REVIEW table.
PAT_HX_REV_TOPIC.VALUE_LINE: The line number of one of the multiple history topics that were reviewed for the associated instance of review and encounter from the PAT_HX_REVIEW table.
PAT_HX_REV_TOPIC.HX_REVIEWED_HEADER: The header (a short title or description) and possibly, depending where in the application the history was reviewed, a unique record ID that describe where the history was reviewed.

PAT_HX_REV_TYPE._TABLE_:
This table contains information types of history that were reviewed for a patient, such as Medical, Surgical, Socioeconomic, Alcohol, Tobacco, etc.





Where in the application a type of history was reviewed is in the PAT_HX_REV_TOPIC table.





Additional information about when a patient's history was reviewed and by whom is found in the PAT_HX_REVIEW table.
PAT_HX_REV_TYPE.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
PAT_HX_REV_TYPE.GROUP_LINE: The line number of the associated instance of history review in this encounter. Together with PAT_ENC_CSN_ID, this forms the foreign key to the PAT_HX_REVIEW table.
PAT_HX_REV_TYPE.VALUE_LINE: The line number of one of the multiple history types that were reviewed for the associated instance of review and encounter from the PAT_HX_REVIEW table.
PAT_HX_REV_TYPE.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
PAT_HX_REV_TYPE.HX_REVIEWED_TYPE_C_NAME: The category value associated with the type of History Visit Navigator topic that was reviewed, such as Medical, Surgical, Socioeconomic, etc.

PAT_MYC_MESG._TABLE_: This table contains a link to the MyChart message for a patient encounter.
PAT_MYC_MESG.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
PAT_MYC_MESG.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
PAT_MYC_MESG.PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL: This is a numeric representation of the date of this encounter in your system. The integer portion of the number specifies the date of the encounter. The digits after the decimal point indicate multiple visits on one day.
PAT_MYC_MESG.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
PAT_MYC_MESG.CM_CT_OWNER_ID: ID of the deployment owner for this contact.
PAT_MYC_MESG.MYCHART_MESSAGE_ID: The unique ID of the MyChart message for an encounter.

PAT_REVIEW_ALLERGI._TABLE_: Table contains patient entered clinical allergy data review from Welcome Kiosk and MyChart.
PAT_REVIEW_ALLERGI.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
PAT_REVIEW_ALLERGI.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.
PAT_REVIEW_ALLERGI.PAT_ID: The unique ID of the patient record for this row. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.
PAT_REVIEW_ALLERGI.PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL: A unique, internal contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of the contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
PAT_REVIEW_ALLERGI.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
PAT_REVIEW_ALLERGI.PAT_REVIEW_ELG_ID_ALLERGEN_NAME: The name of the allergen record.
PAT_REVIEW_ALLERGI.PAT_REVIEW_ELG_R_YN: Patient allergies reviewed by patient response.
PAT_REVIEW_ALLERGI.PAT_REVIEW_EXTERNAL: Patient allergies reviewed by the patient, entered in a free text format.

PAT_REVIEW_DATA._TABLE_: Table contains patient entered clinical data review from Welcome Kiosk and MyChart.
PAT_REVIEW_DATA.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
PAT_REVIEW_DATA.PAT_ID: The unique ID of the patient record for this row. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.
PAT_REVIEW_DATA.PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL: A unique, internal contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of the contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
PAT_REVIEW_DATA.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
PAT_REVIEW_DATA.PAT_REVIEW_ELG_C_YN: Patient allergies reviewed by the patient. The response to the prompt, "do you have any additional allergies?"
PAT_REVIEW_DATA.PAT_REVIEW_ELG_CMT: Additional comments, entered in a free text format by the patient in response to the prompt, "Do you have any additional allergies?"
PAT_REVIEW_DATA.PAT_REVIEW_ORD_C_YN: Patient medications reviewed by the patient. The response to the prompt, "do you have any additional medications?"
PAT_REVIEW_DATA.PAT_REVIEW_ORD_CMT: Additional comments, entered in a free text format, by the patient in response to the prompt, "Do you have any additional medications?"
PAT_REVIEW_DATA.PAT_REVIEW_LPL_C_YN: Patient problems reviewed by the patient. The response to the prompt, "do you have any additional problems?"
PAT_REVIEW_DATA.PAT_REVIEW_LPL_CMT: Additional comments, entered in a freetext format by the patient in response to the prompt, "Do you have any additional problems?"
PAT_REVIEW_DATA.PAT_ALG_RVW_INFO_C_NAME: The patient's response to the "are these allergies correct?" question in Welcome.
PAT_REVIEW_DATA.PAT_MED_RVW_INFO_C_NAME: The patient's response to the "are these medications correct?" question in Welcome.
PAT_REVIEW_DATA.PAT_PROB_RVW_INFO_C_NAME: The patient's response to the "are these problems correct?" question in Welcome.

PAT_REVIEW_PROBLEM._TABLE_: Table contains patient entered clinical problem data review from Welcome Kiosk and MyChart.
PAT_REVIEW_PROBLEM.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
PAT_REVIEW_PROBLEM.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.
PAT_REVIEW_PROBLEM.PAT_ID: The unique ID of the patient record for this row. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.
PAT_REVIEW_PROBLEM.PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL: A unique, internal contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of the contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
PAT_REVIEW_PROBLEM.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
PAT_REVIEW_PROBLEM.PAT_REVIEW_LPL_R_YN: Patient problem reviewed by patient response.
PAT_REVIEW_PROBLEM.PAT_REV_LPL_EXTERN: Patient problems reviewed by the patient, entered in a free text format.

PAT_SOCIAL_HX_DOC._TABLE_: This table contains the history documentation related to your patients for an encounter.  Each row represents one line of history documentation text for a given encounter.
PAT_SOCIAL_HX_DOC.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique identifier of the patient encounter. Contact serial number is unique across all patients and all contacts.
PAT_SOCIAL_HX_DOC.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
PAT_SOCIAL_HX_DOC.HX_SOCIAL_DOC: Contents of the Social Documentation section of  the patient's History activity.

PAT_UCN_CONVERT._TABLE_: Contain if the patient's notes are converted for UCN.
PAT_UCN_CONVERT.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The contact serial number (CSN) for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
PAT_UCN_CONVERT.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.
PAT_UCN_CONVERT.PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL: A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
PAT_UCN_CONVERT.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
PAT_UCN_CONVERT.LINKED_UCN_NOTES_ID: Contains the IDs of the notes linked to this patient encounter.

PAT_UTILIZATION_REVIEW._TABLE_: This table contains information related to the patient utilization reviews entered during an admission.
PAT_UTILIZATION_REVIEW.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
PAT_UTILIZATION_REVIEW.PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL: A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
PAT_UTILIZATION_REVIEW.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
PAT_UTILIZATION_REVIEW.CM_CT_OWNER_ID: The Community ID (CID) of the instance that owns this contact. This is only populated if you use IntraConnect.
PAT_UTILIZATION_REVIEW.UR_NEXT_REVIEW_INST_DTTM: Stores the instant that the next utilization review is due by a case manager or UR specialist.
PAT_UTILIZATION_REVIEW.NO_UTL_REV_NEEDED_YN: A yes or no flag determining whether a patient no longer requires utilization reviews during the admission (yes indicates no further reviews are needed).
PAT_UTILIZATION_REVIEW.LAST_UTL_REV_USR_ID: The last user who updated patient level information related to utilization reviews.
PAT_UTILIZATION_REVIEW.LAST_UTL_REV_USR_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.

RESULT_FOLLOW_UP._TABLE_: This table contains the list of results that were followed up during this particular encounter, such as a telephone encounter.
RESULT_FOLLOW_UP.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
RESULT_FOLLOW_UP.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.
RESULT_FOLLOW_UP.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
RESULT_FOLLOW_UP.RESULT_ID: The unique identifier of the result (ORD) that was followed up on during this encounter.

SOCIAL_ADL_HX._TABLE_: This table contains data recorded in the activities of daily living section of social history contacts entered in the patient's chart during a clinical system encounter. Note: This table is designed to hold a patient's history over time; however, it is most typically implemented to only extract the latest patient history contact.
SOCIAL_ADL_HX.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: A unique serial number for this encounter. This number is unique across all patients and encounters in the system.
SOCIAL_ADL_HX.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.
SOCIAL_ADL_HX.HX_ADL_QUESTION_ID: Stores the link to the unique ID of the ADL question.
SOCIAL_ADL_HX.HX_ADL_QUESTION_ID_RECORD_NAME: The name of the Visit Navigator (VN) History Template Definition (LQH) record.
SOCIAL_ADL_HX.HX_ADL_RESPONSE_C_NAME: This column stores the category value (1, 2 or 3) of the response to ADL questions.
SOCIAL_ADL_HX.HX_ADL_COMMENTS: Holds comments for Activities of Daily Living (ADL) questions.

TREATMENT._TABLE_: This table contains all orders for each patient encounter.
TREATMENT.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
TREATMENT.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.
TREATMENT.PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL: A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
TREATMENT.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
TREATMENT.TREATMENTS_ID: The unique ID of the order record.
TREATMENT.TREAT_ORD_SENT_DTTM: The date/time when the order was sent.

TREATMENT_TEAM._TABLE_: This table stores information about patient treatment teams such as relationship, specialty, department, and start/end time. Each row represents a member of a patient's treatment team.
TREATMENT_TEAM.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
TREATMENT_TEAM.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.
TREATMENT_TEAM.PAT_ID: The unique ID of the patient record for this row. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.
TREATMENT_TEAM.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
TREATMENT_TEAM.TR_TEAM_BILL_PR_ID: The unique ID of the billing provider record.
TREATMENT_TEAM.TR_TEAM_EM_CODE_ID: The evaluation and management code for billing within the treatment team.
TREATMENT_TEAM.TR_TEAM_EM_REQ_C_NAME: Used to determine if the evaluation and management code is required or not for use in the treatment team.
TREATMENT_TEAM.TR_TEAM_SPEC_C_NAME: The category value corresponding to the specialty of the treatment team member to the patient.
TREATMENT_TEAM.TR_TEAM_COMMENT: The comment for the treatment team.
TREATMENT_TEAM.TR_TEAM_ISDE_YN: Indicates whether or not this provider was deleted.
TREATMENT_TEAM.TR_TEAM_ID: The unique ID of the treatment team provider record.
TREATMENT_TEAM.TR_TEAM_REL_C_NAME: The category value corresponding to the relationship of the treatment team member to the patient.
TREATMENT_TEAM.TR_TEAM_COMM_C_NAME: Relates to communication being sent to the treatment team members.
TREATMENT_TEAM.TR_TEAM_INFO_C_NAME: Additional information related to the treatment team members.
TREATMENT_TEAM.TR_TEAM_BEG_DTTM: The date and time the treatment team member started for the patient.
TREATMENT_TEAM.TR_TEAM_END_DTTM: The date and time the treatment team member ended for the patient.
TREATMENT_TEAM.TR_TEAM_ED_YN: Indicates whether or not this provider was on the treatment team in the ED.
TREATMENT_TEAM.TR_TEAM_TEAM_ADD_YN: Indicates whether the assignment was added by the team.
TREATMENT_TEAM.TR_TEAM_SRC_CSN_ID: This item stores the contact serial number corresponding to the encounter responsible for assigning a specific member of the treatment team. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).

description: Clinical notes with plain text, encounter links, orders

ABN_FOLLOW_UP._TABLE_: This table stores the data related to the follow up done on an Advanced Beneficiary Notice (ABN).
ABN_FOLLOW_UP.NOTE_CSN_ID: The contact serial number (CSN) of the contact.
ABN_FOLLOW_UP.NOTE_ID: The unique ID of the note (HNO) record that contains the Advance Beneficiary Notice (ABN) information.
ABN_FOLLOW_UP.CONTACT_DATE_REAL: A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
ABN_FOLLOW_UP.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
ABN_FOLLOW_UP.ABN_FLUP_USER_ID: Stores the user who did the follow up on this ABN
ABN_FOLLOW_UP.ABN_FLUP_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ABN_FOLLOW_UP.ABN_FOLLOW_UP_INST_DTTM: Stores the instant at which the follow up was done.
ABN_FOLLOW_UP.ABN_FLUP_STATUS_C_NAME: Stores the status of the Advance Beneficiary Notice (ABN) follow-up.

HNO_INFO._TABLE_: This table contains common information from General Use Notes items. This table focuses on time-insensitive, once-per-record data while other HNO tables (e.g., NOTES_ACCT, CODING_CLA_NOTES) contain the data for different note types.
HNO_INFO.NOTE_ID: The unique ID of the note record.
HNO_INFO.NOTE_TYPE_NOADD_C_NAME: This virtual item is populated with a category value from Note - Type No-Add (I HNO 51) according to the following logic: * if Note - Type No-Add (I HNO 51) is populated, use the value directly * if Note - Type No-Add (I HNO 51) is null and the note is not ambulatory, return null * if Note - Type No-Add (I HNO 51) is null and the note has an ambulatory encounter context, obtain a category from the UCN note type (I HNO 34033) and map that value to an equivalent category from Note - Type No Add (I HNO 51), if possible
HNO_INFO.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for the patient encounter to which the note is attached. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
HNO_INFO.ENTRY_USER_ID: The unique ID of the user who created this note. This column is frequently used to link to the CLARITY_EMP table.
HNO_INFO.ENTRY_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
HNO_INFO.NOTE_DESC: This is a free text description of the note.
HNO_INFO.IP_NOTE_TYPE_C_NAME: The note type associated with this note.
HNO_INFO.ORIGINAL_HP_ID: For View-Only H&P notes only - original note record identifier
HNO_INFO.ORIG_HP_DATE_REAL: For View-Only H&P notes only - original note record contact
HNO_INFO.SOURCE_HP_ID: For Interval H&P only - ID of H&P Note being modified by interval note
HNO_INFO.SOURCE_HP_DATE_REAL: For Interval H&P only - contact of H&P Note being modified by interval note
HNO_INFO.ADDENDUM_PARENT_CSN: Contains the contact serial number (CSN) of the parent document.
HNO_INFO.PAT_LINK_ID: Virtual item that will check all HNO items linked to EPT and return the first EPT ID it finds. The items are checked in the following order: 505, 38970, 21001, 600 (which gives us an order, then we look at ord 210), 1605, 1643, 1640.
HNO_INFO.TX_IB_FOLDER_C_NAME: Stores the Type of Message (I EOW 30) In Basket folder to be used by the Transcription interface to generate In Basket messages
HNO_INFO.UNSIGNED_YN: A flag for if the note record is considered an unsigned note.
HNO_INFO.DELETE_INSTANT_DTTM: The instant when the note is deleted.
HNO_INFO.DELETE_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
HNO_INFO.COSIGNED_NOTE_LINK: Contains a contact serial number (CSN) that points to the resident's note being cosigned. Cosigning Note Link (I HNO 34158) is a link for the opposite direction.
HNO_INFO.SIGNED_NOTE_ID: This item points to the ID of the signed note that this note is addending/editing/cosigning.
HNO_INFO.LST_FILED_INST_DTTM: The instant the note was last edited.
HNO_INFO.UPDATE_DATE: The date and time when this row was created or last updated in Clarity.
HNO_INFO.CURRENT_AUTHOR_ID: This item stores the current author of the note for indexing purposes.
HNO_INFO.CURRENT_AUTHOR_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
HNO_INFO.VISIT_NUM: Professional billing visit number attached to this note.
HNO_INFO.CRT_INST_LOCAL_DTTM: This is a virtual item that gets the create instant (I HNO 17105), in local time format.
HNO_INFO.NOTE_PURPOSE_C_NAME: This is a virtual item that displays the note purpose. It was previously stored in Note - Purpose (INP-5045).
HNO_INFO.PRIORITY_YN: The priority of the note (Yes = High, No = Routine).
HNO_INFO.ACTIVE_FROM_DT: The date on which the note becomes active.
HNO_INFO.ACTIVE_TO_DT: The date after which the note becomes inactive.
HNO_INFO.TREAT_SUM_RLS_TO_MYC_YN: Indicates whether a Treatment Summary is released to MyChart.
HNO_INFO.TREAT_SUM_RLS_TO_MYC_CSN: Stores the CSN of the Treatment Summary (HNO) that is released to MyChart. If you use IntraConnect, this column stores the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
HNO_INFO.COMMENT_USER_ID: The unique ID of the last user to edit the internal comment in either the Continued Care and Services Coordination or Payer Communication workflows.
HNO_INFO.COMMENT_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
HNO_INFO.COMMENT_EDIT_INST_DTTM: Instant the comment was last edited in either the Continued Care and Services Coordination or Payer Communication workflows. In UTC.
HNO_INFO.CONVERSATION_MSG_ID: The record for the message that was also filed as a note. The text filed in the message and the quicknote will be the same and displaying one of these to the end user should be sufficient.

HNO_INFO_2._TABLE_: This table contains common information from General Use Notes items. This table focuses on one time only data while other HNO tables (e.g., NOTES_ACCT, CODING_CLA_NOTES) contain the data for different note types.
HNO_INFO_2.NOTE_ID: The note ID for the note record.
HNO_INFO_2.RELEVANT_REC_EVENT_ID: Holds the Events (IEV) record which contains records marked relevant to the Note such as problems, allergies, lab results, etc.
HNO_INFO_2.GROUP_NOTE_ID: This item stores the group note ID for notes that are created in a group documentation context.
HNO_INFO_2.LETTER_DEST_C_NAME: The letter destination category ID for the note. This column is only populated if this row is for a Customer Relationship Management letter.
HNO_INFO_2.LETTER_FINAL_UTC_DTTM: The instant the letter was finalized. This column is only populated if this row is for a Customer Relationship Management letter.
HNO_INFO_2.RFL_LETTER_ENC_CSN: Stores the encounter in which the referral communication letter was written
HNO_INFO_2.CONV_MSG_CID: This item contains the Community ID (CID) of a related In Basket Message (EOW) record.
HNO_INFO_2.OUTREACH_TEMPLATE_ID: This item stores the campaign outreach template that created the letter.
HNO_INFO_2.SOURCE_EDITS_CSN: Stores a Contact Serial Number (CSN) pointer to the General Use Notes (HNO) record that holds edits to the parent note while an attestation is in progress.
HNO_INFO_2.EXT_DUP_NOTE_ID: Autoreconciled extneral note duplicate source note
HNO_INFO_2.EXT_DUP_NOTE_C_NAME: Autoreconciled external note duplicate note type
HNO_INFO_2.PARENT_NOTE_ID: The parent note ID of a soft-deleted transcription record.
HNO_INFO_2.ACTIVE_C_NAME: Whether the note is active. This item is not populated for all notes.
HNO_INFO_2.EXT_AUTHOR: Name of the external note's author. The name is stored as pieces delimited by character 127 and is ordered as follows: Last Name, Last Name from Spouse, First Name, Middle Name, Last Name Prefix, Spouse Last Name Prefix, Title, Suffix, Academic Initials.
HNO_INFO_2.NOTE_UPDATE_INST_UTC_DTTM: The last time this note was received through Care Everywhere. The value of Received Assessment and Plan Existence Days (I DXC 17000) defines how long notes with this item set exist before they are deleted. Scheduled task Remove HNO Records (E1J 88032) deletes notes and all of their references that have not been received within the amount of days defined by Received Assessment and Plan Existence Days (I DXC 17000)  Received Assessment and Plan Existence Days (I DXC 17000) defaults to 30 days if not set.
HNO_INFO_2.ROUT_RECPNT_COMMUNICATION_ID: This is a Communication Management (LCA) record that contains information about recipients that users selected for routing in the clinical note editor.
HNO_INFO_2.EXTERNAL_SOURCE_IDENT: If this note is associated with information in an outside system, the ID of that information can be stored here.
HNO_INFO_2.EXTERNAL_PROBLEM_IDENT: The reference ID for the external problem linked to the note.

HNO_ORDERS._TABLE_: Orders that are associated to the note.
HNO_ORDERS.NOTE_ID: The unique identifier (.1 item) for the note record.
HNO_ORDERS.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
HNO_ORDERS.ORDER_ID: The order ID associated to the note.
HNO_ORDERS.ORDER_DAT: The order DAT associated to the note.

HNO_PLAIN_TEXT._TABLE_: This table extracts notes that are stored only in plain text. This table does not contain any notes that are stored in rich text. HNO_NOTE_TEXT should still be used for reporting purposes.
HNO_PLAIN_TEXT.NOTE_CSN_ID: The contact serial number (CSN) of the contact.
HNO_PLAIN_TEXT.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.
HNO_PLAIN_TEXT.NOTE_ID: The unique identifier (.1 item) for the note record.
HNO_PLAIN_TEXT.NOTE_TEXT: Content of the plain text note.

NOTES_LINK_ORD_TXN._TABLE_: Orders linked to/from the HNO (notes) master file by order based transcriptions.
NOTES_LINK_ORD_TXN.NOTE_ID: The unique ID associated with the note record for this row.
NOTES_LINK_ORD_TXN.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
NOTES_LINK_ORD_TXN.LINKED_ORD_ID: Orders linked to/from the note records by order based transcriptions.

NOTE_CONTENT_INFO._TABLE_: This table contains discrete information pertaining to the type of content contained within the note text of a clinical note.
NOTE_CONTENT_INFO.NOTE_CSN_ID: The contact serial number (CSN) of the contact.
NOTE_CONTENT_INFO.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.
NOTE_CONTENT_INFO.NOTE_ID: The unique identifier for the note record.
NOTE_CONTENT_INFO.CONTACT_DATE_REAL: A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
NOTE_CONTENT_INFO.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.

NOTE_ENC_INFO._TABLE_: This table contains information from overtime single-response items about General Use Notes (HNO) records. Contact creation logic for clinical notes is as follows: 1. If a note doesn't exist, a new note is created. This represents the first contact on that note. 2. If a revision is filed by the incoming transcription interface, a new contact is created on the note being revised regardless of note status.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.NOTE_ID: The unique identifier for the note record.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.CONTACT_SERIAL_NUM: The contact serial number (CSN) of the contact.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.CONTACT_DATE_REAL: A unique, internal contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of the contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.COSIGN_INSTANT_DTTM: The instant when the note was cosigned.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.COSIGNUSER_ID: The user who cosigned the note.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.COSIGNUSER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.COSIGN_NOTE_LINK: A note contact serial number (CSN) that points to the attending's note that cosigned this one.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.COSIGN_REQUIRED_C_NAME: The cosign requirement for the current note contact.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.ENTRY_INSTANT_DTTM: UTC formatted instant of entry for a note.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.UPD_AUTHOR_INS_DTTM: UTC instant of update by a specific user.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.SPEC_NOTE_TIME_DTTM: The note's specified date paired with the specified time.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.NOTE_FILE_TIME_DTTM: UTC formatted instant of when a note is filed.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.AUTHOR_PRVD_TYPE_C_NAME: Author's provider type on a specific contact.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.UPDATE_USER_ID: The id of the user who updated this contact of the note.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.UPDATE_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.TRN_DOC_AVAIL_STA_C_NAME: The availability status of the transcription.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.TRN_DOC_TYPE_C_NAME: The document type of the transcription.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.AUTHOR_USER_ID: The unique ID associated with the user who is the author of the note.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.AUTHOR_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.NOTE_FORMAT_C_NAME: The format of the note text like Plain Text, Rich Text, HTML etc.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.UPD_BY_AUTH_DTTM: The instant when the note is updated by the author.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.ACTIVITY_DTTM: The activity date and time of the partial dictation/transcription.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.AUTH_STAT_C_NAME: The authentication status category number for this activity if this note is a transcription. This is also known as the completion status.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.UPD_AUT_LOCAL_DTTM: Update by author instant in local format.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.ENT_INST_LOCAL_DTTM: Note entry instant in local format.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.SPEC_TIME_LOC_DTTM: Note specified instant in local format.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.NOT_FILETM_LOC_DTTM: Note file time in local format.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.EDIT_USER_ID: The unique ID associated with the user record who edited the note for this particular contact. This is populated for notes with note type 76-Simple Med Note, 77-Medication History, etc. This column is frequently used to link to the CLARITY_EMP table.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.EDIT_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.DOCUMENT_NAME: Contains the name of the multi-part document.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.UMRG_SRC_MEDPROB_ID: The unique ID of the Med Problem List record.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.ECG_EDITED_USER_ID: The person who edited the Electrocardiogram (ECG/EKG).
NOTE_ENC_INFO.ECG_DIASTOLIC_BP: The diastolic blood pressure taken from the Electrocardiogram (ECG/EKG).
NOTE_ENC_INFO.ECG_SYSTOLIC_BP: The systolic blood pressure taken from the Electrocardiogram (ECG/EKG).
NOTE_ENC_INFO.ECG_PR_INTERVAL: The interval from the beginning of the P wave to the beginning of the QRS wave on the Electrocardiogram (ECG/EKG).
NOTE_ENC_INFO.ECG_PWAVEAXIS: The P wave axis on the Electrocardiogram (ECG/EKG).
NOTE_ENC_INFO.ECG_QRS_DURATION: The duration of the QRS complex/wave on the Electrocardiogram (ECG/EKG).
NOTE_ENC_INFO.ECG_QRS_WAVEAXIS: The QRS complex/wave axis on the Electrocardiogram (ECG/EKG).
NOTE_ENC_INFO.ECG_QT_INTERVAL: The interval from the start of the QRS complex/wave to the end of the T wave on the Electrocardiogram (ECG/EKG).
NOTE_ENC_INFO.ECG_QTC_INTERVAL: The corrected QT interval for the Electrocardiogram (ECG/EKG).
NOTE_ENC_INFO.ECG_T_WAVEAXIS: The T wave axis for the Electrocardiogram (ECG/EKG).
NOTE_ENC_INFO.SPIRO_BRON: Stores the type of bronchodilator given to the patient (ex: Albuterol).
NOTE_ENC_INFO.CARE_PLAN_CSN_ID: Link to care plan contact.  Used to recreate historic versions of care plan.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.PROGRESS_NOTE_ID: Progress note ID for the careplan goal note.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.PRE_UCN_NOTE_TYPE_C_NAME: This virtual item is populated with a category value from the note type (I HNO 50) according to the following logic:   * if the note type (I HNO 50) is populated, use the value directly * if the note type (I HNO 50) is null and the note is not ambulatory, return null   * if the note type (I HNO 50) is null and the note has an ambulatory encounter context, obtain a category from the UCN note type (I HNO 34033) and map that value to an equivalent category from the note type (I HNO 50), if possible
NOTE_ENC_INFO.CSGN_RECPNT_USER_ID: The unique ID associated with the user who is supposed to cosign the note.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.CSGN_RECPNT_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.TREAT_SUMM_PAT_DTTM: This column stores the UTC instant that a treatment summary note is given to the patient.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.TREAT_SUMM_PROV_DTTM: This column stores the UTC instant that a treatment summary note is given to the follow-up provider.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.TREAT_SUMM_CPLT_DTTM: This column saves the UTC instant that a treatment summary note is marked as complete.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: This column stores the patient encounter contact serial number (CSN) in which the note was edited. Used for persistent notes to determine in which encounter the note was edited.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.END_OF_TREAT_DATE: This column saves the end of treatment date for a treatment summary.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.UNMERGE_SRC_NOTE_ID: The source note ID before patient merge.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.NOTE_SHARED_W_PAT_HX_YN: Was this note contact marked as eligible for sharing with the patient when it was last saved?  Notes will only be displayed in MyChart if their most recent contact is marked for sharing. If you want to determine if a note is currently shared, use the NOTE_SHARED_W_PAT_YN column in the HNO_INFO table instead of this one.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.NOTE_TYPE_C_NAME: Identifies what type of note this record is.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.POC_NOTE_DISC_C_NAME: This item stores the hospice Plan of Care note discipline.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.COSIGN_INST_LOCAL_DTTM: The instant in local time when the note was cosigned.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.IS_PRECHARTED_YN: This indicates whether or not the note is currently a pre-charted note (in appointment encounter).
NOTE_ENC_INFO.LINK_DXR_CSN_ID: Link to the DXR contact that holds the NoteReader data for this note's contact.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.CLINICAL_NOTE_SUMMARY: This item stores a plain text summary of the note contents.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.BLOCK_REASON_C_NAME: Stores a discrete reason why a note was blocked from the patient.
NOTE_ENC_INFO.BLOCK_REASON_TXT: Stores a free text comment with additional information about why a note was blocked from the patient.

NOTE_ENC_INFO_2.NOTE_CSN_ID: The contact serial number (CSN) of the contact.
NOTE_ENC_INFO_2.NOTE_ID: The unique identifier (.1 item) for the note record.
NOTE_ENC_INFO_2.CONTACT_DATE_REAL: A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
NOTE_ENC_INFO_2.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
NOTE_ENC_INFO_2.CM_CT_OWNER_ID: The Community ID (CID) of the instance that owns this contact. This is only populated if you use IntraConnect.
NOTE_ENC_INFO_2.EXT_SHARED_W_PT_YN: Autoreconciled external note share with patient status
NOTE_ENC_INFO_2.EXT_AUTH_NAME: Autoreconciled external note author free text name
NOTE_ENC_INFO_2.EXT_AUTH_SERV: Autoreconciled external note author service text
NOTE_ENC_INFO_2.EXT_LAST_SIGNER: Autoreconciled external note last signer name
NOTE_ENC_INFO_2.NOTE_AUTHOR_TYPE_C_NAME: The internal provider type of a note's author, mapped from the transmitted NUCC code.

V_EHI_HNO_LINKED_PATS._TABLE_: Placeholder view for HNO EHI data that needs to be marked as both static and dynamic.
V_EHI_HNO_LINKED_PATS.NOTE_ID: The unique identifier (.1 item) for the note record.
V_EHI_HNO_LINKED_PATS.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
V_EHI_HNO_LINKED_PATS.LINKED_PAT_ID: The list of patients (EPT) that this HNO is associated with for Electronic Health Information (EHI) Export
V_EHI_HNO_LINKED_PATS.CM_LOG_OWNER_ID: The Community ID (CID) of the instance from which this record or line was extracted. This is only populated if you use IntraConnect.

HNO_PLAIN_TEXT.NOTE_TEXT: Please call the patient with normal result.

title: Messages: MYC_MESG + children → messages
description: MyChart messages with text, RTF, questionnaire answers

MSG_TXT._TABLE_: This table contains the text of MyChart messages.
MSG_TXT.MESSAGE_ID: The unique identifier for the message record.
MSG_TXT.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
MSG_TXT.MSG_TXT: Stores the body text in the message.

MYC_MESG._TABLE_: This table contains information on messages sent to and from web-based chart system patients.
MYC_MESG.MESSAGE_ID: The unique ID used to identify a web-based chart system message record. A new record is created each time a patient sends a message from a web-based chart system to a system user and each time a system user sends a message to a web-based chart system patient.
MYC_MESG.CREATED_TIME: The date and time the web-based chart system message record was created in local time.
MYC_MESG.PARENT_MESSAGE_ID: The unique ID of the original message in a chain of web-based chart system messages between patients and system users.
MYC_MESG.INBASKET_MSG_ID: The unique ID of the system message associated with the web-based chart system message. An example is when a patient sends a message to a system user.
MYC_MESG.PAT_ID: The unique ID of the patient record for this row. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.
MYC_MESG.PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL: A unique, internal contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of the contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
MYC_MESG.FROM_USER_ID: The unique ID of the system user who sent a web-based chart system message to a patient.
MYC_MESG.FROM_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
MYC_MESG.TO_USER_ID: The unique ID of the system user who was sent a web-based chart system message from a patient.
MYC_MESG.TO_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
MYC_MESG.TOFROM_PAT_C_NAME: The message direction category number for the web-based chart system message. 1 corresponds to "To patient". 2 corresponds to "From patient".
MYC_MESG.ORIGINAL_TO: If a message sent from a web-based chart system patient is re-routed from its intended destination, then the ID of the original recipient is stored in the field. Most commonly this occurs when a system user does not accept messages directly from web-based chart system patients. In this case, the message will be re-routed to a pool, but the employee ID of the system user will be stored here. The ID of the final destination is stored in MODIFIED_TO.
MYC_MESG.RQSTD_PHARMACY_ID: The unique ID of the pharmacy selected by the patient from the drop down list when sending a Medication Renewal Request message.
MYC_MESG.UPDATE_DATE: The date and time that this web-based chart system message record was pulled into enterprise reporting.
MYC_MESG.REQUEST_SUBJECT: This field is only used for medical advice request messages and indicates the subject selected by the patient from the drop down list.
MYC_MESG.PROV_ID: The provider that was used in routing the patient access message. The provider may vary depending on message type.
MYC_MESG.DEPARTMENT_ID: The department used in routing the patient access message. The department may vary depending on message type.
MYC_MESG.RESP_INFO: Some response types will include additional information, such as a phone number.  If such data exists for the chosen response method, it will be stored in this field.
MYC_MESG.SUBJECT: The subject line of the web-based chart system message.
MYC_MESG.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
MYC_MESG.EOW_READ_STATUS_C_NAME: The read status category number for the web-based chart system message.
MYC_MESG.BILL_ACCT_ID: The unique ID of the guarantor account associated with this web-based chart system message.
MYC_MESG.BILL_ACCT_TYPE_C_NAME: The billing account type category number for the web-based chart system message. Only billing-specific customer service messages have a value specified for this column.
MYC_MESG.BILL_ACCT_HAR_ID: The unique ID of the hospital account associated with this web-based chart system message.
MYC_MESG.RELATED_MESSAGE_ID: The unique ID of the parent message of the original message chain. This applies only when the system is configured to allow patients to reply to messages associated with closed encounters by creating a new message chain. This item is populated for the message that starts a new chain.
MYC_MESG.WPR_OWNER_WPR_ID: The unique ID of the web-based chart system patient who owns this message.
MYC_MESG.CR_TX_CARD_ID: The unique ID of the credit card used for this transaction.
MYC_MESG.CR_TX_MYPT_ID: The unique ID of the web-based chart system patient associated with this transaction.
MYC_MESG.CR_TX_AMOUNT_AUTH: The amount authorized for this transaction.
MYC_MESG.PAT_HX_QUESR_ID: The unique ID of the history questionnaire associated with this message.
MYC_MESG.PAT_HX_QUESR_ID_RECORD_NAME: The name of the Visit Navigator (VN) History Template Definition (LQH) record.
MYC_MESG.HX_QUESR_CONTEXT_C_NAME: The history questionnaire context category number for the web-based chart system message.
MYC_MESG.HX_QUESR_PROV_ID: The unique ID of the provider associated with the questionnaire.
MYC_MESG.HX_QUESR_ENCPROV_ID: The unique ID of the provider associated with the appointment that the questionnaire is linked to.
MYC_MESG.HX_QUESR_APPT_DAT: The appointment contact date (DAT) if the questionnaire is linked to an appointment.
MYC_MESG.HX_QUESR_FILED_YN: Indicates whether the history questionnaire has been filed for this web-based chart system message. Y indicates that the history questionnaire has been filed. N or a null value indicates that the history questionnaire has not been filed.
MYC_MESG.DELIVERY_DTTM: The instant that this message is scheduled for delivery to the patient. This item may not be populated. In the event that this item is not populated, then the instant the message is created is used to determine when the patient can view the message.
MYC_MESG.RECORD_STATUS_C_NAME: The category title of the status of the message. If not populated, then the message is active; Soft deleted is set when a message is revoked.
MYC_MESG.CR_TX_TYPE_C_NAME: Stores the type of transaction (E-Visit or Copay).
