INV_CLM_LN_ADDL.TRANSACTION_LIST: The charges associated with the invoice. May hold a comma delimited list of professional transactions if the charges were bundled.
INV_CLM_LN_ADDL.FROM_SVC_DATE: The date when the service was first performed.
INV_CLM_LN_ADDL.TO_SVC_DATE: The date when the service was last performed.
INV_CLM_LN_ADDL.PROC_ID: The unique ID of the procedure associated with the invoice.
INV_CLM_LN_ADDL.MODIFIER_ONE: The first modifier associated with the invoice. This is the external modifier, as it was printed on the claim.
INV_CLM_LN_ADDL.MODIFIER_TWO: The second modifier associated with the invoice. This is the external modifier, as it was printed on the claim.
INV_CLM_LN_ADDL.MODIFIER_THREE: The third modifier associated with the invoice. This is the external modifier, as it was printed on the claim.
INV_CLM_LN_ADDL.MODIFIER_FOUR: The fourth modifier associated with the invoice. This is the external modifier, as it was printed on the claim.
INV_CLM_LN_ADDL.QUANTITY: The number of units associated with the invoice.
INV_CLM_LN_ADDL.CHARGE_AMOUNT: The charge amount associated with the claim line.
INV_CLM_LN_ADDL.NONCVD_AMOUNT: The non-covered amount associated with the invoice.
INV_CLM_LN_ADDL.TYPE_OF_SERVICE_C_NAME: The type of service category value for the claim.
INV_CLM_LN_ADDL.DIAGNOSIS_MAP: Holds a comma-delimited list of pointers to the claim level diagnosis. The first number listed represents the primary diagnosis for the charge.
INV_CLM_LN_ADDL.SPECIAL_GRP_TYPE_C_NAME: The claim grouping type category value for the associated claim grouping rule. Only populated if a claim grouping rule was applied to the invoice.
INV_CLM_LN_ADDL.GROUP_TX_LIST: This holds a list of transaction IDs for bundled charges.
INV_CLM_LN_ADDL.UB_MIN_SVC_DATE: The earliest date any charges were performed for an institutional claim.
INV_CLM_LN_ADDL.UB_MAX_SVC_DATE: The latest date any charges were performed for an institutional claim.
INV_CLM_LN_ADDL.CONTRACT_ID_CONTRACT_NAME: The name of the Vendor-Network contract.
INV_CLM_LN_ADDL.REMITTANCE_RMC1_ID_REMIT_CODE_NAME: The name of each remittance code.
INV_CLM_LN_ADDL.REMITTANCE_RMC2_ID_REMIT_CODE_NAME: The name of each remittance code.
INV_CLM_LN_ADDL.REMITTANCE_RMC3_ID_REMIT_CODE_NAME: The name of each remittance code.
INV_CLM_LN_ADDL.REMITTANCE_RMC4_ID_REMIT_CODE_NAME: The name of each remittance code.
INV_CLM_LN_ADDL.CLM_LN_CREAT_DATE: Stores the date the claim line is created.
INV_CLM_LN_ADDL.CLM_LN_PAID_DATE: Stores the most recent date the invoice line is paid.
INV_CLM_LN_ADDL.LN_AUTH_NUM: This item stores the line level authorization number.
INV_CLM_LN_ADDL.LN_REF_NUM: This item stores the line level referral number.
INV_CLM_LN_ADDL.FQHC_BILLOUT_MOD_ID: The modifier added to a bill out line for grouped claim lines.
INV_CLM_LN_ADDL.FQHC_BILLOUT_MOD_ID_MODIFIER_NAME: The name of the modifier record.
INV_CLM_LN_ADDL.CALCULATED_REIMB_AMOUNT: Stores the system calculated reimbursement amount. This may differ from items 395 and 398 if the expected reimbursement amount was manually overridden.

INV_DX_INFO._TABLE_: Stores claim-level diagnosis information sent on Resolute Professional Billing claims. Diagnosis information is coming from the INV 350 related group. The Group 100 column corresponds to claims that were sent.
INV_DX_INFO.INVOICE_ID: The unique ID of the invoice.
INV_DX_INFO.LINE: The line count value of the invoice related group.
INV_DX_INFO.DX_ID: The unique ID of the diagnosis that is associated with the claim.
INV_DX_INFO.INV_NUM: The external ID of the invoice that is associated with the claim.
INV_DX_INFO.INV_NUM_100_GRP_LN: Claim line number that the diagnosis entry applies to. This is the line number that links the INV_DX_INFO table with the LINE column in the INV_BASIC_INFO table.

INV_NUM_TX_PIECES._TABLE_:
Each line in this table corresponds to a transaction (ETR) composing a line on an invoice from item INV 381. Each line can contain a comma-delimited list of transactions composing a claim line. When a transaction is bundled, data will be split out to its own line via the TX_PIECE column.


 


This table is used as a bridge between transaction- and invoice- based tables.
INV_NUM_TX_PIECES.INV_ID: This column contains the internal invoice ID.
INV_NUM_TX_PIECES.LINE: This column contains the line number for any multiple-response item.
INV_NUM_TX_PIECES.TX_PIECE: This column contains the position of the transaction ID in the comma-delimited list of ETR ID's for a given line of INV-381. For example, if a certain line of INV-381 has three transactions, then TX_PIECE will contain 1, 2, and 3 for that line.
INV_NUM_TX_PIECES.TX_ID: This column contains each individual transaction ID from the list of ETR ID's stored on each line of INV-381. So, if a given line of INV-381 has more than one transaction (separated by a comma-delimited list), then each ETR ID will appear on a separate row of the extract table. In other words, one and only one ETR ID will appear in each row of the TX_ID column.

INV_PMT_RECOUP._TABLE_: This table holds information on payment recoup adjustments associated with an invoice.
INV_PMT_RECOUP.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
INV_PMT_RECOUP.TX_ID: Transactions associated with payments, recoups, or adjustments.

INV_TX_PIECES._TABLE_: This table contains Professional Billing charge transactions associated with invoice service lines.
INV_TX_PIECES.INV_ID: The unique identifier for the invoice record.
INV_TX_PIECES.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.
INV_TX_PIECES.TX_PIECE: The position of the transaction ID in the comma-delimited list of transaction IDs for a given line.
INV_TX_PIECES.TX_ID: The ID of the transaction associated with the claim line.

NOTES_ACCT._TABLE_: This table contains summary information for billing system account notepad notes attached to accounts.
NOTES_ACCT.NOTE_ID: The unique ID of the Account Notepad note record.
NOTES_ACCT.ACCOUNT_ID: This column stores the unique identifier for the guarantor associated with the note. It is only populated for guarantor-level notes.
NOTES_ACCT.ACTIVE_STATUS: The status of the note: active or inactive.
NOTES_ACCT.ENTRY_USER_ID: The ID of the user who manually created the note. If the note was automatically created by billing system, this is the person who executed the activity that triggered the note creation. This ID may be encrypted
NOTES_ACCT.ENTRY_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
NOTES_ACCT.INVOICE_NUMBER: The invoice number associated with this note.
NOTES_ACCT.NOTE_ENTRY_DTTM: The date and time the account note was created.

OCC_CD._TABLE_: All values associated with a claim are stored in the Claim External Value record.  The OCC_CD table holds the occurrence codes that apply to the claim.
OCC_CD.RECORD_ID: The unique identifier for the claim record.
OCC_CD.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.
OCC_CD.OCC_CD: This item holds the occurrence codes that apply to the claim.
OCC_CD.OCC_DT: This item holds the date corresponding to the occurrence code.

PAT_ENC._TABLE_:
The patient encounter table contains one record for each patient encounter in your system. By default, this table does not contain Registration or PCP/Clinic Change contacts (encounter types 1 and 31). It does contain all appointments, office visits, telephone encounters, and other types of encounters. The primary key for the patient encounter table is PAT_ENC_CSN_ID.


Note that there is an index named EIX_FILT_PAT_ENC_RFL on the REFERRAL_ID column in Oracle that does not appear in the index list. The index is created by EFN_FAUX_RFL_FILT_INX.
PAT_ENC.PAT_ID: The unique ID assigned to the patient record. This ID may be encrypted if you have elected to use enterprise reporting�s encryption utility.
PAT_ENC.PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL: A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
PAT_ENC.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: A unique serial number for this encounter. This number is unique across all patients and encounters in the system.
PAT_ENC.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
PAT_ENC.PCP_PROV_ID: The unique ID of the provider record for the patient�s General Primary Care Provider as of the date of the encounter. This ID may be encrypted if you have elected to use enterprise reporting�s security utility.
PAT_ENC.FIN_CLASS_C_NAME: The category value associated with the Financial Class of the encounter. Note: This item is only populated through an interface. It is not populated if you have billing system installed.
PAT_ENC.VISIT_PROV_ID: The unique ID for the visit provider associated with this encounter. In cases where there are multiple providers for one encounter, this is the ID of the first provider in the list. This item may be NULL if there is no provider for this encounter. This ID may be encrypted.
PAT_ENC.VISIT_PROV_TITLE_NAME: The visit provider�s provider title (SER 5). See VISIT_PROV_ID above for the definition of visit provider.
PAT_ENC.DEPARTMENT_ID: The ID of the department for the encounter. If there are multiple departments for the encounter, this is the ID of the first department in the list.
PAT_ENC.LMP_DATE: The date of the patient�s Last Menstrual Period. Only contains data for encounters with female patients.
PAT_ENC.ENC_CLOSED_YN: A flag that signifies if this encounter is closed as of the time of the enterprise reporting extract. This column will have the value Y, N or null. Null indicates that closing the encounter does not apply, such as a future appointment.
PAT_ENC.ENC_CLOSED_USER_ID: The unique ID of the system user who closed the patient encounter. This ID may be encrypted.
PAT_ENC.ENC_CLOSED_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PAT_ENC.ENC_CLOSE_DATE: The date on which the patient encounter was closed.
PAT_ENC.LOS_MODIFIER1_ID: The first Level of Service modifier applied to the encounter. This item will appear empty if no modifier is present.
PAT_ENC.LOS_MODIFIER1_ID_MODIFIER_NAME: The name of the modifier record.
PAT_ENC.LOS_MODIFIER2_ID: The second Level of Service modifier applied to the encounter. This item will appear empty if no modifier is present.
PAT_ENC.LOS_MODIFIER2_ID_MODIFIER_NAME: The name of the modifier record.
PAT_ENC.LOS_MODIFIER3_ID: The third Level of Service modifier applied to the encounter. This item will appear empty if no modifier is present.
PAT_ENC.LOS_MODIFIER3_ID_MODIFIER_NAME: The name of the modifier record.
PAT_ENC.LOS_MODIFIER4_ID: The fourth Level of Service modifier applied to the encounter. This item will appear empty if no modifier is present.
PAT_ENC.LOS_MODIFIER4_ID_MODIFIER_NAME: The name of the modifier record.
PAT_ENC.APPT_STATUS_C_NAME: The category value associated with the appointment status of the encounter as of the most recent enterprise reporting extract, such as 1 � Scheduled, 2 � Completed, 3 � Canceled, etc.
PAT_ENC.APPT_CANC_USER_ID: The unique ID of the user who canceled the appointment.
PAT_ENC.APPT_CANC_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PAT_ENC.CHECKIN_USER_ID: The unique ID of the system user who checked in the patient for this encounter. If the encounter has not been through the Check In process this field will be NULL. This ID may be encrypted.
PAT_ENC.CHECKIN_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PAT_ENC.HOSP_ADMSN_TIME: The date and time that the patient was first admitted to the facility, bedded in the ED, or confirmed for an HOV for this contact, regardless of patient's base patient class.
PAT_ENC.HOSP_DISCHRG_TIME: The hospital discharge date and time for this patient contact.
PAT_ENC.HOSP_ADMSN_TYPE_C_NAME: The category value for the type of admission for this encounter.
PAT_ENC.NONCVRED_SERVICE_YN: A flag used to indicate whether the appointment is scheduled in a service not covered by the patient's coverage benefits. The flag is set to "Y" when the service is not covered and an "N" when it is covered.
PAT_ENC.REFERRAL_REQ_YN: A flag used to indicate whether an appointment requires a referral as determined by the visit coverage. This flag is set to �Y� when the appointment requires a referral. If the appointment does not require a referral, it is set to �N."
PAT_ENC.REFERRAL_ID: The unique ID of the referral record linked to this appointment.
PAT_ENC.ACCOUNT_ID: The ID number of the guarantor account assigned to the visit at the time it is scheduled or when it is checked in. This ID may be encrypted.
PAT_ENC.COVERAGE_ID: The ID number of the coverage record assigned to the visit at the time it is scheduled or when it is checked in. This ID may be encrypted.
PAT_ENC.CLAIM_ID: The unique ID of the billing system Claim record (CLM record) linked to charges associated with this visit.
PAT_ENC.PRIMARY_LOC_ID: The unique ID of the patient�s primary location as of the contact date of the encounter. Note: This may not be the same as the patient�s current primary location.
PAT_ENC.CHARGE_SLIP_NUMBER: The encounter form number or charge slip number assigned to this encounter. Note: The charge slip number is also stored in the financial table CLARITY_TDL. You can use this field to link to CLARITY_TDL to identify financial transactions associated with the encounter.
PAT_ENC.COPAY_DUE: The dollar amount shown in the Copay Due field of the scheduling system's Check In Patient activity. This amount may be calculated by the system using the patient's coverage benefit information or be manually entered by a user. This field may also be empty if no copay amount was entered when the patient's appointment was checked in.
PAT_ENC.UPDATE_DATE: The time this patient encounter was pulled into enterprise reporting.
PAT_ENC.HSP_ACCOUNT_ID: The ID number of the hospital billing account assigned to the encounter.
PAT_ENC.ADM_FOR_SURG_YN: Indicates whether the patient is being admitted for surgery.
PAT_ENC.SURGICAL_SVC_C_NAME: The category value corresponding to the surgical service for this patient contact.
PAT_ENC.INPATIENT_DATA_ID: The ID number of the record used to determine how inpatient data is stored for the encounter.
PAT_ENC.IP_EPISODE_ID: The ID number of the inpatient episode of care. This includes discharges from the ED.
PAT_ENC.EXTERNAL_VISIT_ID: The ID for the contact as assigned by a non-system. Usually populated by an interface.
PAT_ENC.CONTACT_COMMENT: Comments entered by the provider for the contact.
PAT_ENC.OUTGOING_CALL_YN: Indicates whether a call associated with a telephone encounter was initiated by the patient or by the clinic / hospital. A "Y" indicates an outgoing call placed by the clinic / hospital while an "N" indicates and incoming call from the patient.
PAT_ENC.DATA_ENTRY_PERSON: This is the name of the user who created the encounter.
PAT_ENC.REFERRAL_SOURCE_ID: The referral ID number of the referring physician. This physician may be from an external organization.
PAT_ENC.REFERRAL_SOURCE_ID_REFERRING_PROV_NAM: The name of the referral source.
PAT_ENC.WC_TPL_VISIT_C_NAME: A field used to indicate whether the patient's contact is related to workers compensation or third party liability situation.
PAT_ENC.CONSENT_TYPE_C_NAME: This item describes the type of consent that was filed for a given encounter. It is a single-response customer-defined category.
PAT_ENC.BMI: This is the patient's Body Mass Index, which is calculated based on the recorded height and weight.
PAT_ENC.BSA: This is the patient's Body Surface Area, which is calculated based on the recorded height and weight.
PAT_ENC.AVS_PRINT_TM: The instant that the After Visit Summary (AVS) was printed for this encounter.
PAT_ENC.AVS_FIRST_USER_ID: Unique ID of the user who first prints out the After Visit Summary (AVS) for the encounter.
PAT_ENC.AVS_FIRST_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PAT_ENC.ENC_MED_FRZ_RSN_C_NAME: The encounter medication freeze reason's category value.
PAT_ENC.EFFECTIVE_DATE_DT: The date of the encounter. The returned date is handled differently depending on the contact type of the encounter: If it is a surgery encounter, the date of the surgery will be returned. If it is a Hospital encounter, Admission/Discharge/Transfer (ADT) info will be used to return an appropriate date. If ADT info cannot be found, then the  Hospital Admission date (I EPT 18850) will be returned. If the Hospital Admission Date cannot be found, the temporary admission date (I EPT 18846) will be returned..
PAT_ENC.DISCHARGE_DATE_DT: The discharge date for the encounter.
PAT_ENC.COPAY_PD_THRU_NAME: The method by which the copay for an appointment was paid (e.g., via MyChart, a kiosk).
PAT_ENC.INTERPRETER_NEED_YN: A flag used to indicate whether a patient requires an interpreter for an encounter.
PAT_ENC.VST_SPECIAL_NEEDS_C_NAME: This field captures any special needs for a visit.
PAT_ENC.BEN_ENG_SP_AMT: Stores the adjudicated self-pay amount (the amount required to be paid by the patient) when determining the copay amount for the visit.
PAT_ENC.BEN_ADJ_COPAY_AMT: Stores the adjudicated copy amount for the visit according to the patient's coverage benefits.
PAT_ENC.BEN_ADJ_METHOD_C_NAME: Flag to indicate if and how the adjudicated copay was overridden
PAT_ENC.ENC_CREATE_USER_ID: The ID number of the user who create the patient or encounter record.
PAT_ENC.ENC_CREATE_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PAT_ENC.ENC_INSTANT: The instant an encounter was created
PAT_ENC.EFFECTIVE_DATE_DTTM: The start date and time of an encounter. The start date is pulled from the date stored in the EFFECTIVE_DATE_DT column. The time references the first populated time in the following fields: hospital admission time (EPT 18851), hospital temporary admission time (EPT 18847), ADT arrival time (EPT 10815), and expected admission time (EPT 10300).  The SlicerDicer reporting application uses this column to determine the EffectiveStartDate of encounters.
PAT_ENC.CALCULATED_ENC_STAT_C_NAME: A status flag used to  determine whether to include data from the encounter in the SlicerDicer reporting application. Statuses includes 1-Possible (e.g., the encounter is a scheduled outpatient appointment or the admission is pending) or 2-Complete (e.g., the appointment is complete, the admission is discharged).

PAT_ENC_2._TABLE_: This table supplements the PAT_ENC table. It contains additional information related to patient encounters or appointments.
PAT_ENC_2.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique system identifier of the patient encounter. Contact serial number is unique across all patients and all contacts.
PAT_ENC_2.CONTACT_DATE: The date on which this patient encounter took place.
PAT_ENC_2.COPAY_COINS_FLAG: Set to 1 if copay is coinsurance.
PAT_ENC_2.CAN_LET_C_NAME: This column links to the type of canceled appointment letter sent for this patient encounter. Some examples are "No Letter", "No Show","Cancelation Letter", etc. This category column is linked to ZC_LET.LET_C.
PAT_ENC_2.SUP_PROV_ID: This column contains the provider ID of the supervising provider for this patient encounter.
PAT_ENC_2.SUP_PROV_C_NAME: This column links to information about the Type of Supervising provider.
PAT_ENC_2.SUP_PROV_REV_TM: This column contains the date and time when the supervising provider submitted his or her review
PAT_ENC_2.MEDS_REQUEST_PHR_ID: The pharmacy identifier from which the medications were requested.
PAT_ENC_2.MEDS_REQUEST_OP_C_NAME: This column contains information about the fill option for the medication request.
PAT_ENC_2.PHYS_BP: This contains the patient's blood pressure that was entered during the patient encounter.
PAT_ENC_2.VITALS_TAKEN_TM: Holds the time the vitals were taken
PAT_ENC_2.PHYS_TEMP_SRC_C_NAME: The source of the patient's temperature measurement.
PAT_ENC_2.PAT_PAIN_SCORE_C_NAME: This column indicates how much pain the patient was in via pain score.
PAT_ENC_2.PAT_PAIN_LOC_C_NAME: This column contains information about which body part is experiencing discomfort.
PAT_ENC_2.PAT_PAIN_EDU_YN: This column contains information as to whether pain education questions were asked.
PAT_ENC_2.PAT_PAIN_CMT: This column contains comments that were entered pertaining to the patient's pain
PAT_ENC_2.PAT_PAIN_SCALE_CAT: This item stores the pain scale category under which the pain score is collected.
PAT_ENC_2.SMOKING_STATUS_C_NAME: This simply stores information about whether the patient smokes, is quitting, etc.
PAT_ENC_2.PHYS_SPO2: Contains the blood oxygen saturation value for this encounter.
PAT_ENC_2.SYS_GEN_LOS_ID: This column contains the system generated Level of Service information to link to the procedures tables.
PAT_ENC_2.DOC_HX_SOURCE_C_NAME: Stores the source of entry for the history documentation.  This category column is linked to ZC_HISTORY_SOURCE.HISTORY_SOURCE_C.
PAT_ENC_2.APPT_LET_C_NAME: This column links to the type of appointment letter that was sent to this patient for this patient encounter. Some examples are "No Letter", "Appt Letter", etc.  This category column is linked to ZC_LET.LET_C.
PAT_ENC_2.PARENT_ENC_CSN_ID: This item is a link to an encounter's parent encounter through the parent's contact serial number.  The contact serial number is the unique identifier for the encounter.
PAT_ENC_2.SYNC_IP_DATA_C_NAME: This is a contact-specific flag to tell Chart Sync whether inpatient clinical data for this visit (such as medication administration or documentation flowsheet data) should be synchronized between deployments. A value of 1 (or Yes) means that inpatient clinical data has been, and will continue to be, synchronized for this visit. Note that this item can only be set for a contact whose type is (or was at some point) an inpatient admission.
PAT_ENC_2.APPTMT_LET_INST: If an appointment letter has been printed for this patient encounter, this column will list the date and time it was printed. If multiple letters were printed, we'll list the date and time of the most recent one.
PAT_ENC_2.RESULT_LET_INST: If a result letter has been printed for this patient encounter, this column will list the date and time it was printed. If multiple letters were printed, we'll list the date and time of the most recent one.
PAT_ENC_2.RESCHED_LET_INST: If a reschedule letter has been printed for this patient encounter, this column will list the date and time it was printed. If multiple letters were printed, we'll list the date and time of the most recent one.
PAT_ENC_2.FOLLOW_LET_INST: If a follow-up letter has been printed for this patient encounter, this column will list the date and time it was printed. If multiple letters were printed, we'll list the date and time of the most recent one.
PAT_ENC_2.PHYS_PEAK_FLOW: This column contains a measurement of the flow of air from the lungs: Peak Flow. If this column contains data, the measurement was taken during the associated encounter.
PAT_ENC_2.ENC_SPEC_C_NAME: The encounter specialty item holds which of the encounter provider's specialties should be used for billing and reporting purposes for this encounter.
PAT_ENC_2.LD_STATUS_YN: Flag to denote if the encounter is for a mother who will deliver
PAT_ENC_2.ADT_PAT_CLASS_C_NAME: The category value corresponding to the Admission/Discharge/Transfer (ADT) patient classification for this patient contact.
PAT_ENC_2.OTHER_BLOCK_TYPE_C_NAME: Indicates the specific type of the episode summary, whose ID is stored in I EPT 1970.
PAT_ENC_2.BILL_NUM: Billing number, often used as an identifier in downstream systems.
PAT_ENC_2.IP_DOC_CONTACT_CSN: For Hospital Outpatient Visit (HOV) encounters, this column stores the unique contact serial number for the patient contact which is used for clinical documentation.  This can be set for appointment contacts if they are not converted to HOVs.
PAT_ENC_2.TEMP_PT_HIS_C: This item shows the temporary patient history.
PAT_ENC_2.PRIMARY_PROCONT_ID: The unique ID of the provider that is the primary contact for this patient encounter.
PAT_ENC_2.PRIMARY_TEAM_ID: The unique ID of the primary Provider Care Team for this patient encounter.
PAT_ENC_2.MCIR_VACCINE_CODE_C_NAME: The patient's eligibility code for Michigan's vaccination registry. This item only applies for the state of Michigan.
PAT_ENC_2.VISIT_POS_ID: The unique ID of the facility that was the place of service for this encounter.
PAT_ENC_2.NO_INTERP_RSN_C_NAME: This column holds the reason an interpreter is not needed for the visit (in the case of a patient who would normally require one). It is meant to be populated when the corresponding EPT 495-INTERPRETER NEEDED? value is "no".
PAT_ENC_2.CVG_ADD_DT: The add date returned in the response message by the payor for the encounter. The add date is defined as the date that the payor added the patient as being covered.
PAT_ENC_2.FARM_WORKER_C_NAME: The category number of the patient's farm worker status for the encounter or appointment.
PAT_ENC_2.KIOSK_HH_QUEST_ID: The unique ID of the health history template that is assigned to the patient encounter.
PAT_ENC_2.KIOSK_HH_QUEST_ID_RECORD_NAME: The name of the Visit Navigator (VN) History Template Definition (LQH) record.
PAT_ENC_2.HSP_ACCT_ADV_DTTM: If the Hospital Account Advisor is turned on, this item records the date and time that the advisor's recommendation was accepted or rejected.
PAT_ENC_2.VISIT_VERIFIED_YN: Indicates whether the visit is verified.
PAT_ENC_2.VERIF_VISIT_DT: The current date the visit contact was verified.
PAT_ENC_2.VERIF_DATE_INIT_DT: The initial date the visit contact was verified.
PAT_ENC_2.VERIF_USER_ID: This collects the user ID of the user who verified the visit.
PAT_ENC_2.ENC_LACT_STAT_C_NAME: The lactation status category ID for the patient.
PAT_ENC_2.PAT_LACT_CMNT: The comments entered when the patient's lactation status has been edited.
PAT_ENC_2.COSIGNER_USER_ID: The unique ID of the user who cosigned the patient's chart.
PAT_ENC_2.COSIGNER_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PAT_ENC_2.COSIGN_REV_INS_DTTM: The date and time the chart was cosigned.
PAT_ENC_2.IS_LOS_UPDATE_C_NAME: Stores the status of any Level of Service updates.
PAT_ENC_2.FORM_ID_COUNTER: Stores the counter of form IDs.
PAT_ENC_2.CONSNT_REV_USER_ID: The unique ID of the user who reviewed patient consent.
PAT_ENC_2.CONSNT_REV_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PAT_ENC_2.VISIT_PAYOR_ID: The unique ID of the payor that is associated with this encounter.
PAT_ENC_2.VISIT_PLAN_ID: The unique ID of the plan that is associated with this encounter.
PAT_ENC_2.SOCIO_SRC_C_NAME: Stores the source of entry for the sociological history.
PAT_ENC_2.TEL_ENC_MSG_RGRDING: Free-text field containing user entered information regarding a telephone encounter message.
PAT_ENC_2.MSG_PRIORITY_C_NAME: Indicates the priority of the routed message.
PAT_ENC_2.RESEARCH_ENC_FLG_C_NAME: Category ID of the research encounter flag used to mark the patient encounter as having all charges billed to a research study, the patient, or a mixture.  This is used for charge routing.
PAT_ENC_2.FAM_SPOUSE_NAME: The name of the patient's spouse
PAT_ENC_2.MSG_CALLER_NAME: The name of the caller who left this message
PAT_ENC_2.CONSENT_EXP_DATE: This is the expiration date of any consent forms that are attached to the patient.
PAT_ENC_2.CV_ACC4_PAT_RESP_YN: Indicates whether a patient wants identifying information to be excluded from submission to the American College of Cardiology-National Cardiovascular Data Registry's (ACC-NCDR) Catheterization and/or Percutaneous Coronary Intervention (CathPCI) registry.
PAT_ENC_2.FAMILY_MEM_PREFIX_C_NAME: This column stores the relationship between the patient and the patient's guarantor.
PAT_ENC_2.AVS_REFUSED_DTTM: The date and time when an end user documented that the patient declined the After Visit Summary.
PAT_ENC_2.AVS_LAST_PRINT_DTTM: Records the instant the After Visit Summary was last printed
PAT_ENC_2.MED_LIST_UPDATE_DTTM: If a patient's prescriptions or Facility-Administered Medications (FAMs) are updated (signed, modified, or discontinued; or other med reconciliation actions are changed) after the After Visit Summary (AVS) has been printed, this item is updated to hold a timestamp indicating the last time that such updates were made. It is left blank if no AVS has been printed yet.

PAT_ENC_3._TABLE_: This table supplements the PAT_ENC and PAT_ENC_2 tables. It contains additional information related to patient encounters or appointments.
PAT_ENC_3.PAT_ENC_CSN: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
PAT_ENC_3.PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL: A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
PAT_ENC_3.CHKOUT_USER_ID: The unique ID number of the user who completed the check out process for the patient for this encounter. If the encounter has not been checked out, this field will appear as "null." This ID may be encrypted.
PAT_ENC_3.CHKOUT_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PAT_ENC_3.ENC_BILL_AREA_ID: The bill area which should be assigned to charges created from this encounter. The available bill areas to choose from will be determined based on lists in the provider and department records.
PAT_ENC_3.ENC_BILL_AREA_ID_BILL_AREA_NAME: The record name of this bill area, financial subdivision, or financial division.
PAT_ENC_3.RX_CHG_ADMIT_FLG_C_NAME: This item contains the status of charge suppression for the patient. 1 indicates all charges are being suppressed. 2 indicates suppressed charges are now dropped. 3 indicates some or all charges are currently being suppressed.
PAT_ENC_3.DX_UNIQUE_COUNTER: The number of unique diagnoses associated with this patient encounter. Unique diagnoses are stored in item EPT 18425, which is extracted by the DX_UNIQUE column in the PAT_ENC_DX table.
PAT_ENC_3.HP_DEFAULTED_YN: Whether the hospital problem was automatically populated from the list of admission diagnoses.  This column will have a Y if the problem was populated from an admission diagnosis and an N otherwise.
PAT_ENC_3.IP_CP_LAST_VAR_DTTM: The date and time the last care plan variance was documented.
PAT_ENC_3.READY_QUT_SMOKING_C_NAME: This column is used to indicate whether patient is ready to quit smoking.
PAT_ENC_3.COUNSELING_GIVEN_C_NAME: This column is used to indicate whether smoking counseling is given.
PAT_ENC_3.COMMAUTO_SENDER_ID: The unique user ID of the sender of the automatically generated communications.
PAT_ENC_3.COMMAUTO_SENDER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PAT_ENC_3.BENEFIT_ID: The benefit record used to store discrete information about the patient's insurance benefits for this encounter.
PAT_ENC_3.PREPAY_DUE_AMT: The amount of pre-payment that is due for this visit.
PAT_ENC_3.PREPAY_AMT_FROM_C_NAME: The activity that set the pre-payment due amount.
PAT_ENC_3.PREPAY_PAID_AMT: The pre-payment amount that has been collected for this visit.
PAT_ENC_3.SMK_CESS_USER_ID: The last user to modify the Smoking Cessation items for the encounter.
PAT_ENC_3.SMK_CESS_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PAT_ENC_3.SMK_CESS_DTTM: Indicates whether Instant Smoking Cessation items were modified for an encounter.
PAT_ENC_3.DO_NOT_BILL_INS_YN: Indicates if a visit is marked as Do Not Bill Insurance.
PAT_ENC_3.SELF_PAY_VISIT_YN: Indicates whether a visit is self-pay.
PAT_ENC_3.REFERRAL_TYPE_C_NAME: The means by which the patient learned about the organization.
PAT_ENC_3.COPAY_NUM_UNITS: The number of units used to calculate the copay for this encounter.
PAT_ENC_3.COPAY_AMT_PER_UNIT: The copay per each copay unit for this encounter.
PAT_ENC_3.COPAY_LASTCALC_DT: The date the copay was last calculated for this encounter.
PAT_ENC_3.COPAY_OVERRIDDEN_YN: Indicates whether the user has overridden the copay amount for this encounter.
PAT_ENC_3.OB_TOTAL_WT_GAIN: This column contains the patient's total weight gain in ounces as of the encounter if the patient had a weight documented on the encounter and a pregnancy episode with a pregravid weight linked to the encounter.
PAT_ENC_3.MEDICAID_GROUP_NAME: Item to store the name of a group defined by a Medicaid program.
PAT_ENC_3.STUDENT_STATUS_C_NAME: Tracks a patient's student status for a given encounter.
PAT_ENC_3.MEDICAID_GROUP_ID: Item to store the identifier of a group defined by a Medicaid program.
PAT_ENC_3.EXTERNAL_REF_ID: The reference ID from an external organization for the patient visit.
PAT_ENC_3.OUTCOME_C_NAME: The clinical outcome of an encounter.  The value of this item will then be used to determine the appropriate RTT/waiting status for the encounter. It is primarily applicable to the UK and Denmark.
PAT_ENC_3.HSPC_NO_ADM_C_NAME: The Hospice Reason for Non-Admit category ID for the hospice episode.

PAT_ENC_4._TABLE_: This table supplements the PAT_ENC, PAT_ENC_2, and PAT_ENC_3 tables. It contains additional information related to patient encounters or appointments.
PAT_ENC_4.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
PAT_ENC_4.FAMILY_SIZE: The number of members in the patient's family.
PAT_ENC_4.VISIT_NUMBER: The visit number for the given contact.
PAT_ENC_4.PAT_CNCT_IND_C_NAME: The patient contact indicator category number for the patient encounter.
PAT_ENC_4.DENTAL_STUDENT_ID: The unique ID of the provider who is the dental student associated with the patient.
PAT_ENC_4.LOC_VISIT_ID: The unique ID of the location that is associated with the visit.
PAT_ENC_4.COPAY_NOT_COVERED_C_NAME: The copay not covered category number for the patient encounter.
PAT_ENC_4.COPAY_COLL_FLAG_YN: The copay collected flag that indicates whether a copay was collected from the patient encounter.
PAT_ENC_4.COPAY_COLL_PERSON: The unique ID number of the person who collected the patient's copay for the encounter.
PAT_ENC_4.COPAY_WAIVE_RSN_C_NAME: The copay waive reason category number for the patient encounter.
PAT_ENC_4.COPAY_MIN_VALUE: The value of the minimum copay.
PAT_ENC_4.COPAY_RECEIPT_NUM: The receipt number of the copay collected.
PAT_ENC_4.BEN_ADJ_COINS_AMT: The adjudicated coinsurance amount for the visit calculated by the benefits engine.
PAT_ENC_4.BEN_ADJ_DEDUCT_AMT: The portion of the self-pay amount applied to the deductible for the visit.
PAT_ENC_4.PAT_HOMELESS_YN: Indicates if a patient is homeless.
PAT_ENC_4.PAT_HOMELESS_TYP_C_NAME: Characterizes the patients homelessness (for example chronic or sporadic)
PAT_ENC_4.PERCENTAGE_OF_FPL: Indicates where the patient falls on the federal poverty level as a percentage.
PAT_ENC_4.MSG_RECEIVED_DTTM: The date and time the encounter creation In Basket message was received.
PAT_ENC_4.TOBACCO_USE_VRFY_YN: This column indicates whether the patient's tobacco usage has been verified. A Y indicates the usage was verified. An N or null indicates the tobacco usage was not verified. It extracts a virtual item, which is calculated using EPT-19202.
PAT_ENC_4.CR_TX_TYPE_C_NAME: The transaction type category number for the encounter(E-Visit or Copay).
PAT_ENC_4.ORIG_ENC_CSN: Holds the CSN of the encounter this Remote Consult encounter is responding to.
PAT_ENC_4.PHYS_BP_COMMENTS: This column contains the comments entered for the last recorded blood pressure for this visit.
PAT_ENC_4.PHYS_TEMP_COMMENTS: This column contains the comments entered for the last recorded temperature for this visit.
PAT_ENC_4.PHYS_TEMPSRC_COMNTS: This column contains the comments entered for the last recorded temperature source for this visit.
PAT_ENC_4.PHYS_PULSE_COMMENTS: This column contains the comments entered for the last recorded pulse for this visit.
PAT_ENC_4.PHYS_WEIGHT_COMNTS: This column contains the comments entered for the last recorded weight for this visit.
PAT_ENC_4.PHYS_HEIGHT_COMNTS: This column contains the comments entered for the last recorded height for this visit.
PAT_ENC_4.PHYS_RESP_COMMENTS: This column contains the comments entered for the last recorded respirations for this visit.
PAT_ENC_4.PHYS_SPO2_COMMENTS: This column contains the comments entered for the last recorded oxygen saturation level (SpO2) for this visit.
PAT_ENC_4.PHYS_PF_COMMENTS: This column contains the comments entered for the last recorded peak flow for this visit.
PAT_ENC_4.INTERPRT_ASGN_CMT: Comments regarding the interpreter assigned to the patient's contact.
PAT_ENC_4.PAT_HOUSING_STAT_C_NAME: This item stores the patient's current housing status. This is a category list item that may contain values such as Stable/Permanent, Temporary, Unstable, or Unknown.
PAT_ENC_4.BCRA_AGE: The patient's age at the time of the risk assessment.
PAT_ENC_4.BCRA_MENARCHE_AGE_C_NAME: The patient's risk factor category number for the Age at Menarche breast cancer risk factor.
PAT_ENC_4.BCRA_FST_LIVBIRTH_C_NAME: The patient's risk factor category number for the Age at First Live Birth breast cancer risk factor.
PAT_ENC_4.BCRA_FST_DEG_REL_C_NAME: The patient's risk factor category number for the Number of Affected First Degree Relatives breast cancer risk factor. Only first degree relatives are considered.
PAT_ENC_4.BCRA_NUM_BIOPSY_C_NAME: The patient's risk factor category number for the Number of Breast Biopsies breast cancer risk factor.
PAT_ENC_4.BCRA_ATYP_HYPLSA_C_NAME: The patient's risk factor category number for the Presence of Atypical Hyperplasia in Breast Biopsies breast cancer risk factor.
PAT_ENC_4.BCRA_RACE_C_NAME: The patient's risk factor category number for the Race breast cancer risk factor.
PAT_ENC_4.LB_ENC_START_DT: This identifies the start date of a Lab Requisition encounter.
PAT_ENC_4.LB_ENC_END_DT: This identifies the end date of a Lab Requisition encounter.
PAT_ENC_4.WAITING_LIST_ID: The unique ID of the Waiting List record associated with this encounter. This column can be used to link to the WAITING_LIST_INFO table.
PAT_ENC_4.SUBMITTER_ID: The submitting organization that the results for the lab orders on this encounter should be sent to.
PAT_ENC_4.SUBMITTER_ID_RECORD_NAME: The name of the submitter record.
PAT_ENC_4.BILL_TO_SUBMITTER_C_NAME: Flag indicating whether the submitter should be billed for any lab procedures performed.
PAT_ENC_4.SUBMITTER_ACCT_ID: The submitter account to be used when billing laboratory procedures.
PAT_ENC_4.LB_BLNG_ENC_SRVC_DT: This identifies the service date of the Billing encounter used for Lab Billing. The date is in the time zone of the lab department that created the encounter.
PAT_ENC_4.ECHKIN_STATUS_C_NAME: The status of the eCheck-In for this appointment.
PAT_ENC_4.PB_VISIT_HAR_ID: The hospital account record used by the Professional Billing system for a given contact.
PAT_ENC_4.TECHNICAL_REFERRAL_ID: The MassHealth technical referral associated with the encounter.
PAT_ENC_4.CR_CLIENT_REF_IDNT: Used to store the client ID returned by the copay reduction web service
PAT_ENC_4.CR_BENEFIT_REF_IDNT: The benefit reference ID number of the patient for the current encounter.
PAT_ENC_4.CR_MESSAGE_ENGLISH: The copay message returned by the web service in English.
PAT_ENC_4.CR_MESSAGE_SPANISH: The copay message returned by the web service in Spanish.
PAT_ENC_4.CR_QUERY_SENT_UTC_DTTM: Instant the copay reduction web service query was sent to the server
PAT_ENC_4.CR_RESP_RECVD_UTC_DTTM: Specifies the instant when the response to the copay reduction web service query was received
PAT_ENC_4.CR_QUERY_ERROR: Specifies the error received in the response to the query sent out to get the copay reduction for the current patient encounter.
PAT_ENC_4.COPAY_REDUCTION_AMT: The amount by which the copay should be reduced for the current visit

PAT_ENC_5._TABLE_: This table supplements the PAT_ENC, PAT_ENC_2, PAT_ENC_3, and PAT_ENC_4 tables. It contains additional information related to patient encounters or appointments.
PAT_ENC_5.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
PAT_ENC_5.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
PAT_ENC_5.PUBLIC_HOUSING_YN: This item tracks whether or not a patient lived in public housing at the time of a given encounter.
PAT_ENC_5.PVT_HOSP_ENC_C_NAME: The category value corresponding to the private encounter setting for this patient contact.
PAT_ENC_5.LINK_INS_TYPE_C_NAME: The lab insurance type category ID for the insurance type used with the ordering encounter in EpicCare Link.
PAT_ENC_5.PAT_VER_HCA_C_NAME: Contains the patient's response on the Health Care Agent Verification screen in Welcome; either "Patient indicated data was correct" or "Patient indicated they want to discuss care decisions with a clinician."
PAT_ENC_5.EXT_GRP_IDNT: This column holds appointment group identifiers assigned by external systems. If two appointments have the same external group identifier, they were checked in as a group, and they will be treated as a group in Epic.
PAT_ENC_5.EXT_GRP_SRC_C_NAME: Holds the source of an external group identifier in EXT_GRP_IDNT. If two rows have the same value for their external group source, the same external system grouped the appointments.
PAT_ENC_5.PREPAY_SET_BY_USER_YN: This item will be set to Yes if the prepay due for this visit was manually set by a user.
PAT_ENC_5.PREPAY_UPDATE_USER_ID: User who last updated the prepay due amount.
PAT_ENC_5.PREPAY_UPDATE_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PAT_ENC_5.PREPAY_UPDATE_INST_DTTM: The last instant the prepay due for the visit was updated.
PAT_ENC_5.PREPAY_CALC_SCENARIO: Stores the scenario/reason why the corresponding payment needs to be collected upfront from the patient.
PAT_ENC_5.AUTHCERT_ID: The unique ID of the auth/cert associated with the patient contact.
PAT_ENC_5.ED_REF_CALLBAK_YN: Whether a referring provider requests a call back from the ED physician at the end their visit
PAT_ENC_5.ED_REF_CALLBAK_P_ID: Provider that is referring the patient to the ED
PAT_ENC_5.ED_REF_CALLBAK_C_ID: Location the provider is being referred to the ED from
PAT_ENC_5.ED_REF_CALLBAK_NUM: Phone number to contact the referring provider at after ED visit
PAT_ENC_5.IS_ON_DEMAND_VV_YN: Denotes whether this contact is an on-demand video visit.
PAT_ENC_5.ATTR_DEPARTMENT_ID: The unique ID of the department that is associated with the encounter.
PAT_ENC_5.PAT_DTREE_ANSWER_ID: Stores the decision tree that was completed by the patient which resulted in this encounter being created.
PAT_ENC_5.PREPAY_DISCNT_AMT: Stores the total amount that was discounted because a patient paid early.
PAT_ENC_5.PREPAY_DISCNT_PCT: Stores the percent that was used to calculate the prepay discounted amount.
PAT_ENC_5.PREPAY_PROPOSED_DISCNT_AMT: Stores what the prepay discount would be if it applied.
PAT_ENC_5.PREPAY_DISCNT_CALC_RULE_ID: Stores the rule that was used to determine the prepay discount percent.
PAT_ENC_5.PREPAY_DISCNT_CALC_PCT: Stores the system calculated percent for a prepay discount.
PAT_ENC_5.PREPAY_DISCNT_OVRIDE_AMT: If a user overrides the prepay discount amount, the override will be stored here and we will no longer use rules to determine the prepay discount.
PAT_ENC_5.PREPAY_DISCNT_OVRIDE_PCT: If a user overrides the prepay discount percent, the override will be stored here and we will no longer use rules to determine the prepay discount.
PAT_ENC_5.PREPAY_DISCNT_OVRIDE_USER_ID: If a user overrides the prepay discount, this will store the user who made the override.
PAT_ENC_5.PREPAY_DISCNT_OVRIDE_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PAT_ENC_5.PREPAY_DISCNT_OVRIDE_CMT: If a user overrides the prepay discount and adds a comment about why they did so, the comment will be stored here.
PAT_ENC_5.PREPAY_DISCNT_OVRIDE_DTTM: If a user overrides the prepay discount, this will store the instant it was overridden. This item is mainly used for reference purposes.
PAT_ENC_5.EVISIT_STATUS_C_NAME: The current status of the e-visit encounter.

PAT_ENC_6._TABLE_: This table supplements the PAT_ENC, PAT_ENC_2, PAT_ENC_3, PAT_ENC_4, and PAT_ENC_5  tables. It contains additional information related to patient encounters or appointments.
PAT_ENC_6.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
PAT_ENC_6.PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL: A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
PAT_ENC_6.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
PAT_ENC_6.LINKED_ENC_CSN: The unique contact serial number of the visit that represents the official visit. Intended for (FINLAND) ad hoc encounters that need to be associated with an official visit.
PAT_ENC_6.LMP_PRECISION_C_NAME: The uncertainty of the last menstrual period date stored in the PAT_ENC.LMP_DATE column.
PAT_ENC_6.PLANNED_BILL_AREA_ID: Used to track what the bill area was for an appointment at the time of check in.
PAT_ENC_6.PLANNED_BILL_AREA_ID_BILL_AREA_NAME: The record name of this bill area, financial subdivision, or financial division.
PAT_ENC_6.BCRA_BRCA_GENE_MUT_C_NAME: The patient's risk factor category number for the Presence of BRCA 1/2 Mutation breast cancer risk factor.
PAT_ENC_6.SVC_TARGET_EFFORT_YN: Flag to indicate that additional effort was needed on behalf of staff to work this encounter in order to meet service targets.
PAT_ENC_6.OUTPAT_VISIT_GRP_C_NAME: Used to indicate additional visit type information for reporting purposes.
PAT_ENC_6.PSYCH_ARRIVAL_C_NAME: Indicates the method of arrival for the patient for psychiatric care.
PAT_ENC_6.PLAN_RECUR_TREAT_YN: Indicates whether the visit is part of a planned recurring treatment period.
PAT_ENC_6.HUS_VISIT_TYPE_C_NAME: Additional visit type information required for HUS visits for reporting purposes.
PAT_ENC_6.SOCIAL_SRVC_AREA_C_NAME: Indicates the social care service area for the visit.
PAT_ENC_6.EXT_LTC_PAT_YN: Indicates whether a patient is a long term care patient at an external organization.
PAT_ENC_6.VETERAN_ENC_MED_CVG_C_NAME: This holds the medical coverage level for a given patient encounter. The medical coverage denotes the level of coverage a patient is using for a given encounter. The coverage level determines how much the patient will be billed. This column is frequently used to link to the ZC_VETERAN_MED_CVG table.
PAT_ENC_6.VETERAN_BILLING_CODE_C_NAME: This holds the veteran billing code for a given patient encounter. The billing code denotes the type of appointment that was given which in turns determines how much the patient should be billed. This column is frequently used to link to the ZC_VETERAN_BILLING_CODE table.
PAT_ENC_6.ED_REF_CALLBAK_D_ID: The ID number of the department from which the patient is being referred to the ED.
PAT_ENC_6.RFV_USED_TO_SCHED_C_NAME: Stores the reason for visit the user selected to schedule an appointment through MyChart.
PAT_ENC_6.BMI_PERCENTILE: This item stores the patient's BMI percentile. This item will be null for ages greater than 20, and is calculated based on the patient's height, weight, and sex.
PAT_ENC_6.CREATION_ORD_ID: The ID number of the order which created the patient contact.
PAT_ENC_6.EXT_TX_STATUS_C_NAME: An optional item used to document the encounter's External Transportation Status/Needs. There is no standard functionality that is driven by this item. This item can be used to drive reporting, confirmation errors, or WQ activities.
PAT_ENC_6.EXT_TX_STATUS_CMT: An optional item used to document the encounter's External Transportation Comments. There is no standard functionality that is driven by this item. This item can be used to driver reporting, confirmation errors, or WQ activities.
PAT_ENC_6.EXT_ACCM_STATUS_C_NAME: An optional item used to document the encounter's External Accommodation Status/Needs. There is no standard functionality that is driven by this item. This item can be used to driver reporting, confirmation errors, or workqueue activities.
PAT_ENC_6.EXT_ACCM_STATUS_CMT: An optional item used to document the encounter's External Accommodation Comments. There is no standard functionality that is driven by this item. This item can be used to driver reporting, confirmation errors, or workqueue activities.
PAT_ENC_6.GAIL_LIFETIME_RISK: This item stores the patient's most recent Gail lifetime risk score from either I EPT 29088 or I EPT 29095.
PAT_ENC_6.GAIL_5_YR_RISK: This item stores the patient's most recent Gail 5-year risk score from either I EPT 29088 or I EPT 29095.
PAT_ENC_6.SG_AT_RISK_IND_C_NAME: Stores the at risk indicator for a specific visit.
PAT_ENC_6.SG_FC_STATUS_C_NAME: Stores the financial counselling status for a specific visit.
PAT_ENC_6.ELIG_PLAN_SELECT_YN: This item indicates if an eligibility plan is currently selected for this encounter.
PAT_ENC_6.SG_MOH_URGENCY_C_NAME: Used to indicate whether an appointment is urgent or non-urgent for Ministry of Health regulatory reporting.
PAT_ENC_6.SG_NAMED_REFERRAL_YN: Used for validation of the patient class and regulatory reporting for whether a patient was referred to a particular provider.
PAT_ENC_6.SG_PAT_REQUEST_YN: Used to indicate whether a patient requested to see a particular doctor and thus should be a private patient.
PAT_ENC_6.SG_TREATMENT_PROG_C_NAME: Used to indicate the type of service programme that the appointment is assigned to.
PAT_ENC_6.SG_APPT_RATIONALE_C_NAME: Used to indicate whether an appointment was the earliest possible, at a patient request, at a doctor request, or force booked. This drives regulatory reporting functionality.
PAT_ENC_6.EVISIT_RFV_C_NAME: The category value of the reason for the e-visit. This number links to the value stored in the ON_DEMAND_VIDEO_VISIT_C of the ZC_ON_DEMAND_VIDEO_VISIT table.
PAT_ENC_6.EVISIT_YN: Indicates whether this encounter is an E-Visit. This will be set only for appointment-based E-Visits.
PAT_ENC_6.EVISIT_TLH_ALLOWED_SUBLOC_C_NAME: The sublocation where the patient indicated they were currently located for a video visit or an e-visit. This information comes from a category value stored in I SER 32510.
PAT_ENC_6.EVISIT_TLH_ALLOWED_LOC_C_NAME: The country where the patient indicated they were currently located for a video visit or an e-visit. This information comes from a category value stored in I ECT 70150.
PAT_ENC_6.APPT_AUTH_STATUS_C_NAME: The authorization status of an appointment based on the information stored in any authorization records linked to an appointment (EPT-23025).
PAT_ENC_6.EVISIT_NEW_STATUS_C_NAME: The current workflow status of an e-visit encounter. Values include 1-In Progress, 2-Submitted, 3-Under Review, 4-Complete, 5-Expired, 6-Returned to Patient, and 7-Cancelled
PAT_ENC_6.LAB_RESP_USER_ID: The unique ID of the phlebotomist (EMP) currently responsible for the patient's lab draws for this encounter.
PAT_ENC_6.LAB_RESP_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PAT_ENC_6.EXT_MEDS_UPD_INST_UTC_DTTM: Contains the most recent instant of update for external medications in external orders encounters.
PAT_ENC_6.INTF_PRIMARY_PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: Contains the CSN of the primary interface contact for this encounter.
PAT_ENC_6.OVERRIDE_BCRA_NUM_BIOPSY_C_NAME: The override value for the number of biopsies. The override value is used in the calculation of the Gail model risk score.
PAT_ENC_6.OVERRIDE_BCRA_RACE_C_NAME: The override value for patient race. The override value is used in the calculation of the Gail model risk score.
PAT_ENC_6.OVERRIDE_GAIL_FACTOR_USER_ID: The user who overrode the factors for the Gail model.
PAT_ENC_6.OVERRIDE_GAIL_FACTOR_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PAT_ENC_6.OVERRIDE_GAIL_FACTOR_DTTM: The instant when the Gail factors were overridden.
PAT_ENC_6.VETERAN_COVERAGE_ENC_YN: Indicates whether the patient's encounter is expected to be covered by their VA coverage
PAT_ENC_6.ADJUD_TO_PHARMACY_COVERAGE_YN: Indicates whether we are adjudicating one or more of the medications administered to the patient to a pharmacy coverage. 'Y' indicates that medications will be adjudicated. 'N' or NULL indicate that no medications will be adjudicated to a pharmacy coverage.

PAT_ENC_7._TABLE_: This table supplements the PAT_ENC, PAT_ENC_2, PAT_ENC_3, PAT_ENC_4, PAT_ENC_5, and PAT_ENC_6 tables. It contains additional information related to patient encounters or appointments.
PAT_ENC_7.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
PAT_ENC_7.PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL: A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
PAT_ENC_7.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
PAT_ENC_7.NOTIFY_REP_ADMSN_C_NAME: Indicates whether a patient wants to have a family member or representative notified of their admission.
PAT_ENC_7.REP_NOTIFIED_C_NAME: Indicates whether a patient's family or representative is notified of their admission.
PAT_ENC_7.NOTIFY_REP_COMMENTS: Information about notifying a patient's family or representative of their admission.
PAT_ENC_7.NOTIFY_PCP_ADMSN_C_NAME: Indicates whether a patient wants to have their PCP notified of their admission.
PAT_ENC_7.PCP_NOTIFIED_C_NAME: Indicates whether a patient's PCP is notified of their admission.
PAT_ENC_7.NOTIFY_PCP_COMMENTS: Information about notifying a patient's PCP of their admission.
PAT_ENC_7.ROC_PLANNING_PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: Stores the unique contact serial number of the resumption of care planning contact linked to this contact
PAT_ENC_7.NUM_PREV_EPSD_C_NAME: Stores the number of previous consecutive episodes category ID for the patient
PAT_ENC_7.SPEC_ORD_RSLT_NOT_AUTO_RLS_YN: It stores whether the order results of all the specimen orders created in the Specimens navigator section are automatically released to MyChart.
PAT_ENC_7.RECENTLY_AT_SCHOOL_C_NAME: Whether the patient has recently been physically present at the school they work at or attend
PAT_ENC_7.LMP_COMMENT: Free-text comments about the last menstrual period
PAT_ENC_7.CONTACT_NUM: The system-assigned number used to uniquely identify each of a given patient's encounters.
PAT_ENC_7.ABN_REQUIRED_YN: Indicates whether an ABN required for this patient encounter.
PAT_ENC_7.IS_ABN_SIGNED_C_NAME: Indicates whether the ABN has been signed for this encounter.
PAT_ENC_7.MSP_IS_MEDICARE_HMO_C_NAME: Indicates whether the patient is covered by a Medicare HMO for this encounter. Used for MSPQ.
PAT_ENC_7.REG_COMMENTS_DATE: The date corresponding to the comment in PAT_ENC_REG_CMT table for this encounter.
PAT_ENC_7.AUTO_MSG_DISABLED_YN: Whether messages that are automatically sent to a patient's companions should be disabled.
PAT_ENC_7.DONT_AUTO_LINK_YN: Whether auto-linking should be disabled for a given encounter.
PAT_ENC_7.RSN_FOR_NO_INC_MSG_C_NAME: The reason for no inc. message Category ID for the patient encounter. Indicates the reason there is no incomplete message to send for the encounter.
PAT_ENC_7.HAS_HORMONE_DATA_YN: Whether the hormone history information is present on the given encounter.
PAT_ENC_7.MEDS_REQUEST_LWS_ID: This is the destination to use with the encounter primary pharmacy stored in EPT 17162.
PAT_ENC_7.EVISIT_SUBMITTED_DTTM: The instant in system local time at which the patient submitted the E-Visit.  If conversion 888449 has not completed, this column might not have data for some submitted E-Visits. Consider using V_PAT_ENC_EVISIT.EVISIT_SUBMITTED_DTTM instead, which will always have a submission time for all submitted E-Visits. Talk to your operational database administrator or Epic representative to determine whether the conversion has finished.
PAT_ENC_7.EVISIT_TURNAROUND_IN_MINUTES: The amount of time, in minutes, between when a patient submitted the E-Visit and when a provider signed the encounter. If the encounter is not an E-Visit, or if the E-Visit was not both submitted and signed, then this column will be NULL.
PAT_ENC_7.PREGNANCY_INTENTION_C_NAME: The patient's stated willingness to initiate a pregnancy within the subsequent year
PAT_ENC_7.PREGNANCY_COUNSELED_YN: Whether the patient received counselling on how to achieve pregnancy
PAT_ENC_7.BIRTH_CONTROL_COUNSELED_YN: Whether the patient wanted to discuss pregnancy prevention
PAT_ENC_7.RSN_NO_BCM_COUNSELING_C_NAME: The reason why the patient did not want to discuss pregnancy prevention
PAT_ENC_7.INTAKE_RSN_NO_CONTRACEPTIVE_C_NAME: The reason the patient has not been using contraceptives as of the start of the encounter
PAT_ENC_7.CONTRACEPTIVE_DELIVERY_C_NAME: The method used to deliver or implement agreed contraceptives
PAT_ENC_7.EXIT_RSN_NO_CONTRACEPTIVE_C_NAME: The reason for not agreeing during the encounter to implement contraceptives
PAT_ENC_7.IS_VAP_DECLINED_YN: Indicates whether this Visit Auto Pay proposal has been declined or not.  This is when a hyperspace user indicates that the patient has declined Visit Auto Pay.
PAT_ENC_7.EPISODE_UPDATE_EFF_DATE: The date when the information in this episode update encounter will start being used.
PAT_ENC_7.EPISODE_UPD_CREAT_RSN_C_NAME: The category ID for the reason the episode update encounter was created.
PAT_ENC_7.VISIT_MSG_DECLINE_YN: Whether the patient has declined visit messaging for this encounter.
PAT_ENC_7.BILL_FOR_DENIAL_YN: The category ID for the decision on if Medicare should be billed for denial for this encounter.

PMT_EOB_INFO_I._TABLE_: The PMT_EOB_INFO_I table contains the Explanation of Benefits information given a transaction ID. It contains data that is not multiple response given a transaction ID.
PMT_EOB_INFO_I.TX_ID: The unique identifier associated with the transaction for this row.
PMT_EOB_INFO_I.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
PMT_EOB_INFO_I.PEOB_TX_ID: The transaction ID of the matching charge.
PMT_EOB_INFO_I.CVD_AMT: The covered amount for that transaction.
PMT_EOB_INFO_I.NONCVD_AMT: The non-covered amount for that transaction.
PMT_EOB_INFO_I.DED_AMT: The deducted amount for that transaction.
PMT_EOB_INFO_I.COPAY_AMT: The copay amount for that transaction.
PMT_EOB_INFO_I.COINS_AMT: The coinsurance amount for that transaction.
PMT_EOB_INFO_I.COB_AMT: The Coordination of�Benefits amount for that transaction.
PMT_EOB_INFO_I.PAID_AMT: The paid amount for that transaction.
PMT_EOB_INFO_I.ICN: The internal control number for that transaction.
PMT_EOB_INFO_I.DENIAL_CODES: The denial code for the transaction.
PMT_EOB_INFO_I.PEOB_ACTION_NAME_C_NAME: The Explanation Of Benefits action category ID for�the transaction.
PMT_EOB_INFO_I.ACTION_AMT: The action amount for this transaction.
PMT_EOB_INFO_I.ACCOUNT_ID: The Account Id of the transfer to self-pay action or next responsible party to self-pay action performed in insurance payment posting.
PMT_EOB_INFO_I.COVERAGE_ID: The Action Coverage of the next responsible party action or resubmit insurance action performed in insurance payment posting.
PMT_EOB_INFO_I.ACTION_ASN_NAME_C_NAME: The action assignment category ID for the transaction.
PMT_EOB_INFO_I.COMMENTS: The comments associated the Explanation of Benefits for a transaction.
PMT_EOB_INFO_I.WIN_DENIAL_ID_REMIT_CODE_NAME: The name of each remittance code.
PMT_EOB_INFO_I.ACTION_EOB: The Explanation of Benefits code for actions (next responsible party or resubmit) in payment posting associated with the transaction.
PMT_EOB_INFO_I.INVOICE_NUM: The invoice number for the transaction.
PMT_EOB_INFO_I.SUMMARY: Contains any paid, adjustment, copay, coinsurance, or allowed amount for a transaction.
PMT_EOB_INFO_I.TX_MATCH_DATE: The date when the charge was matched to the payment.
PMT_EOB_INFO_I.CROSSOVER_C_NAME: Indicates the crossover scenario of this payment transaction at the time of payment posting. The crossover scenario value describes whether this payment transaction is a regular payment, a primary payment (and whether or not the crossover payor has paid), or a crossover payment (and whether or not the primary payor has paid).
PMT_EOB_INFO_I.NON_PRIMARY_SYS_YN: Indicates whether the system determines this payment transaction as a non-primary payment at the time of payment posting based on crossover information, invoice information, and previous payments information.�Y indicates the system determines this payment transaction as a non-primary payment at the time of payment posting based on crossover information, invoice information, and previous payments information.�A null value indicates the system does not determine this payment transaction as a non-primary payment at the time of payment posting based on crossover information, invoice information, and previous payments information.
PMT_EOB_INFO_I.NON_PRIMARY_USR_YN: Indicates whether the user determines this payment transaction as a non-primary payment at the time of payment posting. The value of the Non-primary posting (user) is usually the same as the system determined non-primary posting value. However, users can override the system determined non-primary posting value based on the EOB information.  Y indicates the user determines this payment transaction as a non-primary payment at the time of payment posting.
PMT_EOB_INFO_I.PEOB_ACTION_C_NAME: Indicates the Next Responsible Party, Resubmit Insurance or Transfer to Self-Pay action taken on the charge.
PMT_EOB_INFO_I.INV_ID: Invoice ID that is associated with one payment Explanation  of Benefits line. Use this field along with INV_LINE to link to the proper record in the INV_CLM_LN_ADDL table.
PMT_EOB_INFO_I.INV_LINE: Line count of one invoice record for internal calculation use. It is different from claim form line. Use this field along with INV_ID to link to the associated record in the INV_CLM_LN_ADDL table.
PMT_EOB_INFO_I.NO_MATCHED_CHGS_YN: This column is set to Y when all charges associated with this EOB line have been unmatched from the payment.
PMT_EOB_INFO_I.PEOB_ACCOUNT_ID: The ID of the guarantor on the invoice associated with the payment. If there is no associated invoice, this column stores the ID of the guarantor from the charge.
PMT_EOB_INFO_I.PEOB_LOC_ID: The ID of the revenue location on the invoice associated with the payment. If there is no associated invoice, this column stores the ID of the revenue location from the charge transaction.
PMT_EOB_INFO_I.PEOB_POS_ID: The ID of the Place of Service on the invoice associated with the payment. If there is no associated invoice, this column stores the ID of the Place of Service from the charge.
PMT_EOB_INFO_I.PEOB_DEPT_ID: The ID of the department on the invoice associated with the payment. If there is no associated invoice, this column stores the ID of the department from the charge.
PMT_EOB_INFO_I.PEOB_BILL_PROV_ID: The ID of the billing provider on the invoice associated with the payment. If there is no associated invoice, this column stores the ID of the billing provider from the charge.
PMT_EOB_INFO_I.PEOB_PLAN_ID: The ID of the benefit plan on the invoice associated with the payment. If there is no associated invoice, this column will be blank.
PMT_EOB_INFO_I.PEOB_PROC_ID: The ID of the procedure on the invoice associated with the payment. If there is no associated invoice, this column stores the ID of the procedure from the charge transaction.
PMT_EOB_INFO_I.PEOB_MTCH_CHG_TX_ID: The ID of the first matching charge transaction on the invoice associated with the payment. If there is no associated invoice, this column stores the ID of the charge from the Explanation of Benefits master file.

PMT_EOB_INFO_II._TABLE_: The PMT_EOB_INFO_II table contains the Explanation of Benefits information given a transaction ID. This table contains multiple response items pertaining to PMT_EOB_INFO_I table.
PMT_EOB_INFO_II.LINE: The line number of one EOB code which is different from EOB line number in PMT_EOB_INFO_I.
PMT_EOB_INFO_II.AMOUNT: The Explanation of Benefits amount for a transaction.
PMT_EOB_INFO_II.EOB_CODES: The EOB Code for this transaction.
PMT_EOB_INFO_II.ADJ_PROC_ID: The write-off adjustment code associated with the remittance code.
PMT_EOB_INFO_II.ACTIONS: The action category ID for the payment Explanation of Benefits (EOB)�action in this table. This column is frequently used to link to the ZC_TX_ACTION_TYPE table.
PMT_EOB_INFO_II.SYSTEM_COMMENT: The comment put into the systems for this transaction.
PMT_EOB_INFO_II.WINNINGRMC_ID: The winning remittance code ID from the remittance code.
PMT_EOB_INFO_II.WINNINGRMC_ID_REMIT_CODE_NAME: The name of each remittance code.
PMT_EOB_INFO_II.TX_MATCH_DATE: The date when the charge was matched to the payment.
PMT_EOB_INFO_II.PEOB_EOB_RMC_IDS: The remittance code specified by the payer in its Explanation of Benefits (EOB). If this contains a comma delimited list, we will only show the first remittance code.
PMT_EOB_INFO_II.PEOB_EOB_AMOUNT: The not allowed amount associated with the Remittance Codes that the payor specifies in its Explanation of Benefit (EOB).
PMT_EOB_INFO_II.PEOB_EOB_GRPCODE_C_NAME: The Explanation Of Benefits group code category ID for the transaction�from insurance payment posting.
PMT_EOB_INFO_II.PEOB_DUP_DENIAL_C_NAME: This item contains the duplicate denial reason calculated at the time the  payment is distributed to the invoice. It is populated only when a duplicate denial (Remittance code external ID=18) is present.

REL_CAUSE_CD._TABLE_: All values associated with a claim are stored in the Claim External Value record.  The REL_CAUSE_CD table holds codes indicating whether the claim is related to employment or an accident.
REL_CAUSE_CD.RECORD_ID: The unique identifier for the claim record.
REL_CAUSE_CD.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.
REL_CAUSE_CD.REL_CAUSE_CD: This item holds the codes to identify if the claim is related to employment or to an accident.

SVC_LN_INFO._TABLE_: All values associated with a claim are stored in the Claim External Value record.  The SVC_LN_INFO table holds information about the service lines on the claim.
SVC_LN_INFO.RECORD_ID: The unique identifier for the claim record.
SVC_LN_INFO.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_FROM_DT: This item holds the earliest service date represented on the line.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_TO_DT: This item holds the latest service date represented on the line. It will not be populated if the line only represents a single date.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_PROC_QUAL: This item holds a code identifying the type of procedure code reported on the line.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_PROC_CD: This item holds the procedure code for the line.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_PROC_DESC: This item holds a procedure specific description for the line.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_PROC_MOD: This item holds a comma delimited list of modifiers for the procedure on the line.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_QTY_QUAL: This item holds a code identifying the unit in which the quantity is reported.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_QTY: This item holds the quantity for the service line.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_AMT: This item holds the billed amount for the line.  For Uniform Billing (UB) claims, this amount will include both covered and non-covered amounts.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_REV_CD: This item holds the revenue code for the service line.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_REV_CD_DESC: This item holds a revenue code specific description for the line.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_RATE: This item holds the daily rate for accommodation revenue code lines.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_NON_CVD_AMT: This item holds the non-covered amount for the line.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_POS_CD: This item holds the place of service code identifying where the service on the line was performed.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_DX_PTR: This item holds a comma delimited list of diagnosis pointers. Each piece of the string is a line number from the claim diagnosis table.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_EMERG_IND: This item identifies the service on the line as an emergency service.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_EPSDT_IND: This item identifies the service on the line as an Early & Periodic Screening, Diagnosis, and Treatment (EPSDT) service.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_FAM_PLAN_IND: This item identifies the service on the line as a family planning service.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_COPAY_STAT_CD: This item identifies when the patient was exempt from a copay for the service on the line.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_AMB_PAT_CNT: This item holds the number of patients transported in the ambulance when the line represents an ambulance service.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_MAMM_CERT_NUM: This item holds the mammography certification number for the line.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_CLIA_NUM: This item holds the Clinical Laboratory Improvement Amendment (CLIA) number for the line.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_ORAL_CAV_CD: This item holds a comma delimited list of oral cavity codes for the line.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_DENT_PROSTHESIS: This item holds a code to indicate the initial placement or replacement of a dental prosthesis, crown, or inlay.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_DME_CMN_CD: This item holds a code describing how the certificate of medical necessity (CMN) for the line was transmitted to the DMERC.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_DME_CERT_TYP: This item identifies the type of certification (initial, renewal, or revised) applies to the line.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_DME_DURATION: This item holds the number of months the durable medical equipment (DME) supplies will be needed.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_DME_RECERT_DT: This item holds the new durable medical equipment (DME) certification date when the certification type is renewed or revised.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_CME_BEG_THRPY_DT: This item holds the date that therapy requiring the durable medical equipment (DME) began.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_DME_COND_IND: This item holds a comma delimited list of durable medical equipment (DME) condition codes for the service line.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_CNTRCT_TYP: This item holds a code representing the type of contract between the provider and the payer used for the service line.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_CNTRCT_AMT: This item holds the contract amount for the line.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_CNTRCT_PCT: This item holds the contract percentage for the line.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_CNTRCT_CD: This item holds a code representing the line.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_CNTRCT_DISCNT_P: This item holds the discount percentage for the line.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_CNTRCT_VERS_ID: This item identifies the version of the contract used for the line.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_NDC: This item holds the National Drug Code (NDC) for the service line.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_NDC_UNIT_QTY: This item holds the quantity associated with the National Drug Code (NDC), in terms of the units reported with the NDC.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_NDC_UNIT: This item holds the units associated with the National Drug Code (NDC).
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_RX_NUM_QUAL: This item holds a code distinguishing prescription numbers from sequence numbers used to represent compound drugs.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_RX_NUM: This item holds the prescription number for the line.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_NOTE: This item holds a line level note.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_REND_PROV_TYP: This item indicates whether the rendering provider on the line is a person or a non-person.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_REND_NAM_LAST: This item holds the rendering provider's last name (if a person) or the organization name (if a non-person).
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_REND_NAM_FIRST: This item holds the rendering provider's first name. It is only populated when the provider is a person.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_REND_NAM_MID: This item holds the rendering provider's middle name. It is only populated when the provider is a person.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_REND_NAM_SUF: This item holds the suffix to the rendering provider's name (Jr, III, etc). It is only populated when the provider is a person.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_REND_NPI: This item holds the rendering provider's National Provider Identifier (NPI).
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_REND_TAXONOMY: This item holds the rendering provider's taxonomy code.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_SVC_FAC_NAM: This item holds the name of the external location where the services were performed.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_SVC_FAC_NPI: This item holds the National Provider Identifier (NPI) of the external location where the services were performed.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_SVC_FAC_ADDR_1: This item holds the first line of the external location street address.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_SVC_FAC_ADDR_2: This item holds the second line of the external location street address.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_SVC_FAC_CITY: This item holds the external location's city.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_SVC_FAC_STATE: This item holds the external location's state.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_SVC_FAC_ZIP: This item holds the external location's ZIP code.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_SVC_FAC_CNTRY: This item holds the external location's country. It is only populated if the address is outside the United States.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_SVC_FAC_CNTRY_SU: This item holds the external location's country subdivision (state, province, etc). It is only populated if the address is outside the United States.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_SUP_NAM_LAST: This item holds the supervising provider's last name.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_SUP_NAM_FIRST: This item holds the supervising provider's first name.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_SUP_NAM_MID: This item holds the supervising provider's middle name.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_SUP_NAM_SUF: This item holds the suffix to the supervising provider's name (Jr, III, etc).
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_SUP_NPI: This item holds the supervising provider's National Provider Identifier (NPI).
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_ORD_NAM_LAST: This item holds the ordering provider's last name.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_ORD_NAM_FIRST: This item holds the ordering provider's first name.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_ORD_NAM_MID: This item holds the ordering provider's middle name.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_ORD_NAM_SUF: This item holds the suffix to the ordering provider's name (Jr, III, etc).
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_ORD_NPI: This item holds the ordering provider's National Provider Identifier (NPI).
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_ORD_ADDR_1: This item holds the first line of the ordering provider's street address.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_ORD_ADDR_2: This item holds the second line of the ordering provider's street address.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_ORD_CITY: This item holds the ordering provider's city.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_ORD_STATE: This item holds the ordering provider's state.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_ORD_ZIP: This item holds the ordering provider's ZIP code.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_ORD_CNTRY: This item holds the ordering provider's country. It is only populated if the address is outside the United States.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_ORD_CNTRY_SUB: This item holds the ordering provider's country subdivision (state, province, etc). It is only populated if the address is outside the United States.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_PURCH_PROV_TYP: This item indicates whether the purchased service provider on the line is a person or a non-person.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_PURCH_NPI: This item holds the purchased service provider's National Provider Identifier (NPI).
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_ASST_TYP: This item indicates whether the assistant dental surgeon on the line is a person or a non-person.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_ASST_NAM_LAST: This item holds the assistant dental surgeon's last name (if a person) or the organization name (if a non-person).
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_ASST_NAM_FIRST: This item holds the assistant dental surgeon's first name. It is only populated when the provider is a person.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_ASST_NAM_MID: This item holds the assistant dental surgeon's middle name. It is only populated when the provider is a person.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_ASST_NAM_SUF: This item holds the suffix to the assistant dental surgeon's name (Jr, III, etc). It is only populated when the provider is a person.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_ASST_NPI: This item holds the assistant dental surgeon's National Provider Identifier (NPI).
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_ASST_TAXONOMY: This item holds the assistant dental surgeon's taxonomy code.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_DOC_TYP: This item holds a code indicating the type of supporting document included with the service line.
SVC_LN_INFO.LN_DOC_FORM_ID: This item identifies the specific document. For example, this can identify the version number of a questionnaire so that the payer can correctly interpret the responses.

SVC_LN_INFO_2._TABLE_: All values associated with a claim are stored in the Claim External Value record. The SVC_LN_INFO_2 table holds information about the service lines on the claim.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.RECORD_ID: The unique identifier for the claim record.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_TOS: This item holds the type of service for the procedure on the service line.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_DATE_QUAL: This item holds a qualifier to distinguish between a single date (when the from and to dates are the same) and a date range (when the from and to dates are different).
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_PURCH_SERV_AMT: This item holds the purchased service charge amount for the line.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_REFERRING_CLIA: This item holds the Clinical Laboratory Improvement Amendment (CLIA) number of the referring lab for the line.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_HOSPICE_EMP_IND: This item holds the Hospice Employee Indicator.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_HOSPICE_COND_IND: This item holds the Hospice Condition Indicator.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_TTL_AMT_PAID: This item holds the total amount paid for the line by all payers. This item is populated for both paper and electronic Professional Billing Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) claims but is only used when printing paper claims.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_ADJR_ITM_REF_NUM: This item stores the Adjusted Repriced Line Item Reference Number.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_SERV_TAX_AMT: This item stores the line's Service Tax Amount.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_FAC_TAX_AMT: This item stores the line's Facility Tax Amount.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_REP_ITM_REF_NUM: This item stores the Repriced Line Item Reference Number.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_PRC_METHOD: This item stores the Line Pricing Methodology.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_ALLOWED_AMT: This item stores the Line Allowed Amount.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_SAVINGS_AMT: This item stores the Line Savings Amount.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_REP_ORG_ID: This item stores the Line Repricing Organization Identification Number.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_PRICING_RATE: This item stores the Line Pricing Rate.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_APPRVED_DRG_CODE: This item stores the Line's Approved diagnosis related group (DRG) Code.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_APP_DRG_AMT: This item stores the Line Approved diagnosis related group (DRG) Code.
