SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_APP_REV_CODE: This item stores the Line Approved Revenue Code.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_REPAPR_HCPCS_QL: This item stores the Line Repriced Approved Healthcare common Procedure Coding System (HCPS).
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_REPAPP_HCPCS: This item stores the Line Repriced Approved (Healthcare Common Procedure Coding System (HCPCS) Code.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_UNIT_MSRMNT_CODE: This item stores the Line Unit or Basis for Measurement Code.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_APR_SVC_UNT: This item stores the Line Approved Service Units or Inpatient Days.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_OPR_SER_ETQ: This item stores the Entity Type Qualifier for line's Operating Physician ID.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_OPR_LAST_NAME: This item stores the line's Operating Physician's Last Name.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_OPR_FIRST_NAME: This item stores the line's Operating Physician's First Name.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_OPR_MID_NAME: This item stores the line's Operating Physician's Middle Name.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_OPR_NAME_SUFFIX: This item stores the line's Operating Physician's Name Suffix.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_OPR_NPI: This item stores the line's Operating Physician's ID.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_OTH_OPR_ETQ: This item stores the qualifier for line's Other Operating Physician.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_OTH_OPR_LAST_NM: This item stores the line's Other Operating Physician's Last Name.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_OTH_OPR_FIRST_NM: This items stores the line's Other Operating Physician's First Name.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_OTH_OPR_MID_NM: This item stores the line's Other Operating Physician's Middle Name.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_OTH_OPR_SUF_NM: This item stores the line's Other Operating Physician's Name Suffix.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_OTH_OPR_NPI: This item stores the line's Other Operating Physician ID.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_REF_ETQ: This item stores the line's Referring Provider's Entity Type Qualifier.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_REF_LAST_NM: This item stores the line's Referring Provider's Last Name.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_REF_FIRST_NM: This item stores line's Referring Provider's First Name.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_REF_MID_NM: This item stores the line's Referring Provider's Middle Name.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_REF_SUFFIX_NM: This item stores the line's Referring Provider's Name Suffix.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_REF_NPI: This item stores the line's Referring Provider's National Provider Identifier (NPI).
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_DME_PROC_CD: Stores Line durable medical equipment (DME) Procedure Code
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_DME_QTY: Stores Line durable medical equipment (DME) Length of Medical Necessity
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_DME_RENTAL_PRICE: Stores Line durable medical equipment (DME) Rental Unit Price Indicator
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_DME_PUR_PRICE: Stores Line durable medical equipment (DME) Purchase Price
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_DME_RUP_IND: Stores Line DME Rental Unit Price Indicator
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_AMB_TRANS_RSN_CD: Stores Line Ambulance Transport Reason Code
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_AMB_RND_TRIP_DES: Stores Line Ambulance Round Trip Purpose Description
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_AMB_STRETCH_DESC: Stores Line Ambulance Stretcher Purpose Description
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_ORD_CNCT_NAM: Stores Line Ordering Provider Contact Name
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_PICK_UP_ADDR_1: Stores Line Ambulance Pick-Up Location Street Address Line 1
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_PICK_UP_ADDR_2: Stores Line Ambulance Pick-Up Location Street Address Line 2
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_PICK_UP_CITY: Stores Line Ambulance Pick-Up Location City
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_PICK_UP_STATE: Stores Line Ambulance Pick-Up Location State
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_PICK_UP_ZIP: Stores Line Ambulance Pick-Up Location Zip Code
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_PICK_UP_CNTRY: Stores Line Ambulance Pick-Up Location Country Code
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_PICK_UP_CNTRY_S: Stores Line Ambulance Pick-Up Location Country Subdivision Code
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_DROP_OFF_NAME: Stores Line Ambulance Drop-Off Location Name
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_DROP_OFF_ADDR_1: Stores Line Ambulance Drop-Off Location Address Line 1
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_DROP_OFF_ADDR_2: Stores Line Ambulance Drop-Off Location Street Address Line 2
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_DROP_OFF_CITY: Stores Line Ambulance Drop-Off Location City
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_DROP_OFF_STATE: Stores Line Ambulance Drop-Off Location State
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_DROP_OFF_ZIP: Stores Line Ambulance Drop-Off Location Zip
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_DROP_OFF_CNTRY: Stores Line Ambulance Drop-Off Location Country Code
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_DROP_OFF_CNTRY_S: Stores Line Ambulance Drop-Off Location Country Subdivision Code
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_SVC_FAC_IDEN: Stores line service facility location's entity identifier
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_QTY_TXT: This item holds the units of quantity string for a service line.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_NOTE_TPO: This item holds a line level third party organization note.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_PURCH_SERV_REF: This item holds the purchased service reference identifier for the line.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_DME_LAST_CERT_DT: The last certification date for a durable medical equipment (DME) to be printed on the claim.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_REF_ENTITY_IDENTIFIER_CODE: This item stores the line's referring provider's entity identifier code.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_FILL_NUMBER: The code indicating whether the prescription is an original or a refill.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_DAYS_SUPPLY: Estimated number if days the prescription will last.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_DAW_CODE: Code indicating whether or not the prescriber's instructions regarding generic substitution were followed.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_NDC_COST: This item holds the unit cost associated with the National Drug Code (NDC) for the service line, which is expected to be the charge amount divided by the NDC quantity.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_MCR_PAID_AMT: This is the amount that Medicare paid for the service line for field.
SVC_LN_INFO_2.LN_OTHR_PAID_AMT: This is the amount that the commercial coverage, if any, paid for this service line.

SVC_LN_INFO_3._TABLE_: All values associated with a claim are stored in the Claim External Value record. The SVC_LN_INFO_3 table holds information about the service lines on the claim.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.RECORD_ID: The unique identifier for the claim value record
SVC_LN_INFO_3.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.LN_OTHR_AMT_RECOGZ: Total amount recognized by the processor of any payment from another source.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.LN_NET_AMT_DUE: Net amount paid to provider by the payer.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.LN_DENT_PROS_QUAL: This item holds a code indicating if the date for a prior crown/prosthesis is estimated or exact.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.LN_DENT_PROS_DATE: The date a prior crown/prosthesis was previously placed.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.SVC_DENIED_STATUS_IDENT: This stores the external identifier for the denial status of this line.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.PRCS_IND_CD: Claim line level processing indicator code.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.PRCS_IND_CD_DESC: Claim line level processing indicator code description.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.LN_OPR_TAXONOMY: Stores the Line Operating Provider Taxonomy Code.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.LN_APPLIANCE_REPLACEMENT_DATE: The date when an orthodontic appliance was replaced.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.LN_TREATMENT_START_DATE: The date of the initial treatment for a dental service.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.LN_TREATMENT_COMPLETION_DATE: The date of the completed treatment for a dental service.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.LN_FILL_STATUS: Stores information on whether the prescription was completely or partially filled.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.LN_ORD_TAXONOMY: Stores the National Uniform Claim Committee (NUCC) taxonomy code associated with the line-level operating provider
SVC_LN_INFO_3.LN_APPLIANCE_PLACEMENT_DATE: The date when the orthodontic appliance was placed.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.LN_LIN_QUALIFIER: Qualifier code to identify drug code set or the type/source of the descriptive number used in Product/Service ID.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.LN_PRESC_PROV_NPI: This column holds the National Provider Identifier (NPI) of the provider that prescribed the medication on this service.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.LN_PRESC_PROV_TAXONOMY: This column holds the NUCC Taxonomy Code of the provider that prescribed the medication on this service.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.LN_SERV_PROV_NPI: This item holds the National Provider Identifier (NPI) of the pharmacy that filled the prescription.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.LN_SERV_PROV_TAXONOMY: This column holds the NUCC Taxonomy Code of the pharmacy that filled the prescription.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.LN_DX_PTR_RANK: The comma-delimited list of diagnoses ranks for each diagnosis on a service. Each position here corresponds to the same comma-delimited position of the column LN_DX_PTR from the SVC_LN_INFO table.  The rank here specifies the ranking of diagnoses for the specific service. This can be different than the rank of the same diagnoses at the header-level or even the same diagnoses for a different service.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.LN_PCP_REF_LAST_NM: This item stores the line's PCP referring provider's last name.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.LN_PCP_REF_FIRST_NM: This item stores the line's PCP referring provider's first name.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.LN_PCP_REF_MID_NM: This item stores the line's PCP referring provider's middle name.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.LN_PCP_REF_SUFFIX_NM: This item stores the line's PCP referring provider's suffix.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.LN_PCP_REF_NPI: This item stores the line's PCP referring provider's NPI.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.RX_DATE: The date when the prescription was written.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.SUB_CLAR_CODE: The code indicating that the pharmacist is clarifying the submission.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.RX_ORIGIN_CODE: The code indicating the origin of the prescription.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.RX_PHARM_SRV_TYPE: The type of service being performed by a pharmacy when different contractual terms exist between a payer and the pharmacy, or when benefits are based upon the type of service performed.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.RX_PROD_DESC: The description of the product being submitted on the prescription claim.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.OTHER_CVG_CODE: The code indicating whether or not the patient has other insurance coverage.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.RX_SERVICE_LEVEL: The code indicating the type of service the provider rendered.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.QTY_PRESCRIBED: The quantity of prescription drug expressed in metric decimal units.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.REASON_SVC_CODE: The code identifying the type of utilization conflict detected or the reason for the pharmacist's professional service.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.PROF_SRVC_CODE: The code identifying pharmacist intervention when a conflict code has been identified or service has been rendered.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.RES_SVC_CODE: The code describing a pharmacist's action in response to a professional conflict.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.LEVEL_OF_EFFORT: The code indicating the level of effort as determined by the complexity of decision-making or resources utilized by a pharmacist to perform a professional service.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.DOSAGE_FORM_DESC_CD: The dosage form of the complete compound mixture.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.DISP_UNIT_FORM_INDICATOR: The NCPDP standard product billing codes.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.ADMIN_ROUTE: An override to the "default" route referenced for the product. For a multi-ingredient compound, it is the route of the complete compound mixture.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.INGREDIENT_COMPOUND_CNT: The count of compound product IDs (both active and inactive) in the compound mixture submitted.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.USUAL_CUSTOMARY_CHG: The amount charged to cash customers for the prescription exclusive of sales tax or other amounts claimed.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.COST_BASIS: The code indicating the method used to calculate the ingredient cost.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.INGREDIENT_COST_SUBMITTED: The product component cost of the dispensed prescription.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.DISP_FEE_SUBMITTED: The dispensing fee submitted by the pharmacy.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.PROF_FEE_SUBMITTED: The amount submitted by the provider for professional services rendered.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.INGREDIENT_AMT_SUBMITTED: The amount representing the fee that is submitted by the pharmacy for contractually agreed upon services.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.OTHER_AMT_SUBMITTED: The amount representing the additional incurred costs for a dispensed prescription or service.
SVC_LN_INFO_3.GROSS_AMOUNT_DUE: The total gross amount submitted on the claim.

SVC_PMT_HISTORY._TABLE_: The SVC_PMT_HISTORY table contains line level history for how a payment was processed.
SVC_PMT_HISTORY.TX_ID: The unique identifier for the transaction Record.
SVC_PMT_HISTORY.GROUP_LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record.
SVC_PMT_HISTORY.VALUE_LINE: The line number of one of the multiple values associated with a specific group of data within this record.
SVC_PMT_HISTORY.SVC_PMT_HISTORY_C_NAME: Contains a line level action that was taken for the payment.

TX_DIAG._TABLE_: This table contains information about the diagnoses associated with transactions. Since one transaction may be associated with multiple diagnoses, each row in this table represents one diagnosis and is identified by the transaction ID and line number. The first six diagnosis IDs associated with a transaction are recorded in the CLARITY_TDL table in the columns DX_ ONE_ID through DX_ SIX_ID. This table allows you to easily identify transactions with a specific diagnosis code or range of diagnosis codes. The data for this table is extracted using a KB_SQL query.
TX_DIAG.TX_ID: The unique accounts receivable transaction record ID.
TX_DIAG.LINE: Line number to identify each row of diagnosis data associated with an individual transaction. Line 1 identifies the primary diagnosis of the charge.
TX_DIAG.POST_DATE: The post date of the charge transaction
TX_DIAG.SERV_AREA_ID: The ID of the service area associated with the transaction identified by TX_ID.
TX_DIAG.DX_ID: The diagnosis associated with the charge transaction.  This diagnosis is from the primary codeset.
TX_DIAG.DX_QUALIFIER_C_NAME: Diagnosis Qualifier for the diagnosis associated with this charge

TX_NDC_INFORMATION._TABLE_: This table contains Medical National Drug Code (NDC) information. Since one transaction may be associated with multiple NDC codes, each row in this table represents one NDC code and is identified by the transaction ID and line number. The data for this table is extracted using a KB_SQL query.
TX_NDC_INFORMATION.TX_ID: The unique accounts receivable transaction record ID.
TX_NDC_INFORMATION.LINE: Line number to identify each row of�Medical National Drug Code (NDC) data associated with an individual transaction.
TX_NDC_INFORMATION.NDC_CODES_ID: The ID of the Medical National Drug Code (NDC) associated with a transaction.
TX_NDC_INFORMATION.NDC_CODES_ID_NDC_CODE: The external code for the National Drug Code (NDC). An NDC represents packages of medications.
TX_NDC_INFORMATION.NDC_CODES_ADMIN_AMT: The NDC amount associated with this charge.
TX_NDC_INFORMATION.NDC_CODES_UNIT_C_NAME: The Medical National Drug Code (NDC) unit associated with the charge.

title: Referrals: REFERRAL + children
description: Referral orders with appointments, diagnoses, coverage, auth

EPA_INFO._TABLE_: This table holds information about electronic prior authorization requests.
EPA_INFO.REFERRAL_ID: The unique identifier for the referral record.
EPA_INFO.EPA_REF_ID: This item holds the reference ID for electronic prior authorization. It is generated by the system and used for linking a referral record to an electronic prior authorization message.  This value will not change during an electronic prior authorization interaction.
EPA_INFO.PA_PAT_NOTIFIED_YN: This item specifies whether the patient has been notified about the status of the prior authorization.
EPA_INFO.PA_APPROVAL_SRC_C_NAME: This item records the entry source of the outpatient prescription prior authorization details. If an authorization was completed using both electronic and manual entry, this will be based on how the most recent data was entered.
EPA_INFO.MED_EPA_UPD_UTC_DTTM: This holds the instant that ePA information was last updated on this referral.
EPA_INFO.EPA_RFL_ORD_ID: This virtual item holds the order ID associated with an outpatient prescription medication prior authorization request.
EPA_INFO.PAT_EPA_ENC_CSN_ID: This item holds the CSN of the encounter the prior authorization was requested in.
EPA_INFO.EPA_PHR_ID: This item stores the pharmacy that initiated prior authorization.
EPA_INFO.EPA_REQ_TYPE_C_NAME: This item records the type of the outpatient prescription prior authorization request.  1-Prospective is a request that was initiated at the time of signing the order. 2-Retrospective is a request that was initiated after the order was signed. 3-Retrospective-RxChange is a retrospective request that was initiated by an electronic RxChange message from the pharmacy. 4-Renewal is a request that was initiated on a signed order that already had a prior authorization request linked to it. 5-Renewal-RxChange is a renewal that was initiated by an electronic RxChange message from the pharmacy. 6-Retrospective-Willow Ambulatory is a retrospective request that was initiated from within the Willow Ambulatory application. 7-Renewal-Willow Ambulatory is a renewal that was initiated from within the Willow Ambulatory application.
EPA_INFO.CUR_EPA_STATUS_C_NAME: This item holds the current status of the outpatient prescription prior authorization request.
EPA_INFO.EPA_HRS_FINAL_STAT: This column holds the numbers of hours that the outpatient prescription prior authorization request was in progress.  For requests that were initiated, but no other actions have taken place, the count returned will be 0. For other requests, the count returned will be the hours between the initiation of the request and the last action performed on the request.

EPA_INFO_2._TABLE_: This table holds information about electronic prior authorization requests.
EPA_INFO_2.REFERRAL_ID: The unique identifier for the referral record.
EPA_INFO_2.PREV_AUTH_EXP_DATE: For prior authorization requests that were created because the existing authorization is about to expire, this item holds the date that the existing authorization will expire.
EPA_INFO_2.ELIG_PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: This item holds the CSN of the encounter to use for pharmacy benefits for a prior authorization request.

REFERRAL._TABLE_: The REFERRAL table is the primary table for referral information stored in system.
REFERRAL.REFERRAL_ID: The unique ID of the referral in database. This is the primary key for the REFERRAL table.
REFERRAL.EXTERNAL_ID_NUM: The external identification number used on the referral.
REFERRAL.PAT_ID: The ID of the patient associated with the referral.
REFERRAL.PCP_PROV_ID: The unique ID of the patient's primary care provider at the time the referral was created.
REFERRAL.ENTRY_DATE: The date the referral was entered.
REFERRAL.RFL_STATUS_C_NAME: The category value representing the status of the referral (I.e. authorized, open, pending, etc.).
REFERRAL.REFERRING_PROV_ID: The unique ID of the referral source (REF) record of the provider who made the referral. This column is frequently used to link to the REFERRAL_SOURCE table. The actual provider (SER) ID can be found in column REF_PROVIDER_ID of table REFERRAL_SOURCE.
REFERRAL.REFERRING_PROV_ID_REFERRING_PROV_NAM: The name of the referral source.
REFERRAL.VENDOR_ID: The ID number of the vendor associated with the referral.
REFERRAL.REFERRAL_PROV_ID: The unique ID of the provider (SER) being referred to. This column is frequently used to link to the CLARITY_SER table.
REFERRAL.PROV_SPEC_C_NAME: The category value indicating the provider specialty being referred to.
REFERRAL.RFL_TYPE_C_NAME: The category value indicating the type of referral.
REFERRAL.RSN_FOR_RFL_C_NAME: The category value indicating the main (first) reason for the referral.   Since multiple reasons can be listed, use table REFERRAL_REASONS to view all of them.
REFERRAL.RFL_CLASS_C_NAME: The category value indicating the class of the referral.
REFERRAL.AUTH_VIS_PERIOD: The number of authorized visits in each visit period.
REFERRAL.AUTH_PERIOD_TYPE_C_NAME: The category value indicating the type of period for authorized visits - i.e. hour, day, week, month, year.
REFERRAL.AUTH_NUM_PERIODS: The number of periods authorized for this referral.
REFERRAL.AUTH_NUM_OF_VISITS: The number of visits authorized for this referral.
REFERRAL.ADMISSION_DATE: The admission date associated with the referral.
REFERRAL.DISCHARGE_DATE: The discharge date associated with the referral.
REFERRAL.ESTIMATED_DAYS: The authorized length of stay if the patient is being admitted.
REFERRAL.START_DATE: The start date of the referral.
REFERRAL.EXP_DATE: The expiration date of the referral.
REFERRAL.PEND_TO: The person or pool to whom an In Basket message should be sent about this referral.
REFERRAL.PEND_RSN_C_NAME: For pended referrals, the category value indicating the reason for pending.
REFERRAL.DENY_RSN_C_NAME: For denied referrals, the category value indicating the reason for denial.
REFERRAL.SERV_AREA_ID: The ID number of the service area associated with the referral.
REFERRAL.COVERAGE_ID: The unique ID of the coverage associated with the referral.
REFERRAL.NUM_PROC: The number of procedures associated with the referral.
REFERRAL.SVC_DATE_REAL: If available, this column is populated by the authorized start date (I RFL 85). If not, it is populated by the expiration date on the referral (I RFL 90). If neither of these are available, the column will be empty. The date in this column is based on days since December 31, 1840.
REFERRAL.CARRIER_ID: The ID number of the carrier associated with the referral.
REFERRAL.CARRIER_ID_CARRIER_NAME: The name of the carrier record.
REFERRAL.PAYOR_ID: The ID number of the payor associated with the referral.
REFERRAL.PLAN_ID: The ID number of the plan associated with the referral.
REFERRAL.SERV_DATE: This column is populated by the authorized start date (I RFL 85) if available. If not, it is populated by the expiration date on the referral (I RFL 90). If neither of these are available, the column will be empty. The date in this column is in MM/DD/YYYY format.
REFERRAL.RETRO_FLAG_YN: The category value used to mark a referral as being "Retro" entered.
REFERRAL.IBNR: The "Incurred but not reported" amount associated with this referral.
REFERRAL.AUTO_APPROVED_DATE: The date on which the referral was approved automatically by the system.
REFERRAL.AUTH_RSN_C_NAME: The category value indicating the authorization reason associated with the referral.
REFERRAL.REFD_BY_LOC_POS_ID: The ID number of the place of service the referral was referred from.
REFERRAL.REFD_TO_LOC_POS_ID: The ID number of the place of service the referral was referred to.
REFERRAL.REFD_TO_DEPT_ID: The ID number of the department the referral was referred to.
REFERRAL.REFD_TO_SPEC_C_NAME: The category value indicating the specialty the department was referred to.
REFERRAL.PRIORITY_C_NAME: The category value indicating the priority of the referral.
REFERRAL.TOTAL_PRICE: The total cost of the procedures authorized under the referral.
REFERRAL.TOTAL_PAYABLE: The portion of the total price for which your facility is responsible.
REFERRAL.PATIENT_AMOUNT: The total patient liability, under the parameters of the primary coverage used, for the procedures authorized under the referral.
REFERRAL.EXPECT_TO_PAY: The total amount you expect your facility will pay for the procedures authorized under the referral. This amount entered by you overrides the total payable amount for the purpose of calculating IBNR.
REFERRAL.IBNR_PAY_UNTIL_DT: The date up to which your facility will pay claims for the procedures approved on this referral.
REFERRAL.CASE_RATE_YN: The category value indicating whether this referral involves services that are reimbursed at a specific case rate.
REFERRAL.PRIM_LOC_ID: The unique ID of the member's primary location at the time the referral was entered.
REFERRAL.MED_TYPE_C_NAME: The category value indicating what type of confirmation it is - acute, chronic or PAT.
REFERRAL.ACUTE_AMOUNT: The amount of the confirmation if the confirmation is acute.
REFERRAL.CHRONIC_AMOUNT: The amount of the confirmation if the confirmation is chronic.
REFERRAL.PAT_AMOUNT: The amount of the confirmation if the confirmation is an acute medication that was suggested by the pharmacist or over-the-counter medication.
REFERRAL.RFL_LOB_ID: ID of the Line of Business (LOB) assigned to the referral.
REFERRAL.RFL_LOB_ID_LOB_NAME: The name of the line of business record.
REFERRAL.ACTUAL_NUM_VISITS: The actual number of completed visits for this referral.
REFERRAL.SCHED_NUM_VISITS: The number of visits scheduled for this referral.
REFERRAL.REQUEST_NUM_VISITS: The number of visits requested for this referral.
REFERRAL.OVRD_ADMIT_DATE: Override admit date for this referral.
REFERRAL.OVRD_DISCHARGE_DT: Override discharge date for this referral.
REFERRAL.DISP_VAL_C_NAME: Whether the referral was accepted ("appointed") or refused ("denied") by the referred-to provider, department or facility.
REFERRAL.DISP_RSN_C_NAME: The reason that a referral's disposition has a status of "denied."
REFERRAL.DISP_EAF_ID: The unique id of the facility to which the referral was forwarded.
REFERRAL.REFD_BY_DEPT_ID: The ID number of the department the referral was referred by.
REFERRAL.CLOSE_RSN_C_NAME: For closed referrals, the category value indicating the reason for closing.
REFERRAL.SCHED_STATUS_C_NAME: Scheduling status of the referral to keep track of internally schedulable referrals.  For category list use ZC_SCHED_STATUS.
REFERRAL.SCHED_BY_DATE: Indicates deadline to schedule a referral.
REFERRAL.PREAUTH_REQ_C_NAME: For referrals created from an order, indicates if a preauthorization number must be collected before scheduling.
REFERRAL.NOT_COLLCTD_RSN_C_NAME: Reason indicating why the preauth number will not be collected for this referral.
REFERRAL.PROCESSED_RSN_C_NAME: Reason indicating why the preauth number is marked as processed for this referral.
REFERRAL.PREAUTH_CHG_EMP_ID: The unique ID of the user who last changed the preauthorization data.
REFERRAL.PREAUTH_CHG_EMP_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
REFERRAL.PREAUTH_CHNGD_DTTM: Date/time stamp for last time the preauthorization data was changed.
REFERRAL.NON_PREF_PROV_RSN_C_NAME: Stores the reason why a non preferred level provider was chosen.
REFERRAL.EXT_REF_DATE: This is the external referring date.
REFERRAL.EOW_ID: The unique EOW ID associated with the referral.
REFERRAL.REQ_VIS_PER_PERIOD: The requested visits per period on the referral.
REFERRAL.REQ_PERIOD_TYPE_C_NAME: The requested period type on the referral.
REFERRAL.REQ_NUM_OF_PERIODS: The requested number of periods on the referral.
REFERRAL.REF_TO_PROV_ADDR_ID: This stores the address ID of the referred to provider. The format is as follows: ProvID-AddressID. AddressID is the line number of the multiple response address items in the SER masterfile. To use this column, join to CLARITY_SER_ADDR on REFERRAL.REF_TO_PROV_ADDR_ID = CLARITY_SER_ADDR.ADDR_UNIQUE_ID. If you use IntraConnect, also join on REFERRAL.REFERRAL_PROV_ID = CLARITY_SER_ADDR.PROV_ID.
REFERRAL.DECISION_DATE: Date on which the referral's current status was assigned.
REFERRAL.NUM_CLMS_EXPECTED: Number of claims expected to be filed on this referral.
REFERRAL.RFL_STATCHG_RSN_C_NAME: The reason category number describing why the referral status was changed.
REFERRAL.TOTAL_EST_DAYS: Total estimated days for the referral.
REFERRAL.TOTAL_OVERRIDE_DAYS: The total number of override days on the referral.
REFERRAL.TOTAL_CONVTD_DAYS: The total number of converted days on the referral.
REFERRAL.NO_CLAIMS_PAID: The number of claims paid on the claim.
REFERRAL.ADJUD_SERV_AREA_ID: Service area used in referral pricing and adjudication.

REFERRAL_2._TABLE_: The REFERRAL_2 table is a continuation of the REFERRAL table. These tables are the primary tables for referral information stored in the system.
REFERRAL_2.REFERRAL_ID: The referral ID for the referral record.
REFERRAL_2.CE_SENT_YN: Indicates whether this referral was sent using Care Everywhere.
REFERRAL_2.RFL_ATT_PROV_ID: The unique ID of the supervising provider of the resident issuing the referral.
REFERRAL_2.RFL_CONTACT_NAME: Free text field that will be populated by the user who creates the referral.
REFERRAL_2.RPT_RECEIVED_DATE: Indicates the date that a PCP acknowledged receipt of an internal report regarding a referral.
REFERRAL_2.RPT_SENT_DATE: Indicates the date that an internal report regarding a referral is sent to the referring provider.
REFERRAL_2.RFL_RECEIVED_DATE: Indicates the date in which the referred to department acknowledged receipt of the referral.
REFERRAL_2.AUDIT_REF_TO_NAME: This item is used to audit data from incoming Care Everywhere referrals. It stores the name of the referred-to provider.
REFERRAL_2.AUDIT_DATE: This item is used to audit data from incoming Care Everywhere referrals. It stores the referred-on date.
REFERRAL_2.AUDIT_RFL_TYPE: This item is used to audit data from incoming Care Everywhere referrals. It stores the original text for the referral type.
REFERRAL_2.AUDIT_REQ_VISITS: This item is used to audit data from incoming Care Everywhere referrals. It stores the requested number of visits.
REFERRAL_2.AUDIT_AUTH_VISITS: This item is used to audit data from incoming Care Everywhere referrals. It stores the authorized number of visits.
REFERRAL_2.AUDIT_START_DATE: This item is used to audit data from incoming Care Everywhere referrals. It stores the starting date for the referral in HL7 format.
REFERRAL_2.AUDIT_END_DATE: This item is used to audit data from incoming Care Everywhere referrals. It stores the ending date for the referral in HL7 format.
REFERRAL_2.AUDIT_RFTO_PROVSPEC: This item is used to audit data from incoming Care Everywhere referrals. It stores the original text for the referred-to provider specialty.
REFERRAL_2.AUDIT_RFNG_PROVSPEC: This item is used to audit data from incoming Care Everywhere referrals. It stores the original text for the referring provider specialty.
REFERRAL_2.AUDIT_RFTO_DEPTSPEC: This item is used to audit data from incoming Care Everywhere referrals. It stores the original text for the referred-to department specialty.
REFERRAL_2.AUDIT_RFNG_DEPTSPEC: This item is used to audit data from incoming Care Everywhere referrals. It stores the original text for the referring department specialty.
REFERRAL_2.CASE_MGMT_CREATE_ID: Specifies the case management creation message.
REFERRAL_2.ALT_PYR_SVC_DT: The service date for the alternate payor information. This date is used as the contact date to look up the alternate billing table in the plan master file.
REFERRAL_2.GEN_RFL_NUM_IT_1: This contains information from generic referral numeric item 1.
REFERRAL_2.GEN_RFL_NUM_IT_2: This contains information from generic referral numeric item 2.
REFERRAL_2.GEN_RFL_NUM_IT_3: This contains information from generic referral numeric item 3.
REFERRAL_2.GEN_RFL_NUM_IT_4: This contains information from generic referral numeric item 4.
REFERRAL_2.GEN_RFL_NUM_IT_5: This contains information from generic referral numeric item 5.
REFERRAL_2.GEN_RFL_NUM_IT_6: This contains information from generic referral numeric item 6.
REFERRAL_2.GEN_RFL_NUM_IT_7: This contains information from generic referral numeric item 7.
REFERRAL_2.GEN_RFL_NUM_IT_8: This contains information from generic referral numeric item 8.
REFERRAL_2.GEN_RFL_NUM_IT_9: This contains information from generic referral numeric item 9.
REFERRAL_2.GEN_RFL_NUM_IT_10: This contains information from generic referral numeric item 10.
REFERRAL_2.GEN_RFL_CAT_1_C_NAME: This contains information from generic referral category item 1.
REFERRAL_2.GEN_RFL_CAT_2_C_NAME: This contains information from generic referral category item 2.
REFERRAL_2.GEN_RFL_CAT_3_C_NAME: This contains information from generic referral category item 3.
REFERRAL_2.GEN_RFL_CAT_4_C_NAME: This contains information from generic referral category item 4.
REFERRAL_2.GEN_RFL_CAT_5_C_NAME: This contains information from generic referral category item 5.
REFERRAL_2.GEN_RFL_STR_1: This contains information from generic referral string item 1.
REFERRAL_2.GEN_RFL_STR_2: This contains information from generic referral string item 2.
REFERRAL_2.GEN_RFL_STR_3: This contains information from generic referral string item 3.
REFERRAL_2.GEN_RFL_STR_4: This contains information from generic referral string item 4.
REFERRAL_2.GEN_RFL_STR_5: This contains information from generic referral string item 5.
REFERRAL_2.GEN_RFL_DATE_1_DT: This contains information from generic referral date item 1.
REFERRAL_2.GEN_RFL_DATE_2_DT: This contains information from generic referral date item 2.
REFERRAL_2.GEN_RFL_DATE_3_DT: This contains information from generic referral date item 3.
REFERRAL_2.GEN_RFL_DATE_4_DT: This contains information from generic referral date item 4.
REFERRAL_2.GEN_RFL_DATE_5_DT: This contains information from generic referral date item 5.
REFERRAL_2.TRIAGE_DECISION_C_NAME: The triage decision category ID for the referral.
REFERRAL_2.TRIAGE_APPT_CHANGE: The appointment change comments for the referral record.
REFERRAL_2.OVRRD_REF_COUNTS: The number of visits approved for this referral, overridden by the user.
REFERRAL_2.CALC_SVC_LVL_CNTS: The calculated number of service level authorizations counts, based on the service level authorizations collected.
REFERRAL_2.TOC_STATUS_C_NAME: Indicates the status of the last transfer of care transmission attempt. If the attempt was unsuccessful, the failure reason is stored.
REFERRAL_2.GEN_RFL_STR_6: This contains information from generic referral string item 6.
REFERRAL_2.GEN_RFL_STR_7: This contains information from generic referral string item 7.
REFERRAL_2.GEN_RFL_STR_8: This contains information from generic referral string item 8.
REFERRAL_2.GEN_RFL_STR_9: This contains information from generic referral string item 9.
REFERRAL_2.AP_CLAIM_COUNT: The actual AP claims count for the referral. This number is calculated from the counts table based the Counts Settings in the Referral System Definitions.
REFERRAL_2.RFL_DX_ID: Holds the primary coded diagnosis for the referral.
REFERRAL_2.RFL_ENC_TYPE_C_NAME: The expected encounter type for the referral (inpatient or outpatient).

REFERRAL_3._TABLE_: The REFERRAL_3 table is a continuation of the REFERRAL_2 which is continuation of the REFERRAL table. These tables are the primary tables for referral information stored in the system.
REFERRAL_3.REFERRAL_ID: The unique identifier for the referral record.
REFERRAL_3.GEN_RFL_STR_10: This contains information from generic referral string item 10.

REFERRAL_3.GEN_RFL_CAT_15_C_NAME: This contains information from generic referral category item 15.
REFERRAL_3.REFERRING_DEP_SPC_C_NAME: Indicates the specialty of the department where the referral is coming from.
REFERRAL_3.CANCEL_RSN_C_NAME: Status reason explaining why a referral was canceled.
REFERRAL_3.PAT_COMM_DATE: The date when the patient's scheduled encounter was communicated to the patient.
REFERRAL_3.GEN_RFL_CAT_16_C_NAME: This contains information from generic referral category item 16.
REFERRAL_3.GEN_RFL_CAT_17_C_NAME: This contains information from generic referral category item 17.

REFERRAL_3.GEN_RFL_CAT_24_C_NAME: This contains information from generic referral category item 24.
REFERRAL_3.GEN_RFL_CAT_25_C_NAME: This contains information from generic referral category item 25.
REFERRAL_3.GEN_RFL_STR_11: Referral-level generic string for general use.
REFERRAL_3.GEN_RFL_STR_12: Referral-level generic string for general use.
REFERRAL_3.GEN_RFL_STR_13: Referral-level generic string for general use.
REFERRAL_3.GEN_RFL_STR_14: Referral-level generic string for general use.
REFERRAL_3.GEN_RFL_STR_16: Referral-level generic string for general use.
REFERRAL_3.GEN_RFL_STR_17: Referral-level generic string for general use.
REFERRAL_3.GEN_RFL_STR_18: Referral-level generic string for general use.
REFERRAL_3.GEN_RFL_STR_19: Referral-level generic string for general use.
REFERRAL_3.GEN_RFL_STR_20: Referral-level generic string for general use.
REFERRAL_3.GEN_RFL_STR_21: Referral-level generic string for general use.
REFERRAL_3.GEN_RFL_STR_22: Referral-level generic string for general use.
REFERRAL_3.GEN_RFL_STR_23: Referral-level generic string for general use.
REFERRAL_3.GEN_RFL_STR_24: Referral-level generic string for general use.

REFERRAL_3.GEN_RFL_STR_28: Referral-level generic string for general use.
REFERRAL_3.GEN_RFL_STR_29: Referral-level generic string for general use.
REFERRAL_3.GEN_RFL_STR_30: Referral-level generic string for general use.
REFERRAL_3.GEN_RFL_STR_15: Referral-level generic string for general use.

REFERRAL_4._TABLE_: The REFERRAL_4 table is a continuation of the REFERRAL_3 which is continuation of the REFERRAL_2 table. These tables are the primary tables for referral information stored in the system.
REFERRAL_4.REFERRAL_ID: The referral ID for the referral record.
REFERRAL_4.ATTEND_PROV_ADDR_ID: This item stores the address ID of the attending provider. The format is as follows: SerID-AddressID. AddressID is the line number of the multiple response address items in the Provider (SER) master file. It can be used to print the correct address in a report or letter, for example.
REFERRAL_4.GEOGRAPHIC_AREA_ID: Geographic area from ZIP code mapping.
REFERRAL_4.IN_OUT_OF_AREA_C_NAME: In or out-of-area classification from ZIP code mapping.
REFERRAL_4.GEN_RFL_SEC_SINCE_MIDNIGHT_1: Referral-level generic time item for general use.
REFERRAL_4.GEN_RFL_SEC_SINCE_MIDNIGHT_2: Referral-level generic time item for general use.
REFERRAL_4.GEN_RFL_SEC_SINCE_MIDNIGHT_3: Referral-level generic time item for general use.
REFERRAL_4.GEN_RFL_SEC_SINCE_MIDNIGHT_4: Referral-level generic time item for general use.
REFERRAL_4.GEN_RFL_SEC_SINCE_MIDNIGHT_5: Referral-level generic time item for general use.
REFERRAL_4.AUDIT_REF_TO_LOC_ID: This item is used to audit data from incoming Care Everywhere referrals. It stores the original text for the referred-to location ID.
REFERRAL_4.AUDIT_REF_TO_DEPARTMENT_ID: This item is used to audit data from incoming Care Everywhere referrals. It stores the original text for the referred to department ID.
REFERRAL_4.AUDIT_REFG_PROV_ID: This item is used to audit data from incoming Care Everywhere referrals. It stores the original text for the referring provider ID.
REFERRAL_4.AUDIT_REFG_PROV_ADDR: This item is used to audit data from incoming Care Everywhere referrals. It stores the original text for the referring provider address ID.
REFERRAL_4.AUDIT_REF_TO_PROV_ID: This item is used to audit data from incoming Care Everywhere referrals. It stores the original text for the referred-to provider ID.
REFERRAL_4.AUDIT_REF_TO_PROV_ADDR: This item is used to audit data from incoming Care Everywhere referrals.  It stores the original text for the referred-to provider address ID.
REFERRAL_4.AUDIT_RFL_SRC_LOC_ID: This item is used to audit data from incoming Care Everywhere referrals.  It stores the original text for the source referral location.
REFERRAL_4.RFL_DIRECTION_C_NAME: The referral direction, as calculated by logic for transitions of care
REFERRAL_4.REFD_TO_LINK_PROV_YN: Is the referred to provider an EpicCare Link provider
REFERRAL_4.REFD_TO_LINK_LOC_YN: Is the referred to location an EpicCare Link location
REFERRAL_4.IS_LEAKED_YN: Holds whether the referral is considered leaked
REFERRAL_4.TRIAGE_REMIND_DATE: A date in the future when the user should be reminded of this referral.
REFERRAL_4.TRIAGE_INFO_RECPNT_C_NAME: The recipient of a request for more information. This item holds which item should be looked to for routing purposes.
REFERRAL_4.CE_DISCONNECT_YN: Indicates that this referral is disconnected from the sending organization for Care Everywhere referrals.
REFERRAL_4.RECENT_AUTH_RSN_C_NAME: This item holds the most recent non-empty authorization reason for the referral. If this item is null, it means the referral was never authorized. If value is added/updated to the authorization code (I RFL 73), same value is copied into this item. But if authorization code (I RFL 73) is cleared, then this item is not updated.
REFERRAL_4.RECENT_DENY_RSN_C_NAME: This item holds the most recent non-empty denial reason for the  referral. If this item is null, it means the referral was never denied. If value is added/updated to the reason for denial (I RFL 18007), same value is copied into this item. But if reason for denial (I RFL 18007) is cleared, then this item is not updated.
REFERRAL_4.TRIAGE_UNACCEPT_REASON_C_NAME: The unaccept reason that was specified when the triage decision changed from accept to no decision.
REFERRAL_4.ADMITTING_PROV_ID: The admitting provider related to an inpatient service. This item is only for Tapestry documentation purposes.
REFERRAL_4.EXPECTED_DISCHARGE_DATE: The expected discharge date documented on the referral bed days form of referral entry.
REFERRAL_4.GEN_RFL_DATE_6_DT: This contains information from generic referral date item 6.
REFERRAL_4.GEN_RFL_DATE_7_DT: This contains information from generic referral date item 7.
REFERRAL_4.GEN_RFL_DATE_8_DT: This contains information from generic referral date item 8.
REFERRAL_4.GEN_RFL_DATE_9_DT: This contains information from generic referral date item 9.
REFERRAL_4.GEN_RFL_DATE_10_DT: This contains information from generic referral date item 10.
REFERRAL_4.GEN_RFL_SEC_SINCE_MIDNIGHT_6: This contains information from generic referral time item 6.
REFERRAL_4.RFL_SVC_TYPE_CODE_C_NAME: Specifies the service type that applies to the entire referral.
REFERRAL_4.INT_RFL_TYPE_C_NAME: The internal referral type for the referral.

REFERRAL_5._TABLE_: The REFERRAL_5 table is a continuation of the REFERRAL_4 table. The REFERRAL_* tables are the primary tables for referral information stored in the system.
REFERRAL_5.REFERRAL_ID: The unique identifier for the referral record.
REFERRAL_5.GEN_RFL_SEC_SINCE_MIDNIGHT_7: This contains information from generic referral time item 7.
REFERRAL_5.GEN_RFL_SEC_SINCE_MIDNIGHT_8: This contains information from generic referral time item 8.
REFERRAL_5.GEN_RFL_SEC_SINCE_MIDNIGHT_9: This contains information from generic referral time item 9.
REFERRAL_5.GEN_RFL_SEC_SINCE_MIDNIGHT_10: This contains information from generic referral time item 10.
REFERRAL_5.RPT_REF_TO_CNTRCT_YN: Stores an override value that indicates the referred to provider/location/vendor/department should be considered contracted or not for Medicare Advantage ODAG reporting. If NULL, system defined logic will be used. If Y, a user marked the provider as contracted (CP in ODAG). If N, a user marked the provider as non-contracted (NCP in ODAG).
REFERRAL_5.RPT_REF_BY_CNTRCT_YN: Stores an override value that indicates the referred by provider/location/department should be considered contracted or not for Medicare Advantage ODAG reporting. If NULL, system defined logic will be used. If Y, a user marked the provider as contracted (CP in ODAG). If N, a user marked the provider as non-contracted (NCP in ODAG).
REFERRAL_5.LIVING_SITUATION_C_NAME: Describes who the patient or child lives with.
REFERRAL_5.FIRST_APPOINTMENT_BY_DATE: The date that the first appointment for the referral should occur by.
REFERRAL_5.SENIORITY_DATE: The Seniority Date for the referral which represents a 'start date' that might have been set before the referral was created.
REFERRAL_5.CASE_WORKER_NAME: The case manager of the child psychology case.
REFERRAL_5.CHILD_SERVICE_C_NAME: Indicates the child welfare service role in connection with child psychology services.
REFERRAL_5.PARENTAL_RESP_C_NAME: Indicates which entity has parental responsibility for the patient.
REFERRAL_5.CONSENT_TO_TREAT_STAT_C_NAME: Indicates the status of obtaining the patient's consent in connection with the referral's transfer of medical record information.
REFERRAL_5.FORWARDED_EVALUATION_DATE: This date represents the date an external organization evaluated or triaged the referral before forwarding it to an Epic instance. This date represents the internal concept of Triage History Instant, for the forwarding decision done at the external organization.
REFERRAL_5.EMSG_COMM_PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: This item is part of a link to a communication from which the referral was created. This item contains the CSN of the contact which contains the communication. EMSG_COMM_JOB_ID (I RFL 18961) contains the communication job ID.
REFERRAL_5.EMSG_COMM_JOB_ID: Part of a link to a communication from which the referral was created.
REFERRAL_5.AUTHORIZED_MEDICATION_ID: This item holds the ID of the medication being authorized in this referral.
REFERRAL_5.INITIAL_REQUEST_TYPE_C_NAME: The initial request type for the referral.
REFERRAL_5.REF_BY_CNTRCT_AT_AUTH_YN: The contracted status of referred-by entities on the referral as of the last decision or the current contracted status if the referral is pending.
REFERRAL_5.REF_TO_CNTRCT_AT_AUTH_YN: The contracted status of referred-to entities on the referral as of the last decision or the current contracted status if the referral is pending.
REFERRAL_5.REF_BY_SER_CNTRCT_AT_AUTH_YN: The contracted status of referred-by provider on the referral as of the last decision or the current contracted status if the referral is pending.
REFERRAL_5.REF_TO_SER_CNTRCT_AT_AUTH_YN: The contracted status of referred-to provider on the referral as of the last decision or the current contracted status if the referral is pending.
REFERRAL_5.REF_BY_EAF_CNTRCT_AT_AUTH_YN: The contracted status of referred-by location on the referral as of the last decision or the current contracted status if the referral is pending.
REFERRAL_5.REF_TO_EAF_CNTRCT_AT_AUTH_YN: The contracted status of referred-to location on the referral as of the last decision or the current contracted status if the referral is pending.
REFERRAL_5.REF_TO_VEN_CNTRCT_AT_AUTH_YN: The contracted status of referred-to vendor on the referral as of the last decision or the current contracted status if the referral is pending.
REFERRAL_5.REF_BY_PROV_NET_LEVEL_C_NAME: The network status of the referred-by provider on the referral.
REFERRAL_5.REF_TO_LOCATION_NET_LEVEL_C_NAME: The network status of the referred-to location on the referral.
REFERRAL_5.REF_TO_VENDOR_NET_LEVEL_C_NAME: The network status of the referred-to vendor on the referral.
REFERRAL_5.REF_TO_PROV_NET_LEVEL_C_NAME: The network status of the referred-to provider on the referral.
REFERRAL_5.REF_BY_LOCATION_NET_LEVEL_C_NAME: The network status of the referred-by location on the referral.
REFERRAL_5.RPT_REF_BY_SER_CNTRCT_YN: The user override for the contracted status of the referred-by provider on the referral.
REFERRAL_5.RPT_REF_TO_SER_CNTRCT_YN: The user override for the contracted status of the referred-to provider on the referral.
REFERRAL_5.RPT_REF_BY_EAF_CNTRCT_YN: The user override for the contracted status of the referred-by location on the referral.
REFERRAL_5.RPT_REF_TO_EAF_CNTRCT_YN: The user override for the contracted status of the referred-to location on the referral.
REFERRAL_5.RPT_REF_TO_VEN_CNTRCT_YN: The user override for the contracted status of the referred-to vendor on the referral.
REFERRAL_5.RFL_AUTH_PROG_C_NAME: Authorization Prognosis code associated with a referral
REFERRAL_5.PRINCIPAL_DX_DATE: Specifies the diagnois date used for Prinicpal Diagnosis
REFERRAL_5.ADMISSION_SOURCE_C_NAME: The source from which the paitent is being admitted or referred. Only available in UM referrals.
REFERRAL_5.DISCHRG_DISP_C_NAME: This disposition (location) of the patient after discharge. Only available in UM referrals.
REFERRAL_5.FIRST_PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: Ths CSN of the encounter linked to the referral or auth/cert with the earliest encounter instant.
REFERRAL_5.LAST_PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: Ths CSN of the encounter linked to the referral or auth/cert with the latest encounter instant.
REFERRAL_5.REF_BY_CNTRCT_AT_DEC_YN: The contracted status of referred-by entities on the referral as of the last decision.
REFERRAL_5.REF_TO_CNTRCT_AT_DEC_YN: The contracted status of referred-to entities on the referral as of the last decision.
REFERRAL_5.REF_BY_SER_CNTRCT_AT_DEC_YN: The contracted status of referred-by provider on the referral as of the last decision.
REFERRAL_5.REF_TO_SER_CNTRCT_AT_DEC_YN: The contracted status of referred-to provider on the referral as of the last decision.
REFERRAL_5.REF_BY_LOC_CNTRCT_AT_DEC_YN: The contracted status of referred-by location on the referral as of the last decision.
REFERRAL_5.REF_TO_LOC_CNTRCT_AT_DEC_YN: The contracted status of referred-to location on the referral as of the last decision.
REFERRAL_5.REF_TO_VEN_CNTRCT_AT_DEC_YN: The contracted status of referred-to vendor on the referral as of the last decision.
REFERRAL_5.REGION_ID: The facility profile ID of the region on the coverage used for this referral.
REFERRAL_5.MEDICAL_GROUP_ID: The facility profile ID of the medical group on the coverage used for this referral.
REFERRAL_5.PRIMARY_CONDITION_GROUPER_ID: Primary condition for which the patient is being referred as a Search Condition MAG record.
REFERRAL_5.PRIMARY_TREATMENT_GROUPER_ID: Primary treatment for which the patient is being referred as a Search Treatment MAG record.
REFERRAL_5.PRIMARY_SPECIALTY_GROUPER_ID: Primary specialty to which the patient is being referred as a Search Specialty MAG record.
REFERRAL_5.PRIMARY_SUBSPEC_GROUPER_ID: Primary subspecialty to which the patient is being referred as a Search Subspecialty MAG record.
REFERRAL_5.CONC_UM_REV_TRANS_FROM_DELE_YN: Indicates if the responsiblity for concurrent review of this authorization request has been transitioned from a delegate system to this UM system.

REFERRAL_APT._TABLE_: This table contains information about referral appointments.
REFERRAL_APT.REFERRAL_ID: The referral ID for the referral record.
REFERRAL_APT.LINE_COUNT: A line number that is used to group information about contacts that have counted towards the referral.
REFERRAL_APT.SERVICE_DATE: The date of the service (date of the appointment, claim, charge, or admission date) that is associated with the referral
REFERRAL_APT.SERVICE_TYPE_C_NAME: The type of service that has been counted as a contact toward the total of completed contacts for this referral.
REFERRAL_APT.CHARGE_ID: The ID number of the charge, if the source is �Charge.�
REFERRAL_APT.CLAIM_ID: The ID number of the AP Claim, if the source is �Claim�
REFERRAL_APT.SERIAL_NUMBER: The ID number of the contact, if the source is either "Visit" or "Admission"
REFERRAL_APT.USER_ID: The ID number of the user who performed an override of the counting/contact information, if the source of the contact is "User Override"
REFERRAL_APT.USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
REFERRAL_APT.REASON: The reason for the user override, if the source of the contact was "User Override"
REFERRAL_APT.TABLE_COUNT: The number of completed contacts that have been counted for this source.
REFERRAL_APT.EXT_SVC_PROV_ID: The unique ID associated with the provider record for this row.
REFERRAL_APT.EXT_SVC_TIME: The time associated with the external appointment that was added to the referral.
REFERRAL_APT.EXT_SVC_POS_ID: The unique ID associated with the location or place of service record for this row.  This column is frequently used to link to the CLARITY_POS table.
REFERRAL_APT.EXT_APPT_STATUS_C_NAME: This column contains the appointment status for external appointments.
REFERRAL_APT.EXT_APPT_UNIQ_ID: This column contains the unique ID for external appointments.
REFERRAL_APT.EXT_SVC_UTC_DTTM: This column contains the timestamp when the service is performed in UTC format.
REFERRAL_APT.EXT_SVC_DTTM: This column contains the external service date and time as an instant in the local time zone.

REFERRAL_CROSS_ORG._TABLE_: This table contains cross-organization referral information.
REFERRAL_CROSS_ORG.REFERRAL_ID: The unique identifier (.1 item) for the referral record.
REFERRAL_CROSS_ORG.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
REFERRAL_CROSS_ORG.CROSS_ORG_RFL_STATUS_C_NAME: Track the status of a cross-organization referral.
REFERRAL_CROSS_ORG.CROSS_ORG_RFL_ORGANIZATION_ID: Store the organization for a cross-organization referral.
REFERRAL_CROSS_ORG.CROSS_ORG_RFL_ORGANIZATION_ID_EXTERNAL_N: Organization's external name used as the display name on forms and user interfaces.
REFERRAL_CROSS_ORG.CROSS_ORG_RFL_UNIQUE_IDENT: Store the unique ID of a cross-organization referral.
REFERRAL_CROSS_ORG.CROSS_ORG_RFL_ASGN_AUTH_OID: Store the assigning authority OID of a cross-organization referral.
REFERRAL_CROSS_ORG.CROSS_ORG_RFL_RSN_CNCL_RQST: The reason a cancellation was requested for this referral.
REFERRAL_CROSS_ORG.CROSS_ORG_RFL_INST_UPDATE_DTTM: Instant the cross-organization status was last updated.
REFERRAL_CROSS_ORG.CROSS_ORG_RFL_INACTIVE_YN: Indicates whether this line of cross organization referral information is inactive due to patient unlinking. 'Y' indicates that the information is not currently active. 'N' or NULL indicates that the information is active.
REFERRAL_CROSS_ORG.CROSS_ORG_RFL_REASON_DECLINE: The reason the cross-organization referral was declined.

REFERRAL_CVG._TABLE_: The REFERRAL_CVG table contains coverage information for referrals.
REFERRAL_CVG.REFERRAL_ID: The unique ID of the referral in database.
REFERRAL_CVG.LINE: A line number that is used to identify a group of coverage-related information. For example, if a referral has 2 valid coverages, line 1 of the coverage items contains the information about the first coverage, line 2 contains the information about the second coverage.
REFERRAL_CVG.CVG_ID: The ID of a coverage that is valid for the referral.
REFERRAL_CVG.CVG_USED_YN: A yes/no flag that indicates whether or not the coverage should be considered available for the referral use in non-UM (utilization management) workflows. For UM workflows, consider using SUBMITTED_UM_AUTHS_YN.  The coverage may be valid on the dates, but still inappropriate to use. Setting the flag to Yes means that the coverage is all right to use.
REFERRAL_CVG.AUTH_REQUIRED_YN: A flag to indicate whether the coverage requires external authorization to be received (as from an insurance carrier) for the services.
REFERRAL_CVG.CARRIER_AUTH_CMT: The carrier authorization number or comment, indicating that authorization was received.
REFERRAL_CVG.EFF_CVG_PRECERT_NUM: Precertification number associated with a coverage on a referral.
REFERRAL_CVG.EFF_CVG_AUTH_CMT: Comments regarding authorization specific to a coverage used on a referral.
REFERRAL_CVG.CVG_INVALID_FLAG: Flag for invalid coverage for non-UM (utilization management) workflows.
REFERRAL_CVG.CHARGE_COUNT_TYPE_C_NAME: Type of charges that this service level authorization record counts for professional, technical or all charges.
REFERRAL_CVG.USE_CHARGE_COUNT_YN: Flag to specify if the referral & coverage are using charge counting.
REFERRAL_CVG.CHARGE_COUNT_MTHD_C_NAME: Charge counting method for this service level authorization.
REFERRAL_CVG.CVG_SVC_TYPE_CODE_C_NAME: Specifies the service type at the coverage level.
REFERRAL_CVG.CVG_AUTH_STATUS_C_NAME: The authorization status category ID  for the coverage.

REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH._TABLE_: The REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH contains coverage auth/cert information for referrals.
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.REFERRAL_ID: The referral ID for the referral record.
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.PRE_CERT_REQ_YN: Indicates whether pre-cert is required for this coverage
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.PRE_CERT_AGENCY_ID: ID of the agency used for precertification
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.PRE_CERT_AGENCY_PH: Phone number of the agency used for precertification
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.PRE_CERT_CONTACT: Contact individual for the pre-certification agency
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.PRE_CERT_CALLED_DT: Date on which the payor was called for pre-certification information
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.PRE_CERT_RECV_DT: Date on which pre-certification information was received
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.PRE_CERT_RCV_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.PRE_CERT_BN_REQ_YN: Indicates whether a pre-certification benefits check is required
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.PRE_CERT_BEN_CHECK: Individual from whom pre-cert benefits information was received
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.PRE_CERT_BEN_PHONE: Phone number to use for pre-cert benefits checking
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.PRE_CERT_BEN_CNCT: Contact person for pre-cert benefits checking
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.PRE_CERT_BEN_FAX: Fax number for pre-cert benefits checking
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.PRE_CERT_BEN_CK_DT: Date on which pre-cert benefits were checked
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.PRE_CERT_BN_USR_ID: ID of user who checked pre-cert benefits information
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.PRE_CERT_BN_USR_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.PRE_CERT_CLIN_CNCT: Contact individual for pre-cert clinical information
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.PRE_CERT_CLIN_PHON: Phone number for pre-cert clinical information
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.AUTH_FROM_DT: The beginning date of the period authorized by the payor
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.AUTH_TO_DT: The end date of the period authorized by the payor.
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.MAX_OUT_POCKET: Contains Maximum Out of Pocket Amount: The most you pay in coinsurance during a benefit plan year. After you reach your out-of-pocket maximum, your medical plan option pays 100% (unless balance billing applies) of eligible expenses for the remainder of the benefit plan year
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.LIFETIME_MAX: Contains Lifetime Maximum Amount: The maximum amount that the insurance company will cover for this patient over the course of their lifetime.
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.TOT_PT_AMOUNT: Contains Total Patient Amount: The total amount the patient owes for this visit
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.ADM_NOTIF_STAT_C_NAME: Contains admission notification status: A field that can be used to track the status of the admission notification that needs to be faxed or sent electronically to the payor. This is a customer-owned category list.
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.CONC_REV_REQD_YN: Contains Information on whether a concurrent review (clinical review) is required or not.
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.IN_NETWORK_YN: This field is used to track whether or not the patient�s insurance is in Network.
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.DEDUCTIBLE_MET_YN: A deductible is the amount you must pay before the Plan begins to pay benefits. This field tracks whether or not the patient has paid that amount.
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.DEDUCTIBLE_MET_AMT: Contains Deductible Met Amount. A deductible is the amount you must pay before the Plan begins to pay benefits. This field tracks how much the patient has paid.
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.COINSUR_MET_YN: Coinsurance is a percentage of an eligible expense that you are required to pay for a covered service.  This field tracks whether or not the patient has paid that amount.
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.COINSURANCE_MET_AMT: Contains coinsurance met amount. Coinsurance is a percentage of an eligible expense that you are required to pay for a covered service.  This field tracks how much the patient has paid.
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.OUT_POCKET_MET_YN: This fields tracks whether or not the patient has paid their out of pocket expenses.
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.OUT_POCKET_MET_AMT: Contains Out of Pocket Met Amount. This fields tracks how much the patient has paid towards their out of pocket expenses.
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.PREEXIST_COND_YN: Contains whether or not pre-existing conditions are present. It is used to track whether or not the patient has pre-existing conditions that may impact their benefits.
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.PREEXIST_COND_VAL: Contains Pre-existing conditions value. If the patient has pre-existing conditions that may impact their benefits, this field is used to document the pre-existing conditions.
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.PRECERT_CMT_NOTE_ID: The unique ID of the note containing pre-certification comments entered on the referral.
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.PRECERT_BEN_NOTE_ID: The unique ID of the note containing benefits information entered on the referral.
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.GENERIC_STR_1: Generic string item for general use
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.GENERIC_STR_2: Generic string item for general use
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.GENERIC_STR_3: Generic string item for general use
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.GENERIC_STR_4: Generic string item for general use
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.GENERIC_STR_5: Generic string item for general use
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.GENERIC_NUM_IT_1: Generic numeric item for general use
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.GENERIC_NUM_IT_2: Generic numeric item for general use
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.GENERIC_NUM_IT_3: Generic numeric item for general use
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.GENERIC_NUM_IT_4: Generic numeric item for general use
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.GENERIC_NUM_IT_5: Generic numeric item for general use
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.GENERIC_NUM_IT_6: Generic numeric item for general use
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.GENERIC_NUM_IT_7: Generic numeric item for general use
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.GENERIC_NUM_IT_8: Generic numeric item for general use
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.GENERIC_NUM_IT_9: Generic numeric item for general use
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.GENERIC_NUM_IT_10: Generic numeric item for general use
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.GENERIC_DATE_1_DATE: Generic date item for general use
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.GENERIC_DATE_2_DATE: Generic date item for general use
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.GENERIC_DATE_3_DATE: Generic date item for general use
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.GENERIC_DATE_4_DATE: Generic date item for general use
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.GENERIC_DATE_5_DATE: Generic date item for general use
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.GENERIC_SEC_SINCE_MIDNIGHT_1: Generic time item for general use
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.GENERIC_SEC_SINCE_MIDNIGHT_2: Generic time item for general use
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.GENERIC_SEC_SINCE_MIDNIGHT_3: Generic time item for general use
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.GENERIC_SEC_SINCE_MIDNIGHT_4: Generic time item for general use
REFERRAL_CVG_AUTH.GENERIC_SEC_SINCE_MIDNIGHT_5: Generic time item for general use

REFERRAL_DX._TABLE_: The REFERRAL_DX table contains diagnosis information stored with referrals.
REFERRAL_DX.REFERRAL_ID: The referral ID for the referral record.
REFERRAL_DX.LINE: The line number of the diagnosis associated with the referral. For example, if a referral has two associated diagnoses, the first diagnosis will have a line value of 1, while the second diagnosis will have a line value of 2.
REFERRAL_DX.DX_ID: The ID number of the diagnosis associated with the referral. This is not the diagnosis code.  NOTE: Link to CLARITY_EDG to get the diagnosis code.
REFERRAL_DX.DX_TEXT: Free text associated with each additional diagnosis (I RFL 1000).
REFERRAL_DX.DX_CODE_TYPE_C_NAME: Stores the code type of the additional diagnosis

REFERRAL_HIST._TABLE_: The REFERRAL_HIST table contains information on changes to referrals stored in system.
REFERRAL_HIST.REFERRAL_ID: The referral ID for the referral record.
REFERRAL_HIST.LINE: The line number of the change to the referral. For example, if the referral is changed twice, the first change will have a line value of 1, while the second change will have a line value of 2.
REFERRAL_HIST.CHANGE_DATE: The date of the change to the referral.
REFERRAL_HIST.CHANGE_TYPE_C_NAME: The category value indicating the type of referral change.
REFERRAL_HIST.CHANGE_USER_ID: The ID number of the user who made the change to the referral.
REFERRAL_HIST.CHANGE_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
REFERRAL_HIST.PREVIOUS_VALUE: Some of the information on the referral is tracked when it changes. This stores the previous value of an item if it is tracked when it changes.
REFERRAL_HIST.CHANGE_DATETIME: The date and time of the change to the referral.
REFERRAL_HIST.AUTH_HX_EVENT_NO: The event no of the authorization history
REFERRAL_HIST.AUTH_HX_NOTE_ID: Referral audit trail item to store note Id
REFERRAL_HIST.CHANGE_LOCAL_DTTM: The authorization date and time as an instant in the local time zone
REFERRAL_HIST.NEW_RFL_STATUS_C_NAME: If the item being changed is Referral Status (I RFL 50), this item stores the new value for that item.
REFERRAL_HIST.NEW_PEND_RSN_C_NAME: If the item being changed is Reason Pending (I RFL 18003), this item stores the new value for that item.
REFERRAL_HIST.NEW_FIN_PROV_STATUS_C_NAME: If the item being changed is Finland - Provision Status (I RFL 72124), this item stores the new value for that item.
REFERRAL_HIST.NEW_FIN_VALID_END_DATE: If the item being changed is Finland - Validity End Date (I RFL 72115), this item stores the new value for that item.

REFERRAL_NOTES._TABLE_: Notes attached to the referral record.
REFERRAL_NOTES.REFERRAL_ID: The unique identifier for the referral record.
REFERRAL_NOTES.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
REFERRAL_NOTES.NOTE_ID: The unique identifier for the note record.
REFERRAL_NOTES.NOTE_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
REFERRAL_NOTES.NOTE_DATETIME: The instant of creation of the note.

REFERRAL_ORG_FILTER_SA._TABLE_: This table holds a list of authorized service areas, business segments and the patient associated with each referral. This table is used with Organizational Filtering. An organization will have access to a referral if they are authorized for at least one of the referral's associated service areas/business segments or if they are authorized for the referral's associated patient.
REFERRAL_ORG_FILTER_SA.REFERRAL_ID: The unique identifier for the referral record.
REFERRAL_ORG_FILTER_SA.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple service areas and business segments can be associated with a referral.
REFERRAL_ORG_FILTER_SA.AUTH_SA_OR_BUS_SEG_ID: The authorized service areas and business segments. This is only populated when Tapestry business segmentation is on. When it is, this column is used to determine which organizations are authorized to view the referral.

REFERRAL_PX._TABLE_: This table contains information on procedures associated with referrals. This table is related to the REFERRAL_ORDER_ID table. The REFERRAL_ORDER_ID table contains the list of procedures for the referral. The REFERRAL_PX table contains information on each of those procedures.
REFERRAL_PX.REFERRAL_ID: The unique ID of the referral in database.
REFERRAL_PX.LINE: The line number of the procedure associated with the referral. For example, if a referral has two associated procedures, the first procedure will have a line value of 1, while the second procedure will have a line value of 2.
REFERRAL_PX.PX_ID: The unique ID of the procedure associated with the referral. This is frequently used to join to the CLARITY_EAP table.
REFERRAL_PX.UNITS_REQUESTED: The number of units of this procedure that were requested
REFERRAL_PX.UNITS_APPROVED: The number of units of this procedure that were approved
REFERRAL_PX.TOTAL_PRICE: The total price calculated for this procedure using fee schedules or vendor contracts (for outgoing referrals)
REFERRAL_PX.NET_PAYABLE: The total net payable calculated for this procedure (the price - the patient portion).
REFERRAL_PX.PATIENT_PORTION: The total patient responsibility calculated for this procedure using the benefits engine
REFERRAL_PX.PROV_ID: The ID of the provider who will perform the service
REFERRAL_PX.AUTH_REQ_YN: A flag that indicates whether the member's benefits require a referral for this service. Yes=> a referral is required, No=> a referral is not required.
REFERRAL_PX.COVERED: A flag that indicates whether the procedure is not covered by the member's benefits or it is covered but by supplemental insurance
REFERRAL_PX.REVENUE_CODE_ID: Stores the revenue billing code entered on the service.

REFERRAL_REASONS._TABLE_: Contains the reasons for each referral.
REFERRAL_REASONS.REFERRAL_ID: The unique ID of the referral.
REFERRAL_REASONS.LINE: The line number of the referral reason.
REFERRAL_REASONS.REFERRAL_REASON_OTHER: The comment entered when the user chooses "Other" as the reason for referral. If the comment surpasses 60 characters, it will be truncated to 60.

RFL_REF_TO_REGIONS._TABLE_: This table holds the list of geographical areas for referred to geographical steering in Referral and Order Entry. It will only be populated if the "Use Referred to Geographic Areas" Referral system definition is set to Yes.
RFL_REF_TO_REGIONS.REFERRAL_ID: The unique ID of the referral.
RFL_REF_TO_REGIONS.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
RFL_REF_TO_REGIONS.REF_TO_AREAS_ID: The unique ID of the geographical area record that was used for referred to geographical steering for this referral. The stored value will be the first populated value from this list: 1) The referred to department's geographic area item  2) The referred to location/POS 3) The referred to vendor 4) The referred to provider

REFERRAL_CROSS_ORG.CROSS_ORG_RFL_ORGANIZATION_ID_EXTERNAL_N: UW Health and Affiliates - Wisconsin and Illinois

title: Documents: DOC_INFORMATION + children
description: Clinical documents with CSN links, DICOM, assessments, procedures

DOCS_RCVD_ALGS._TABLE_: This table stores discrete allergies information received from outside sources.
DOCS_RCVD_ALGS.DOCUMENT_ID: This item stores the Received Document record ID.
DOCS_RCVD_ALGS.CONTACT_DATE_REAL: This is a numeric representation of the date of this encounter in your system. The integer portion of the number specifies the date of the encounter. The digits after the decimal point indicate multiple visits on one day.
DOCS_RCVD_ALGS.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.
DOCS_RCVD_ALGS.ALG_REF_ID: This item stores a unique reference identifier to identify a specific instance of an allergy.
DOCS_RCVD_ALGS.ALG_SEVERITY_C_NAME: This item stores the overall allergy severity.
DOCS_RCVD_ALGS.ALG_DATE_NOTED_DT: This item stores the date when the allergy was noted by the external system.
DOCS_RCVD_ALGS.ALG_DATE_RESOLVD_DT: This item stores the date of when the allergy was resolved.
DOCS_RCVD_ALGS.ALG_SRC_LPL_ID: This item stores the source Problem List record identifier.
DOCS_RCVD_ALGS.ALG_TYPE_OF_CHNG_C_NAME: This item stores the type of change being performed on the allergy.
DOCS_RCVD_ALGS.ALGN_NAME: This item stores the display name of the allergen as sent by the external source.
DOCS_RCVD_ALGS.ALGN_ID: This item stores the Allergen record identifier that maps to the allergen from the external source.
DOCS_RCVD_ALGS.ALGN_ID_ALLERGEN_NAME: The name of the allergen record.
DOCS_RCVD_ALGS.ALG_TYPE: This item stores the textual allergy type sent by the external source.
DOCS_RCVD_ALGS.ALG_TYPE_ID_C_NAME: This item stores the category value which maps to the allergy type sent by  the external source.
DOCS_RCVD_ALGS.ALG_SRC_DXR_CSN: This item will store the contact serial (CSN) number of the Received Document record that owns the instance of this allergy.
DOCS_RCVD_ALGS.ALG_DUP_OVRD_LPL_ID: This item stores the record identifier of the local allergy that this external allergy should be grouped with.
DOCS_RCVD_ALGS.ALG_LAST_UPD_DTTM: This item stores the date and time when the allergy was last updated by the external system.
DOCS_RCVD_ALGS.ALG_PT_SRC_APP_C_NAME: If this allergy is a patient-entered allergy (i.e. DXR type = 25), this item stores the application which was used to edit the allergy for the contact (e.g. MyChart or Welcome). If blank, this is assumed to be MyChart.
DOCS_RCVD_ALGS.ALGRX_TYPE: This item stores the text value of the allergy reaction type sent by the external source.
DOCS_RCVD_ALGS.ALGRX_TYPE_ID_C_NAME: This item stores the category value which maps to the allergy reaction type sent by the external source.
DOCS_RCVD_ALGS.ALG_DT_NOTED_NF_C_NAME: This item stores the nullFlavor value from the effectiveTime low node in a received CDA document.
DOCS_RCVD_ALGS.ALG_DT_RESOLV_NF_C_NAME: This item stores the nullFlavor value from the effectiveTime high node in a received CDA document.
DOCS_RCVD_ALGS.ALG_STATE_C_NAME: This item stores the value from the statusCode node in a received CDA document. This item itself is not the status of the allergy.
DOCS_RCVD_ALGS.ALG_STATUS_ENTRY_C_NAME: This item stores the value from the status entryRelationship node in a received CDA document. This item itself is not the status of the allergy.
DOCS_RCVD_ALGS.ALG_HIST_STATUS_C_NAME: The item indicates whether the allergy is current or historical.
DOCS_RCVD_ALGS.ALG_HIST_DATE: This item stores the date that the historical status for this allergy is valid through. After this date, the historical status needs to be rechecked.
DOCS_RCVD_ALGS.ALG_SRC_WPR_ID: Stores the Patient Access Accounts ID of the MyChart user who edited the allergy for the contact.
DOCS_RCVD_ALGS.ALG_CRITICALITY_C_NAME: This item stores the category value for overall allergy criticality.
DOCS_RCVD_ALGS.ALG_CRITICALITY_TXT: This item stores the free text allergy criticality.
DOCS_RCVD_ALGS.ALG_PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: Stores the contact serial number (CSN) of the encounter that the allergy was added on.

DOCS_RCVD_ASMT._TABLE_: Table to maintain information related to assessments and risk scores. The information stored in this table was received from outside sources.
DOCS_RCVD_ASMT.DOCUMENT_ID: This item stores the Received Document record ID.
DOCS_RCVD_ASMT.CONTACT_DATE_REAL: A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
DOCS_RCVD_ASMT.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.
DOCS_RCVD_ASMT.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
DOCS_RCVD_ASMT.ASMT_REF_ID: This item stores the unique reference identifier associated with the assessment.
DOCS_RCVD_ASMT.ASMT_SRC_DXR: The Contact Serial Number (CSN) of the received document record from which the assessment for this row was sourced.
DOCS_RCVD_ASMT.ASMT_DATETIME: The clinically relevant date for this assessment. This could be the recorded date or the date of an update for a current assessment.
DOCS_RCVD_ASMT.ASMT_LAST_UPD_INST_DTTM: This item stores the last update instant of this assessment in UTC.
DOCS_RCVD_ASMT.ASMT_NAME: This item stores the assessment name sent by the external source.
DOCS_RCVD_ASMT.ASMT_STATUS_C_NAME: The ASMT_STATUS_C column contains the status of a received assessment. Under normal circumstances, only cancelled or removed statuses will be filled out.
DOCS_RCVD_ASMT.ASMT_EXT_DATA_FILTER_REASON_C_NAME: Stores the reason why an external assessment was filtered from the composite record (I DXR 14712)

DOCS_RCVD_PROC._TABLE_: This table stores procedure information received from outside sources.
DOCS_RCVD_PROC.DOCUMENT_ID: The unique identifier for the document record.
DOCS_RCVD_PROC.CONTACT_DATE_REAL: A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
DOCS_RCVD_PROC.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.
DOCS_RCVD_PROC.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
DOCS_RCVD_PROC.PROC_REF_ID: This item stores the unique reference ID.
DOCS_RCVD_PROC.PROC_TYPE_ID: This item stores the mapped procedure record ID for the external procedure.
DOCS_RCVD_PROC.PROC_TYPE_TXT: This item stores the free text name for the external procedure.
DOCS_RCVD_PROC.PROC_PERF_AT_ID: This item stores the facility record mapped location where the external procedure was performed.
DOCS_RCVD_PROC.PROC_PERF_AT_TXT: This item stores the free text location where the external procedure was performed.
DOCS_RCVD_PROC.PROC_START_DATE: This item stores the start date of the external procedure.
DOCS_RCVD_PROC.PROC_END_DATE: This item stores the end date of the external procedure.
DOCS_RCVD_PROC.PROC_EVENT_ID: This item holds the event identifier of the event information for the procedure.
DOCS_RCVD_PROC.PROC_MASTER_REF_ID: This item will be used to indicate duplicate procedure data.
DOCS_RCVD_PROC.PROC_LST_UPD_INST_DTTM: Stores the last update instant of the procedure in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).
DOCS_RCVD_PROC.PROC_UNSUCCESSFUL_FLG_C_NAME: Indicates whether a procedure was an unsuccessful attempt
DOCS_RCVD_PROC.PROC_UNSUCCESS_INST_UTC_DTTM: Instant the procedure unsuccessful flag was set
DOCS_RCVD_PROC.PROC_STATE_C_NAME: This item contains the status code of a procedure when received from a document.
DOCS_RCVD_PROC.PROC_DUP_INT_PROC_ID: Stores the ID of the Order record of an internal charge that is a duplicate of this row in an external document record.
DOCS_RCVD_PROC.PROC_DUP_INT_UCL_ID: Stores the ID of the Universal Charge Lines record of an internal charge that is a duplicate of this row in an external document record.
DOCS_RCVD_PROC.PROC_DUP_INT_TX_ID: Stores the ID of the Accounts Receivable Transaction record of an internal charge that is a duplicate of this row in an external document record.
DOCS_RCVD_PROC.PROC_DUP_INT_HOSP_TX_ID: Stores the ID of the Hospital Permanent Transaction record of an internal charge that is a duplicate of this row in an external document record.
DOCS_RCVD_PROC.PROC_FILTER_RSN_C_NAME: Stores the reason why an external procedure should be filtered from the composite record

DOC_CSN_REFS._TABLE_: This table contains references to the document from patient contacts, by contact serial number.  It is populated by the Consents navigator section.
DOC_CSN_REFS.DOCUMENT_ID: The unique identifier for the document record.
DOC_CSN_REFS.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
DOC_CSN_REFS.CSN_REFERENCE: This item contains the patient contacts (by contact serial number) that reference this document.  A reference here does not imply the document was created during any of these contacts and is different from the encounter storage level for documents (provided by I DCS 280); it is simply an indicator of relevance.  If this item is populated, a document should not be allowed to move between patients.  The user must remove all of these references manually before a patient change can occur.

DOC_INFORMATION._TABLE_: The DOC_INFORMATION table contains information about documents, including scanned and electronically signed documents.
DOC_INFORMATION.DOC_INFO_ID: The unique ID of the document information record.
DOC_INFORMATION.DOC_INFO_TYPE_C_NAME: The type of document described by this document information.
DOC_INFORMATION.DOC_STAT_C_NAME: The current status of the document described by this document information.
DOC_INFORMATION.DOC_DESCR: A short free text description of the document described by this document information.
DOC_INFORMATION.DOC_RECV_TIME: The date and time the document described by this document information was received.
DOC_INFORMATION.RECV_BY_USER_ID: The employee who received the document described by this document information. This ID may be encrypted.
DOC_INFORMATION.RECV_BY_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
DOC_INFORMATION.PAT_REP: The free text name of the person who legally represents the patient described by this document information.
DOC_INFORMATION.DT_ON_DOC: The date which appears on the document described by this document information.
DOC_INFORMATION.DOC_EXPIR_TIME: The date and time the document described by this document information expires.
