DOC_INFORMATION.DOC_LOC: A short free text description of the location of the paper copy of the document described by this document information.
DOC_INFORMATION.IS_SCANNED_YN: Specifies whether there is a scanned image version of the document described by this document information.
DOC_INFORMATION.SCAN_TIME: The date and time the document described by this document information was scanned.
DOC_INFORMATION.SCAN_BY_USER_ID: The employee who scanned the document described by this document information. This ID may be encrypted.
DOC_INFORMATION.SCAN_BY_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
DOC_INFORMATION.SCAN_DEP_ID: The department where the document described by this document information was scanned.
DOC_INFORMATION.SCAN_FILE: The file name of the scanned image version of the document described by this document information.
DOC_INFORMATION.IS_ESIGNED_YN: Specifies whether the document described by this document information has been electronically signed.
DOC_INFORMATION.ESIGN_TIME: The date and time the document described by this document information was electronically signed.
DOC_INFORMATION.WITNESS_BY_USER_ID: The employee who witnessed the electronic signing of the document described by this document information. This ID may be encrypted.
DOC_INFORMATION.WITNESS_BY_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
DOC_INFORMATION.ESIGN_DEP_ID: The department where the document described by this document information was electronically signed.
DOC_INFORMATION.ESIGN_HTML_FILE: The file name of either the template HTML file of the document to be electronically signed prior to it being electronically signed or the unique file name of the HTML file of the electronically signed document described by this document information.
DOC_INFORMATION.DOC_REQ_DT: The date when a copy of the type of document described by this document information was requested.
DOC_INFORMATION.IS_REQ_YN: Specifies whether the type of document described by this document information was requested.
DOC_INFORMATION.DOC_EFF_TIME: The date and time the document described by this document information becomes effective.
DOC_INFORMATION.IS_EFF_YN: Specifies whether the document is in effect.
DOC_INFORMATION.DOC_DISCL_DT: The date when a copy of the document described by this document information was last disclosed.
DOC_INFORMATION.DOC_REVOK_DT: The date when the type of document described by this document information was revoked.
DOC_INFORMATION.IS_REVOK_YN: Specifies whether the document was revoked.
DOC_INFORMATION.DOC_LOCATION_C: The category entry for the location of the document.
DOC_INFORMATION.DOC_PT_ID: The unique ID of the patient associated with the document record.
DOC_INFORMATION.DOC_CSN: This stores the contact serial number of the encounter that this record is attached to, if applicable.
DOC_INFORMATION.DOC_CLM_ID: Stores Claim (CLM) ID for the claim that the document is associated with, used by Tapestry.
DOC_INFORMATION.DOC_CVG_ID: Stores Coverage (CVG) ID for the coverage that the document is associated with, used by Tapestry.
DOC_INFORMATION.DOC_NCS_ID: Stores customer service (NCS) ID for the customer relationship management (CRM) that the document is associated with, used by Tapestry.
DOC_INFORMATION.DOC_NMM_ID: Stores the case master (NMM) ID for the case that the document is associated with, used by Tapestry.
DOC_INFORMATION.DOC_RFL_ID: Stores Referral (RFL) ID for the Referral that the document is associated with, used by Tapestry.
DOC_INFORMATION.DOC_SER_ID: Stores Provider/Resource Directory ID (SER) for the provider that the document is associated with, used by Tapestry.
DOC_INFORMATION.RECORD_STATE_C_NAME: The record state category number for the document record.
DOC_INFORMATION.SOURCE_ETX_ID: Stores the SmartText (ETX) ID that this document (DCS) record was created from.
DOC_INFORMATION.SOURCE_ETX_ID_SMARTTEXT_NAME: The name of the SmartText record.
DOC_INFORMATION.DOC_HNO_ID: The unique ID of the note record associated with this document.
DOC_INFORMATION.SCAN_LWS_ID: This item stores the id of the workstation where the document was scanned.
DOC_INFORMATION.ESIG_SIGNED_BY: eSignature of person document was signed by.
DOC_INFORMATION.ESIGNED_REL_C_NAME: The relationship between the patient and the person who signed the form (self, parent, spouse, etc.).
DOC_INFORMATION.DOC_SRVC_DTTM: The service date and time of the document.
DOC_INFORMATION.SCAN_INST_DTTM: This item stores the most clinically relevant date for the document. From top to bottom, it looks to the service date/time (I DCS 246/247), the order prioritized instant (I ORD 24), the encounter date, and the import date/time (I DCS 310/315).
DOC_INFORMATION.DOC_STORAGE_LVL_C_NAME: The level at which the document is attached to the patient's record. For example, the document could be stored at the patient, encounter, or hospital account level.
DOC_INFORMATION.SOURCE_DOC: The identifier for the document (DCS) record's source document.  This column is only populated for DCS records of type Discharge Attachments. If the document was created from a SmartText (ETX) record, this column contains the ID of that ETX record. If the document was created from an HTML document in the References Activity, this column contains the unique identifier from the CRS.mdb file.
DOC_INFORMATION.DOC_CREAT_DEPT_ID: The department where this document was created.
DOC_INFORMATION.PT_ENT_DRAW_STAT_C_NAME: Holds the status of the documents (DCS) record - Is it ready to show?
DOC_INFORMATION.PT_ENT_DRAWING_CMT: Holds any associated comments from a patient-entered drawing question. Only present for documents (DCS) records of type 32010 used by MyChart and Welcome.
DOC_INFORMATION.PHOTO_APPROVED_C_NAME: Whether or not this document (DCS) record is in the history of the patient's photos.  If not, includes the reason the photo was rejected.
DOC_INFORMATION.PHOTO_APRV_APPL_C_NAME: The application that processed the approval/denial of the photo.
DOC_INFORMATION.WEB_USER_ID: This item holds the ID of the MyChart user who created this document record, for patient-generated document records.
DOC_INFORMATION.NEED_ENC_YN: This item is used to denote whether a document needs to be attached to an encounter or not. For Patient level documents this would always be No. For encounter level documents, depending on whether it is attached or detached from an encounter, this would say No or Yes respectively.
DOC_INFORMATION.PERFORMING_PROV_ID: Used to store the Provider's name who is performing the procedure mentioned in the e-signature consent form.
DOC_INFORMATION.ESIG_TMPLT_USED: Stores a link to the template used to sign the document
DOC_INFORMATION.TMPLT_SF_CNTCT: Contact of the SmartForm used to collect information for this document.
DOC_INFORMATION.RESEARCH_STUDY_ID: Stores the ID of the research study associated with this document.
DOC_INFORMATION.FT_CONSENT_PROCS: Stores free text procedures for consent documents
DOC_INFORMATION.ORIGINAL_DOC_ID: Stores the link to the original (unannotated) document.
DOC_INFORMATION.DOC_SPECIALTY_C_NAME: This item can be extended to hold possible values for the specialty that a document can be associated with.
DOC_INFORMATION.DOC_SRVR_NAME_C_NAME: This item stores the desktop integration (FDI) record that was used for scanning the document.
DOC_INFORMATION.DOC_SOURCE_INFO_C_NAME: Determines the source of the document rather than the document's type.
DOC_INFORMATION.RX_CUST_ID_TYPE_C_NAME: This item contains the categories for the types of customer ID documents used to pick up prescriptions from outpatient pharmacies.
DOC_INFORMATION.RX_CUST_ID_NUM: This item contains the customer ID number.
DOC_INFORMATION.CE_SERVICE_START_DATE: Service start date for a received Care Everywhere external authorization
DOC_INFORMATION.CE_SERVICE_END_DATE: Service end date for a received Care Everywhere external authorization
DOC_INFORMATION.DOC_PND_APRV_STAT_C_NAME: Holds status of document undergoing review
DOC_INFORMATION.COMM_ORIG_LRP_ID: This item stores the original report (LRP) ID when a report is converted to a PDF.
DOC_INFORMATION.CREATED_STUDY_AMENDMENT: The ID of the research study amendment considered to be the consent version signed for Research Consent type document (DCS) records. Use the RESEARCH_STUDY_ID column to link to RESEARCH_VERSION_INFO table which has the user-entered version number (STUDY_VERSION) as well as other information.
DOC_INFORMATION.EFF_STUDY_AMENDMENT: The ID of the research study amendment considered to be the current effective version for Research Consent type document (DCS) records. Use the RESEARCH_STUDY_ID column to link to RESEARCH_VERSION_INFO table which has the user-entered version number (STUDY_VERSION) as well as other information.

DOC_INFORMATION_2._TABLE_: The DOC_INFORMATION table contains information about documents, including scanned and electronically signed documents.
DOC_INFORMATION_2.DOCUMENT_ID: The unique identifier (.1 item) for the document record.
DOC_INFORMATION_2.DOC_RDI_ID: Stores the linked form (RDI) that contains key-value pairs.
DOC_INFORMATION_2.COMM_ORIG_RDI_ID: This item stores the original form (RDI) ID when a form is converted to a PDF.
DOC_INFORMATION_2.RSH_LAST_UPDATE_USER_ID: The last user who updated the research data capture form.
DOC_INFORMATION_2.RSH_LAST_UPDATE_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
DOC_INFORMATION_2.RSH_LAST_UPDATE_UTC_DTTM: The last instant this data capture form was updated.
DOC_INFORMATION_2.RSH_FORM_STAT_C_NAME: Used to indicate whether or not all of the required fields on an esignature document's smartform have been completed.
DOC_INFORMATION_2.DOC_SPEC_TYPE_C_NAME: The document specialty for a document (DCS) record.
DOC_INFORMATION_2.DOC_SUBSPECIALTY_C_NAME: This item stores the document subspecialty for a document (DCS) record
DOC_INFORMATION_2.TMPLT_SF_FORM_ID: The unique ID of the SmartForm used to collect information for this document. Should be used in conjunction with DOC_INFORMATION.TMPLT_SF_CNTCT to identify the SmartForm Record.
DOC_INFORMATION_2.TMPLT_SF_FORM_ID_FORM_NAME: The name of the form associated with the questionnaire.
DOC_INFORMATION_2.RSH_FORM_NAME: The instance name for the research data capture form.
DOC_INFORMATION_2.DOCUMENT_USAGE_C_NAME: The document usage category ID for the document record.
DOC_INFORMATION_2.BLOB_CATEGORY_C_NAME: The blob category for the document.
DOC_INFORMATION_2.RX_CUST_ID_OWNER_NAM_RECORD_ID: This item contains a pointer to the name record of the owner of the customer ID used to pick up the prescriptions for the patient from outpatient pharmacies.
DOC_INFORMATION_2.ESIG_ACCESSIBLE_PDF_FILE: Stores the file name for the accessible PDF of this document on the BLOB.
DOC_INFORMATION_2.SERIES_SEQ_NUM: The sequence number of the series in a DICOM study (attribute 0020,0011).
DOC_INFORMATION_2.PS_SERIES_UID: The instance UID of the series that has the presentation state for the image.
DOC_INFORMATION_2.PS_UID: The presentation state instance UID for the image.
DOC_INFORMATION_2.IMAGE_SEQUENCE_NUM: The image sequence number within the series (attribute 0020,0013).
DOC_INFORMATION_2.IMG_SLCT_TYPE_C_NAME: The category ID indicating how the DICOM image associated with the record was selected, including if it was computer selected or marked as a key image.
DOC_INFORMATION_2.FILE_CREATION_TIME: Stores the timestamp in HL7 format of when the file was created on the blob or DMS server.
DOC_INFORMATION_2.FILE_LAST_UPD_TIME: Timestamp in HL7 format of when the image was last updated.
DOC_INFORMATION_2.CLN_DOC_SRC_APT_PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The appointment that a Document Information (DCS) record was attached to before it was moved to a Clinical Documentation Only encounter.
DOC_INFORMATION_2.ENROLL_ID: The unique ID of the research study association that has been linked to this document.
DOC_INFORMATION_2.FILE_CREATION_DTTM: Stores the file creation time of the document on the Web Blob Server (WBS)
DOC_INFORMATION_2.DEFERRED_GEN_STATUS_C_NAME: The deferred generation status category ID for the document. This field is only used for deferred generation documents.
DOC_INFORMATION_2.DOC_TX_ID: Stores ETR ID for the service-line on a claim that the document is associated with, used by Tapestry
DOC_INFORMATION_2.CLM_ATTACH_CTL_NUM: Attachment control number for electronic attachments. This is used to identify electronic attachments for a claim in an ANSI X12 275.
DOC_INFORMATION_2.CLM_PROV_ACCT_NUM: Provider submitted account number for electronic attachments. This is used to identify electronic attachments for a claim in an ANSI X12 275.
DOC_INFORMATION_2.CLAIM_VENDOR_NPI: NPI of the vendor sent in ANSI X12 275. This is used to identify electronic attachments for a claim in an ANSI X12 275.
DOC_INFORMATION_2.COPIED_FROM_DOCUMENT_ID: This item links to the original DCS record that this record was copied from.
DOC_INFORMATION_2.DOCUMENT_IDENT_SOURCE_C_NAME: Indicates whether the identifier for this document, which is stored in item 350, is a native Epic identifier, or an identifier assigned by external system. When this item is set to 1-Native, the identifier refers to binary data that was uploaded through the Blob service. If the identifier was generated by an external system, this item is set to 2-External. If this item is set to 0-Unknown or not set, then other items must be used to determine if item 350 is a Blob or external identifier.
DOC_INFORMATION_2.EOB_MEMBER_SHARE_AMOUNT: Total amount a member is responsible for, for all the claims included in an Explanation of Benefits document.
DOC_INFORMATION_2.DOC_SOURCE_ROI_ID: Stores the ROI ID used to generate a composite document (DCS). A composite document represents one or more contexts which is included in the ROI.
DOC_INFORMATION_2.CREATED_BY_USER_ID: The user who created the document.
DOC_INFORMATION_2.CREATED_BY_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
DOC_INFORMATION_2.CREATED_INST_UTC_DTTM: The date and time the document was created.
DOC_INFORMATION_2.INDEXED_BY_USER_ID: The user who indexed the document.
DOC_INFORMATION_2.INDEXED_BY_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
DOC_INFORMATION_2.INDEXED_INST_UTC_DTTM: The date and time the document was indexed.
DOC_INFORMATION_2.DEPTH_CAPT_STATUS_C_NAME: Whether depth information was captured on an image, or why depth was unable to be obtained. Only applies to images.
DOC_INFORMATION_2.LINK_DEPTH_DCS_ID: Stores the ID for the DCS record of the depth map taken with the image.
DOC_INFORMATION_2.DEPTH_ACCURACY_C_NAME: Depth map accuracy measured on mobile when taking a wound image.
DOC_INFORMATION_2.DEPTH_QUALITY_C_NAME: Depth map quality measured on mobile when taking a wound image.

DOC_INFO_DICOM._TABLE_: Table contains information related to DICOM about a document.
DOC_INFO_DICOM.DOCUMENT_ID: The unique identifier (.1 item) for the document record.
DOC_INFO_DICOM.ARCHV_ACCESSION_NUM: The accession number of the imaging study, as pulled from the DICOM image archive (attribute 0008,0050).
DOC_INFO_DICOM.STUDY_DATE: The date this imaging study was performed (attribute 0008,0020).
DOC_INFO_DICOM.STUDY_DESCRIPTION: The description of this imaging study (attribute 0008,1030).
DOC_INFO_DICOM.SENDING_AE_TITLE: The title of the sending DICOM Application Entity.
DOC_INFO_DICOM.BELONGS_TO_STUDY_DOCUMENT_ID: This column stores the ID of the study that this series belongs to.
DOC_INFO_DICOM.MODALITY: This is the DICOM modality type, as pulled from a DICOM image header (attribute 0008,0060).
DOC_INFO_DICOM.REFERRING_PROV: Referring physician as per DICOM attributes (attribute 0008,0090).
DOC_INFO_DICOM.SERIES_TM: The series time per the DICOM attributes (attribute 0008,0031).
DOC_INFO_DICOM.SERIES_DESC: The series description as per the DICOM attributes (attribute 0008,103E).
DOC_INFO_DICOM.BODY_PART_EXAMINED: This column stores the body part examined as per the DICOM attribute header (attribute 0018,0015).
DOC_INFO_DICOM.ACQUISITION_TM: This column stores the acquisition time of this series (attribute 0008,0032).
DOC_INFO_DICOM.SERIES_LATERALITY: The DICOM laterality for this series (attribute 0020,0060).
DOC_INFO_DICOM.SERIES_INSTANCE_UID: The series instance UID for this imaging series (attribute 0020,000E).
DOC_INFO_DICOM.BELONGS_TO_SERIES_DOCUMENT_ID: This column stores the ID of the series that this image belongs to.
DOC_INFO_DICOM.PRIMARY_IMAGE_INST_UID: This is the DICOM SOP instance UID (attribute 0008,0018). If this is a CT/MR, then it is the SOP instance UID of the first image in the series.
DOC_INFO_DICOM.INST_SOP_CLASS_UID: The instance SOP class UID specifies the exact type of this image or other DICOM document (attribute 0008,0016).
DOC_INFO_DICOM.RESCALE_INTERCEPT: Rescale intercept value from the DICOM header (attribute 0028,1052).
DOC_INFO_DICOM.RESCALE_SLOPE: Rescale slope value from the DICOM header (attribute 0028,1053).
DOC_INFO_DICOM.RESCALE_TYPE: Rescale type value from the DICOM header (attribute 0028,1054).
DOC_INFO_DICOM.PIXELS_PER_ROW: The number of pixels per row for this image (attribute 0028,0010).
DOC_INFO_DICOM.IMAGE_COLUMNS: The number of columns of this image (attribute 0028,0011).
DOC_INFO_DICOM.BITS_ALLOCATED: Number of bits allocated. This is bits per pixel (attribute 0028,0100).
DOC_INFO_DICOM.BITS_STORED: The number of bits stored in pixels (attribute 0028,0101).
DOC_INFO_DICOM.PIXEL_SPACING_X_DIR: Pixel spacing in X direction. This is the first piece of the DICOM attribute (attribute 0028,0030).
DOC_INFO_DICOM.PIXEL_SPACING_Y_DIR: Pixel spacing in Y direction. This is the second piece of the DICOM attribute (attribute 0028,0030).
DOC_INFO_DICOM.PHOTOMETRIC_INTERPRT: Photometric interpretation as per the DICOM header (attribute 0028,0004).
DOC_INFO_DICOM.IMAGE_TYPE_C_NAME: The image type. A multi-frame image is (usually) a movie type image.
DOC_INFO_DICOM.NUM_OF_FRAMES: The number of frames in this image (attribute 0028,0008).
DOC_INFO_DICOM.MAX_PIX_VALUE: This is the maximum pixel value in this image. This value is used to determine usable window width and level adjustment ranges.
DOC_INFO_DICOM.FRAME_TM: This column stores the frame time as time between image frames in milliseconds and it is used for setting initial display speeds.
DOC_INFO_DICOM.IMAGE_ORIENTATION: Image orientation defines the spatial position of the patient in relation to the image (derived from attribute 0020,0037).
DOC_INFO_DICOM.PAT_ORIENTATION: The patient orientation defines the patient position in relation to the image (attribute 0020, 0020).
DOC_INFO_DICOM.SLICE_THICKNESS: This column stores the slice thickness of the image. This is only relevant for cross-sectional images (attribute 0018,0050).
DOC_INFO_DICOM.IMAGE_LOCATION: This column stores a URL that can be used to retrieve this image through a WADO-RS web service call.

DOC_LINKED_PATS.DOCUMENT_ID: The unique identifier (.1 item) for the document record.
DOC_LINKED_PATS.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
DOC_LINKED_PATS.LINKED_PAT_ID: The list of patients (EPT) that this DCS is associated with for Electronic Health Information (EHI) Export

DOCS_RCVD_ALGS.ALGRX_TYPE: Propensity to adverse reactions to drug

title: Episodes: EPISODE + CAREPLAN_INFO
description: Care episodes and care plan enrollments

CAREPLAN_ENROLLMENT_INFO._TABLE_: This table cotains the enrollment information for a care plan.
CAREPLAN_ENROLLMENT_INFO.CAREPLAN_ID: The unique identifier (.1 item) for the care plan record.
CAREPLAN_ENROLLMENT_INFO.CP_ENROLL_WORKFLOW_C_NAME: This item store the Care Companion workflow from where this care plan was applied to the patient.
CAREPLAN_ENROLLMENT_INFO.ALERT_CSN_ID: BestPractice Advisory ALT CSN used to enroll the patient in the care plan.
CAREPLAN_ENROLLMENT_INFO.SIGNUP_MYPT_ID: MyChart user ID who enrolled the patient in the care plan.
CAREPLAN_ENROLLMENT_INFO.PREG_SELF_EPISODE_ID: Pregnancy episode ID (HSB) associated with the self-enrolled care plan.
CAREPLAN_ENROLLMENT_INFO.ENROLLING_USER_ID: User who enrolled the patient in the care plan.
CAREPLAN_ENROLLMENT_INFO.ENROLLING_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
CAREPLAN_ENROLLMENT_INFO.SURGICAL_PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: Patient CSN linked to the surgical encounter where the enrollment was done

CAREPLAN_INFO._TABLE_: Contains information about care plan template records.
CAREPLAN_INFO.CARE_INTG_ID: The unique identifier for the care plan record.
CAREPLAN_INFO.CAREPLAN_TYPE_C_NAME: The category ID of the type of the care plan record (Collaborative or Home Health).
CAREPLAN_INFO.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The linked unique contact serial number for the patient. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI). This column is frequently used to link to the PAT_ENC_HSP table.
CAREPLAN_INFO.PATIENT_ID: Links OP care plan (patient-level and episodic) to the associated patient
CAREPLAN_INFO.LINKED_PAT_CAREPLAN_YN: Indicates whether the outpatient care plan is linked at the patient level or the episode level. Yes means it is patient level, No means it is episode level.
CAREPLAN_INFO.RFL_INSTR_NOTE_ID: Stores the ID of the HNO record that contains the referral instructions
CAREPLAN_INFO.READING_CAREPLAN_ID: The link to the care plan reading Care Plan record.
CAREPLAN_INFO.LAST_EDITED_DTTM: The date and time when the care plan was last edited. This does not include documentation-only changes.
CAREPLAN_INFO.RECORD_STATUS_2_C_NAME: Record status flag. Used in conjunction with record archived flag for encounter archiving.
CAREPLAN_INFO.PAT_ENROLL_DEPARTMENT_ID: This item stores the department which enrolled the patient in MyChart care plan.

EPISODE._TABLE_: This table contains high-level information on the episodes recorded in the clinical system for your patients. When a provider sees a patient several times for an ongoing condition, such as prenatal care, these encounters can be linked to a single Episode of Care. It does not contain episodes linked to an inpatient encounter.
EPISODE.EPISODE_ID: The unique ID of the episode of care record.
EPISODE.NAME: The name of the episode.
EPISODE.START_DATE: The date the episode was initiated.
EPISODE.END_DATE: The date the episode was resolved in calendar format. This field is called "Resolved" on the clinical system screen.
EPISODE.COMMENTS: Any free text comments about the episode.
EPISODE.PREGRAVID_WEIGHT: This field contains the pre-pregnancy weight maintained before this episode.
EPISODE.NUMBER_OF_BABIES: Prior to delivery, this column is expected to contain the number of fetuses that the patient is carrying. This can be manually documented, such as in the Prenatal Vitals section, or the value can be automatically set by creating or removing fetal result tabs in the ultrasound activity.  If your organization documents on the Delivery Summary then after the Delivery Summary is signed, this column is expected to contain the number of viable deliveries associated with the pregnancy. Specifically, this is the number of delivery records attached to the pregnancy. This expectation is based on Epic's recommendation that only viable deliveries should be documented on the Delivery Summary. Your organization may follow a different policy for when to create a delivery record. The behavior of this column containing the number of delivery records may be overridden at the profile level in system definitions, in which case it will continue to contain the number of fetuses that were being carried unless the number of deliveries is manually documented in its place.
EPISODE.PRIMARY_LPL_ID: The primary problem linked to the episode.
EPISODE.STATUS_C_NAME: The status category number for the episode.
EPISODE.L_UPDATE_USER_ID: The ID of the last user that updated the episode of care record.
EPISODE.L_UPDATE_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
EPISODE.PATERNITY_ACK_C_NAME: Whether a paternity acknowledgement has been signed by the biological father of the baby if the parents are not married. This column may not be applicable depending on the identity of the second parent and the two parents' relationship.
EPISODE.SMOKE_3_MO_BEF: The number of cigarettes/packs smoked per day 3 months before the pregnancy by the mother.
EPISODE.SMOKE_3_MO_BEF_C_NAME: The unit of measurement for the quantity of cigarettes being smoked 3 months before the pregnancy by the mother.
EPISODE.SMOKE_1ST_3_MO: The number of cigarettes/packs smoked per day in the first 3 months of the pregnancy by the mother.
EPISODE.SMOKE_1ST_3_MO_C_NAME: The unit of measurement for the quantity of cigarettes being smoked the first three months of the pregnancy by the mother.
EPISODE.SMOKE_2ND_3_MO: The number of cigarettes/packs smoked per day in the second 3 months of the pregnancy by the mother.
EPISODE.SMOKE_2ND_3_MO_C_NAME: The unit of measurement for the quantity of cigarettes being smoked the second three months of the pregnancy by the mother.
EPISODE.SMOKE_3RD_TRI: The number of cigarettes/packs smoked per day in the third trimester of the pregnancy by the mother.
EPISODE.SMOKE_3RD_TRI_C_NAME: The unit of measurement for the quantity of cigarettes being smoked the third trimester of the pregnancy by the mother.
EPISODE.DRINK_3_MO_BEF: The number of alcoholic drinks consumed per week 3 months before the pregnancy by the mother.
EPISODE.DRINK_1ST_3_MO: The number of alcoholic drinks consumed per week in the first three months of the pregnancy by the mother.
EPISODE.DRINK_2ND_3_MO: The number of alcoholic drinks consumed per week in the second three months of the pregnancy by the mother.
EPISODE.DRINK_3RD_TRI: The number of alcoholic drinks consumed per week in the third trimester of the pregnancy by the mother.
EPISODE.IN_CITY_LIMITS_YN: Whether the address of the mother is inside the city limits.
EPISODE.WIC_FOODS_YN: Did the mother receive WIC foods during this pregnancy?
EPISODE.TOTAL_PNC: Override value to be used in situations where not all prenatal care was given at the same Epic provider and so not all prenatal care visits are in the system.
EPISODE.MONTH_1ST_PNC: Override value to be used in situations where not all prenatal care was given at the same Epic provider and so first date of prenatal care is not in the system and the month of the pregnancy when prenatal care began cannot be calculated.
EPISODE.LIVE_BIRTHS_LIVING: Override value to be used in situations where not all prenatal care was given at the same Epic provider, and consequently, other pregnancy information is not available. The number of children born alive which are still living not including children born at this birth.
EPISODE.LIVE_BIRTHS_DEAD: Override value to be used in situations where not all prenatal care was given at the same Epic provider, and consequently, other pregnancy information is not available. The number of other children born alive which are now deceased not including any born alive and deceased at this birth.
EPISODE.MOTHER_MARRIED_YN: Whether the mother is married at birth, conception, or any time in between.
EPISODE.OB_PREGRAVID_BMI: The patient's pre-pregnancy BMI for this pregnancy episode.
EPISODE.FIRST_PNT_LOC_C_NAME: This item stores who the patient's first prenatal care was with.
EPISODE.SERV_AREA_ID: The unique ID of the episode's service area. This column is used for DBC episodes, which are specific to a service area.
EPISODE.OB_WRK_EDD_DT: The estimated date of delivery for a pregnancy episode.
EPISODE.EXPECTED_DEL_LOC_C_NAME: Location where the woman plans to deliver her baby.
EPISODE.DEL_LOC_CHANGE_C_NAME: Why the delivery location changed from the expected delivery location (EXPECTED_DEL_LOC_C) for a pregnancy episode.
EPISODE.OB_FEEDING_INTENTIONS_C_NAME: Mother's intended feeding method for the baby.
EPISODE.INTENT_TREAT_C_NAME: The intended treatment for an implanted Mechanical Circulatory Device.
EPISODE.INTENT_TREAT_OTHR: The free text intended treatment for an implanted Mechanical Circulatory Device.
EPISODE.MCS_DISCHARGE_DT: Date a Mechanical Circulatory Device patient is discharged.
EPISODE.MCS_EVAL_DT: The start date of the Mechanical Circulatory Device evaluation.
EPISODE.MCS_REV_DT: The date when the Mechanical Circulatory Device case was reviewed by the evaluation committee.
EPISODE.MCS_ADMISSION_DT: Date of the admission for the Mechanical Circulatory Device procedure.
EPISODE.MCS_SURG_DT: The date of the Mechanical Circulatory Device surgery.
EPISODE.MCS_IS_HISTORIC_YN: Flag indicating a historic Mechanical Circulatory Device episode. This is intended to flag if the Device was implanted at another center than the Center that is currently following the patient.
EPISODE.MCS_EVAL_END_DT: The date on which the Mechanical Circulatory Device evaluation was completed.
EPISODE.MCS_NEXT_REVIEW_DT: The date on which both the Mechanical Circulatory Device episode and the patient chart should be reviewed.
EPISODE.MCS_REFERRAL_DT: The date the patient was referred for the Mechanical Circulatory Device.
EPISODE.MCS_TXPORT_MTHD_C_NAME: The method of transportation to the implantation center.

EPISODE_2._TABLE_: This table supplements the EPISODE table. It contains additional information about episodes. When a provider sees a patient several times for an ongoing condition, such as prenatal care, these encounters can be linked to a single Episode of Care.
EPISODE_2.EPISODE_ID: The unique ID of the episode of care record. NOTE: This table is filtered to include only non-inpatient episodes. Inpatient episode data can be found in the table IP_EPISODE_LINK (first released with system 2002).
EPISODE_2.DEPT_ID: The unique identifier for the department primarily responsible for managing the episode.
EPISODE_2.RXENROLL_LAST_EDIT_USER_ID: The user ID for whoever last updated the pharmacy enrollment.
EPISODE_2.RXENROLL_LAST_EDIT_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
EPISODE_2.RXENROLL_LAST_EDIT_DTTM: The date and time the pharmacy enrollment was last updated.
EPISODE_2.ENROLL_PROG_C_NAME: The current enrollment program for the pharmacy.
EPISODE_2.RXENROLL_NOTE_ID: Summary note documented on this episode
EPISODE_2.RXENROLL_ENROLLMENT_DATE: The date the patient was enrolled in the program
EPISODE_2.RXENROLL_DISENROLL_DATE: The date the patient was unenrolled from the program.
EPISODE_2.RXENROLL_DECLINE_DATE: The date the patient was declined enrollment (or declined to enroll) in the program
EPISODE_2.CRT_PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The patient contact serial number that auto created this episode.
EPISODE_2.CMGMT_STATUS_C_NAME: Stores the status of the case episode.  Enrolling - The manager is working to enroll the patient in a case management program. Open - The manager is performing ongoing outreach with the patient. Closed - The patient is no longer enrolled in case management, or they opted out of case management.
EPISODE_2.CMGMT_SENSITIVITY_C_NAME: Store the sensitivity flag for security restricted case episodes. If your organization has implemented break-the-glass, this sensitivity flag can be used to restrict access to the case episode.
EPISODE_2.CMGMT_ENROLLMENT_RSN_C_NAME: Stores the reason the patient was enrolled in case management.
EPISODE_2.CMGMT_ENROLLING_STEP_C_NAME: Stores the enrolling step that specifies the current step of enrollment for the case episode.
EPISODE_2.CMGMT_CLOSED_REASON_C_NAME: Stores the reason the case episode is closed.
EPISODE_2.ENROLL_ID: The research study-patient association (LAR) record ID for this episode.
EPISODE_2.PREG_CHORIONIC_C_NAME: For a pregnancy with multiple fetuses, indicates if the fetuses have individual or a shared chorionic and amniotic sacs.
EPISODE_2.PLAN_ADOPT_TYPE_C_NAME: This item indicates if the mother plans to give the baby up for adoption and if so, what type of adoption or arrangement is planned.
EPISODE_2.SUSPECTED_FD_YN: This item indicates whether a suspected fetal demise has occurred in the pregnancy.
EPISODE_2.PLAN_CIRCUMCISION_C_NAME: This item is used to indicate whether the parents have requested a circumcision after the baby is born.
EPISODE_2.PLAN_DELIVER_BY_GA: This item represents the gestational age (in weeks of pregnancy) at when the patient and provider expect the delivery to occur.
EPISODE_2.PLAN_DEL_METHOD_C_NAME: This item captures the planned method of delivery as documented prior to labor.
EPISODE_2.CMGMT_DECLINE_REASON_C_NAME: Documents the reason a patient/client refused coordinated case management services.
EPISODE_2.HSPC_ADD_DISCUSSED_WITH_PAT_YN: This item indicates whether or not a hospice election addendum was discussed with the patient for this episode.
EPISODE_2.HSPC_ADD_REQUESTED_WITH_PAT_YN: This item indicates whether or not a hospice election addendum was requested for this episode.
EPISODE_2.HSPC_ADD_DISCUSSED_USER_ID: The unique user record ID that is frequently used to link to the CLARITY_EMP table.
EPISODE_2.HSPC_ADD_DISCUSSED_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
EPISODE_2.HSPC_ADD_DISCUSSED_DATE: The date the addendum was discussed with the patient.
EPISODE_2.CMGMT_ENROLL_DATE: Documents the enrollment date, which is the date on which a patient or client's status becomes active and the patient or client starts receiving Coordinated Care Management services. Refer to CMGMT_CALC_ENROLL_DATE for more robust reporting.
EPISODE_2.CMGMT_ENROLL_CALC_DATE: This virtual item contains a calculated enrollment date determined from the user- documented enrollment date (CMGMT_ENROLL_DATE, HSB-18030) or the Case Management History related group (I HSB 18400).  If the overall episode status (CMGMT_STATUS_C, I HSB 18010) is 1-Enrolling, the value will be blank.  If the overall status is anything besides 1-Enrolling, the value will be set to the user- documented Enrollment Date, if it exists. Otherwise, the value will be set to the date (ACTION_UTC_DTTM) the status (ASSOC_CMGMT_STATUS_C) originally changed to 2-Active, unless the status was changed to 1-Enrolling more recently.
EPISODE_2.CMGMT_TRIGGERING_CLASSIFIER_ID: The classifier (CFR record) that triggered the creation of this case.
EPISODE_2.CMGMT_TRIGGERING_CLASSIFIER_ID_CLASSIFIE: The title of the classifier record.
EPISODE_2.CMGMT_TRIGGERING_CLAIM_ID: The claim that caused the creation of this case.
EPISODE_2.PREG_CORD_BLOOD_PLANS_C_NAME: This item indicates the patient's plans for umbilical cord blood.
EPISODE_2.LINKED_SERVICE_PLAN_ID: The service plan associated with this episode.
EPISODE_2.MC_TG_RSLV_DATE: Stores the resolve date for this Tapestry bundle.
EPISODE_2.BPC_ID: Stores the bundled episode terms id.
EPISODE_2.BPC_ID_BPC_NAME: The name of the bundled episode terms record.
EPISODE_2.BPC_CSN_ID: Stores the bundled episode terms contact serial number.

PAT_EPISODE._TABLE_: The PAT_EPISODE table links patient ID numbers to Episodes of Care records. This is especially helpful for connecting patients to episodes of care when there are no linked encounters on an episode record. When this is the case, the PAT_ID column in the EPISODE table may be null.
PAT_EPISODE.PAT_ID: The unique ID assigned to the patient record. This ID may be encrypted if you have elected to use enterprise reporting�s encryption utility.
PAT_EPISODE.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
PAT_EPISODE.EPISODE_ID: The unique ID number associated with an Episode of Care.

title: History: SOCIAL_HX + SURGICAL_HX + FAMILY_HX

CLARITY_EAP._TABLE_: The CLARITY_EAP table contains basic information about the procedure records in your system. This does include both A/R and clinical procedures.
CLARITY_EAP.PROC_ID: The unique ID of each procedure record in your system. This is not the CPT� code or other procedure code.

CLARITY_EAP_3._TABLE_: The CLARITY_EAP_3 table contains basic information about the procedure records in your system. This includes both A/R and clinical procedures. This is a continuation of Clarity table CLARITY_EAP.
CLARITY_EAP_3.PROC_ID: The unique ID number for a procedure record.
CLARITY_EAP_3.PT_FRIENDLY_NAME: The patient friendly procedure name for use in MyChart.

CLARITY_EAP_5._TABLE_: The CLARITY_EAP_5 table contains basic information about the procedure records in your system. This includes both A/R and clinical procedures. This is a continuation of Clarity table CLARITY_EAP.
CLARITY_EAP_5.PROC_ID: The unique identifier (.1 item) for the procedure record.
CLARITY_EAP_5.MYC_TKT_OVR_RULE_ID: Specify a rule to determine when to allow manually sending appointment requests to the patient for scheduling.

FAMILY_HX._TABLE_: The FAMILY_HX table contains data recorded in the family history contacts entered in the patient's chart during a clinical system encounter. Note: This table is designed to hold a patient's history over time; however, it is most typically implemented to only extract the latest patient history contact.
FAMILY_HX.LINE: The line number to identify the family history contact within the patient�s record.  NOTE: Each line of history is stored in enterprise reporting as its own record; a given patient may have multiple records (identified by line number) that reflect multiple lines of history.
FAMILY_HX.MEDICAL_HX_C_NAME: The category value associated with the Problem documented in the patient�s family history.
FAMILY_HX.MEDICAL_OTHER: The custom reason for visit or problem entered when the clinical system user chooses "Other" as a family history problem. NOTE: The comment is stored in the same item as MEDICAL_HX_C but is delimited from the response "Other" by the comment character, "[". The EPIC_GET_COMMENT function returns everything after the comment character.
FAMILY_HX.COMMENTS: Free-text comments entered with this problem. This column may be hidden in a public enterprise reporting view.
FAMILY_HX.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: A unique serial number for this encounter. This number is unique across all patients and encounters in the system.
FAMILY_HX.FAM_HX_SRC_C_NAME: This item contains the source of information for a patient's family medical history.
FAMILY_HX.RELATION_C_NAME: This is the category value associated with the family member who has or had this problem. An example might be sister, brother, or mother.
FAMILY_HX.FAM_RELATION_NAME: This is the first and/or last name of the patient's family member. This column is free-text and is meant to be used together with the RELATION_C category to form a unique key for the family member. If no name is entered this column will display an abbreviation of the family relation type beginning with ##.
FAMILY_HX.AGE_OF_ONSET: This item contains the age of onset of the patient's family member that is documented with a history of a problem.
FAMILY_HX.FAM_MED_REL_ID: This item contains the unique ID of the patient's family member relationship for medical history.
FAMILY_HX.FAM_MEDICAL_DX_ID: The unique ID of the diagnosis associated with the family member condition.
FAMILY_HX.AGE_OF_ONSET_END: When the age of onset for a family member's history of a problem is documented as an age range, this item contains the age at the end of the range.

FAMILY_HX_STATUS._TABLE_: Family status relationship table.  Contains the relationship to the patient and the name of the family member, as well as the source of this information.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_STAT_REL_C_NAME: The family status relationship category number for the relationship between the patient and their family member.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_STAT_STATUS_C_NAME: The family status category number for the family member, such as 1 for "alive" and 2 for "deceased".
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_STAT_DEATH_AGE: Age of family member at their death.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_STAT_COMMENT: This item contains the free text comments associated with a patient's family member status in medical history.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_STAT_SRC_C_NAME: The family status source category number for the source of corresponding family status information.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.HX_LNK_ENC_CSN: The Contact Serial Number of the encounter in which the history was created/edited. If the history was created/edited outside of the context of an encounter, then this column will be blank.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_STAT_DOB_DT: This is used to calculate the age of a relative. This is either the date of birth (approximate or exact) or part of a range. If it is a range, then this column will be the beginning date and FAM_STAT_DOB_END_DT will store the end date. This range of dates is used to define an age range.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_STAT_ID: The Unique ID for the family member.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_STAT_DOB_END_DT: If an age range is entered for a family member, then the range is stored as two dates. This column holds the end date and FAM_STAT_DOB_DT holds the beginning date.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_STAT_TWIN: This item tracks twin relationships among members of the patient's family.  Two family members who are twins (or three who are triplets, etc.) will have the same value on their lines of this item.  A value of 0 indicates that the family member is a twin of the patient.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_STAT_IDENT_TWIN: This item tracks identical twin relationships among members of the patient's family.  Two family members who are identical twins (or three who are identical triplets, etc.) will have the same value on their lines of this item.  A value of 0 indicates that the family member is an identical twin of the patient.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_STAT_COD_C_NAME: The cause of death of a family member of the patient.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_STAT_SEX_C_NAME: This item stores the sex of a family member of the patient.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_STAT_GENDER_IDENTITY_C_NAME: Gender identity for a family member.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_STAT_REL_ID: This item stores the unique ID of the patient relationship record. The patient relationship record contains information about how the person is related to the patient.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_STAT_ADOPT_C_NAME: Adoption status of a particular family member.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_STAT_ADPT_PAR_1: The ID of a relative's adoptive parent. We allow two adoptive parents. The other adoptive parent ID is stored in I EPT 20359.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_STAT_ADPT_PAR_2: The ID of a relative's adoptive parent. We allow two adoptive parents. The other adoptive parent ID is stored in I EPT 20358.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_STAT_PREG_EPISODE_ID: This item stores a link to the patient's pregnancy information in Obstetric history.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_STAT_DELIV_EPISODE_ID: This item stores a link to the patient's delivery information for Obstetric History.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_HX_FERT_STAT_C_NAME: This field contains the category value representing a patient's relative's fertility status.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_HX_FERT_NOTE: This field is a free text item holding notes pertaining to a particular relative's fertility status.

SOCIAL_HX._TABLE_: The SOCIAL_HX table contains social history data for each history encounter stored in your system. This table has one row per history encounter.
SOCIAL_HX.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
SOCIAL_HX.CIGARETTES_YN: Y if the patient uses cigarettes. N if the patient does not.  NOTE: Uses the EPIC_IN_ITEM function to determine if a given value exists in a multiple response item.  If the category value for this selection exists in the multiple response item, then it returns "Y", otherwise it returns "N".
SOCIAL_HX.PIPES_YN: Y if the patient smokes a pipe. N if the patient does not.  NOTE: Uses the EPIC_IN_ITEM function to determine if a given value exists in a multiple response item.  If the category value for this selection exists in the multiple response item, then it returns "Y", otherwise it returns "N".
SOCIAL_HX.CIGARS_YN: Y if the patient uses cigars. N if the patient does not. NOTE: Uses the EPIC_IN_ITEM function to determine if a given value exists in a multiple response item.  If the category value for this selection exists in the multiple response item, then it returns "Y", otherwise it returns "N".
SOCIAL_HX.SNUFF_YN: Y if the patient uses snuff. N if the patient does not. NOTE: Uses the EPIC_IN_ITEM function to determine if a given value exists in a multiple response item.  If the category value for this selection exists in the multiple response item, then it returns "Y", otherwise it returns "N".
SOCIAL_HX.CHEW_YN: Y if the patient uses chewing tobacco. N if the patient does not. NOTE: Uses the EPIC_IN_ITEM function to determine if a given value exists in a multiple response item.  If the category value for this selection exists in the multiple response item, then it returns "Y", otherwise it returns "N".
SOCIAL_HX.ALCOHOL_OZ_PER_WK: The fluid ounces of alcohol the patient consumes per week.
SOCIAL_HX.ALCOHOL_COMMENT: Free-text comments regarding the patient�s use of alcohol.
SOCIAL_HX.IV_DRUG_USER_YN: Y if the patient is an IV drug user. N if the patient is not.  NOTE: Uses the EPIC_IN_ITEM function to determine if a given value exists in a multiple response item.  If the category value for this selection exists in the multiple response item, then it returns "Y", otherwise it returns "N".
SOCIAL_HX.ILLICIT_DRUG_FREQ: The times per week the patient uses or used illicit drugs.
SOCIAL_HX.ILLICIT_DRUG_CMT: Free-text comments regarding the patient�s use of illicit drugs.
SOCIAL_HX.FEMALE_PARTNER_YN: Y if the patient has a female sexual partner. N if the patient does not. NOTE: Uses the EPIC_IN_ITEM function to determine if a given value exists in a multiple response item.  If the category value for this selection exists in the multiple response item, then it returns "Y", otherwise it returns "N".
SOCIAL_HX.MALE_PARTNER_YN: Y if the patient has a male sexual partner. N if the patient does not. NOTE: Uses the EPIC_IN_ITEM function to determine if a given value exists in a multiple response item.  If the category value for this selection exists in the multiple response item, then it returns "Y", otherwise it returns "N".
SOCIAL_HX.CONDOM_YN: Y if the patient uses a condom during sexual activity. N if the patient does not. NOTE: Uses the EPIC_IN_ITEM function to determine if a given value exists in a multiple response item.  If the category value for this selection exists in the multiple response item, then it returns "Y", otherwise it returns "N".
SOCIAL_HX.PILL_YN: Y if the patient uses birth control pills. N if the patient does not. NOTE: Uses the EPIC_IN_ITEM function to determine if a given value exists in a multiple response item.  If the category value for this selection exists in the multiple response item, then it returns "Y", otherwise it returns "N".
SOCIAL_HX.DIAPHRAGM_YN: Y if the patient uses a diaphragm. N if the patient does not. NOTE: Uses the EPIC_IN_ITEM function to determine if a given value exists in a multiple response item.  If the category value for this selection exists in the multiple response item, then it returns "Y", otherwise it returns "N".
SOCIAL_HX.IUD_YN: Y if the patient uses an IUD. N if the patient does not. NOTE: Uses the EPIC_IN_ITEM function to determine if a given value exists in a multiple response item.  If the category value for this selection exists in the multiple response item, then it returns "Y", otherwise it returns "N".
SOCIAL_HX.SURGICAL_YN: Y if the patient uses a surgical method of birth control such as hysterectomy, vasectomy, or tubal-ligation. N if the patient does not. NOTE: Uses the EPIC_IN_ITEM function to determine if a given value exists in a multiple response item.  If the category value for this selection exists in the multiple response item, then it returns "Y", otherwise it returns "N".
SOCIAL_HX.SPERMICIDE_YN: Y if the patient uses spermicide. N if the patient does not. NOTE: Uses the EPIC_IN_ITEM function to determine if a given value exists in a multiple response item.  If the category value for this selection exists in the multiple response item, then it returns "Y", otherwise it returns "N".
SOCIAL_HX.IMPLANT_YN: Y if the patient uses an implant as a form of birth control. N if the patient does not. NOTE: Uses the EPIC_IN_ITEM function to determine if a given value exists in a multiple response item.  If the category value for this selection exists in the multiple response item, then it returns "Y", otherwise it returns "N".
SOCIAL_HX.RHYTHM_YN: Y if the patient uses the rhythm method as a form of birth control. N if the patient does not. NOTE: Uses the EPIC_IN_ITEM function to determine if a given value exists in a multiple response item.  If the category value for this selection exists in the multiple response item, then it returns "Y", otherwise it returns "N".
SOCIAL_HX.INJECTION_YN: Y if the patient uses an injection as a form of birth control. N if the patient does not. NOTE: Uses the EPIC_IN_ITEM function to determine if a given value exists in a multiple response item.  If the category value for this selection exists in the multiple response item, then it returns "Y", otherwise it returns "N".
SOCIAL_HX.SPONGE_YN: Y if the patient uses a sponge as a form of birth control. N if the patient does not. NOTE: Uses the EPIC_IN_ITEM function to determine if a given value exists in a multiple response item.  If the category value for this selection exists in the multiple response item, then it returns "Y", otherwise it returns "N".
SOCIAL_HX.INSERTS_YN: Y if the patient uses inserts as a form of birth control. N if the patient does not. NOTE: Uses the EPIC_IN_ITEM function to determine if a given value exists in a multiple response item.  If the category value for this selection exists in the multiple response item, then it returns "Y", otherwise it returns "N".
SOCIAL_HX.ABSTINENCE_YN: Y if the patient practices abstinence. N if the patient does not. NOTE: Uses the EPIC_IN_ITEM function to determine if a given value exists in a multiple response item.  If the category value for this selection exists in the multiple response item, then it returns "Y", otherwise it returns "N".
SOCIAL_HX.SEX_COMMENT: Free-text comments regarding the patient�s sexual activity.
SOCIAL_HX.YEARS_EDUCATION: The number of years of education the patient has completed. Note: This is a free text field.
SOCIAL_HX.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: A unique serial number for this encounter. This number is unique across all patients and encounters in the system.
SOCIAL_HX.ALCOHOL_SRC_C_NAME: This columns stores the person (e.g. provider, patient, legal guardian) who provided alcohol use information for this encounter.
SOCIAL_HX.DRUG_SRC_C_NAME: This columns stores the person (e.g. provider, patient, legal guardian) who provided illicit drug use information for this encounter.
SOCIAL_HX.SEX_SRC_C_NAME: This columns stores the person (e.g. provider, patient, legal guardian) who provided sexual activity information for this encounter.
SOCIAL_HX.HX_LNK_ENC_CSN: The Contact Serial Number of the encounter in which the history was created/edited. If the history was created/edited outside of the context of an encounter, then this column will be blank.
SOCIAL_HX.ALCOHOL_USE_C_NAME: The category value associated with the patient's alcohol use. Data may include, Yes, No, or Not Asked.
SOCIAL_HX.ILL_DRUG_USER_C_NAME: The category value associated with the patient's use of illicit drugs. Data may include, Yes, No, or Not Asked.
SOCIAL_HX.SEXUALLY_ACTIVE_C_NAME: The category value associated with the patient's sexual activity. Data may include Yes, No, Not Asked, or Not Now
SOCIAL_HX.TOBACCO_USER_C_NAME: The category value associated with the patient's tobacco use. Data may include, Yes, Never, Not Asked or Quit.
SOCIAL_HX.SMOKELESS_TOB_USE_C: Stores the patient's usage of smokeless tobacco.  Data may include, Current User, Former User, Never Used or Unknown.
SOCIAL_HX.SMOKELESS_QUIT_DATE: The date on which the patient quit using smokeless tobacco.
SOCIAL_HX.SMOKING_TOB_USE_C: Stores the patient's usage of smoking tobacco.  Data may include, Current Everyday Smoker, Current Some Day Smoker, Former Smoker, Never Smoker, Unknown If Ever Smoked or Smoker, Current Status Unknown.
SOCIAL_HX.UNKNOWN_FAM_HX_YN: Y if the patient's family history is unknown by the patient. N otherwise.
SOCIAL_HX.EDU_LEVEL_C_NAME: This item stores responses to the social determinants of health question about level of education. Response is categorical, and corresponds to highest level of school attended.
SOCIAL_HX.FIN_RESOURCE_STRAIN_C_NAME: This item stores responses to the social determinants of health question about financial resource strain.
SOCIAL_HX.IPV_EMOTIONAL_ABUSE_C_NAME: This item stores responses to the social determinants of health question about emotional abuse from an intimate partner.
SOCIAL_HX.IPV_FEAR_C_NAME: This item stores responses to the social determinants of health question about fear of an intimate partner.
SOCIAL_HX.IPV_SEXUAL_ABUSE_C_NAME: This item stores responses to the social determinants of health question about sexual abuse from an intimate partner.
SOCIAL_HX.IPV_PHYSICAL_ABUSE_C_NAME: This item stores responses to the social determinants of health question about physical abuse from an intimate partner.
SOCIAL_HX.ALCOHOL_FREQ_C_NAME: This item stores responses for the social determinants of health question about frequency of drinking alcohol.
SOCIAL_HX.ALCOHOL_DRINKS_PER_DAY_C_NAME: This item stores responses for the social determinants of health questions about number of standard drinks consumed in a typical day.
SOCIAL_HX.ALCOHOL_BINGE_C_NAME: This item stores responses for the social determinants of health questions about binge drinking.
SOCIAL_HX.LIVING_W_SPOUSE_C_NAME: This item stores the response to social determinants of health question about whether or not the patient is currently living with spouse or partner.
SOCIAL_HX.DAILY_STRESS_C_NAME: This item stores responses to the social determinants of health question about daily stress.
SOCIAL_HX.PHONE_COMMUNICATION_C_NAME: This item stores responses to the social determinants of health question about how often the patient socializes with friends or family over the phone.
SOCIAL_HX.SOCIALIZATION_FREQ_C_NAME: This item stores responses to the social determinants of health question about how often the patient socializes with friends or family in person.
SOCIAL_HX.CHURCH_ATTENDANCE_C_NAME: This item stores responses to the social determinants of health question about how often the patient attends religious services.
SOCIAL_HX.CLUBMTG_ATTENDANCE_C_NAME: This item stores responses to the social determinants of health question about how often the patient attends club or other organization meetings in a year.
SOCIAL_HX.CLUB_MEMBER_C_NAME: This item stores responses to the social determinants of health question about whether the patient is a member of any clubs or organizations.
SOCIAL_HX.PHYS_ACT_DAYS_PER_WEEK_C_NAME: This item stores responses to the social determinants of health question about how many days a week the patient exercises.
SOCIAL_HX.PHYS_ACT_MIN_PER_SESS_C_NAME: This item stores responses to the social determinants of health question about how many minutes the patient exercises on days that they exercise.
SOCIAL_HX.FOOD_INSECURITY_SCARCE_C_NAME: This item stores responses to the social determinants of health question about whether or not the patient had run out of food and was not able to buy more.
SOCIAL_HX.FOOD_INSECURITY_WORRY_C_NAME: This item stores responses to the social determinants of health question about whether the patient worried about food running out in the past year or not.
SOCIAL_HX.MED_TRANSPORT_NEEDS_C_NAME: This item stores responses to the social determinants of health question about whether the patient had difficulty regarding transportation for medical appointments and medicine.
SOCIAL_HX.OTHER_TRANSPORT_NEEDS_C_NAME: This item stores responses to the social determinants of health question about whether the patient had difficulty regarding transportation for things other than medical appointments and medicine.
SOCIAL_HX.SOC_PHONE_SRC_C_NAME: Stores the source of entry for a patient's Social Connections Phone history.
SOCIAL_HX.SOC_TOGETHER_SRC_C_NAME: Stores the source of entry for a patient's Social Connections Get Together history.
SOCIAL_HX.SOC_CHURCH_SRC_C_NAME: Stores the source of entry for a patient's Social Connections Church history.
SOCIAL_HX.SOC_MEETINGS_SRC_C_NAME: Stores the source of entry for a patient's Social Connections Meetings history.
SOCIAL_HX.SOC_MEMBER_SRC_C_NAME: Stores the source of entry for a patient's Social Connections Membership history.
SOCIAL_HX.SOC_LIVING_SRC_C_NAME: Stores the source of entry for a patient's Social Connections Living history.
SOCIAL_HX.PHYS_DPW_SRC_C_NAME: Stores the source of entry for a patient's Physical Activity Days per Week history.
SOCIAL_HX.PHYS_MPS_SRC_C_NAME: Stores the source of entry for a patient's Physical Activity Minutes Per Session history.
SOCIAL_HX.STRESS_SRC_C_NAME: Stores the source of entry for a patient's Stress history.
SOCIAL_HX.EDUCATION_SRC_C_NAME: Stores the source of entry for a patient's Education history.
SOCIAL_HX.FINANCIAL_SRC_C_NAME: Stores the source of entry for a patient's Financial history.
SOCIAL_HX.IPV_EMOTIONAL_SRC_C_NAME: Stores the source of entry for a patient's Intimate Partner Violence (IPV) emotional history.
SOCIAL_HX.IPV_FEAR_SRC_C_NAME: Stores the source of entry for a patient's IPV Fear history.
SOCIAL_HX.IPV_SEXABUSE_SRC_C_NAME: Stores the source of entry for a patient's IPV Sexual Abuse history.
SOCIAL_HX.IPV_PHYSABUSE_SRC_C_NAME: Stores the source of entry for a patient's physical abuse history.
SOCIAL_HX.ALC_FREQ_SRC_C_NAME: Stores the source of entry for a patient's Alcohol Frequency history.
SOCIAL_HX.ALC_STD_DRINK_SRC_C_NAME: Stores the source of entry for a patient's Alcohol Standard Drinks history.
SOCIAL_HX.ALC_BINGE_SRC_C_NAME: Stores the source of entry for a patient's Alcohol Binge history.
SOCIAL_HX.FOOD_WORRY_SRC_C_NAME: Stores the source of entry for a patient's Food Worry history.
SOCIAL_HX.FOOD_SCARCITY_SRC_C_NAME: Stores the source of entry for a patient's Food Scarcity history.
SOCIAL_HX.TRANS_MED_SRC_C_NAME: Stores the source of entry for a patient's Transport Medical history.
SOCIAL_HX.TRANS_NONMED_SRC_C_NAME: Stores the source of entry for a patient's Transport Non-medical history.
SOCIAL_HX.FAM_PAT_ADPT_PAR_1: Stores the family history ID of the patient's adoptive parent. A patient can have two adoptive parents. The ID of the other parent is in FAM_PAT_ADPT_PAR_2.
SOCIAL_HX.FAM_PAT_ADPT_PAR_2: Stores the family history ID of the patient's adoptive parent. A patient can have two adoptive parents. The ID of the other parent is in FAM_PAT_ADPT_PAR_1.
SOCIAL_HX.TOB_HX_ADDL_PACKYEARS: Number to add to the total number of pack years calculated for the patient's tobacco history.
SOCIAL_HX.TOB_HX_SMOKE_EXPOSURE_CMT: Store the comment for passive tobacco smoke exposure.
SOCIAL_HX.PASSIVE_SMOKE_EXPOSURE_C_NAME: Document the patient's passive smoke exposure.
SOCIAL_HX.FAMHX_PAT_IS_ADOPTED_C_NAME: The Adoption Status category ID for the patient.

SURGICAL_HX._TABLE_: The SURGICAL_HX table contains data from medical history contacts entered in clinical system patient encounters. Since one patient encounter may contain multiple medical history contacts, each contact is uniquely identified by a combination of the patient encounter serial number and a line number.
SURGICAL_HX.PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL: This is a numeric representation of the date of this encounter in your system. The integer portion of the number specifies the date of the encounter. The digits after the decimal point indicate multiple visits on one day.
SURGICAL_HX.LINE: The line number of the surgical history contact within the encounter.
SURGICAL_HX.PROC_ID: The unique ID of the procedure record associated with the surgical history contact. Note: This is NOT the CPT(R) code. It is an internal identifier that is typically not visible to a user.
SURGICAL_HX.SURGICAL_HX_DATE: The free-text date entered in a patient's Surgical History for the procedure.
SURGICAL_HX.COMMENTS: Free-text comments entered for the procedure in the surgical history contact.
SURGICAL_HX.PROC_COMMENTS: Free-text comments entered for the "other" procedure in the patient's surgical history.
SURGICAL_HX.CONTACT_DATE: The contact date of the encounter associated with this surgical history contact. Note: There may be multiple encounters on the same calendar date.
SURGICAL_HX.CM_CT_OWNER_ID: ID of the deployment owner for this contact.
SURGICAL_HX.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: A unique serial number for this encounter. This number is unique across all patients and encounters in the system.
SURGICAL_HX.SURGICAL_HX_SRC_C_NAME: This category number represents the source of entry, the person providing the information, for the surgical history data.
SURGICAL_HX.HX_LNK_ENC_CSN: The Contact Serial Number of the encounter in which the history was created/edited. If the history was created/edited outside of the context of an encounter, then this column will be blank.
SURGICAL_HX.SURGICAL_HX_SRG_CSN: Stores the contact serial number of the surgery contact related to the current procedure.
SURGICAL_HX.SURG_LATERALITY_C_NAME: This category is used to store the laterality for each past surgical record in surgical history.
SURGICAL_HX.SURG_HX_START_DT: The starting date for the range of possible dates extracted from the free text date entered in column SURGICAL_HX_DATE. It is filled in automatically when the patient's history is saved. The ending date is in column SURG_HX_END_DT.
SURGICAL_HX.SURG_HX_END_DT: The ending date for the range of possible dates extracted from the free text date entered in column SURGICAL_HX_DATE. It is filled in automatically when the patient's history is saved. The starting date is in SURG_HX_END_DT.
SURGICAL_HX.SURG_HX_ORDER_ID: The unique ID of the order related to the current surgical history procedure

CLARITY_EAP_3.PT_FRIENDLY_NAME: Insertion of needle into vein for collection of blood sample

title: Health Maintenance: HM_HISTORY + forecasts + guides
description: Preventive care tracking, forecasts, guidelines, topic status

HM_FORECAST_INFO._TABLE_: Health Maintenance forecast information for the next completion.
HM_FORECAST_INFO.PAT_ID: The unique ID of the patient record for this row. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.
HM_FORECAST_INFO.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
HM_FORECAST_INFO.HM_FORECAST_TOPIC_ID: This column stores a Health Maintenance topic that has forecast information.
HM_FORECAST_INFO.HM_FORECAST_TOPIC_ID_NAME: The name of the health maintenance topic.
HM_FORECAST_INFO.EARLIEST_VALID_DATE: This column stores the earliest date that the current completion will be considered valid.

HM_HISTORICAL_STATUS._TABLE_: Records Health Maintenance status over time.
HM_HISTORICAL_STATUS.PAT_ID: The unique ID of the patient record for this row. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.
HM_HISTORICAL_STATUS.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
HM_HISTORICAL_STATUS.HM_TOPIC_ID: The Health Maintenance topic that applied to the patient at the time the snapshot was taken.
HM_HISTORICAL_STATUS.HM_TOPIC_ID_NAME: The name of the health maintenance topic.
HM_HISTORICAL_STATUS.HM_STATUS_C_NAME: Indicates the patient's due status for the Health Maintenance topic at the time the snapshot was taken.
HM_HISTORICAL_STATUS.NEXT_DUE_DATE: The patient's next due date for this Health Maintenance topic at the time the snapshot was taken.
HM_HISTORICAL_STATUS.LAST_COMPLETED_DATE: The date this patient last had a completion for the Health Maintenance topic, as of the time the snapshot was taken.
HM_HISTORICAL_STATUS.HAS_OUTSIDE_COMPLETION_YN: Indicates whether external data was used to complete the related Health Maintenance topic at the time the snapshot was recorded.
HM_HISTORICAL_STATUS.EXTERNAL_CLINICAL_DATE: If the related HM topic is currently satisfied by external clinical data (e.g. Care Everywhere or immunization registries), this item will contain the date of the relevant completion.
HM_HISTORICAL_STATUS.EXTERNAL_CLAIM_DATE: If the related HM topic is currently satisfied by external claims data, this item will contain the date of the relevant completion.
HM_HISTORICAL_STATUS.PAT_REPORTED_DATE: If the related HM topic is currently satisfied by patient-reported data, this item will contain the date of the relevant patient-reported satisfaction.
HM_HISTORICAL_STATUS.EXTERNAL_HEALTH_PLAN_DATE: If the related HM topic is currently satisfied by external health plan data, this item will contain the date of the relevant completion.

HM_HISTORY._TABLE_: The HM_HISTORY table records information about completed and manually overridden clinical system health maintenance topics that apply to each patient. This information is found in your system by the following path: clinical system Supervisor Menu > Supervisor's menu > Patient Health Maint option, or by clicking the clinical system client Health Maintenance button.
HM_HISTORY.PAT_ID: The unique ID assigned to the patient record. This ID may be encrypted if you have elected to use enterprise reporting�s encryption utility.
HM_HISTORY.LINE: Identifies the health maintenance topic within the patient�s record.
HM_HISTORY.HM_COMP_TYPE_C_NAME: Stores the type of Health Maintenance completion

PATIENT_HMT_STATUS._TABLE_: This table contains information on the due status of health maintenance topics.
PATIENT_HMT_STATUS.PAT_ID: The unique ID of the patient record for this row. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.
PATIENT_HMT_STATUS.HMT_PPN_UNTL_DT: The date until which a Health Maintenance topic is postponed.
PATIENT_HMT_STATUS.HMT_PPN_RSN_C_NAME: The postpone reason category number for a Health Maintenance topic which was postponed.
PATIENT_HMT_STATUS.HMT_LAST_UPDATE_DT: The date when the patient's qualified Health Maintenance topic due status was last updated.
PATIENT_HMT_STATUS.HM_ORDER_STATUS_YN: This item indicates if the Health Maintenance (HM) topic has been addressed by signing an order. If an appropriate active order was found during the HM update, this will be set to yes.
PATIENT_HMT_STATUS.ACTIVE_SUBTOPIC_ID: Stores the active subtopic for a combination topic
PATIENT_HMT_STATUS.ACTIVE_SUBTOPIC_ID_NAME: The name of the health maintenance topic.
PATIENT_HMT_STATUS.ACTIVE_HM_PLAN_ID: Stores the Health Maintenance plan that is currently active for the topic
PATIENT_HMT_STATUS.ACTIVE_HM_PLAN_ID_HM_PLAN_NAME: The name of the Health Maintenance Plan record.
PATIENT_HMT_STATUS.HM_TENTATIVE_YN: Boolean value indicating whether the Health Maintenance topic's next follow-up is tentative and requiring review.
PATIENT_HMT_STATUS.HM_ACTIVE_SERIES_C_NAME: Stores the active immunization series the patient is currently on.

PAT_HM_CUR_GUIDE._TABLE_: Health Maintenance Plans used during patient's last health maintenance update.
PAT_HM_CUR_GUIDE.PAT_ID: The unique ID of the patient record for this row. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.
PAT_HM_CUR_GUIDE.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
PAT_HM_CUR_GUIDE.HM_CURRENT_GUIDE_ID: Current Health Maintenance Plans the patient is a part of.
PAT_HM_CUR_GUIDE.HM_CURRENT_GUIDE_ID_HM_PLAN_NAME: The name of the Health Maintenance Plan record.
